Reviews.Title: “Great staff, horrible building”
Reviews.Author: ikesmler
Reviews.Content: Staff was super friendly and helpful but building is run down and filthy. Hallways were very dirty and room carpet looked disgusting! KBC needs to clean up their act to get up to the standards that were there when it was an Embassy Suites Hotel! Our kids used a rollaway cot which was as hard as the floor. No place to hang wet swimsuits and No extra outlets to plug in computers and phones. Our lanai used to have plants on it but now just dirt and cigarette butts cover the space. Bathroom was large and kitchen was adequate. Property was large but never enough places to sit by the pool or by the beach. We noticed several people from other hotels using KBC's pool and grills which left guests with nothing. We have been here 4 times and each time the experience gets worse...don't think we will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: TennessseeReese
Reviews.Content: On the evening that we got to Ka'anapali Beach Club, we were informed that there was a booking problem with time share rentals, and they had overbooked some rooms. We were told that we had been rebooked and upgraded to the Honua Kai Resort & Spa. It was located just around the corner. We were not disappointed, it was a newer resort, the condo could not have been any greater, the cleaning, maintenance crews and staff were great. Christina Budrow at Ka'anapali Beach Clup took great care of us with this situation, we all make mistakes, I don't think that President Obama could have been treated any better, the staff and the great guys at the door were very sorry and they regretted what happen. Yes, if we return, I would stay at Ka'anapali Resort. Thank you again for seven great days and making this a great trip for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “great deal because we booked early through hotels.com”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: Considering the price doubled from what we paid for a one bedroom unit using a discounter we felt we got a good deal. Huge property nicely located in kaanapali section of Maui with a spacious bathroom. The kitchen was not a full size kitchen rather more of a kitchenette. No stove per say but whop plays to cook when they are on vacation in Maui anyway? Use the BBQ grill downstairs. Or like 90% go out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Golden Girls Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StewartsLucy
Reviews.Content: We found this on vrbo. When we checked in, we were directed to a second desk, which turned out to be the concierge-sales desk. Upon arrival, our plan was to lay in the sun for the remainder of the afternoon. We were hijacked into listening to activities options and a pitch to attend a timeshare meeting. By the time we were settled in our room, the sunshine was turning into the sunset.We ended up booking our sunset/appetizer whale watching outing through concierge for $136 for 2ppl. Later realized we could have had it for half the cost. The room, 716, was large and well equipped, though the decor is dated. The service/trash department is below & quite noisy. If the bed had been placed on the opposite wall we would have had the ocean view instead of the mountain view. You had to crane your neck on balcony to see the ocean in this ocean view room. This place is average. We would not stay here again because we do not want timeshare sales pitches on our vacations. This is the one & only time we stayed at a timeshare. The luggage & maid carts clickety clack on tiles in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Aloha”
Reviews.Author: trappedinahaolesbody
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Ka'anapali Beach Club (on an exchange) and had a wonderful time. The staff was caring and interested in our enjoyment, when we chose not to do the presentation it was no problem, when anything was brought to their attention, they were on it quickly. Love the music around the pool, good mix and not just 'tiny bubbles", they honored the culture (big thumbs up). Great activities on site for family. We brought SUPs and surfboards and the bell desk had storage ready for us, always with aloha and eager to help. Our room was top floor and newly renovated, beautifully done. Had no issues with the hot plate and kitchen performance. Once again, the Staff is terrific, give aloha, get aloha. Take the time, open up and talk story with everyone, you'll get back so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large pool, good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: divearnd
Reviews.Content: Formally the Embassy Suites now Diamond International's timeshare resort on Kaanapali Beach. Very nice grounds, large pool, water slide, small gym just off the pool area. Great views across the water of Molokai and Lanai. Resort has a restaurant, grill bar, pizza area, etc. Also has an activity center for the kids. Sit on the beach and watch the whales from Nov - April. We had a one bedroom suite. While everyone would like an ocean view or ocean front our room faced the mountains which was a very nice view. The rooms are very large. Very comfortable king bed, in living room there is a nice sized sleeper sofa, bathroom has a separate shower and tub and two separate sinks. Kitchen area has a microwave, dishwasher, full refrigerator. Refrigerator had no ice maker or ice trays but there was an ice machine on the floor. There is no stove top but there was an electric skillet. Across the street is a small strip mall with a Times grocery store (somewhat expensive). The Kaanapali Beach Club is going through a room renovation program, beginning on the top floors, with a plan to have all rooms renovated within the next four years. It was obvious, when we checked in, that the furniture and rugs need upgrading. The A/C unit was a bit noisy but not unbearable. We noticed a musty odor when we first got to the room but after running the A/C for a few hours the mustiness went away. WIFI access is available in the lobby. There are no laundry facilities in the room. Each even floor has a small laundry, on washing machine and two dryers. Laundry facilities are free. Please note - this is a timeshare resort. I've seen a number of complains on Trip Advisor from people, who booked at a timeshare, but were expecting typical hotel services. As with most timeshares there IS NOT daily maid service. They do provide, in the middle of the week if you are staying seven nights, a room tidy up with towel exchange. Also, if you are not a timeshare owner here, there may be some fees such as parking so I would suggest that you check with the resort so that you know what fees to expect. Not a bad place to be to get away from the winter!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, perfect for kids”
Reviews.Author: emily32
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic resort. Perfect for kids. The pool was great, complete with waterslide. Everything was very convenient. There was a multitude of activities to join in. The beach was great, although there was a rip tide when we were there. Only downside was the knives in the unit were terrible. Other than that, absolutely perfect. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “staff are excellent”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCouple56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ka'anapali Beach Club from January 3rd to 6th this year. It was a short visit but memorable. We had a room over looking the pool and the ocean. It was awesome. We skipped the time share presentation, but I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare owner since 2009! And Honestly no complain what do ever.”
Reviews.Author: Islandhulagirl101
Reviews.Content: This Beautiful Resort located on kaanapali beach is like my second home. I have owned a Timeshare in Maui KBC since August 2009. It is absolutely beautiful. The prices are reasonable and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are very beautiful and they are homey. The kitchen is small But for a hotel room, it's perfect, I mean you don't come to Maui to sitt in you kitchen in the hotel or do you? The sound of the birds when waking up in the hotel is great and I go here every summer and don't plan changing it for any reason. The pool is big and they have a waterside and 1 reasonable size jacuzzi. They have luau's for the people on the patio overlooking the water. The beach is next door and they provide towels. The hotel offers scuba diving lessons every day and has many clubs and free events in the hotel. I love KBC and every remember it when it was The Embacy. The resturant(Grill) is great! Reasonable prices! $6, $7! Dot a big deal. They have great pizza! Honestly the best I have ever tasted. Everyone has their own opinion I this place and I see alot of hateful ones but don't let that bad experience ruin your chance of going, you may fall in love just like me and my family have. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: F00die67
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Kaanapali Beach Club, and we couldn't have been more satisfied. The staff is welcoming and friendly, and while it's not the Ritz Carlton, (it's more Embassy Suites) the location is what will bring us back over and over again. First, not only are you easy walking distance to coffee - Java Jazz across the street, and Bad A** (rhymes with lass) coffee down the street - but a short walk down the Beach brings you to Duke's Beach Club for Breakfast, Lunch, Happy Hour, or Dinner, and there is also a Grocery Store close enough to walk to. It's an easy 5 minute drive into Lahaina, and the INCREDIBLE beaches of Kapalua are about 10 minutes north. It's about a 40 minute drive from the Airport in Kahului (which is beautiful once you hit the coast). Overall, a very good jumping off place to see and tour the island. On to the resort itself. The beachy/ sandy part of the resort is fine, but once you get into the water there is moderate reef so water shoes could be advisable. (We never bring any, and just look for the sandy bits). They have lounge chairs, and a towel service, and you can sign up for stand-up paddling classes close by. There is a Gym at the resort and a lovely pool (with ample space for sunning, and also abundant lounge chairs), and there is a different musician nightly that plays in the lounge area. There are also Laundry facilities, a miniature golf course (it's not the best) and a parking garage, a place to get pizza, and even a few outdoor movie nights by the pool (with popcorn, of course!). That was cool. The resort is well maintained, clean, and landscaped beautifully with several Koi ponds. The rooms are comfortable, clean, spacious (very surprised by the space actually) and the beds are comfortable, bathrooms spacious (great towels), and the kitchen area, while small, is perfect for a week away. Only downside is no cooktop, but there is a microwave, and the market across the street has a deli section with roasted chicken and all that... You can also rent movies there as well (the grocery store is called Times). Seriously, no complaints here. Will gladly return. Mahalo Kaanapali Beach Club!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Tricklic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Club Jan. 18th - 25th, 2012. The friend we went with is a time share owner with Diamond Resorts so we got cheaper pricing if we sat through their 120 minute presentation. The good...Everyone at the hotel was VERY friendly and nice and always willing to help out. Our suite was really nice and big. The pool is really big and nice and great beach access. The property is well manicured with several water falls, koi ponds, picnic areas with grills. Our $15.00 per day parking fee was waived :o) and they didn't even charge us the lost room key fee of $25.00 when my husband misplaced his key card. The location is really great with a little grocery store and breakfast joint (Java Jazz and Soup Nutz) within walking distance. There is lots of great shopping just a few miles down the road at Whalers Village, Cannery Mall or in Lahaina. Lastly...I was worried the time share presentation was going to be high pressure but it really wasn't to bad. The bad...our shower did have a good amount of black mold around the bottom. Our "Scenic View accommodation" was of the road and if the wind was blowing down from the mountain you could smell the sulphur smell from the water treatment plant down the road :o( however, we really didn't spend much time in our room. The breakfast buffet was a bit overpriced at $15.00 per person for an average buffet. We only did that one day then started going to Java Jazz accross the street. It is still around $15.00 per person but worth every penny! This next compaint is petty but I wish the ping pong table was out in the open but instead it is locked in the activity center which closes at 8pm but that is just me :o) Over all we really enjoyed staying at the Ka'anapalie Beach Club and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: family086
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Club in November 2011, we had an excellent holiday. The rooms are well maintained, clean and have plenty of space. We booked a partial sea view and were not disappointed, the location of our room was excellent we woke up every morning to the sun and sea outside of our balcony. Gym within the hotel was good, and very clean, my husband and I used it several times, pools and hot tub good too, although the hot tub is a little small. The grounds are well maintained. Breakfast buffet is available at a small cost and was value for money, we used this facility at least 7 times within our two week stay. The reception and Diamond staff are great at their jobs, we booked several trips and nothing was a problem to them. I hope that we get to visit this hotel again as coming from the UK, it is a long travel but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas and New Years!!!”
Reviews.Author: tnsna
Reviews.Content: Just spent 16 wonderful days at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. We arrived Christmas day and stayed until January 10th in a 2 bedroom unit overlooking the pool and the Ocean. We stayed on the 9th floor the first week and then moved to the 8th floor (larger balcony) the second week. We had a total of 18 guests in 5 different rooms!!! We had a great time!!! The BBQ day by the pool is an excellent deal for the kids. The movie nights by the pool were sooooo cool also. The electric skillet made meal preperation a breeze. The BBQ's downstairs need some tending to. Ruby at the front desk was wonderful!!! When others had no clue as to what was going on......she always said and did the right things to make our vacation as smooth as possible!!! Gary, the Hotel manager was awesome as well!! Thank you both for making our Christmas vacation/family reunion a great one!!! The pool is awesome. The beach there is very nice. Not many bad things to say about KBC!!! The Times grocery store across the street has just about everything one would need. I have stayed at KBC at least 10 times and I love the property!!! Have never had a bad room!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love the pink pyramid”
Reviews.Author: CyndeM
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Maui since 2007 and have stayed here -- the rooms are plenty big, the pool is great and it is right on a wonderful beach. We are using the time share part -- not sure if there is another way to stay here. But the location is great and so is the staff. This used to be an Embassy Suites and so the rooms do not have a full kitchen -- but there are BBQs downstairs and one can use the electic skillet in the room to cook meals if one wants to. Free internet and washers/dryers, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaSeniorita
Reviews.Content: I have to laugh at the reviewers who give their accomodations lousy marks because of the weather, wind, etc., all things beyond the control of the resort. It's unfortunate that the aloha never quite soaks in to some people. In any event, my husband, son and I just returned from Maui, having stayed at the KBC for a week. Upon driving up to the huge pink monstrosity, we were somewhat concerned, but were quickly put at ease when we saw the grounds and our room. The pool area and grounds are large and well maintained. There are plenty of activities scheduled daily, both for adults and kids, and a full activity centre for keikis (kids), complete with bowling alley, board and video games, etc. On-site fitness facility, spa and mini-golf course offer something for the whole family. Our room had been recently renovated, and the bathroom was HUGE! There is also on-site (free) laundry facilities which is a life saver! The bed was comfy too! Free wired internet in the rooms and wi-fi in the lobby and pool area. There are 5 grills down by the beach, and from our room we could see them being cleaned every day. We did not eat at the restaurant so cannot comment on that (drinks were pricey but they do have happy hour). We ordered a pizza on the day of arrival from the pizza joint and it was good. A vacation tip (and life tip for that matter) - If you treat the staff with respect, you will find that they reciprocate: we never had to purchase any additional supplies (some have mentioned having to purchase more coffee filters, etc). They also even called us to see if we needed a crib for our baby - now that's service! We simply asked our cleaner politely for what we needed and she was happy to help. Perhaps if you are the crazy lady in the gift shop having a melt-down because they didn't carry the local paper (the horror!), you might not get a great response from the staff. If you are lucky enough to visit during the whale season (Dec-Mar), you will surely see humpbacks frolicking very close to the resort. Snorkeling is so-so, but the beach is decent, not rocky. We have been to Maui a few times and this was the best visit so far. All in all, I would highly recommend KBC and will definitely be back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: Whitney B
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned based on some of the reviews I saw before traveling, however it was a wonderful hotel in a wonderful location. The staff from valet to check in were very helpful and nice. The hotel looks dated but the rooms are finely appointed. I was not even in the most updated room and had no complaints. Ruby at the concierge desk was amazing. I did sign up for timeshare presentation but didn't feel pressured. I imagine this will vary salesperson to salesperson. It was worth it to get the tour discounts. Chambliss was our salesperson and she was great, no AMAZING. (I am in sales so I understand it's her job to be nice, but she was genuine and no pressure.) my only suggestion would be to get wireless in the room as I had my IPAD. My husband had his laptop some were able to plugin. The food was good, the pool staff was great, and most of all the location and view was amazing. I visited some of the other hotels and they felt stuffy compared to this one. If you enjoy traditional stuffy hotels, this may not be for you. If you like friendly hotels with a family feel (not overrun by kids), this is the place to stay. Literally the beach is steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the frustration”
Reviews.Author: Theresa G
Reviews.Content: We spent the Christmas Holiday at the Kaanapali Beach Club in 2011 and it was the WORST vacation of my life. Upon arrival we were starving and had lunch at the out door grill by the pool. I found a hair in my food. That was strike one. Did I mention how WINDY and cold it was?... The room smelled musty and was dated and oh yea, I felt a pinch on the bottom of my foot when crossing from the kitchen to the living room carpet. The tacking was exposed on the floor. Strike Two. Rishi at consierge services came across as very pleasant, helpful and competent however she is highly incompetent and lacks attention to detail! She was the major cause of most of the problems with our vacation. 1. She booked an 8:30 AM massage for me and said to arrive at 8:15 which I did. The massause didn't show up until 8:45. My entire morning was to start off in a relaxed state of mind and instead, I was angry and pissed off. Why didn't she confirm with the massuse the start time or at least call me to reschedule!!! Strike Three Rishi booked me and my husband on an evening dinner cruz. I informed her that I was highly gluten insensitive and needed a gluten free dinner. She confirmed to us that she made the arrangements and I would have a gluten free dinner. Upon arrival at the ship, I double checked on the menu and was told mine was not gluten free. Strike FOUR!!! Sansai is a highly recognized Japaneese Food restaurant and we asked Rishi to book reservations for us. she confirmed she did. As we drove to dinner I phoned the restaurant to reconfirm our reservations and say we were ont he way. We were told there were no reservations for us. STRIKE FIVE. Oh, the fitness area is about the size of my kitchen. Some mornings we couldn't even get in. No oven, no stove tops. You'll have to make do with a plug in fryer. So, there you have it. No attention to detail, marginal accommodations, hair in my food and windy windy trade winds. No, I don't recommend this place. If you want to stay in Kaanapali, be sure that you are below the Sheraton - it isn't windy there. I must say that Kathy and Dan in the consierge department listened my very detailed complaints and offered their apologies and whatever they could to calm me down. Save your money and sanity and stay somewhere else. I liked the Westin Kaanapali when I stayed there. No trade winds, great pools and amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share”
Reviews.Author: wnday101
Reviews.Content: The property was very good .In this location you will need a car to go most places. The little grocery across the street was handy for any food items you might want . The wednesday market for fresh veggies was great. There is a good chinese place to the left that serves substantial portions for those hungry teenagers. The pizza at the property is very good. Good snorkeling at Black Rock and mile marker 14. We were there from 12/19 to12/29 and the weather was bad , windy and rainy. mahalo bill

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great amenities, great time!”
Reviews.Author: nevillcanada
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our New Year's trip to Maui. We are Diamond members so expect a certain level of comfort in condo living. Ka'anapali Beach Club was all that and more! The room itself was roomy and comfortable. The only downside was their was no stove/oven. However, you are able to request a rice steamer and/or slow cooker from housekeeping. There was an electric frying pan in the unit and barbeques down by the beach (which are a bit of a hassle if your room is on a higher floor or near the front of the building). The pool area is fantastic with lots of loungers, a children's pool with waterslide, waterfalls (good for an aquamassage after surfing!), hot tub, and direct beach access. The coral comes pretty close to shore so watershoes are a MUST. Snorkeling is excellent past where the surfers are (closer in is shallow, murky, and "dead" coral). The best surf lessons on Maui are right in front of the barbeques! There's a grocery store right across the street from the resort entrance (a block up the drive -- buy boogie boards there for $12 rather than renting them then just pass them onto another family when you leave) and a local bus stops right out the base of the drive that takes you either up to Napili or down to Whaler's Village. You can connect at Whaler's Village to go to Lahaina and the fare is cheap! However, if you want to see more of the island, tours can be booked through the concierge (which I highly recommend for the Hana Hwy drive as doing it yourself is exhausting) or you can rent a car. There's a fish market just up the road and a farmer's market right across from the Honokowai Beach Park which is a 10 minute walk. The farmer's market has awesome homemade guacamole and pineapple salsa. They also have a deli which serves all vegetarian food (the store itself is completely vegetarian so you need to go to the grocery store or fish market for meat/fish). The resort itself has a bar, pizza place, and restaurant for those who don't feel like cooking and want to spend lots of money on meals. To the left of the grocery store in a little strip mall is a fantastic restaurant for supper called Java Jazz. It has a great atmosphere and has live music (folk/jazz/blues) at 7pm every night. If you're travelling with kids, the resort has fantastic activities throughout the day to keep everyone busy -- sunset movies by the pool, bowling, Wii and Kinect, hula lessons, lei making, etc. Whether you choose to do a timeshare presentation or not is totally up to you. If you choose to, don't complain about it later (Hawai'i real estate is expensive). Either you're interested or you're not.

Reviews.Title: “second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: debra1104
Reviews.Content: i decided to choose maii as our second honeymoon .we went to orlando florida in 2010 & went though this timeshare presentation with diamond resorts & declined the sales they offer & accepted to purchase the sampler package which i thought wow!!! second honeymoon.i went bought my airline tickets over 2000.00 & the package was almost 900.00 so on october 24 2011 we went to ka'napali beach club .the hotel is great,the rooms are really spacious & we had a refrigerator & microwave no stove though ,so we would buy ourgroceries & drinks at walmart or costco .you definetely need a car you are far from everything.there is a grocery store in front of the resort but its expensive .i thought the hotel was missing entertainement ,they had a drive in movie with a big screen & popcorn but i do that with the kids not alone with my husband!!!we took the road to hana which is super the view is to die for there is a bridge with natural ponds do not miss this.its scary the drive but so worth it if you turn left on the resort & go straight for 20 mitutes you will get to this awsome beach almost no one there just beautiful.we had to assist through another sales pitch & explained to the sale person that our sales representation that we had in florida was not so great & they mentioned that it would not be like that in maui it sells by itself.after i refused the offer they were rude .but that did not take away my experience in maui because it is the most beautiful place to be .will go back but not to this hotel ps:no long chairs on beach just where grass is :(

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare "Sampler" too expensive by comparison to Maui resorts.”
Reviews.Author: MedicinemanPA
Reviews.Content: After attending the "short" presentation by Diamond Resorts International in Las Vegas, and it taking most of a day, we declined the sales pitch for the full product. We then were offered a "Sampler" that included sufficient "points" to book a week at Ka'anapali Beach Club. We paid $1400+ for this trip, not counting the additional $2200 for r/t tickets to Hawaii from Colorado Springs. The salesman in Las Vegas gave me a login and password to the Diamond Resorts International website, and I thought I booked the vacation on that site. I got a confirmatory email stating that we had reserved an "Ocean view deluxe" suite, and were told it would be a completely furnished apartment in the resort. Arriving after dark on December 3, we were greeted by friendly valets, who handled their job beautifully. We went to the desk to check in, and no record of our reservation was on file. Luckily I had the email confirmation code number, and it took nearly 2 hours for the manager to figure out that the website on which I booked was an "internal training site" not a real site, and the reservation was canceled after the exercise, despite sending me a confirmation number and email. informed me that "parking" would be $16 a day." I told the manager that the least they could do would be "comp" the parking, which they did. Thank you. They put us in a room, admirably, since we really had no booking. The next day was pretty much wasted while we waited around, and we did take a drive, awaiting the matter to be cleared up. We got to stay in the same suite they put us into on the first nite. It was OK. Somewhat mildew odor typical of so many tropical places where they use carpets that get wet from people using the place, but not unbearable. The furniture was so-so in comfort. Good bed, two large flat screen TV's, however we had planned on using the "apartment" to prepare meals to save costs on our vacation. There was no stove, or oven. There was a microwave and an electric frying pan, but that was it for cooking options. The appointments were nice. Housekeeping was included once in the week, and the woman did a good job. The restaurant was OK, but the Luau was overpriced, the entertainment was good, but the food was nothing to write home about. By looking on "http://www.hotels.com" for a comparable week in 2012 pricing, the Royal Lahaina Resort has rooms for $159 a night, The Maui Coast Hotel for $165/night. The Mana Kai Maui for $122/night, the Castle Kamaole Sands, a Condominium Resort for $124 a night. So our "Sampler" at $200 a night plus parking was no bargain. We were apparently spared the repeat timeshare presentation others on this site have experienced. I was not going to attend it regardless, having killed way too much time in Las Vegas on this in the first place. We did enjoy our first trip to Hawaii, the weather was great, snorkeling with Blue Water Rafting (separately reviewed with pix) was fun. I would book via hotel.com if we chose to return to Maui and save money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy but a hassle”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: I found the room accomodations to be adequate and comfy but the staff and processes of staying there are inconvenient and annoying. We came across road blocks around every corner with this company! When we asked for butter pats for our meal, they charged us an extra 25 cents per pat of butter! This seems ludicrous to me! They did not replace and provide more coffee filters in our room, we had to buy those too. The housekeeping staff kept walking in on us the last morning we were there prior to our check out time to see if we had left yet. The pool is very cold and the hot tub is extremely small and always seems to be packed so using it was very difficult. We had our wedding reception in the hotel's restaurant but experienced much difficulty there with accomodating the 17 people in our party, wanting to charge us rental fees to eat in their dining room, and the manager told us that though they would serve us there "you won't get the same amount of service because our waiters will be busy with other tables and can't focus only on you and your group." He was argumentative and rude, even telling us at one point that we could take our business elsewhere and "that was fine" by him. The halls are grouted tile so you wake up very early (5:00am) to the sound of carts being wheeled down the halls, clanging and banging. Our "ocean view room" was partially right....it looked directly onto the backside of it's neighboring property and if you looked to the left, you could see some ocean. The worst part is the sales pitch from the timeshare staff. Brutal. So glad we got out after an hour and a half!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a week on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. Large suite with nice master bedroom and a bath which was almost as large. Double balcony and nice kitchenette. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. No high pressure sales pitch to learn about vacation ownership. Very nicely decorated and right on the beach. Nice pool and restaurant and options for water sports. Located in the heart of resort area, with access to grocery, shopping, etc. Not too far from Whaler's Village and Lahaina shopping areas. Always be aware of a parking fee, which is normal for this type of resort. I agree with others about the sales pitch. Avoid it if you are not interested even for the opportunity for discounted activity tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but beware of the vacation ownership sales pitch!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club for a week in November for our honeymoon trip. The week we stayed was actually a gift from one of my wifeâ€™s relatives for our wedding/honeymoon. The hotel was very nice, clean, and was nicely decorated around the pool with waterfalls, tropical flowers, palm trees, and tiki torches. The pool overlooks the ocean for a great view and just a short walk over to the beach. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable, with nice kitchen facilities (refrigerator, dishwasher, can opener, toaster, microwave, and glasses, dishes, and utensils). The $16/day fee for parking, as noted in other reviews, was a bit disappointing. Overall, all of the staff was very pleasant and helpful. When we checked in, we were greeted by a staff member from the concierge desk, who was very nice and helpful, and sat down at the activities desk to review what the resort had to offer and discuss potential activities we might be interested in. This was helpful, since we were interested in booking a few guided activities for the week. However, beware of the trap! They offer discounts on many activities if you agree to sit through â€œa quick 90 minute presentation about the resort and Diamond properties, just to educate people and get the word out about what they have to offer.â€� We reluctantly agreed to sit through this â€œpresentationâ€� in order to save some money on activities, since it was a good offer, and booked our â€œpresentationâ€� for mid-week. All of the discounts they offer are contingent upon you attending and sitting through the entire â€œpresentation.â€� Well, Tuesday came around, and we went to the lobby area for this â€œpresentation.â€� What a show this was! This was one of the worst, most painful experiences I have ever sat through in my life. The â€œpresentationâ€� was in fact a brief tour of the hotel and a sample room followed by an excruciating sales pitch about why we should buy a vacation ownership there. It was a worse experience that negotiating for and buying a car! We made explicitly clear from the beginning of this â€œpresentationâ€� that we were not going to be committing or buying anything, since we were newly weds trying to finish paying off our wedding and honeymoon trip. When asked about our jobs, we explained that I am a civil engineer and my wife is a scientist, so we both donâ€™t make rash decisions and like to really review and evaluate things before we agree to commit/buy (and read all the fine print about the hidden fees, which conveniently they neglect to tell you about!). This still did not deter our vacation counselor, Daniel, who I refer to as a self-proclaimed vacation dream weaver, from doing everything possible to get us to commit to buying a vacation ownership, even though he knew â€œthis probably wasnâ€™t for usâ€� from the get-go. No matter how many times we said no, there would be â€œjust one last thing.â€� We ended up being stuck there for almost three hours, with the staff trying to pull out all the stops to get us to buy â€“ a manager came over with this fancy story about special leiâ€™s that he gave us; Daniel took us over to a big screen TV to show us some simple math about the money we could save by buying there, in what I now refer to as his vacation wheel of fortune; and being offered every discount they had. While we were treated professionally, I was pretty disappointed in their presumptuous attitude, knowing nothing about our personal financial situation and still trying to get us to buy something after we told them we werenâ€™t in the financial position at the current time to take on any other payments, regardless of how good a deal anything was. Daniel actually at one point in his fancy sales pitch, which involved drawing pictures in a fancy game of Pictionary for almost everything he described, did have the nerve to insult my intelligence to ask me if I knew what the word â€œhypotheticalâ€� meant, as if it was some big word choice. One would think after we told him what our occupations were, he would have known he was at least dealing with two fairly educated people. After almost three hours, Daniel got a manager to come over to confirm that we werenâ€™t going to buy anything. The manager made some fancy scribbles on a paper and â€œsigned us outâ€� as if it was some kind of prison release. It was amazing at how their jovial attitudes changed after that. After finally getting to leave, we were greeted by a woman for a â€œquick exit surveyâ€�, where she promptly asked us some questions, but once again threw one more â€œfabulous dealâ€� at us to try to get us to buy! It felt like it never would endâ€¦ Iâ€™m extremely disappointed with how we were misled by this â€œpresentation.â€� It would have almost been worth spending the extra $165 on the activity we booked to avoid the three hours this took out of one of our days on our trip and the aggravation of sitting through it. Overall, though, itâ€™s a nice, clean place with a great beach and great view of the Maui sunset. Just avoid the vacation ownership sales pitch!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious one bedroom”
Reviews.Author: WMC08
Reviews.Content: Although the outside looks dated (it is a large pink pyramid), the rooms were very comfortable and spacious. The kitchenette is always nice to have when travelling especially the full size fridge. Bathroom was also large with lots of towels and two sinks. Bed was comfortable and had 2 tvs (one in bedroom with better cable and one in living room). We had the ocean view room which means that you could see part of the ocean when on the balcony with your head tilted (not a full on view) but we did not mind because we spent a lot of time at the beach. We used timeshare points for this one so cannot comment on price. I thought it was one of the best uses of my Diamond timeshare points compared to other vacations. Pool is a good size. We did not participate in any of the activities but seemed like there was a lot going on at the resort. We enjoyed walking on the beach to Dukes restaurant (10 min walk south on the beach) for lunch and drinks. We ate at the Pineapple grill based on other reviews but thought it was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Where to eat around there”
Reviews.Author: Tino59
Reviews.Content: When you are enjoying Maui then some good food should follow. And it does not have to empty your valet. Highly recommend "5 Palms Lahaina". You can see them from highway when driving from KBC to Lahaina right at the beginning of Front street. Breakfast 8 to 2.30 p.m. Their "5 Palm big breakfast " is only $11.95. It is soooo good. No comparison to $15 breakfast buffet at KBC (to me it was tasteless). Happy hour 3 to 7 p.m. Appetizers are at half price. Calamari are very good. Chinese style ribs are absolutely fantastic. Their dinner choices are awesome. We tried 4 different preparations for different kinds of fish and it is something. And if you save your old receipt, next day you can get your dinner 20% off. By the way, they have great salads too. Even romaine heart salad will surprise you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort (including some travel tips)”
Reviews.Author: MYeung918
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maui with my fiancÃ© and we got a week at Ka'anapali Beach Club through RCI. The resort is very nice a big. It has an open air feel to it since it is fully exposed to the outside. The only time you're indoor is if you are in your room or on the lowest ground level. We stayed at a one bedroom with partial kitchen, full bath and partial ocean view. The room was beautiful and clean. Bathroom had two sinks, soak tub, separate shower, and the toilet was in a separate room (added privacy). The kitchen had microwave, dishwasher, very small kitchen sink, coffee maker, blender, but no stove top (instead we got a hot plate cooker that you plug into the wall). The hot plate cooker was actually very good, we made steak dinner, eggs, even stir fry veggies. We saved lots of money on food by cooking dinner and making breakfast. There is a 16 dollar parking fee and free wi-fi only in the lobby, but some rooms can get reception if you are close enough to the lobby. I think internet was 10 dollars a day (we didn't get it). Since parking was so expensive we rented a car after our 4th day there so we only paid for 3 days of parking. TIP:: This hotel is actually very close to Kapalua-West Maui Airport (JHM) so if you want to save money you should fly into this airport instead of Kahului Airport. A cab ride from Kapalua airport is only 12 to 14 dollars while a cab ride from Kahulhi airport can cost up to 100 dollars each way. The hotel is located right on the beach which is great. Every night I slept with my window open so I could fall asleep and wake up to ocean waves. The bed was very comfortable so I had some of my best sleep here. The pool is very large and deep (up to six feet). There is a kiddy pool area with a small water slide for children. The pool is clean (I actually saw someone clean it in the morning) and nice. TIP:: When you check in you will get a towel card which lets you get a towel. They hold the cards until you return the towel and if you lost the card its 25 dollars so make sure you get your towel card back every time you return a towel. To save money on excursion we went to a timeshare presentation. We saved about 500 dollars booking with the hotel then if we were to book it ourselves. They did offer the best price. We were not pressured into a sale it was very easy we said no twice and then they let us off the hook. I think it's because we already own a timeshare and said we just don't want anymore, so maybe if you don't own anything they might press harder. We did our food shopping at the Times supermarket which is just a 10 minute walk. It's across the street and about 4 blocks to the right. TIP:: Starting 2011, Maui is BYOB, meaning bring your own bag. All venders do not provide plastic bags so bring reusable bags if you don't you'll have to carry your purchase in paper bags with no handles. There is a public bus route that stops right in front of the hotel. Bus fare is 1 dollar per ride so transfers are not free. The bus comes once every hour and the last best is at 8pm. All in all, this was a great resort. We did travel to other locations but if you want to just lounge around and do nothing this is the place to be. The beach is close and the pools are crisp and blue. I will come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Skeptical of "Ocean View" and the Concierge is an Aggressive Upsale Service”
Reviews.Author: longtrails
Reviews.Content: This hotel we discovered used to be the Embassy Suites but is now a time share owned by Diamond Resorts. We were very tired having traveled a long way on Thanksgiving day and arriving late afternoon. We checked in at the front desk and then the Concierge came to greet us. She gave us Lei's and had us go sit with her at her desk. We soon realized that she was trying to get us to agree to a 2 hour meeting to discuss buying in to the Diamond time share. She tried various tactics such as free meals, discounted activities. We kept saying no thank you and we are tired. Then she said well just wait a minute and she called her manager and then said to us "OK, well if you agree to take the 2 hour tour, we'll give you a 4-day cruise for $20". Well by this time our heads were spinning and it's not our style to be rude, but we simply said we are leaving now. Well so we finally got to our ocean view room. We had saved for our honeymoon and spent extra when booking through Orbitz to get an ocean view room. When we finally checked in to the ocean view room, we had to stand in one corner of the room and then we could look over the miniature golf course in the hotel and through the ventilation engines and then we could see a small block of the ocean. We were disappointed. So we went back to the front desk and said there must be some mistake. They pointed out to us that we did not buy a "deluxe" ocean room and that since we officially could see the ocean from our room, that was considered an ocean view room. We are polite people and don't usually write negative reviews, but we paid a premium for that room and this was very disappointing, so we decided when we got home we'd express our opinion. The only other negative was on channel 37 the owner of Diamond Resorts is on all day and night and he sits there in a chair with a fireplace and tells you why his properties are the best. It was like rubbing salt in a wound. Well, enough with the negative. But - there are certainly positives. The rooms are very nice. They are suites and roomy and a nice clean room with balcony. The staff is wonderful. We saw lots of people who couldn't say no going on the Diamond tours, and the gossip on each activity we went on was about getting duped in to the sales pitch. But we found the people who came to this resort as either owners or renters were really lots of fun. There was a bit of a "club" sense about it. The resort overall is really nice and it's close to a grocery store and we walked over and bought groceries. The pool staff is great and we tried Snuba with a guy named Cavin and he was a pleasure and helped us along even with our leg disabilities and was able to give us a great experience. The restauraunt is nice and they teach Hula and have some fun activities around the pool and you feel like you are part of an experience. Overall we had a very nice time. We give an average rating because although the staff and place are great, the aggressive upsale at check-in and the misleading advertising on the ocean view are disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice for exchanges”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here inummerable times, about time to write about it! Stayed in 1bdrm, 2 bdrm ocean view , mountains views...the rooms are always wonderful. Clean , spacious and well maintained. Living room area furniture good, not broken or smelly. Bathroom always wonderful and clean , linens always fresh and clean. Downside, is the exorbitant parking and the additional daily fees, all these, I heard will increase by January 1st, 2012. The beach area is rocky, in front and back, always have to bring water slippers. Also be careful of strong waves, very deceiving. The restaurant food is ok , and reasonable when you consider prices in Maui. There is a supermarket across the road and you can use the resort grill for your stay. You have to provide all your grilling needs. You can also request for a crib for a price, which i thought should be free. The resort is lovely with all the water features and koi ponds. Always a treat for my grandchildren to help during feeding times. Will continue to exchange there , i guess, since there is no reason not to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great price”
Reviews.Author: myarosz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights and the end of October. Our first room (703) had a ocean view if you looked between 2 buildings. We had a late check in and requested another room (withouth the handicap facilities) with a better view the next day. The woman at the desk told us to check the next day as nothing was available at the moment but would be. When we inquired about a another room the next day, no one at the front desk knew anything about it and no notes we recorded. Again we asked for a better room and the request was fulfilled but we had to wait another day again. The woman who took our request the first time have us the impression she had no interest in helping us. The staff took care of tranporting our luggage and groceries to our new room which was overlooking the pool with a 100% better view of the ocean. Housekeeping was prompt with the exception of the week end when we did not recieve any service un 4 pm. I am assuming it is because of various check outs on Saturday. I loved the large rooms and plenty of towels. Times grocery store across the street was very convenient. The staff was friendly. We used the beach more than the pool, The only disappointment is that they had no lounges on the beach and if the winds kicked up you were hit with sand. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay in Kaanapali; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: cdufek
Reviews.Content: We are Club Members at Diamond Resorts and normally stay at the Point at Poipu but hadn't been back to this resort in a while so spent a week at the Kaanapali Beach Club before heading to the Island of Kauai. We were at the resort October 15th through October 22nd. As previously noted, the grounds are beautiful and this place offers just about every activity one would want on their Hawaii vacation. It is a great resort for families who enjoy spending time at the pool and playing in the ocean. This place is huge and there is much activity; there are people everywhere. We had a 1 bedroom Deluxe Ocean View room (Room 109 on the Mezzanine level). The room was really on the 2nd floor just above the restaurant and kitchen. The view of the ocean was great. The only drawback to the location of this room was that for 7 days straight we had the odor of the grill in our room and at times; it smelled like hamburgers round the clock. At times it was quite annoying. The room has been described by the others and I won't go into any additional detail about that but I will add that the space was more than adequate for 2 adults. We ate out most of the days as the kitchen was really not set up for meal preparation and there was no place on the lanai to eat a meal unless you shared the little snack table between the 2 chairs. We ate at the grill one evening and the food was average. We also had the breakfast buffet and I was not at all impressed; the was food was just ok. It did not contain anything out of the oridinary; no hawaiian fruit (not even pineapple) that I recall and I would suggest that you walk to Duke's just down the boardwalk if you want a good breakfast (macademia nut and banana pancakes were awesome) with an ocean breeze. For those that like to exercise, the boardwalk through some of the close resorts was fun to walk (there were walkers and runners and many families with strollers) and led to a really good swimming and snorkeling beach. I was surprised that we were not asked to attend the Diamond Resort Presensation and we were happy about that. As noted by the others, the staff was receptive and very helpful. We had trouble with our TV one evening and it was fixed immediately. I personally prefer a quieter resort with a little less hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: LovetheTropics05
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights and found the property to be decent enough but nothing special. The grounds are beautiful-- lovely pool and plantings. The beach is narrow and steep but the views of Lanai'i and Molokai are beautiful. Our room was a little down at the heels and the kitchen is way too small to be functional. More outlets are needed in the kitchen. The toaster had to be squeezed next to the coffee maker or plugged into the bathroom. The mattresses are supposed to be new, but honestly are not that comfortable. Love the large bathroom! The first time we stayed here 6 years ago, it seemed much nicer. Too bad. The exterior of the hotel could use a new coat of paint. It's renowned on the island for its pink exterior.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzytravelingabroad
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It's very close to a grocery store and a few cheap restaurants. Beach isn't very swimmable but the pool is big and usually it isn't too hard to find a chair or two. King has checked us in two years in a row. He is such a pleasure, we were surprised to see he isn't a manager yet....maybe next year? The staff are all very friendly, just watch out for the timeshare hustlers. They will try to fake you out with a tour or presentation. Rooms are spacious and include a kitchen without a stove in the one bedrooms, they do have a plug in griddle. The two bedroom has a larger living/dining room and a fuller kitchen. Large bathtubs are included in bathrooms. Only gripe is bathrooms could be cleaned a little better. Food at the pool bar is ok, pizzas were very good! We have stayed here three years in a row, definitely worth checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but a nice resort”
Reviews.Author: NorCal-traveler08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as part of a 10 days trip to Maui. The hotel used to be the Embassy Suites(pink pryamid) but is now part of Diamond Resorts(timeshare). The hotel is in need of some updating(I understand some rooms are already being re-decorated) but the rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are fabulous. There is a kitchenette(fridge, microwave, electric skillet, dishwasher) and is fully stocked with everything you might need while cooking on vacation. We had an ocean view but it overlooked the mini golf course. You could hear the air conditioning running instead of the ocean waves. Ask for a room with a pool view. The grounds are also in need of some TLC but the koi ponds and foilage are beautiful. The beach is good with some good snorkeling right out in front of the hotel. The pool is large and has plenty of chairs with cushions. They only give you one beach towel per person at a time so that was a bummer. They have movie night on Friday night out by the pool and live music at the outside bar. It is located close to a grocery store(walking distance) and several places to eat and there is a shuttle to Whalers Village for $1. We were told that they are completely re-furbishing the hotel over the next year. That will make it a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation & pool but avoid the timeshare pitch”
Reviews.Author: Twinmommie
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a week. The hotel is nice and has a huge pool with waterfalls, a water slide and many koi ponds. As others posted, the $16/day parking was a bummer. There is free parking to the right side of the hotel as you face the beach. I think some beach access parking must be made available at the hotels. I don't know however if it is OK to park there overnight. We were greeted by someone just after we checked in to rope us into a timeshare meeting during the week. They offered $125 of vouchers. We went to the meeting and they offered childcare for our kids while we were there. It took a total of 3 HOURS of our time and we were not pleased and neither were our kids. Each time we tried to leave, somebody else would pressure us. It is a real waste of time. While chatting with others in the jacuzzi, this man who was an owner said that if we really wanted to own a timeshare, it's better to buy it as a resale. We stayed on the top (12th) floor which was not good as when it rained, the rain hit the fiberglass roofing and the noise kept me up all night. The room had 2 full size beds in the bedroom (too small for my husband and me) so the kids stayed in the bedroom and my husband and I stayed in the living room sofa bed. Although the bathroom is very large, the room with the toilet is right against the shower, divided by a distorted glass wall. This was not a good idea as when I was taking a shower, my son had to use the toilet so I had to place a towel over myself until he was done. The kitchen was well equipped and had a microwave, dishwasher and electric pan. They do offer childcare, but our kids (7 y.o. twins) did not like it since they were not 10+, they were not allowed in the part of the room where they could play Wii and mini-bowling. I will not come back to this hotel because (as the timeshare manager stated) they had given us the "privilege" of staying at their hotel and I did not appreciate their arrogance.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort property”
Reviews.Author: Claud L
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7-day vacation in Maui where my fiance and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club. First impression of the resort was great - spacious grounds, cool Hawaiian touches all around, really clean, open-air spaces, and awesome pool. Our 1-BR suite was huge and really comfortable. Bathroom had 2 sinks, soaking tub and separate shower, and the towels were nice and plush. The KBC feels like a resort, i.e. much more than a hotel. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the hallways could use an updating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Leigh R
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautiful, on a great beach. The pool was the kind you would picture at a resort...surrounded by waterfalls, koi ponds, a slide for kids, a hot tub for adults (ok, kids too). A few things that dissapointed me....you have to pay extra for a lot of stuff, but I believe this is common in Hawaii. Parking was $16 a day (in January 2012 they are going to start charing a "resort fee of $25/day which will include parking and internet), laundry was not in your room, there was no oven or stove top (but an electric skillet), and the fridge was small. There was a grocery store, shops, and restaurants within walking distance of the resort. Amazing snorkeling was within a 10 minute (or less) drive. One of our last nights we happened upon HUGE sea turtles eating before sunset. I'm a big girl and one of the sea turtles was almost my size!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Marsha F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBC this month (Oct 11) Sadly we had to cut short our stay due to a death in the family and return to Australia. As soon as we heard we were devastated and didn't know where to turn. I bundled all my paperwork and headed for the Concierge desk. Angel was the concierge on duty. She was wonderful...took the paperwork I had..arranged flights home and accomodation along the way and also managed to get accomodation refunds as we were due to stay on Waikiki on the way home. This wonderful girl spent hours on this and made a tragic event much easier for us. Prior to that the staff were so obliging and it is absolutely a GREAT place to stay. Also to quote my husband they also serve the best Hawaiian Burgers in the restaurant. We will stay again in a second, given the chance

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location but hotel is not the best....”
Reviews.Author: Boilers-in-oregon
Reviews.Content: We were at the beach club for a week. Service is mostly poor and the guest services folks have much training to receive. Do not sign up for the portraits as that sub contractor is horrible. Other than that, the bar at the hotel is great with ver y good happy hour specials every day

Reviews.Title: “Beware of TimeShare - Do Not Sign”
Reviews.Author: mphumphr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the KBC several times as time share members. No issues with the place - nice place to stay. As a timeshare owner, beware that from time to time you can be assessed yearly dues above the standard dues to cover large maintenance issues. My normal annual fee is about $1800 which is freaking expensive. Just got my 2012 fee - $4000!! And it is for a resort we have never stayed at in Kaui since this is a sister resort to that one. Think about how any nights you could stay at the Grand Waleai for that amount. I am trying to sell this $&#% thing now, because who knows what the fee will be the following year. They will suck you into a timeshare talk when there. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Maui perfect”
Reviews.Author: UtahUtes69
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, we were somewhat apprehensive about our stay at the Kannapali Beach Club. After our week long stay at this hotel, I'm not sure that these negative reviewers stayed at the same hotel we did. The hotel was about as good as it can get, Great staff includding the timeshare folks who when told them I was not interested as I was there on a timeshare exchange, thanked me, and gave us a little gift. Our one bedroom suite had an ocean view and was clean and well furnished. The oversize bathroom was unlike anything I have experienced in other hotels. The pool area is the best on Maui including the brand hotels down the road. The valet attendant told us about a great place for breakfast across the street in a little strip mall. Believe it was called soup and nuts. Crazy local bar at night, but great breakfast special in the morning. There is also a grocery store in this strip mall that was convenient and well stocked. We bought some light items for lunch as there is a fridge and microwave in the room. The beach is steps from the hotel and the pool attendants are great about moving the lounge furniture to be convenient to the beach and the pool. Parking is $16.00 per day, but is covered and convenient to the hotel elevators. I'm used to big city parking charges so this was no big deal to me. They do charge for internet access, but do provide free access in the lobby area. All in all the Kaanapali Beach Club is a hidden gem and you should definitely consider staying with them. Keep in mind Maui is expensive and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: LahainaBound77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2- weeks in July. It is a well kept, very clean hotel with underground parking and a nice beach. The staff was very accomodating. The location is approx. 5 minutes from Lahaina, which is where we spend most of our time. The have a really nice pool area with more than enough chairs, music, bar, food, and diving lessons. The workout room was good, and clean. They supply your pool towel which you can turn in whenever you want for a new one. There is only a limited number of 2-bedroom rooms, which are hard to come by. We had a 1-bedroom with a roll-away bed for my wife and I and our 2-teenagers. We used the fold out sofa also. Kapalua is 5- minutes away with a great beach and snorkeling.The main airport is about 40 minutes away. We liked this resort so much, we are buying a timeshare there.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: charlene g
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of getting married on beautiful Maui and stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club with my parents and our 2 year old son. The staff were extremely friendly and upgraded us to an ocean view as a courtesy due to our wedding ( fabulous! ) The location of the hotel was great however due to the massive nature of the hotel you really lose the intimate feeling Maui has to offer .. the other downside to the hotel is no screen door ( crazy ) since we were on the 5th floor with a 2 year old who we were terrified would push a chair up to the railing on the lanai and topple over so had to keep the sliding doors closed at all times and the lack of any decent laurdry facility. The kitchenette is "dooable" although an oven and cooktop would have been ideal, however the one washer and two dryers per every even floor was ridiculous! I give the staff a 5 however the lack of locking screens, unbelievably lackinging laundry facilities and barely functional kitchenette would be enough for me to definiely seek other accomodations on future trips. I have stayed at the Maui Eldorado right down the street and have found their accomodations and prices to be far superior to the KBC. We were fortunate to have my father-in-law provide us with his timeshare on this trip however would not stay here again if it wasn't free. And the 16 dollar a day parking was just an extra added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: waterskier_29
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest Hotel that I've ever stayed in. Very clean. Hotel staff treated me and my wife very well! We stayed 7 nights. They had washing machines which were very helpful. The skillet in the room had its limitations but you just have to get the right food to cook. The pool and beach front were Awesome! There is a bar at the pool where you can order drinks and just relax. The beach-front at the hotel was great too. The king size bed was the most comfortable bed that I've slept in while traveling. The hotel staff was very helpful in making dinner reservations and booking events. Me and my wife already reserved a room for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hunted466
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a week and like others, I was a little aprehensive because of some negative comments. All I can say is that if you are complaining about this resort you are one of "those people"! We were treated like royalty upon our arrival and it continued throughout our stay. The pool was fantastic (as was the poolside bar), great location, service, rooms, amenities, etc. The parking is $16.00. So what? Don't go on vacation if that's going to present a problem. It's $16.00/day for valet parking and the guys couldn't be better about helping with bags and hurrying to get your car. The Hyatt charges $10.00 just to self-park. You people must not have ever been to New York or any other major city. I've paid $50 to self park so quit whining! The timeshare people approached us right after we checked in on our way to the room and we said we weren't interested and that was the last we ever saw of them. I highly recomment this hotel for it's value for the dollar. We met friends that were staying at the Hyatt and paid double what we paid. After spending time over there we couldn't wait to get back to KBC. Keep up the good work. We'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “We love it, love it, love it!”
Reviews.Author: aereo22
Reviews.Content: We were there from Aug 28 to Sep 4, and we can't wait to go back! The room is super nice and clean, the bed is king plus, the bathroom has soooo much room. Ok the kitchen is kind of small and does not have a stove, but the skillet is so useful. If you know how to cook, you can do anything you want with that thing. The pool is so big and relaxing. I agree that the little whirpool was always full and people overstay their 15 min., but we did not care. The beach is enough ( I don't understand why people say is small, it is, but very sufficient). The sunsets are gorgeous. We bought wine and sat at the lanai almost every night. We had a view to the mountains and it was beautiful. We did not rent a car, and the bus was very good to go to lanai and napili bay. We had a super vacation there, so do not hesitate and go!

Reviews.Title: “Why All The Negative Reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Bronzchica
Reviews.Content: I approached this hotel with some trepidation after seeing the massive number of negative reviews. It was nice to see they were completely unwarranted. The checkin person checked us in immediately and offered us free parking for our stay. I was aware of the parking charge because I read the information that was emailed to me prior to my arrival. The timeshare sellers did grab us after check in but we told them we weren't interested and they respected our decision and never bothered us for the rest of our 2 week stay. Our condo unit was extremely spacious. Lovely bathroom and kitchen was sufficient for our needs. Not sure if some people are cooking up 4 course feasts while on vacation, but I found it had everything I needed. One thing I really appreciated was that there were PLENTY of chairs at the pool. You don't find this at many resorts, usually people are up at 6:00 am reserving their chairs but this was not the case at KBC, very refreshing. Definitely rent a car and get out and see Maui. I saw a public bus around the island but I question if that could get you all of the little beaches. Get out there and explore! We loved DT Fleming beach park and Kapalua Bay. Also, Hanakaoo beach park just past the Hyatt was wonderful. You will find the beach parks are very well designed with bathrooms, picnic tables, parking and plenty of shade. This is not common everywhere on the mainland. Check out Wailea and Paia, This is a great property, can't believe the complaints on here. We had a wonderful time and hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Big Pink Resort”
Reviews.Author: mitimom
Reviews.Content: My husband and friends and I recently returned from a week stay at the Kaanapali Beach Club, a Diamond Resort. We all had a wonderful time and really enjoyed the amenities of the resort. The pool and pool bar are refreshing and beautiful with great sunset views. The location is great with a grocery store across the street and a neighborhood park with great snorkeling walking distance away, and Lahaina and Whalers Village a short trip by car. There is also a bus stop on the property. We were treated like special guests upon arrival, even upgraded to an ocean view room that was spacious and well equipped. My only disappointment was the hefty per diem parking charge. It also appears they are making improvements from the bottom up as our 5th floor suite was upgraded and our friends' 11th floor room was not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oceanfront property, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: mshorris
Reviews.Content: This is right on the beach in Ka'anapali. There are now wonderful walkways leading to Ka'anapali Beach and Wayfarer's Village. Great for strolling and jogging. The staff is extremely helpful and gracious. The poolside cabana staff is awesome too. You can rent snorkel gear right there and the snorkeling is great. The exercise room is quite small and there was often a wait for a machine. Stay away from the Diamond Resort Timeshare deal. We found the associates to be rude.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from any night life or activities”
Reviews.Author: Lfour44
Reviews.Content: The name of this resort is deceiving. It is not IN Ka'anapali Beach. It is north of the main beach and a very far walk on the beach (if the tide is low and you can get through). You must drive everywhere from here. Also, they charge a daily fee for parking and internet use (not wireless). They basically close up by 10:00 p.m. and there is not much to do here other than lay at the pool. We paid for 5 nights and ended up moving to the Westin at Ka'anapali Beach after the 3rd night and we were so glad we did. We loved the Westin location and never used our car once we got there. Lots of night life at Whalers Village and lots of other hotel bars to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place...Awesome suites!”
Reviews.Author: Steev_0
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed ourselves at the KBC. The view from the room was intoxicating & the activities were plentiful. The room was very accommodating & the staff very friendly. We did not eat on the property as the prices were a bit high & there are good places across the street for less money. If you stay here do not swim in the ocean without water socks. We cut our feet on the first day & limped around the rest of our trip. The only other lows are the $16. per day parking & no stove in an otherwise nicely equipped kitchen. It is not actually on Kaanapali Beach so don't let the name fool you. It was very windy almost every day on that part of the island in mid August....don't know if that was just bad luck or not!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: Jedmonds905
Reviews.Content: Positives: We rented the suite from its timeshare owner. Great veiw and the suite was spacious. The bathroom was gigantic and well appointed. The kitchenette was adequate although there was no cook top. We were actually able to get a good night's sleep on the bed in the master bedroom. Negatives: The living room furniture needed to be refurbished. The paint on the arm chair was all gummy and scratched up. When you sat in the chair it felt like your arms were resting on a massive wad of chewing gum. The sofa bed was dirty and stained and was in need of a steam cleaning. The skirts on the inside were ripped from age. A little paint and a furniture upgrade would do wonders for the place. Other than that it was relatively comfortable. My only other complaint was being directed to the time share welcome booth on check in. My wife, sister-in-law and I had just checked in after a 4 + hour flight from Sacramento. All we wanted to do was get checked in, situated in our room, showered and on our way to a family dinner with my son, his finacee and her parents and her sister's family. Also the sales rep's face went sour when we told him we weren't ready to talk about timeshare ownership. Love to own a house or condo on Maui if it was in our budget, but a man's got to know his limitations. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Good value resort.”
Reviews.Author: surfcity_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel resort last week. It it okay. It's a timeshare resort with a mini kitchen (microwave, dishwasher, electric grill, juicer, plate settings, and utensils). The kitchen saved us some $ on breakfast and dinner. We stopped by Costco few times to buy things to cook/grill. This property has 6 propane gas grills in the back with ocean view!! It was cool to just grill some fish and steak and have a picnic. The concierge has the grilling tools for guests free of charge. The room was nice, but you can tell it needs some remodeling since it shows its age. The staff were very friendly, and the cleaning crew were wonderful; they cleaned daily and ran the dishwashers whenever there are plates inside. It always boggles my mind why they would have carpet at tropical area because you do smell the muggy smell (probably from carpet) because of high humidity and stuff. For some reasons, the sliding glass doors have no bug screens. I mentioned to them, and they said they don't have much bug problems. I do see some flying bugs in the room when we cook. I would probably not use AC (save them $) and leave the sliding glass doors open if there were bug screen doors. Overall, the common ground, landscape, pool are well kept. The "activitiy" room for kids is great! Free video games, air hockey, foosball, and other board games. You get to rent boogie boards for free. The only game you pay is the 2-lane mini bowling alley. One thing I didn't like is the $16/day parking fee. It's a common fee for hotel to boost revenue. I am anti-parking fees. I would not have picked it if I didn't get such good deal on the weekly stay package.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: charles959
Reviews.Content: When this resort was the Embassy Suites It was top self. Now it is a Diamond resort timeshare. Lousy!!! All they want to do is sell you a timeshare. Service is bad buffet is over priced and selection is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Our week in Maui”
Reviews.Author: irishwhiskey135
Reviews.Content: This place is located on the ocean five miles north of Lahinia.With its pink decor you can miss it when driving to it.It will cost you a fee to park your rental car in the basement garage.The view from our room was beautiful on the the12th floor.The rooms sleep four with one huge bathroom. It is minutes from Whalers Village,Lahinia and about a 40 minute drive from the main airport .There are ice machines and pay washing machines on every other floor.A breakfast buffet every morning,snack and fastfood breakfast bar located on the main floor.The outdoor bar serves lunch and dinner which we used most of the time.There is afternoon entertainment and happy hours from 3 to 7pm.we saw many wedding parties during our stay having pictures taken in the gardens or in front of the many waterfalls.This hotel sells vacation time shares.We did not take part in any of the meetings that they hold daily.Before we even saw our room,staff was trying to schedule us for a meeting.Our luggage was still at the curb.It was a total turn off, but it didn't affect the rest of our stay.The fitness center was outside near the pool.It was small and congested.The machines were very close together.Our room was spacious.We had a large fridge with a microwave,sink and coffeemaker.We went out on shopped a the safeway which is located in Lahinia for all our needs.The safeway was about 5 minutes away,and was much cheaper than the area stores near the hotel.We passed it everyday.The rooms on the southside of resort have the better views.We had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Ka'anapali - good space, close to beach, but otherwise a bit isolated - you need a car”
Reviews.Author: MDKiwi
Reviews.Content: This timeshare resort is in Honokowai so is not on the board walk that links the resorts and restaurants in Ka'anapali The room was very spacious, clean, and had a great balcony with a lovely sea and sunset view. The room had a kitchenette that was very functional, and with a supermarket 5 minutes walk away it was easy to organize our own breakfast etc. The hotel interior and rooms are showing signs of age. The pool was large. The fitness center was smallish with a limted range of equipment - the exercycles were not particularly good. The beach is sandy, windy, and flew red flags (dangerous) the two days that we were there. We saw lots of colorful fish just off of the beach. You can only walk beyond neighboring properties at low tide meaning that you really need a rental car to enjoy the really nice beaches that are only 5 minutes to the north or south, and to get to restaurants outside of the resort. Parking is $16 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: Andie57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. We had a group of six and three different rooms. Our room was an ocean view and was just awesome. Although our friends rooms were not, they each had excellent views of gardens and swimming pools and seemed very satisfied with their accommodations. The rooms were very spacious. The living room had a large flat screen tv complete with DVD. The bedroom also had a nice size flat screen as well. Although your not really there to watch much television it was sure nice to have the abality to watch DVD's of surfing and zip lining at the end of the day. We also had a docking station for ipods. The furnishings were nice and it was extremely clean. The location was great and although we didn't have children traveling with us, the resort seemed to have plenty of activities to keep kids of all ages busy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, GREAT ROOM, amenities were awesome”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The kitchen and bathroom were great. We chose a one-bedroom scenic view. Rooms were quiet. Maid service was great, and the beach and pool were beautiful. The activity center was really nice. Awesome bowling. The location was Great. A push at check-in for a time share presentation. Timing was very inconsiderate of our state of mind after a long day of travel. Or maybe that was the intent. $16.00 per day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere else if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: DCjoann
Reviews.Content: I am giving this an average review based on three things. The rooms are large, the property grounds are nicely maintained and has its own beach front and the propery is a good location in Kaanapali and accessible to beach walk. We stayed for a week in June for our wedding and honeymoon. A friend gave us her time share rate of about $200/night. The propery is older and clearly showing its age, the common areas and hall ways are very marginal. However it is nicely located and the gardens are well maintained. The resturants are unappealing and the food and beverage staff were clearly puzzled on how to execute the gifts of champagne and breakfast in bed our friends paid for.
