In the end, it was such as hassle that we had to ask them to refund the money. The rooms are large with a separate living area with a small kitchen. The kitchen is nicely appointed which is important as we wanted to be able to make breakfast, have snacks and eat leftovers and given the food prices on Maui, this is important. The downside, maid service only once a week. We had a King size bed and a large bedroom. There was a very large marble bathroom with a soking tub and separate shower. Very nice. Not so nice, paying $15/day for parking and paying extra for the Internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 808Gail
Reviews.Content: Staff was unfriendly and unhelpful...pretty useless. Around 8 staff members standing around doing nothing when we arrived at the front desk. When I gave them my confirmation number I was told they did not have a room for us. Was told by the staff member that I had to go to Aston Mahana next door where they sent our reservation. She said they should be expecting us. Nothing more was said...almost like...get out of here, you're not our problem anymore.... Go next door. Poor customer service....I will not recommend this hotel to any of my family or friends. On the other hand, Aston Mahana was great. They were very apologetic about our situation even though it wasn't their fault. They tried to accomodate us as best they could. Garret and Gerri at the front desk were the best. Super friendly and most helpful. The room was nice with a great view of the ocean. They turned my bad situation into something not so bad. I was furious when I first arrived...but when I finally got my room I was fine. The staff at Aston Mahana was the best. My recommendation would be to stay at Aston Mahana. They know how to treat their guests. Kaanapali Beach Club needs to take some lessons from them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, my wife & I love it”
Reviews.Author: Frank017
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love Ka'anapali Beach Club so much that we have stayed there 3 times. This last time we talked 2 other couples into joining us. Your first impression as you walk into the open air lobby is great. The suites are large, beds comfortable, huge bathroom which allows access to the bed room closet, a really neat idea. There is also a large living room, dining room and a kitchen. Off of the living room is a balcony with chairs and table. Their is a huge swimming pool that is next to the beach. The pool was recently rebuilt. There is a rooftop miniature golf course and many other recreational activities. It is located just a 5 minute drive from Lahaina. If we didn't live on the east coast we would probably go every year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the family”
Reviews.Author: lizzzzie
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the resort. Pros: Right on the beach with beach access, nice swimming pool, and kids pool with water slide. Small kitchenette in the room (plug in skillet, microwave, and full size frig.) Cons: If you are not an owner at the property you will be charge $10/day for internet access and $13/day for parking. If you are an owner no charges for internet and parking. I would have liked a full size kitchen but was able to make do with what the room had. Great service all around. Extra info: My Vacation Portraits (MVP) located in the gift shop will take pics of your family and give you a free 8x10 hoping you will purchase additional prints. Book any photographer except Jackie. I found her very rude both during the photo session and during the viewing of our phots. After talking with other guests they felt the same way. I heard no other complaints about other photographers when I asked around.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DivingOver60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming here almost every year for about 10 years now. We usually spend the first week with either one of our kids and their families or my brother and his family. The second week we always spend by ourselves so that we can just relax and do whatever we want. This is a GREAT place to stay as it is close enough to Lahaina and Whalers Village to be handy, but without the crowds. We are scuba divers and this property sits on one of the BEST reefs on the West side of Maui. The reef has a couple turtle cleaning stations and is home to some of the biggest turtles around this island. The property has really worked to keep updated and we've had large flat screen TV's in each room the last couple years. They have also updated their workout facilities and is much nicer now. The pool and water slide is always a hit with the kids! We'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to go”
Reviews.Author: Azbkpkr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy coming to KBC. There are a few things that I can tell you to make the trip better. The staff is awesome and very friendly. If you want a pool cabana ($60 day), call the resort a week before you go to reserve it. They book up early. There is a grocery store right acroos the street for all of your food. The BBQ pit is a great place to cook and hangout before sunset. Don't do the Luau. Just hangout at the pool and watch the show without paying $70 for a buffet. It is 2 miles up the road from the main portion of Kaanapali but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationingturtles
Reviews.Content: We used our points from HGVC and stayed in a 1bed. The exterior of the hotel may seem dated but the interior was very nice and roomy. I would have given them 5 stars for the hotel except that our room had an "old" smell. I don't know why, everything was nice and modern. We were upgraded to the 12th floor, the top floor with a nice ocean view. I think if you ask and it's available they will upgrade you. They charge $16 parking. The Internet called Shakanet is free throughout the Kaanapali beach area, but the connection can be slow or nonexistent. The coin operated laundry is $1.50washer/$1.25dryer. It was never crowded. The pool was warm with a lot of chairs, never that crowded also. Some people say they nickel and dime here, but I think they try to keep the rental costs from being so high and to prevent waste. The kitchen was well equipped with everything you need. It's a partial kitchen, the refrigerator was smaller than the normal size and there was no gas or electric range. The electric skillet was large. You can ask for a rice cooker at no charge. There are 6 barbecue grills by the pool. We never had to wait. You can buy food at Costco at the airport or you can buy food across the street at Times supermarket. The location was very convenient, Safeway and Foodland was 5-10 way in Lahaina. Overall this is a great place to stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Had an Awesome Time”
Reviews.Author: donanna2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBC for the second time in the last year and a half and we had an awesome time. We arrived at the resort on July 6th before noon and my husband requested an ocean front room. The girl at the desk could not have been sweeter. Because our room was not ready, they took our cell phone number and offered to call us when the room was ready. We then went to Costco and got stocked up on groceries. On our first visit we had sat through a timeshare presentation and it was grueling. I vowed never to do it again. I was nervous that we would be pressured but no mention was ever made. My advice to new visitors to the KBC when asked to attend a timeshare presentation is to just firmly say no. Our room was on the 5th floor and it had a beautiful ocean and pool view. We signed up for the pool and beach dive and enjoyed it so much we decided to get certified. Our instructor was Artie and he was hilarious. IF you are thinking of getting certified, do it there. The water is warm and Artie makes it so enjoyable. What a great experience. Our teenage boys hung out at the pool or jacuzzi and enjoyed themselves. The room had a wonderful coffee maker and electric skillet. Half price mai tais at happy hour put a smile on my face. Overall, it was a wonderful experience. The resort is a bit dated but the rooms are remodeled and very nice. There is WiFi connection in the lobby. The only hassle is using the lobby computers to print your boarding passes. They are expensive and you find yourself wasting valuable time clicking out of the advertisements. I let ut a few expletitives and the clerk at the front desk offered to print my boarding passes for me. Again, everyone worked hard to make our vacation extremely pleasant. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families”
Reviews.Author: Danny007
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 years old daughter and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Club from May 30 to June 11, 2011. We wanted to use the Sampler package purchased from Diamond Resorts to try the resort but had to sit through another 2 hours presentation from their sale office. That was by far the most annoying and frustrating part of the trip as they really pressure you to purchase a time share. However the rest of our stay at the hotel was very pleasant. It is located on a nice stretch of beach but make sure you have water shoes, there is lot of reef in the area, which creates a better snorkeling experience. It is a big property with lots to do with kids. My daughter really enjoyed the pool and waterslide. You can also get free scuba diving lessons in the pool. Their activities centre (and staff) is great with bowling alleys, air hockey table, playstations 3, board games and painting/drawing tables. There is also a mini-putt area outside. They have a restaurant and a bar on-site by the pool. The room was nice and spacious. However, it only has a kitchenette which was not ideal. The fridge is small and there is no stove nor oven. There is a dishwasher, microwave, coffee machine and an electric skillet. There is a BBQ area by the beach. There is no washer/dryer in the room. And I could not believe that the hotel room did not come with free wifi!!! Finally, if you want to explore you will definitely need a car but if you just want to hang out and relax, there are plenty of things to do in the area. There is a walking distance Times grocery store across the street and a few restaurants nearby including "Dukes" restaurant at the Honua Kai resort. Also, there is a bus stop by the hotel that takes you to Whalers Village for dining and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Some staff are a little too serious”
Reviews.Author: vacationperson1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort I must say. The pink color of the building along with the bright blue swimming pool make this place picture perfect. There was one guy that was the employee in charge of handing out towels and snorkel gear at the shack by the pool was a little "unhappy" it seemed. I don't know this guys deal but he would go around and stare at everyone around the pool. Seemed like more of a security guard for the place. He was looking to challenge anyone that didn't belong at the pool. The guy needs to relax and remember he's working at a vacation resort. If the mgr. reads this, tell him to have a beer before he starts his shift or something to make him more happy. One thing about the pool, it gets crowded and very hard to find anywhere to lay out after 12noon. You almost have to reserve a chair or recliner or put a book on it to show its taken. Most of the time we were sandwiched in with everyone else. Besides that, the food at this place was pretty good. We ate at the outdoor bar area and had burgers and fries. and a club sandwich.. Good price, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we'd hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyRoseville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Kaanapali Beach Club and were truly pleased and are anxious to return. I am a very selective hotel guest and often times ask to change rooms if I am not completely satisfied; however, I was MORE than pleased with our room. We are Diamond Resort time share owners and in definite need of a vacation, so we decided to go to Maui at the last minute. We stayed in Room 940 which had an amazing view of the ocean and the pool. The room is extremely spacious and very nicely decorated and as everyone else has commented on, the bathrooms are huge. There isn't a stove/oven in the kitchen but is fully equipped otherwise, refridgerator, dishwasher, sink, dishes, coffee maker, etc. Anyway, we made due just fine with the large electric skillet and microwave. The pool is exceptionally nice with plenty of lounge chairs. The resort was at maximum capacity and there was never a shortage of lounges. The ONLY negative was the fact that where our room was located you had no privacy on the balcony, so if you went out on your balcony you had to be completely dressed since your neighbor could be on their balcony only a few feet away. At first it was bothersome since I like to go out on the balcony, have my coffee and read the paper in the morning in my night clothes but I soon got over it. Again, it was the ONLY negative. As a resort owner we had free internet access and newspaper delivery daily; however, there is a $16 daily parking fee regardless of whether your an owner. The staff were incredibly accomodating, the food on the premises was fine, there is a grocery store directly across the street and a independent shuttle bus to Lahaina and Whalers Village available for a $1.00 and picks up right at the resort. We are extensive travelers, and we especially love the beaches. We have been everywhere from Cabo, Cancun, Bahamas, Virgin Islands, Jamaica to Aruba, to name only a few and this rivals some of the most exlusive resorts we have stayed in. So, I hope this helps you decide to go. I ALWAYS read trip advisor before I go but have never submitted a review, so I thought I owed it to all of the other trip advisor readers to write a review on this property! Go and enjoy... mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Park next to the hotel on the beach access road”
Reviews.Author: coastaltravler03
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and found the only hot tub on the property inadequate for the 400 plus people staying in the resort. The hot tub was always full (held about 6-8 adults). Take the 90 minute timeshare presentation and get some big discounts on activities. Instead of paying $16.00 plus taxes per day to park in the hotel parking garage, go to the North side of the hotel and park for free on the beach access road. There is a great market just across the street which has anything you might need. Staff was pleasant and responded immediately to requests.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to be back”
Reviews.Author: GMarginet
Reviews.Content: As promised on my January 2011 review, my partner and I went back to KBC in May. We were there the first week of May and once again, had a wonderful time. When we were checking in, King a very friendly front desk employee, remembered us and welcomed us home again. We saw a lot of familiar friendly faces during our stay and it confirmed why we like coming here so much. We had a deluxe ocean view room and loved our wonderful views of Molokai to the right and Lanai on the left. We did a lot of snorkeling this trip too. I strongly recommend going to Boss Frog's ( a small chain of equipment rental) and getting a snorkeling kit (about $35 for the week). The fish and marine life right outside the hotel's beach is amazing. We saw a ton of tropical fish and loved every second of it. Even if you are not a water person, Maui is a beautiful place to visit and I strongly recommend this island to everyone. There's a limited nitelife but if you head to Lahaina (about 5 minute drive south) or Paia (30 minute drive towards the airport) you can have late night drinks, music and fun. What we like to do is head to Oahu for the weekend before coming back to LA to get back into the swing of things. We generally stay in a hotel on Waikiki Beach and I will be submitting my review for the Moana Surfrider soon. To summarize our visit to KBC...once again, we loved every moment we spent there. The people and the location make it a wonderful place to spend time in the Aloha State... Mahalo, Ka'anapali Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TubaChristmas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 15 nights. All the staff was very cordial, many very outgoing. especially King at the front desk when we checked in. We stayed in a 4th floor partial ocean view room facing north. As mentioned by many others, the units are quite large, only the kitchenette is small. The electric fry pan instead of a stove did not present any problems other than once. The micro wave is directly wired to the same circuit as the GFCI outlet on the counter. Once during the middle of supper prep using both, the breaker tripped. A call down and they had it reset within five minutes. The bathroom had a deep tub, a separate shower and w.c.. There was a pedestal sink at one end, a vanity style one at the other. Storage; besides a double long closet accessible from both the bedroom and bathroom with a shelf atop, there were 12 good size drawers split between the bedroom and living room. The night stands alongside the king size bed also had drawers. There were two TVs and two ceiling fans. One feature we really liked, central air with separate controls for temperature and fan speed. Since we were guests not owners house keeping came daily. They replenished everything and ran the dishwasher, once when the dishes were already clean. Being guests we also had the privilege of paying $16/day to park in the underground ramp. We ate only once at the resort restaurant, did the half price happy hour [3-6 PM] a couple times. Times grocery store and the strip mall is about the equivalent of 3 blocks away. The pool, heated to 81 deg., with its many waterfalls is beautiful. The "lounge chair hoarders" were out early in the morning spreading towels etc. across what they must have considered choice seating, however there were so many chairs available that we could always find a couple no matter what time of day it was. The beach is not very wide during high tide. We walked south about a quarter mile to snorkel, where it was only fair at best. After the tsunami the water was murky. One can stroll to Whaler's Village in about 45 minutes. After the first 100 yards there is the option of staying on the beach until Black Rock or doing the hard surface beach walk. We walked down one late afternoon to catch the sunset cliff dive at the Sheraton, the beach walk path is lighted. There is a lawn/garden on the mauka side of the grounds, not evident from the pool area, and only partially from the lower floors. There is a small white gazebo where we renewed our wedding vows. Though private it was not exactly ceremonious, I just asked my bride if she was willing to try it for another 38 years, she said "sure, why not". There is a bathroom in the lower lobby that has a cubicle and shower for cleaning up before heading to the airport for a red eye flight home, soap and towel are furnished. Cons: The already mentioned parking fee. Although the person we eventually saw was friendly and not pushy, we had to wait 20 minutes at the activities desk area to see someone for a parking pass. The only thing between our room and the laundry room [one washer and two dryers on even numbered floors] was a staircase so it was not difficult for us check availability or to use, but it could be if staying on another floor. A few times someone was sitting on a chair in hall while doing their clothes. The day we left the washer was out of order. All things considered we very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: OhioSuTee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights at the Kaanapali Beach Club in Maui in March, 2011. We saw a terrific price on Travelzoo and decided to take a chance. What a great choice. This is a timeshare condo resort.....with large suites.... seperate bedroom......full kitchen.....living room area and balcony. The rooms are very nicely appointed. Room service daily was provided and the week we booked.....we also received free breakfast buffet coupons with our reservation. This was a nice added bonus. This hotel sits directly on the beach and has a large shaded if need be pool area. I would reccomend renting a car at the airport so that you have the freedom to come and go and explore the island. We did drive up to the top of the volcano which was an experience and well worth the trip...... "take a warm sweatshirt or jacket....it's cold up there!". We also did a whale watch trip with the Pacific Whale Foundatioon which was wonderful! Food is pricey in Maui......so talk with other vacationers to see where they have been and what they liked. The only thing we did not like about this resort was the daily parking fee..... which I believe was about $16.00. They do offer valet with the parking which is great but then you tip on top of the daily rate. I would also suggest a drive around the island and stop to see the kite surfers....what a beautiful sight! Free internet is only provided in the lobby and within a certain area only. They do offer internet in the rooms for a fee. Since this is a time share resort..... you will be asked to take a few hours to tour the resort and then get a sales pitch..... we declined and were not bothered at all. They do offer discounts, etc..... if you agree to do so.....but we preferred to enjoy the resort by ourselves. Aloha.... enjoy your trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: kapev
Reviews.Content: Okay, we are hooked. We LOVE this place! We are a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children - age 6 & 9). We have been there several times now. We love the large one bedroom units (maybe 900 sq ft?). They have partial kitchens (with the exception of a stove), but they have counter cookers which work fine. The fridge is not a mini fridge, but not a large fridge either, it's somewhere in between. So you can do your costco shopping and be fine for room. Plus there's a freezer on it. There are about 4 - 5 nice barbeques too where you can watch the sun go down as you make your dinner. During the Whale season, you can see Whales off shore too. My kids loved the free snuba lessons that they have daily in the pool. We watched older kids surf right off the beach along with people playing in the small waves, snorkling and of course snuba and scuba too! It's a great beach that you can do almost anything on for all ages - but you still need to watch the little ones as there are small waves and they can get bigger at certain times of the year. The pool is awesome and warm too! The resort is in walking distance to the supermarket, some small restaurants and the famous ABC stores of Hawaii. The facilities in the resort are also very good. Don't forget the Kids Club! (small fee for some projects/events). We couldn't get our kids out of there - they loved it! This is an awesome 4-5 star resort! You wont regret staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Whales swam right in front of the resort every day!”
Reviews.Author: ByeByeGrammy
Reviews.Content: Great resort. Lovely views. Very helpful staff. Clean and updated. My husband and I had a "second honeymoon" here. It was romantic and the staff was very helpful. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location & Beautiful Spot--But Take Note...”
Reviews.Author: leftydana
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times, beginning in 2000. We are owners and bought here when it was still owned by Embassy. The resort has changed quite a bit since those days, and mostly not for the better. The good parts: The location and view are fabulous. We absolutely love the twin views of Lana'i and Moloka'i from the balcony, pool, and beach areas. We like that it's a quieter part of Ka'anapali Beach but still close to everything. The property is beautiful; the pool/beach area are just great. When our kids were little, they loved the pool. The suites are spacious and much nicer than a standard hotel room with a huge bath and a living room and kitchenette. The downsides: The service has deteriorated massively since the ownership change. The last time we were there, we had to wait past the 4 p.m. check-in time to get our room. We had booked a deluxe ocean view suite, and they tried to put us in one with a great view of the POOL and a side view of the ocean. We had stayed in deluxe ocean view before and knew the difference, and after an hour or so of wrangling with the front desk, we finally got a satisfactory room. But it was a stressful, unhappy way to begin our vacation, and seemed downright deceitful to me. You no longer get daily housekeeping or even towel service. In the Embassy days, we got daily housekeeping, free happy hour, and a discounted breakfast if you wanted one. I understand that most time share properties do not have these things, but having been there before the changeover, it feels like a take-away. The kitchenette is great for breakfast, snacks, and drinks, but other than a microwave, you can't cook. There are gas BBQs down by the pool, and there is a supermarket (including ready-to-eat deli meals) across the street. So it's not quite the same as a condo with a full kitchen, but it's pretty satisfactory most of the time. The restaurants on site are pricey and not that good--the coffee is OK. It's fine for sitting on the deck and having a cocktail for the sunset, but other than that, there are much better places to eat on Maui. All that said, we love the view and the location so much that despite the drawbacks, we keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, grounds and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: rodbeeson
Reviews.Content: Spacious, nicely appointed suites. Former Embassy Suites building that is now owned by Diamond Resorts timeshare company. Diamond has upgraded everything in the rooms, including Granite counter tops & tile shower and flooring. We had a 1 bdrm Deluxe Ocean View unit. Very comfortable bedding, spacious bathroom with 2 sinks so my wife & I could get ready the same time. A nice range of on-site eating options from pizza to casual restaurant to upscale dining on certain nights. They now have a luau as well on Wednesdays. A bar by the beautiful pool area is convenient. We were very pleased with virtually everyone we came in contact with on the staff. They seemed to truly be living Aloha and all were helpful. We liked renting a gazebo & spending a day on the beach. They send servers around to offer to get drinks for you. They also offered daily scuba & snuba lessons on the property. Kaanapali was a great base location for seeing Maui, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would come bach for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: durado
Reviews.Content: The facts: * $16 / day parking fee, but if you didn't ask about fees when you booked then it's your fault. * resort appears to be dated but then upgraded - the tiles in the halls are an 80's blue, but the rooms have new carpet, granite counters, etc. However there is popcorn on the ceiling (showing the age) * cabana's require a rental fee * the beach isn't all that * there's a fee for the internet The Pros: * The staff could not be nicer. No two ways about it everybody here is TOP NOTCH!! * The bathroom is HUGE * The layout of the room is great * The is a "strip mall" walking distance from the resort. The mall has a grocery store, pizza joint, Mexican food, scuba and surf board rental, etc. * Good location for seeing the island The Cons: * the $16 a day parking, but if it's a surprise to you it's your own fault * the internet fee, but really in this day and age, hook your laptop up to your smart phone (that's what I'm doing now for this review), or use your ipad or other tablet * the beach isn't all that * the store on site is outrageous (just don't shop there) the bottle water we got for $3 a case down the street was $14 here * there is no fan in the bathroom. I'm here with my wife so I don't care too much but if I wasn't married and it was a hot week with a girl I was just getting to know there is nothing to mask the noise of the bathroom.... * The kitchenette has no stove or oven, just a hot plate * breakfast buffet is $15 and it's only eggs, bacon, pancakes, and fruit ... not worth it ... go to gazebo restaurant which is a 5 minute drive Bottom Line: We will be back. My wife and I came here with our 9 month old daughter. The room was comfortable, nice, and we like the location (not for walking on the beach, but ease of access to the island). Do not be swayed by the poor reviews. My wife is VERY particular and almost every where we go she makes us change rooms at least once every place we go. however we checked in, came to our room, and my wife said, WOW I LOVE THIS ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, As Always”
Reviews.Author: vpelham
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this resort, this time during Christmas. Our room was spacious and had a small kitchen. Each of the rooms in which we have stayed have been similar. We had a view of the ocean and the pool area. The staff are always pleasant and helpful. We planned our activities via the activities desk, which was great. We rented a private cabana on the beach for a couple of days. While relaxing on the beach we ordered cheeseburgers & fries from the grill and I was very impressed. The view from the beach was awesome, we could watch whales breaching from the Pacific. During our stay we dined at the restaurant for breakfast and dinner. The breakfast bar had a great selection and the food was also good. I ordered fish and chips during our dinner and I was pleasantly surprised. I think these were the best fish and chips that I have ever eaten. Yes, there are charges for about everything but I don't mind paying when the food/spa/cabanas are such of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Great snorkeling right from hotel!Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: akjessk85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBC as a timeshare week. We couldn't complain about ANYTHING! I The reason I only gave 4 stars for the value portion is because I think that they charge way too much for rooms, if you are not booking through a timeshare. I dont know, maybe they can charge that much because of the location. It is right on the beach and the views are amazing. We stayed on the 10th floor in room 1004 The room was very spacious, especially the bathroom! Which is nice because we were using that room the most. Between the wet clothes and sweimsuits from the pool, or sandy clothes from the beach, it was nice to have that much space in the bathroom to really clean up and hang things. There are two sinks in the bathroom, that is great because the kiddos had their own space. The toilet also has its own little room with a door. Except I will say one thing, we couldnt find a fan for it, which kinda "stunk", so to speak. Countertops in kitechen were nice and the coffee maker was very nice and new. Kitchen gets an A+ especially since it had a dishwasher! Furniture was clean, but could use and update. The pool was AWESOME! It was very big, and never felt crowded. My kids loved the kids pool too. They could have stayed in that thing all day. It has a waterslide, which was used by the adults too! The beach is nice, I mean its not great, but hey you're in Hawaii, with the warm sun and the soft sand, so its hard to be unhappy. I have been to MExico and the sand here at this beach was way softer, and the snorkeling was great. You have to go a ways out, like past the buie (but not far) My husband say sea turtles here. We also saw whales from our balcony. Drinks are amazing, normal prices for fruity bar drinks, but at 3-6 I beleive, is happy hour where they are half off. The beachside restaraunt actually has great food. Very good quality, worth the money. The buffett breakfast, is just OK, I think its overpriced ($15 pp) for what you actually eat. Kids eat free so that is always a plus. There is a small strip mall right across the street with restaraunts and such, plus a full service grocery store, which was very helpful, we made dinner almost every night. The gift shop in the hotel also has everything you need, milk, bread, cereal, etc. but prob a little pricier than the grocery store. They also sell cases of beer, and alcohol, so that mght be something to consider before paying for high price drinks at the bar. All in all I think that this place is wonderful, the people are VERY friendly, and no one makes you feel like you are asking too much. Its clean and comfortable with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but felt nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: GravityJones
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful. The pool is great and the location on the water is perfect. The rooms are spacious and we fell in love with the bathroom. You have to experience it to understand. We did not have a good view, but it didn't matter to us. A couple of things that did bother us about the hotel: $16 a day parking, almost $10 a day internet use and the biggest issue, as soon as we checked in one of the acitivities people dragged us over to a booth to try and plan our daily schedules. We had literally just walked in the door with our bags in hand and obviously tired from travel. This bit could have been done a little later. However, they did give us leis and a box of chocolates with a bag, but that could have waited as well. The concierge also called us a bunch before our arrival, which would have been helpful if we hadn't already planned the things we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, small beach”
Reviews.Author: kjdpm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week end of April 2011. Exchanged our RCI time for this Diamond Resort timeshare. Because of this (they wanted to sell us Diamond time), we were given a great room with view of the pool, ocean, and mountains all from our private lanai. But as compared to Grand Wailea (South Maui), well, let's say the KBC is not so grand. But it's not a bad place to stay. The young man who checked us in was a bit scatter-brained. He forgot to give as cards to get pool towels; when asked about Easter Sunday services in the area, he kept trying to direct us to the hotel's Sunday Brunch, and (best of all) he forgot to set us up on the obilgatory timeshare tour. Since we still wanted to find Easter Sunday church service, we ended up talking with the Time share representative and did book some tours at reduced rates and carried out our obligatory 90 minute talk/tour. The young woman selling the time share was not overly aggressive and was quick to figure out that we weren't interested in buying anymore time share. She was pleasant and informative. She did tell us that she had already achieved a sale earlier in the day, so maybe she left us alone because of this. There was absolutley no other sales pressure beyond this 90 minute presentation. The pool and grounds are great. The beach is nice but short. Walking north you run into a canal pretty quickly. To the south, there are two condo buildings with very small shore line to walk on. If you go to the parking lot side of these condos, then cut through to the beach you can get on the Kaanapali beach path and walk all the way to Black Rock or even beyond if you choose. Parking fee is $16 per day, but very convenient. Hotel is walking distance to Times Grocery store and to the Fish Market to the north of the hotel. The Fish market was recommended by two locals (the bike tour van driver and a hair stylist). The Fish Market is a small deli in a strip mall near Honoapiilani Beach. It has very fresh seafood (like hours from the sea to the deli) and restaurant sandwiches and salads. We got sandwiches the first day and went back the second for deli Ahi Poke, shrimp, and crab cakes. We prepared the crab cakes in the electric fry pan provided in our room. Fabulous food! The room does not have a full kitchen. But for the two of us, the frig, microwave, electric fry pan, toaster and blender were enough. There is cleaning and trash removal once mid week so keep your towels clean :). The bathroom was huge, linens are average (but you can buy them like the "Westin Bed" if you like!), the balcony/lanai has two regular chairs and a small cocktail table and one lounge chair. Coin laundry on every other floor; Ice on opposite floors. We had a great room - can't say much about non-view rooms, non-pressure time share sales, and a great trip all together.

Reviews.Title: “Average with Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: Forknknife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with three teenage children. The room was average, and a bit musty smelling at first until we opened the doors. The bathroom was spacious and the beds were typical hotel room beds. All in all a pretty basic hotel room. The kitchen was well equipped, but small and the lack of an oven/stove was limiting as far as meal options went. There is a slow cooker available if you ask, but it's small. The electric skillet was useful. The hotel has a nice location right on the beach and the pool is huge and well kept. The only way to gain internet access in the rooms was by renting a cable from the front desk for $10/day. There was free wifi access in the main lobby, but it tended to be somewhat slow. I don't know that this resort would be my first choice next time due to the small kitchen size. This is a good hotel for those who like to stay in a more moderate facility with a few above average characteristics (i.e. the pool and location).

Reviews.Title: “Home”
Reviews.Author: tnsna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at KBC almost every year since 1998. We own a Presidential suite (Rm 1208) but have stayed in other rooms as well. We have seen a lot of transformations of this hotel due to the owners. When we bought it was Embassy Suites now it is owned by Diamond. The pool are has always been an awesome gathering place for our groups. The rooms are well appointed and most have been renovated. We have seen many of the same faces on staff since the first year we started going to KBC. There is good diving right off the shore as well as good snorkeling! The kids menu is awesome and the fish sandwich is pretty darn good by the pool. We have always thought of this resort as our second home. It is a very homey place that we love!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: PEZHEADS
Reviews.Content: Front staff very friendly and upgraded our room to ocean view. It was incredible. The rooms were large and very clean (no hair or fuzz in the corners of the bathroom). Towels were plentiful as were other ammenities (lots of soaps and hair dryers in each of the bathrooms). The balcony extended through all of the rooms. We could walk out onto the balcony from our room, our daughter's room, the living room . . . . We saw whales from the balcony and there was great snorkeling, including turtles, right outside the hotel (which took seconds to walk to). The pool was great, the grounds were beautiful. We didn't use them much, but there were activities for kids such as ping-pong, bowling, miniature golf, air hockey, hula classes, bracelet making, face painting . . . they had a gaming area with wii and x-box. There was live music at night. We did not meet any staff person at this hotel who was not friendly. Grocery store just across from the hotel. Wish we had taken more photos. GREAT HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable West Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: MCEBY
Reviews.Content: Basically a timeshare resort. We stayed in a one BR that needed some upgrade but was basically adequate. Beware of constant hounding for timeshare purchase. Kitchen with no range was a disappointment. Pools and beach were great.

Reviews.Title: “Singles? Yeah, um..no.”
Reviews.Author: Pkillian
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor lists this property as a top location for singles.. I couldn't agree less. I've been at the Kaanapali Beach Club for almost a week and I'm convinced that I'm the only single guy here. There are lots of friendly couples everywhere and the location of the resort is fantastic. I have no other complaints at all But a hot spot for singles? You might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Kaanapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: RoseAnn01
Reviews.Content: Accomodations, service, view, amenities.... all were fabulous. Beautiful rooms and resort. Large, nice pool. Saw whales AND dolphins right from the hotel. I saw previous reviews on this hotel that were "not so good" and all I can think is they must be confusing it with the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I highly recommend this resort by Diamond.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Resort, on Our Favorite Island”
Reviews.Author: swagsherman
Reviews.Content: I purchased a week at Ka'anapali Beach Club, off of eBay, from Tonya Wiliiams of Dream Travel Condos (travelinqueen - eBay username). I could not have been more skeptical of either my purchase or the resort itself -- especially with the ocassional negative review here on TripAdvisor. However, everything was perfect! We arrived to an oceanview room and could see full whale breaches from our balcony. My husband and I slept great on the large bed. No idea how the kids slept, but they didn't complain about the queen-size pull-out sofa. I type this as I sit on the balcony our last night here. Yes -- at least on the "non-pool" side of the resort, I had free wireless access on the balcony. We're sad to be leaving, but a few other comments on the current amenities. It seems the resort has changed hands a number of times and available amenities change as well. The one-acre pool is great. My kids played in it all week. Friday was "Aloha Friday" and there were $2 grilled cheese and plenty of kids activities around the pool. The slide was shorter than some others, about 25 ft, but still entertained. The room was well-appointed though I did find myself wishing for a measuring cup. Lo and behold! 3 days into our stay the management replaced all the dinnerware and brought new plates, silverware, a knife set, and measuring cups! We cooked pancakes and grilled cheese on the electric skillet (could have easily managed hamburger helper as well) and had sandwiches/cereal/bagels for lunch and breakfast. Ate in all days except for dinner. Plenty to eat within a 5-mile drive -- highly recommend Paradiso Pizza directly across the street! A great greek homestyle food establishment. As a matter of fact, we're heading there tonight for our last dinner here. What else can I tell you that we wanted to know? Didn't really notice the "pink" after being here a day. One restaurant (Ohana Grill) & one take-out kind of place (Maui Pizza) on site. Good bar, prices on par with the rest of the island. All staff we encountered were exceptionally friendly and always helpful! I was surprised at the number of people I talked to at the resort who were surprised there was no stove. There's no stove, just a kitchenette but it worked just fine for us. There's a supermarket across the street and an ABC store right down the road. Get your pool toy floaties at ABC -- much cheaper! For activities, we went on a cool whale watch with Trilogy and went to the family magic show, Kupanaha. The rest of the time, we played and relaxed by the pool. Suited our family perfectly. We're pretty low maintenance and relatively self-entertaining. Bring at least one reuseable grocery bag, or something similar; Maui is a "plastic bag free" zone. We live on Oahu and have vacationed on all the major islands in the Hawaiin chain -- this was our favorite stay, favorite place.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at Ka'anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: everguard88
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weeks stay at the KBC in Maui. Very nice hotel with beautiful grounds and large pool. Staff was very good and helpful. Room was good but musty and we were disappointed that there wasn't a full kitchen. Whenever we travel to a timeshare we like to cook and it is difficult to cook without a stove and oven. There was a microwave and electric frying pan and a barbeque area downstairs. Large bathroom with tub and shower but we didn't like the pedistel sink and low table. The table is too small and low and was very inconvenient when you have 4 people using the bathroom and there isn't any room to put anything. We couldn't get the air conditioner to work but we didn't need it. There is underground parking but the stalls are small and you have to be careful when parking. We were surprised at the $16 per day for parking and it seemed like the hotels are now taking the "airline" route and charging fees for everything. This seemed to be a nickle and dime way to increase revenue. We were told that the resort owners did not have to pay the parking fee but we felt that we were owners from another resort who were trading into a similar unit and conditions. We don't pay for parking in Puerto Vallarta.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Decision Ever”
Reviews.Author: vacationerPortland
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend that everyone think twice before making a reservation at this hotel. I did a lot of research to find a hotel that had a kitchen and suite setup for a reasonable rate. When I showed up at the hotel after a long day of traveling, they informed me that they were overbooked and would have to send me to a hotel down the street. I asked if I would still have a beach view and kitchen at this new hotel and they said, "Oh yes, you will love it!" and pushed some paperwork into my face saying that I accept the change. I got to the new hotel, they had no suites, no kitchens, not even a microwave. They said they were unaffiliated with the Kaanapali beach club and that the beach club had simply booked us a room down there due to the overflow. Luckily the customer service at the Sheridan was amazing but we were completely inconvenienced and had no kitchen or suite for the exact same cost. Why the horrible treatment? Well as you have probably read, the Kaanapali beach club is a time share through diamond resorts and they will call you about 1 week prior to your arrival and ask you to schedule to attend one of their sales pitch sessions. I said no to this when they called me and I'm 90% sure this is why they were "overbooked" for all 5 nights of my stay. I would NEVER stay at any diamond resort in the future and if you do dare to make a reservation with this horrible establishment, be sure to say yes to the sales pitch or be prepared to be re-located. There are plenty of other great hotels on Kaanapali beach that actually know the meaning of customer service...book one of those.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Honeymoon in a wonderful place.”
Reviews.Author: jgut69
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay and a great location. The pool was very nice and it's right on the beach. The hidden gem in this place is the breakfast on the bottom floor. It was so nice to buy the meals for the week and I knew I was going to have a great meal for breakfast every morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a shop on the beach in which you can rent equipment such as snorkel gear or even take a scubba class if you desire. The grounds are beautiful and my wife and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, awesome view, clean, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: Anthropologie
Reviews.Content: On our last trip we stayed at the Grand Wailea so we were a little worried about how the KBC would be, esp since our kids loved the slides and pools at GW. KBC turned out to be a wonderful surprise. The hotel staff were friendly, warm and helpful; clean spacious rooms, elegant large bathrooms; efficient kitchenette, amazing views including humpback whales from the ocean view suite, huge uncrowded pool, and a relaxed island feel. You can walk forever on the beach which is steps away from the pool. While not as swanky like Wailea, the Kaanapali/Lahaina area has a warm, inviting, tropical vibe to it that felt "real". We loved the mountains/rolling hills in the background of the hotel; beautiful grounds filled with flowers; and having our morning coffee with a 180 degree view of the ocean. We picked up supplies at the grocery for b'fast and lunch and went out for excellent dinners (Sansei in Kihei, Star Noodle, Aloha Mixed Plate, and Dukes Beach House--which is on the next property and an easy walk w/ delicious reasonably priced food). And the price was excellent. Turned out we didn't miss the GW at all at the end of our week at KBC!

Reviews.Title: “hotel more like a cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: shirlbaird
Reviews.Content: One of the worst rooms we have ever stayed in! Room was for wheelchair use, so door to bedroom had to be closed in order for bathroom door to be opened. Single pedestal sink with no countertop in bathroom. Had to wash bottom of feet after walking around the room. Mattress an old tired, wheezing Hilton model with no support. Smelly room since is was above the kitchen vent below the balcony. No privacy in room; had to keep curtains closed since balcony was open to inside hallways between units. Poor service in restaurant; waited three hours to finally have food served in inside restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very, nice....”
Reviews.Author: travelbysue
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at the Maui Kaanapali Villas, but thought we would give this place a try. Right after we checked in, we were lead to another desk to pick up our parking permit. At this point I thought, okay, here comes the time share sell. Well, we did schedule an appt. for Saturday, but right off the bat we said we were not interested. The sales person was very up front and also appreciated our honesty. We actually spent two hours with him, but never felt high pressure at all. We ended up with 150.00 in vouchers for various restaurants in addition to the supermarket across the street. This was the only reason we sat thru the presentation and we knew this in advance. We visit Maui a lot and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, we will probably skip the presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly luxurious”
Reviews.Author: el2chuy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our very first trip to Maui and our stay at â€œKBCRâ€�. We were pleasantly surprised at the overall level of luxury the hotel provided. The lobby is spacious and grand that open ups to a tall atrium that overlooks the grounds. The pool area is one of the nicest around in the area with direct access to the beach. The grounds are all lush and green with waterfalls and koi ponds about. You truly get that â€œresortâ€� feel. The rooms were spacious, the bathrooms alone a sizable chunk of the suite floor space. There were flat screen TVâ€™s in the living room and bedroom, but went largely unused as the vistas from the balcony were breathtaking. Every morning we would step out to watch whales as the played in the waters between Maui and Molokai. Some other reviews had mentioned that the place looked and felt dated. But I feel it is negligible considering the level of service and all the features and amenities the hotel provides.

Reviews.Title: “We would do it all again.”
Reviews.Author: redboat123
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at KBC. The rooms were large with a huge bathroom. two TVs, thick fluffy towels and all the amenities, however we like to cook and thought that with a kitchen we would have a stove. Otherwise it was well equipped including a big electric skillet and we managed several delicious meals, a real saving at Hawaii food prices. This was a lovely quiet place. The pool area was outstanding and the beach was nice too. There were a few initial shocks. We were not aware of the $16 parking fee. While it is not an unusual price it would have been nice to know ahead of time. We also arrived tired and did not appreciate the attempted sales pitch for timeshare ownership, however, it was not a problem as we simply told them we were not interested and that was the end of it. The one other thing that others have mentioned was the funky, musty smell in the rooms. Overall we found this to be a good bargain and a comfortable, convenient place to stay. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Pink Motel”
Reviews.Author: RomanGirl1018
Reviews.Content: A large pink hotel on the beach, hard to miss! Underground parking (valet available). Convenient elevators. My room was a large partial ocean-view suite with kitchenette, 2 tvs, large, private balcony, impressive bathroom with private toilet, two sinks, shower, and tub. King-sized bed, ipod dock alarm clock, maid service came only once during our stay as was stated upon check-in. Restaurant was very good with excellent service, the breakfast buffet good too, with a cheerful omelette-maker. Koi pond extremely charming, open air lobby, large scenic pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend. However, I would mention that it is expensive (like everything else in Hawaii), slightly difficult to find as lots of hotels in the area have similar names, and that there was a damp smell in the rooms that only went away with the balcony doors open. Only serious complaint I have is that the restaurant used all plastic cups, which seems kinda wasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Scuba, relaxation, beautiful views, and a great scuba instructor/staff!”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaNastasia
Reviews.Content: My friend had a tough time getting one of our rooms...it was hours late, and the staff was not very nice about it until the end when things got a little heated. Other than that, everyone was nice. The view, beach, and pool were amazing. Their scuba instructor, Artie was amazing, funny and such a good teacher. Scuba was AMAZING and swimming with the Hawaiian Green Sea Turtles was awesome. Snorkeling right out front on the reef is fun and easy...lots of colorful fish very close. Beware of going out to the dive site bouies if you don't have fins...rip current. I loved our room, I loved our stay, and I think I will be back in a few months!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: gt_linz
Reviews.Content: We traded in thru a timeshare agency. We had a low floor room on the side but near the ocean with a great view. The room was remodeled and beautiful, with a large bathroom. It did not have a stovetop but that was ok for us traveling as a couple. The hotel is made the buildings tied together with a courtyard which made sense since it was originally an Embassy Suites property - but the buildins all flowed together. The grounds were awesome with the first couple of floors open Hawaiian style and multiple waterfalls, gardens and koi ponds which were also integrated into the pool area. The bar and restaurant area had sunset views. One of our favorite things was to watch the sunsets, and the guy dressed like a warrior blowing the conch shell and lighting all of the tiki torches. The beach there was rocky but natural and beautiful. There was valet service and other services we did not use since but were available, except the first night where we had them park the car and bring up all of our luggage. Onw complaint was that the hotel food lacked variety and was a little pricey and not particularly good - but Hawaiii in general can be expensive, The gym was way too small for a property that large. We really enjoyed the Aloha mixed grill in Lahaina. We also got out most days and explored - a beautifull island - top of Haleakela, drive to Hana, the blowhole, Up Country and coffee at Grandmas (best breakfast on the island). But overall a great stay and a great Hawaiin experience. Get the book "Maui Revealed" if you want to see the sights and get great tips on restaurants. Mauk no ka oi !!

Reviews.Title: “Sampler Package after Wedding”
Reviews.Author: iSingLow
Reviews.Content: We also traveled using a Sampler Package we purchased at a timeshare presentation in Sedona. Everything went as we expected and were told---NO SURPRISES! The rooms are outstanding and condo size. The kitchen is just missing a stove due to building codes from when it was an Embassy Suites Resort. We didn't end up purchasing but had a good stay. Parking was part of our Sampler Package or else that cost would have been a disappointmentj. We were awed at seeing whales even from shore and while driving down the road near Lahaina. We attended the first PGA tourney right up the road one day for free. Easy access. We'd recommend the whale watching and snorkeling with Boss Frogs....GREAT VALUE! We ate several mixed plate meals (take out) right down the road from the resort (on the resort side of the road). ONO KAU KAU....eat local food!!! (and save tons of $$$$) Be careful with your soft-sided luggage....it rained when we left and the airport is so open that many things were wet, including books. Hard-sided is better for Hawaii. For snorkeling, be sure to go down towards Lahaina a couple miles and swim by BLACK ROCK....you can park in public beach access under the parking ramp in one area. Better snorkeling than Molokini. We didn't do the luau but Greg Brady (Barry Williams was there for a couple months). It's usually held by the beach on Mondays and Wednesdays (weather permitting). If you get a good rate....this is a great location...otherwise, yes, there are newer places, if $$$ are similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money. And rooms are huge!”
Reviews.Author: chaimbac
Reviews.Content: This is an old Embassy Suites hotel so all the rooms are suites. The rooms have a full kitchen area, a family room area, a porch, and a huge bedroom. The pool is very large, gym isn't too bad and has a hot tub. The beach isn't huge but will work. For the price, you can't beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!! VERY OLD AND VERY MISLEADING!!”
Reviews.Author: panther777
Reviews.Content: We are a quite surprised by the reviews on here rating KBC so highly. We purchased an entire week stay with KBC a year ahead of time through Diamond Resort Properties, and we used it for our honeymoon after our wedding. We purchased what was called a "sampler package" through a timeshare presentation we attended through another hotel a year before. We were told when we purchased the 7 day package with KBC and Diamond that we would never have to attend another timeshare presentation again. We could go there on our honeymoon and enjoy ourselves. The week before our wedding, we received a phone call from KBC confirming our arrival and advising us that we must attend a timeshare presentation while there on our honeymoon or else we would be non-compliant and would be charged $3000 on our credit card!! We were shocked and advised them we had already attended a presentation prior. They didn't even want to listen to us. We arrived within a few days after that phone call. The valet was very nice and the lobby was pretty. As we were checking in, the lady at the front desk advised us again that we had to appear and warned us not to be late for the presentation or else they would charge our card. We told her we wanted to speak to someone about the situation, but she kept insisting there was nothing they could do. Apparently, KBC likes to blame Diamond Resort Properties for any miscommunication, and vice versa...they just like blaming each other. We were told we would be given an ocean view room because we had actually purchased through Diamond on a presentation a year before, and therefore, we would be entitled to an ocean view room and be given a bucket of champagne upon arrival and be treated like honeymooners. To our horror, we got to our room and I opened back the curtains and saw multiple dumpsters and construction trailers in what appeared to be an old park. We even saw a homeless person urinating in the park. Then, our shower had the showerhead faucet coming directly out of the ceiling. There was a large hole and it looked like it was going to fall down any minute. You could move it from side to side and there were cobwebs up in the hole. In addition, there was a dirty razor blade on the shower floor where the housekeeping obviously missed and the shower was very moldy and our entire room smelled musty and old. The bed was so uncomfortable you could feel the springs digging into your back. We walked back down to the front desk to express our concern. The lady said that if Diamond promised us an ocean view room that there was nothing they could do about it and we had to speak to them but they were not available. They had us booked in that room, and she said to us, "All of our rooms come with a scenic view even though they are not on the ocean." We laughed and showed her our camera with the photos of the dumpsters and I said, "Does this look like a scenic view to you?" She said, "Oh, well, there are mountains in the background you can see." We told her we are from Phoenix, AZ and we have mountains in our own backyard that have a prettier view than this. We were told that no other rooms were available and we had no choice but to stay in the one we were given. Later on that same night, I asked for a showercap because there were not any in the room. They never brought one so I walked back down yet again to get one. The front desk staff took 10 minutes to find a showercap and finally brought me a cardboard box with showercaps that had the words "Sheraton" marked out with a black marker...very odd! The TV in the room would not work correctly. If you turned it off, it kept coming back on entirely on its own. The WiFi access would not work and we called the front desk. They gave us a number to call for maintenance to get help. When we checked out, they actually billed us for making that call to maintenance!! Each morning at 5 am, we were awoke by the loud sound of housekeeping dragging the vaccum cleaners on the ceramic tile hallways outside the front door. People checking out early also wake you up with the suitcase wheels being walked by. Because the rooms open to an outdoor atrium and it is all raised tile it makes it extremely noisy. When we attended the time share presentation as we were told to do, we advised them of all the problems we had. It was at this time that Diamond Properties told us that our room was one of those that had not yet been converted from the old Embassy Suites to the new remodeled ones. Diamond Properties intervened and that same day they got us moved finally to our ocean view room that we were promised. They did not push us at the presentation after hearing our story and seeing the pictures on our camera. They really did try and rectifiy the situation. The spa at KBC is really awful, and caution if you make an appointment there. As honeymooners, we wanted to go and get a couples massage and we found out they do not even offer that. We went to get massages anyway and the spa is the size of a closet with a couple of rooms. The towels were dirty and you could hear everyone's coversation going on in the place as you were getting a massage. I had to use the restroom at the spa, and they directed me to a cleaning closet with a washer and dryer, a dirty mop bucket and dirty toilet bowl brushes on the floor and a tiny toilet in the corner. Later, we visited the Hyatt Spa down the road...a must spa to go see...absolutely gorgeous! As for the food at KBC, the outdoor patio restaurant was not very good quality. We ordered some nachos for an appetizer and the salsa tasted like it was out of a Pace Picante jar from the market across the street. As for the buffet breakfast each morning...beware of the birds that swoop down and eat your food right off your plate. I sat my plate down on our table and walked away to go get my drink and came back to my plate with 3 birds standing on it eating my scambled eggs. One good thing about KBC was the sunset and the cabana rental. It was a really gorgeous view of the sunset. The beach was nice, but very small and cut off right away. We went to go for a walk and it only lasted a few minutes before you have to turn around and walk back. We spent most of our time in the cabana we rented on the beach. It was very nice and the cabanas had nice views of the ocean and were very close to the beach. For a couple of days, the pool was closed off with yellow tape around it and no one would tell us why?? Looking back, I am glad we never found out what happened...probably better off not knowing. We purchased tickets for their luau that they advertise by calling it the "Feast By The Sea" but they actually hold it in the basement of the hotel in a dark and dirty conference room! We will never stay at KBC again, and I definitely do not reccommend this hotel / timeshare. My new husband and I have already agreed to re-do our honeymoon...this time it will be at the Hyatt down the street from KBC or 4 Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Iten2bs
Reviews.Content: We went for 9 nights with 3 other couples. Had a great time, the rooms are so spacious and comfortable. We arrived during what could almost be described as a Hurricane and the valet was amazing as we just left everything in the car and they brought it all up. No small feat as we had stopped at both Costco and Safeway. The bags had dissolved in the rain so it was just piles of wet stuff! Loved the the huge bathroom, the two sinks made it so much easier to get ready. The size of the 2 tv's was unexpected. The size of the living room area was great. No problem when all 8 of were having cocktails before dinner. Fullsize fridge was great for all of our liquids and snacks. The electric skillet came in handy for dinner one night as we made taco's. Service throughout the resort was wonderful. We booked through and owner via Craigslist and would certainly recommend this to anyone. Didn't do the timeshare, mostly because I was so annoyed by how many times they called prior to arriving trying to get us to book tours. January is a perfect time to go. The whales right off shore were amazing to watch during the day. It was great to have a grocery store and a few restaurants across the street. We tried both the pizza and the mexican place. Prices were good and food was fine for the nights we didn't feel like driving into Lahaina. Fat Cat burgers in Lahaina is worth checking out. Lahaina pizza and Bubba Gumps were fun with the crowd we were with. Would certainly go back to Kaanapali Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Andreanfamily
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ka'anapali beach club. Wonderful staff, clean beautiful rooms, fabulous big pool with plenty of lounger chairs for everyone, and two steps away from the beach. We were there for our first week and then for our second week we went on to a more expensive higher star hotel and enjoyed it less. I would have rather have stayed at the Ka'anapali beach club. When we spoke to the activities centre we were asked to hear their time share presentation but when we declined they did not ask us again the whole time we were there. My kids loved their free fun things to do and we loved the laid back atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “10 Stars if we could!!! A++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: bclady5
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Beach Club is great! The room sizes are HUGE! Pool is HUGE! Located close enough to everything. Definitly going back! Can't wait!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay Maui. Liked it so much we are going back in May”
Reviews.Author: GMarginet
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Maui last November (1st week of the month) and we had a wonderful time. We were crazy busy during the holidays and I finally got a chance to submit this review. Ka'anapali Beach Club is a great place to stay on Maui's beautiful west coast. From the second the valet guys open your door and you get out of your car, the spirit of Aloha takes over. These guys are always hustling and smiling and ready to give helpful directions or advice when we picked up our car. One of the guys also told me about a great radio station to listen to (Native 92.5) and I'm actually listening to it in SoCal right now on my iPad, since they broadcast online. The front desk was also very helpful and welcoming. They certainly made us feel at home. The time share team was very nice as well. Being owners definitely has its privileges and we were treated very nicely. Our second day there we met with Walter R. and we had such a great meeting with him that we decided to buy more timeshare. Walter is definitely a professional and I would strongly recommend people to meet him if you want to find out what timeshare is all about or if you want to expand your portfolio. The staff at the outdoor bar was great a well, especially a very gracious and super friendly Filipino hostess that kept the Mai Tais flowing. The pool staff was nice as well, but we did not spend a lot of time in that area, although it's a huge pool with plenty of room. We are definitely beach people so we spent almost all day hanging out in the beach and jumping in the beautiful blue waters of Maui. The hotel itself is very spacious and you never feel crowded. The rooms are very big, as well as the bathroom and the living areas and a great kitchenette. I agree with a few of the previous reviews however when they talk about the hotel feeling a little "dated". I don't think it needs a major makeover but I think a few tweaks would definitely help. I also wanted to comment on two other "issues" that were identified by previous reviews. It is no secret that this location is trying to sell timeshare, but if you express the fact that you are not interested, that is where it ends. The staff is not pushy and understands the fact that you are not interested. Another thing that struck me as odd is the people complaining about the $15 parking fee. That seems to be in line (if not cheaper) than most other places anywhere, especially in a resort area. It can cost up to $40+ to park your car in a hotel in NYC, LA or Paris. Overall, KBC is a great place to stay. The staff is warm and friendly. Its needs a small makeover but the Aloha spirit makes up for it... We liked Maui and the area so much that we are going back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Time Share presentations!”
Reviews.Author: love2flyWatsonville
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a beautiful 2 bedroom, full service condo at a much smaller resort in Kona, we were overwhelmed when arriving at the Ka'anapali Beach Club Resort. It was huge and when we walked in we were immediately greeted by hotel staff members of which some were very kind and the others were trying their best to SELL, SELL, SELL discounted activities if we would just sit and listen to a "presentation". One of the staff members thought we were "owners" and told us to go over to their VIP service desk for our free flower lei and parking placard. Well, the guy at the concierge/VIP desk told my daughter and I that we couldn't have the fresh flower lei that were for "owners", so we were given a shell lei. He would not let up with the sales pitch until I finally said all we want to do is go up to our room. That small customer service mistake set the tone for the next 8 days. 95% of the staff were very nice, but again, we found a letter under our door inviting us to participate in a "survey"--another tactic to get us to hear a time share presentation. Our vacation hours are precious, so we didn't want to lose any hours to hear a sales pitch. The original staff member that steered us over to the concierge/VIP desk saw we only received the shell lei and gave us a flower lei. We never wore the flower lei, but it was his tactics, that were upsetting. The hotel on the most part is very clean, but I found the laundry room dirty and in odd locations. They're only located on the even floors and only 1 washer to 2 dryers. We ordered 1 entree from the cafe located by the pool and it was disgusting, but the cinnamon roll was very good. The majority of the guests during our stay were age 65+, so we felt a bit out of place, perhaps the summer is different!? Our daughter had to sleep on the sofa bed and the first night we had to ask for a foam cushion to ease the pain from the springs in the sofa bed, but by the 8th night, we had to ask for another.....she couldn't take the pain anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great value”
Reviews.Author: TwoCanucks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit dated but works very hard to provide an excellent vacation experience to guests. The pool area and the beach are second to none. There's free WiFi on the main floor where the TimeShare presentations are offered. It's flaky, but it is free! Parking is $16.00 per day but if you know up front, it's not so bad. The Maui bus is an option and we spent one week without a car quite comfortably. We stayed two weeks and both one bedroom suites were comfortably appointed. Yes, the furnishings are a bit tired, but that was also the case at the Mahana. The hotel is extremely clean, the grounds are immaculate and I would come back in a heart-beat!

Reviews.Title: “friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jeapjai510
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay with families. When we arrived they had an activity set up to occupy the kids while we checked in. Check in is at 4pm, so we didn't expect to get into our rooms until then. But, you can check out the pool, and meet with an activity planner until then. You can get great discounts on your activities if you sign up for the resort tour. We didn't, and they left us alone for the rest of the stay. Car valet services guys are great. Rooms were spacious with great views. All we needed were lots of towels, and there were plenty of those. Full sized fridge came in handy too. The pool was fun. There is a very fun water slide in the smaller pool; only goes to 3 1/2 ft. But adults can go down the slide too. The attendant at the top of the slide was very helpful. This was a great place to stay in Maui. Only 10 minutes from Lanai and activities. Oh there is a market across the street, so convenient. and Pizza Paradiso has yummy pizza too. have a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MKBG
Reviews.Content: Overall, I really liked this place. The customer service was great at all times. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view, instead of mountain view. The outside and hallways of the hotel are very outdated, but the rooms are wonderful. (It's the rooms we really care about anyways, right??). They have been totally remodeled and are very nice and super clean. The pool area is great as well. The beach has a lot of coral, so we drove to other beaches and the kids swam/ boogie boarded there. The grocery store across the street is perfect to stock up the fridge for breakfast and snack items. Kids meals at the cafe by the pool were $2. An unbelievable bargain!!! We very very pleased with everything during this stay. (Don't expect the Ritz or Four Seasons, but it's a great place for families!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Dennis-and-Barbara
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice time at Kaanapali Beach Club although there could have been more to do. There could have been more restaurants and the food and drink could have been cheaper ! Generally we enjoyed ourselves very much........

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good value”
Reviews.Author: s53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live on the Big Island and had some vacation time. Had to attend timeshare prewsentation, but very easy and no preasure. Yes, it is an older hotel, but for the money and views it is a very good value. The entire staffr were very pleasnt and they worked hared to accomodate us. A wonderful, stress-free getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says it is...nice..but..”
Reviews.Author: fifraser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and were surprised at how this plays bills itself versus the reality. The check in staff need a refresher course in customer service - maybe because this is mostly time share owners coming in they don't feel they have to really explain anything ro give a care. The rooms are not bad. Beds are comfortable and bathrooms spacious. Our room was a handicapped room and had a different lay-out and a funky smell -we were told they couldn't move us anywhere in the hotel at all. However,the kitchen is not a full kitchen. Cooking is fine for microwave but otherwise they give you an electric skillet. The balconies are long and narrow and you can sit on the lounge chair if you keep it sideways on the balcony. For what they suggest is an all suites, time share property it needs some care and attention. I've seen plenty of time share places and this is not anything close to top notch. Standing on the inside of the building looking down or up at all the floors and the awful metal railings you could be in cell block H. There's a grocery store just at the end fo the drive in the stip mall across the road and you can also get the $1 bus to take you to Whaler's Village and then another $1 on into Lahaina. The Happy Hour staff are the best people there and the drinks reasonable. Food in the bar area is popular. There's also a coffee bar area that does pizza. The pool area is spacious but it needs some softening as it's lots of concrete. The beach area is small and trhey don't let you take loungers onto the beach. When we were there it was red flag warning but people swam anyway. If you have kids then this is a good deal. The rooms are big enough for a family and the kids will do fine with the facilities. if you are an all adult party, rent a car and spend time away from the property and come back in tiome for a late afternoon swim and Happy Hour! The timeshare presentations are as annoying as you let them be. Just say no and be firm or sign up, go along and see what you think. To us, their otehr resorts seem more in keeping with what they claim to be. Oh and take your laptop to the area outside the time share presentations, it's free wireless!

Reviews.Title: “The Reosrt is very nice”
Reviews.Author: Dclassy
Reviews.Content: The pool was warm, big and inviting. Plenty of lounges. Friday's they have $5.00 lunch which was a great bargain! The grounds of very nice. The beach isn't one of the best for walking. The only negative is they make you wait for your room until check in time of 4:00pm it seems pretty tight when you know the Resort is not booked up it's had when you arrive at 10:30am and are really tired and traveling with your 80 year old mother. We seen people all week long setting waiting till 4:00pm to get into their room. It would be nice if businesses could be a little more accommodating. Overall had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and excellent value if you are in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: kahuna1959
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days at the end of our Hawaiian holiday on Maui. I hadn't been back for a few years when we'd stayed in Kihei. I really wanted to spend more time in Kaanapali to get a better feel for that part of the island. It has a bit more of a touristy feel becuase it's mostly hotels and high rises instead of the low rise condo's of Kihei. However the great shopping, better restaurants and proximity to Lahaina make it a great place to stay, just different that what we'd experienced last trip. Pool The resort has a great pool with cabana's available for rent if you like the shade. There are plenty of lounge chairs so the cabanas are not necessary, simply a nice option. I saw a few servers around the pool but if you want a drink you're better off just going up to the bar which is no problem, it's right next to the pool. They have decent bar food if you get a bit hungry but i wouldn't recomend it as a place to go for a nice dinner. The pool has a small water slide for kids and a hot tub for adults.
