The towel hut is right next to the pool so you don't have to haul wet towels around, just swap them back for the towel cards and bring the cards the next day for new towels. Beach The beach is not nearly as nice as the section on the other side of black rock where the big name hotels are situated. You can swim here but it's a bit rougher and the snorkling is lackluster. If you want better beach time you should go to the other section of Kaanapali, or better yet head up the road about five minutes to Kapalua bay. It's a lovely beach, decent snorkling, much easier water entry to go swimming and it's really picturesque bay with a coconut grove just up from the beach. It also has a walkway that will take you right around the point so you can go for a nice walk/run if you get tired of sitting on the beach. This beach was highly rated by "Doctor Beach" and I think he gave it #1 spot. Rooms We had a one bedroom and it was LARGE. Tons of space even if you had four people. The bed was very good and the bedding was decent quality along with two types of pillows. There is a regular fridge, coffee maker, microwave, toaster etc. but no stove. I read somewhere you could get hot plate but we only ate breakfast and late snacks in the room so we never inquired. It had the largest washroom I've ever had in a hotel room or condo. I'm not even sure why it's so darned large. They could have put more room into the bedroom or kitchen area. One nice touch is that the closet in the bedroom opened on both sides into both the bedroom and the bathroom. So you could get dressed right after your shower if you wanted. It had both a large soaker tub and a shower so you have both options. My only complaint other than the lack of stove, is that the lanai is really very small and cramped. Not really conducive to being comfortable if you want to sit outside and watch the ocean. Service All the staff were very good, helpful and well informed. No complaints about any aspect. Because we got the room through a time share swap we only got one day of housekeeping but she did a fantastic job. She tidied up more than was really necessary so we left a good tip when we left. I was never presured or even asked to participate in a timeshare presentation which was a welcome change. Parking Parking is an extra charge of $16 per day but that includes the valet if you want to use them, which we did. I have a bad hip and didn't want to be walking more than necessary. I'm never a fan of paying for parking at a resort, I think it should be included so I guess that is a complaint. The valets were absolutely top notch though. Really helpful, polite and truly a warm hearted bunch of guys if you took the time to talk to them and get to know them a little. We'll definitely be back if we have to swap a timeshare in the future. I think Maui is my second favorite island after Kauai and there is still a lot to see and do for my wife and I. I can honestly recomend this resort if you want to explore Maui. If you just want to sit on the beach and go swimming then I suggest finding a resort with a better swimming beach.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: stephiek456
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time. I am VERY picky when it comes to hotels and this one met my expectations. It was very clean, open and comfy. Very good location but you will need a car but that is any where you stay in Maui. I was not thrilled with the beach in front of the hotel, i mean the sunsets were great but the beach was pretty short however it was really quiet and not alot of people around. The hotel staff was fine, i ususally do not expect much from these people anyway. there was some confusion on our room but the fixed it. It would not make be not come back or anything. The pool is great the food was good. Not alot of kids it more for adults and honeymooners. The one thing to stay away from the it Luau. OMG it was SOOOO bad awful horrible. It was inside and its not like it was raining. It was $ 50 per person and the food was so gross and the drinks were NOT free. You get one nasty free drink. Spend your money on a nice dinner elsewhere. Other than that I would totally go back! Do the helicopter ride. its the best way to see the island.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, large comfortable suites, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Madeline049
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Maui, we were greeted with smiles, kindness and helpfulness. The greeting area was open and friendly as were the valet's and the front desk people. When we arrived on the 8th floor for our vista view room, in no way were we disappointed that we did not have an ocenview room. we had a very large studio with a kitchen (full size fridge, but cooking pan for cooking, no stove, yes and a dishwasher), dining area and livingroom with fold out couch, coffee table dresser and a flat screen tv with music or dvd player for nights in. Next to the livingroom was the bedroom with a kingsize comfortable bed and dresser with another flat screen tv, but no dvd player. There was a desk for my computer, but WiFi was$10 a day, unless you opted to go downstairs in the lobby and work there for free. The bathroom was huge with 2 sinks a tub a seperate shower and toilet area. Very well designed. I liked that I could reach into the closet from either the bedroom side or the bathroom side.The bedroom also had a sliding door that lead to the patio. The bedroom had a safe, pretty small, and you had to pay for its use. Don't lose the key! Handicapped parking is not very friendly. when valet closes at 11pm, and you arrive back after that we had difficulty finding proper spots for us. 3 times we had to go to lowest level and climb a flight of stairs to get to elevators. Just my opinion, but i think employee of the months can walk the stairs and give the much needed spots for people with disabilities. That and paying $16 a day for parking were my only big griefs with the entire place. (I was compensated for 3 days, however) We visited the Sheraton, and although it is a beautiful place, it is too sprawling and difficult to get around the maze! We will return to Kaanapali Beach Club any time possible!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: PAlovebug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there August 28 until September 5. We stayed on the 11th floor and had a room with an ocean view it was great. Kitchen was great, we like to cook breakfast and lunch in, then go out for dinner. Knowing we were going over I passed my on-line book work for scuba diving then with the great instuctions from Rob at the dive shop (TINY BUBBLES) right on the grounds..I am now a certified scuba diver...All the guys there were great...try it in the pool for free if you like it they walk you right out to the ocean....lots of cool things to see right out from the resort...The resort has everything you need there..great sunset views..very friendly staff..Beware of the boat cruise they push, won a buy one get one free ticket and still felt like i payed to much BEWARE.... Best massage I've ever had don't let the small salon full you If you have a chance go see the show Unalena. Over all best timeshare we've ever stayed at..can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rdy2226
Reviews.Content: My Mom lent me her Ocean View timeshare and I traveled with my husband and another couple. We arrived a couple of hours early but were not able to check in until 4PM (The actual check in time). We were given a room with a great view (Room 1122). We split cost for the entire vacation and shared the one room condo. The hide a bed in the living room was uncomfortable (would be okay for kids) even after we were given the egg crate "pillow" top so we moved one of the double beds (we were supposed to have a King but it actually worked out better this way) into the living room so we could have our privacy. The rooms were good size and the bathroom was huge. Separate shower, Jacuzzi tub and toilet. Two sinks on ether end and lots of closet space. The kitchenette had a full fridge and service for four. It had a toaster, blender and square wok. We used the wok to make eggs one morning. The pool was fantastic and the hotel is right by the water with a nice beach. We were treated as owners and got free parking. The staff was very helpful and always had a smile. We even did the timeshare for free Luau tickets and it was actually pretty painless. Our friends almost bought but changed their mind at the last minute and the presenters didn't blink an eye. No hard feelings, we were released back into the wild. Actually, it was the easiest timeshare I ever attended. The Luau food and entertainment was well worth the 90 minutes. Close to restaurants and other activities. Gonna have to get the timeshare from my Mom again or buy my own.

Reviews.Title: “The Only place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: brennygirl
Reviews.Content: This was the ultimate hotel for our family of 5, kids are 15, 5, and 3. They have a full kitchen. The pool was the high light for the young kids and they loved the beach too, nice sand and calm clean water. The hotel is clean and layed out well. We love it here and will always return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: kshark1958
Reviews.Content: Traded in our Disney World timeshare to stay here for one week for our 25th wedding anniversary. We originally requested a one bedroom ocean view did not get that but we were upgraded to a two bedroom scenic view. Did not need the second bedroom but the second bathroom came in handy. I did get to see a one bedroom when they were trying to sell us a timeshare and I can tell you they are exactly the same except for the extra bedroom and bathroom. Also this is a corner unit with two balconies so I am not sure if this room is like some of the rooms in the middle of the hotel.When you open the front door to your unit their is a foyer with a large bureau to pile all your junk on from your day trips. The foyer opens to a decent sized living room with a sleeper sofa, a couple of lounge chairs and a flat screen tv.The master bedroom is large with plenty of drawer space and closet space. The master bathroom is huge with two vanities, a bath tub, separate shower stall and water closet. The entire bathroom is done in real nice tile. the kitchen comes with a full size fridge, D/W, enough plates and silverware to serve eight and pots and pans. It did not have an oven or stove top but it did have a large electric fry pan that was good enough for us. Some people complain about no stove top but personally from my experience staying in plenty of time share units that had stove tops we very rarely used them even when our kids were younger. We ate breakfast in the morning usually cereal or waffles from the toaster then were gone for the rest of the day and usually ate lunch or dinner while we were out. We used the electric frying pan a couple of times to cook steak or hot dogs and it was fine. Their are plenty of gas grills on property if you want to use them. Their was also a good size dining area with a large dining room table. The second bedroom had twin beds and its own bathroom. The bathroom in the second bedroom was just your average bathroom with a sink, toilet and shower stall. We were on a corner unit ( #834) so we had two balconies. One shared by the living room and master bedroom and the other which was huge shared by the dining area and second bedroom with lounge chairs and table. The view was okay mostly of the mountains and highway but on the dining area side you could see the pool area and some ocean.Not great but I thought it was just fine. The unit itself was very clean they only offer complete maid service once a week but if you need towels and other things like toiletries and trash emptied you can call them and they will take care of it at anytime for no extra charge One thing that was missing was an over under washer dryer that I have seen in other time share units I stayed at. Their are washer and dryers on the even number floors but you have to pay 1.25 a load I was a little disappointed in this. The resort itself is right on the beach and the beach was a good size with the greatest sunsets you will ever see and good swimming. The pool area was large with plenty of loungers but if you want an umbrella you will need to get down there early to grab one.Their was also a hot tub. Check in and check out was quick and the front desk was very friendly when ever I needed something. In fact all the employees I dealt with were very friendly. Their is a parking garage underneath that you have to pay 16 dollars a day for. They have valet parking for no extra charge except for the tip you have to give to the guy every time they get your car. We did valet the first day then parked and got our car on our own after that. The hotel elevator goes to the the parking garage level so it was pretty easy. Their are a couple of places to eat at the hotel. Their is bar and grill that is open late, food was pretty good I also noticed a more upscale restaurant but not a lot of people eating there and probably pricier. Their was also a breakfast buffet every morning that cost about 18 dollars a person. They do have a concierge desk that was very helpful but let me tell you right now one of their jobs when you ask about activities is to try to interest you in going to a timeshare presentation. They will not pressure you so if you don't want to just say no and they will not bother you about it. But if you do go to a presentation you will get discounts on a l lot of activities. We probably saved about 200 dollars on activities by going to one and at the first opportunity to walk away we did. The time share presentation was not high pressure and we were able to walk away after about a half hour. The salesman will ask you if you are interested in going forward and all you have to do is say no. If you want to go shopping to stock up on food their is a shopping center across the road with a food market and a pizzeria. Their is a Safeway about a mile down the road which we thought offered the best selection and prices. Remember you are in Hawaii food is expensive. Other things they had that we did not use but noticed was an exercise room, a poolside bar and towel service at the pool. They also had activities planned everyday for kids and a Luau on Wednesday night. They also had photographers if you want a photo session with the beautiful sunset. We will definitely come back here the next time we come to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wow What a Great time we had”
Reviews.Author: Bra_Head
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks in early June 2010 and had a blast. The accommodation was more than adequate, the resort amenities was just right. There are many positives such as location, central to most attraction on the west side of the island, a few minutes from Lahaina, beach access was easy, resort activities were fun, like movies and games, room was more than adequate for a family of four and even the city bus was just outside the resort. There is a grocery store within a few blocks and the farmers market too. We stayed relaxed and hung out by the pool and the beach area. You will have a great time here. They also offered a luau within the resort and happy hour everyday. Plenty of gas grill for you to use and vendors are available at the lobby that offered local crafts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but Average Experience at KBC”
Reviews.Author: cali2maui
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here for 6 days during the last week of September of 2010 for a girls getaway vacation. we are in our early 30's. we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a scenic view. we booked this resort through travelocity because it was the best deal in the kaanapali area. and this is my 2nd vacation in maui. Pros: The resort is clean, quiet, large pool, rooms are pretty large with a small kitchen (but no stove), bathrooms are huge (with 2 sinks and a tub and separate shower), fast & easy check-in and check-out, the resort is ocean front, the beach in front of the resort is just so-so (a little rocky), 2 flat screen tv's in the room (1 in the living room and 1 in the bedroom), maid service is good, and our view was just ok (it was a view of the street and mountains). Cons: Parking is $16/day. And the staff is not as friendly/accomodating as i expected. When we checked in, my friend asked if we could get a free room upgrade but he simply said the resort was fully booked, without even pretending to confirm on his computer. and during our week stay, it was pretty obvious that the resort was not fully booked since there never seemed to be too many guests on the resort grounds. at every other resort in hawaii the check-in clerk would always try to upgrade our room without us even having to ask. so then after check-in we had to get our parking pass from the time share staff. we had to wait for about 5 to 10 minutes for the time share coordinator to finish gossiping with her co-worker for her to even acknowledge our existence. then the coordinator gave us each a free lei but after we said we're not interested in attending a time share presentation they didn't hassle us at all. Another time, we were at the resort pool and my friend ordered some nachos and after waiting about 45 minutes my friend decided to go to the bar/kitchen to ask about her order. the waitress seemed kind of annoyed and said she would bring her order over when it was ready. so overall, the resort had nice rooms but the biggest complaint for me was the staff. they just didn't seem as warm, friendly, and accomodating as my other hawaiian experiences, which isn't a big deal since we were out most of the time but in my opinion it really adds to my vacation experience when the staff is friendly and helpful. but in the end, i had a great time in maui so i would highly recommend the island but probably not this resort (unless you got a great deal).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: tibinaba
Reviews.Content: I went with my fiance to get married in Hawaii. This hotel was one of the most inexpensive ones that I found and it was a GREAT value. The rooms were HUGE and the location was FANTASTIC. The only thing is the decor is not that up to date, but that's the least of the worries when you're out all day long. The pool, the view, the restaurant food were all awesome! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location. Close to...”
Reviews.Author: needinfo81
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location. Close to restaurants and lahaina. Very pleasant staff. Lots of activities to do on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a Few Quirks”
Reviews.Author: sarah05
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our room at the KBC, although our stay was not perfect and there were definitely a few things I did not enjoy. As others may have mentioned, upon arrival you are forced to go to the concierge to receive a parking pass. I didn't appreciate the annoying sales push immediately upon arrival. The person we spoke with was a particularly bad salesperson, condescending and awkward at the same. Finally I told her we were tired and wanted to check in and we'd come back later if we wanted to. The interaction was odd though and I would have preferred to not have to deal with her. Our room/suite was much bigger than expected. The bathroom was huge and looked to have been recently remodeled, with a separate shower and jacuzzi tub. Living room and bedroom were also large with fairly modern furnishings, including large flat screens in both. Kitchen was pretty well-equipped. No stove/oven, but the included hot plate allowed us to cook eggs every morning. We were told when making the reservation that we would not have a sea-view, but it turned out that we did, so that was another nice surprise. Most annoying about the room was a weird smell when we first walked in. According to the front desk it had something to do with the air conditioning being off between visitors. After we aired it out for a few hours the odor dissipated. We also had an issue with the toilet but we figured out that if we pushed the handle a certain way it would stop running. Overall, most of the issues were minor and we enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect, close to plenty of beaches as well as restaurants in surrounding areas. The pool was so large that despite the many rooms and guests staying here, it was never crowded or full. We also enjoyed watching the sunset from the beach in front of the hotel. We'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: DMonette
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I'm an owner and come back once or twice a year. I never get tired of coming to Maui. I can't help but think what a great deal I got with my timeshare. Since I originally purchased, which was way back when this was the Embassy Suites, I have upgraded my points twice, so I can come at least for 2 weeks a year. I have seen so many changes. When it was Embassy, it had lots of nice perks, then it was sold to Sunterra, which I consider the black times. The place really went downhill, was neglected and the perks went away. Since then, I'm happy to say that Diamond Resorts has purchased this property and there have been many improvements. The bedding is of the same quality as a Marriott. Very comfortable with top quality sheets. Top quality appliances and flat screen TV's have been added. They have Aloha Fridays with a BBQ and music at the pool. They have added an inexpensive, yet very nice Luau on Wednesday's. Every time I come back there are new changes, but for the better. My maintenance fees have double over the last few years, but I am okay with it, since they have made so many improvements. At least, I know the money is being well spent on the property. My only complaint is how expensive the food is here at the resort. I would much rather dine out than pay the prices they are asking. I did try pizza one night and was very disappointed with the quality and the small size pizza for $15. There is a new mixed plate restaurant in town and I plan to give a review as soon as trip advisor adds it. It is within walking distance of KBC and it's called, "Ono Kau Kau Mixed Plate". We like to eat local and we prefer this to the Aloha Mixed Plate, now. Ono Kau Kau, has an extensive menu of Chinese and Hawaiian foods. We had the Locomoco and BBQ Chicken mixed plate and not only was it delicious, but there was lots of food. I had the mini version and it still was more food than I could eat. The food was very fresh and hot off the grill. I heard other customers commenting on how good the chow mein was. I intend to go back and order Chinese food, before we leave. (We're still here as I type this) So, if you want good, quality, fresh local food for a low price, try Ono Kau Kau. It's our new favorite mixed plate restaurant on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaB11
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy staying at the Diamond Resorts thorought the USA. They are very clean and comfortable and it is not just a room but more like a very nice one or two bedroom apartment. We like eating in and saving some cash and this really allows you to especially if you are traveling with children. The pool is magnificent and the chef there is outstanding. They have many things to do each day for adults and children. I would recommend this to anyone who wants more than just a room. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “KAANAPALI BEACH CLUB MAUI (TIMESHARE)”
Reviews.Author: lexibaby
Reviews.Content: Got Lucky with an exchangre into this place and we were real happy when we checked in. We did not have an ocean view but the room was remodel so every thing was new and clean and refurbished includfing new bed. Unit hadA full kitchen (except stove top and oven) but threy do have an electric skillle so you can cook bacon and eggs or grilled sandwiches full fridge so stop at Costco by airport get your groceries therer. Market across street pretty reasonable. Pizza Place across streat also good and is pretty good quality and great for lunch or late nite back in. Pools were pretty large for Maui standards. Air conditioning great and can't complain about the location. Would stay again. Checked into the Westin for the next 3 days and rather stayed here for another 3 days. I'm spoied pefere timeshare suites than a basic hotel room. no fridge, no space and air did not work very well at the Westin. But nice hotel and also about the same size pool.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the sunset at the beach”
Reviews.Author: Family_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 8/23 â€“ 8/28. Overall, we liked it. It surprised us a little bit by the size of the property. It is large V shape property with 3 sets of twin elevators to take the guest up to their perspective section. Local called the â€œpinkâ€� (but more like coral) building. The ground was nice, with multiple waterfalls, koi pond, big pool and a water slide. Our room had a partial ocean view yet it was on 2nd floor (RM 116) right above the air vent. It was just too loud to sit on the balcony or open the sliding door. It was also a very long walk to the ice machine (cross 2 sections) on the other end of the building. Likewise, it will be far from the ice machine side to do laundry over this side. Laundry/detergent costs $3.75 per load was reasonable. Room was comfortable, 1 king size bed with a queen size sofa bed. The mattress was thin like any other sofabed. It didn't have stove but had everythng else in the kitchen. There were two sinks in the bathroom and 2 doors connecting to master bedroom and living room. The bathroom was big. The parking fee of $16 was a bit stiff. The valet parking crews were very friendly though. I also found parking rather easily in the underground garage when I need to be in and out in short period of time. Internet access costs extra in the room (no wireless, only wireline) but you could get free internet access near the lobby. KBC was a little further north from the main Kaanapali resort area, e.g. Hyatt and Westin Yet it was quite convenient. There was Bobâ€™s snorkel, Subway, Pizza Paradiso and Times supermarket right across the street. It is also a short drive from the Whaler Village (local shopping ceter). I reserved KBC with my own timeshare company (Raintree Vacation Club) so I didnâ€™t need to deal with Diamond Resort or RCI personnel. Oh, donâ€™t forget the sunset. You get a wonderful view at the beach every day. We will stay here again if it is available.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary gettaway”
Reviews.Author: Takemeaway74
Reviews.Content: We decided to get take a trip for our 10yr. We stayed in the Ka'anapaili Beach club. The room was nice. Unexpected charges were: Daily parking fees were expensive ($16 day) The view from our room was breath taking. The down fall, sitting thru the time share. It was overbearing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but dont buy a timeshare there.”
Reviews.Author: wlbarnson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is great. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the view is fantastic. However, being an owner there doesnt give you any special privileges. I have struggled every year to make a reservation at the time I wanted to take my vacation. I always go in the off season, so I'm not sure why it is so difficult. When I purchased the timeshare, I was given many promises that were never kept. Although I have complained numerous times, I have never had my concerns acknowledged by a real person, other than to tell me it is my fault, and I should have known better. The maintenance fees are outrageous, but of course they dont tell you any of that when you buy. I was also told on my last visit, because I declined to buy additional points, I was wasting their time. Is that any way to treat an owner?

Reviews.Title: “KBC exceeds expectations, but Expedia made the trip”
Reviews.Author: wareitat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with another couple to Maui for our 10th anniversary. Both couples were married on the same day and kept in touch after meeting on our honeymoon 10 years ago. After almost counting Hawaii out because of the cost, we discovered a Hawaiian bargain (expensive elsewhere) at the Kaanapali Beach Club (KBC). I must say that after staying at different levels of lodging, I wasnâ€™t overwhelmed at first. However, I grew fonder of the resort the longer I stayed. The KBC pretty much had everything a couple/family would need (I know since I have 3 kids of my own) and in a nice location close to Whalers Village and Lahaina. It is settled directly on the beach and has a large pool area, both of which I discovered were rare in Waikiki where I went the following week. The structure is pink with 12 levels and all rooms are suites. They are nice and spacious with comfortable beds and large drawers to unpack your belongings. There is a small balcony area to sit on to overlook the resort/ocean. Please note that oceanview could mean â€œas long as you can see a sliver of the ocean somewhere in the distanceâ€� so donâ€™t get excited if itâ€™s not directly in front of you. The only thing really lacking was a stove although my wife was able to work something out with the electric skillet they provided. Every other floor has a washer and 2 dryers, which I didnâ€™t consider necessary until I used it. The restaurants exceeded expectations. There is a breakfast buffet for $15/person, which is good with an omelet station. The pancakes werenâ€™t fixed the way I like and there was no waffle cooker but other than that breakfast was great. There was a variety and the fruit was amazing. We also ate downstairs 2 evenings. I must say that the food was really good with excellent coconut shrimp and a fish special that was tasty. The KBC even offered a few extras like a little fitness center, a koi pond with waterfalls, mini-golf, ping-pong, activities like movie by the pool and a DVD dispenser (like Redbox), which I didnâ€™t know about until the last day. It is at least a noted place because there are vendors who come in the lobby and comedian Tom Green made a cameo (just missed him). Maybe because we were owners elsewhere or just missed, but we never got asked about a timeshare presentation. I highly suggest getting a car in Maui to explore the island. Yes, there is a $16/day +tax parking fee but truly enriches the experience. Also, it is only 2 minutes from the smaller Kapalua Airport, which is recommended if coming from another Hawaiian island. We did a round trip from our home city to Honolulu, then another round trip from Honolulu to Kapalua to save money (think about it). If you go to the KBC with the right expectations, you will find that it has what you need. Read further if you want to know what we did in Maui. With 4 head strong people on our vacation, we could not agree on what to do in Maui. But while out the 1st day, we stumbled upon an activity center and agent which turned our vacation from disaster to delightful. If in or going to Maui, I highly recommend contacting the energetic Lisa Kerstein from the Expedia Local Experts in the West Maui Center. The numbers are 808-667-7777 or 800-624-7771. It is located on 910 Honoapiilani Highway (Hwy 30), Lahaina, HI 96761 next to the Outlet Center and Subway. We sat down with Lisa for an hour and planned out the rest of our trip. She was honest with us on what was a good value, our taste and what days to go. Looking back, Lisa was a Godsend and probably the turning point to a positive and memorable vacation. What we did: Monday: Road to Hana â€“ All day event and recommend Paia (picked up lunch), Twin Falls (bring swimsuit for pics in water & water shoes to walk thru water on rocks), Waianapanapa State Park (black sand beach) and Oheo Gulch (didnâ€™t make it but wish I would have) Tuesday: Helicopter Ride (Air Maui) â€“ Quick Â½ hour tour to see most of Maui including thousand foot waterfalls and mountains unreachable by car Wednesday: Catamayran Cruise (Ahi Lanai?) â€“ Snorkel & Snuba, like scuba but tank is on raft up to 15 feet above instead of back and no certification is required; Thursday: Dinner Cruise (Pacific Whale Foundation) â€“ Great food and amazing sunset; Spa (Kapalua) â€“ Ritz Carlton experience Friday: Luau (Drums on the Pacific) â€“ Get to the Hyatt early because popular from good food, drinks and show including fire-dancer

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, but we will never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: RoseWashington
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Kaanapali Beach Club. We love the location because you are only 5 minutes from Whalers Village and 10 minutes from Lahaina. We have rented a timeshare from people in the past and this trip we actually bought this timeshare rental on ebay. So we got a two bedroom room for a week for $1175 which I know is an amazing deal. However, when I called the hotel to ask if we could request an oceanview room, they informed me that all 2-bedroom suites have an oceanview. Great! I thought. When we checked in I again requested an oceanview room and they then informed me that we had one waiting for us!. Ha! Once I checked out the room we realized the oceanview was only if you stood out on the balcony and leaned over the railing. I went back to the front desk (and waited in their crazy check-in line again) and they informed me that they didn't have anymore 2-bedroom oceanviews available because they save those for the Diamond resorts owners. Even though we were guests of an owner. It was so frustrating. The room themselves are nice enough and we even had a stovetop which was nice to cook with. The pool area is great for the kids and they loved the slide. The first time we stayed at this hotel breakfast was included along with a managers reception every afternoon for free. The mini golf was free for all guests, and there was no hotel room tax per night. This time breakfast was an astronomical amount, the afternoon managers reception was for diamond resort owners only, they charged for the falling apart mini golf course, and charged us $70 at the end of the week for a room tax. The most frustrating thing to my husband was after we used the first little bag of coffee he called to ask for more and they said they don't provide extra coffee that the first one was only a "starter coffee." So, it's a fun family hotel on a budget, but there are many other hotels around for the same deal that won't nickle and dime you for everything. I wouldn't stay there unless you were Diamond Resort members. For sure stop at Costco by the airport and Safeway in Lahaina to get your breakfast, lunch and snack food. We saved so much money that way. We also went to Gazebo restaurant in Napili for breakfast, we had the white chocolate chip macadamia nut pancakes. They were amazing!!! Get there early before they open or else wait for a long time to get in.

Reviews.Title: “A nice option for those on a budget...”
Reviews.Author: thechangingtimes
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that my wife have traveled over half a dozen times to the Hawaiian Islands and so we are familiar with lots of different kinds of lodging/prices/amenities. I would have to agree with the general consensus that this hotel/timeshare resort would score about an 82%. It's not a bad options for people traveling on a budget, especially those with children. If you are looking for a retreat that is a "jawdropper" this is NOT it- as opposed to the Ritz-Carlton, 4 seasons, or Grand Wailea. What it does offer though is a charming little kitchenette in each room complete with fridge, sink, dishwasher, cooking skillet, blender, etc. This made the trip for my family the downright most affordable wev'e ever had in the islands here. Again, my wife and I were hoping for something a little more impressive, but honestly we are world travelers and are spoiled. My family loved it and it was affordable for them- which made me feel especially good given the outrageous price for the economy class plane tickets. Again if your a young family or a family on a budget this is a great option, if you want a romantic getaway with the significant other think elsewhere. *Oh yes, i almost forgot, this is a timeshare place, so you will have to beat the salespeople away with sticks to be left alone. Once that is clear, you'll be left alone- but still a little bit of a pain in the neck if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianInMotion
Reviews.Content: We booked this property at a very attractive price through Tonya Williams of Dream Travel and were very pleased with the stay. Our ocean-view suite was nicely decorated but had not received the TV upgrade that some units apparently have. Not a big deal as we were not in Hawaii to watch TV. While there were some minor signs of wear, the condition of the suite was much better than other properties we have stayed at in the area. The large pool area is very nice and the beach is hard to beat! The bathroom was beautiful with separate shower and soaker tub, ceramic floor and marble vanity. The small kitchen (full sized fridge, microwave and dishwasher but no cook top) was also well done.were nice touches. The bed was very comfortable but could have used softer pillows (a personal thing). We would return in an instant to Kaanapali Beach Club and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Middle-Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weber20
Reviews.Content: Middle- to upper-Class Hotel on one of the finest Hawaiian islands directly on the beach. Great snorkeling area directly next to the hotel beach with low surf and shallow sandy beach which is safe even for children most of the time, unless warning posted. In the winter time whales can be seen from the rooms with ocean view or directly from the beach. Moderate cleanliness: Rooms are cleaned twice a week or daily for extra fee. Rooms have small kitchen; small shopping mall in walking distance with restaurants and food store open around the clock. Very friendly staff at the counter as well as in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort With Many Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Aloha-lover
Reviews.Content: This place is very impressive when you walk in from the valet parking to the glass elevators. It has a lovely open air feel with a beautiful pool, right on the beach. There are 2 restaurants, the regular Ohana Grill being relatively reasonably priced with good food. Nothing spectacular but fine for an evening at the resort. The other restaurant is very exclusive and requires reservations. The amenities abound here - clean towels, water, mini golf, teen center, activities room. You will pay $16 a day for parking and while there is a supermarket across the street, Maui will leave you broke. It's very expensive for everything. Drive 5-10 minutes north to Nahili and go to the market there; it's a little cheaper. We did the Molokini snorkel cruise and were very disappointed, btw. The cruise wasn't bad but there was not an abundance of sea life. No turtles in Turtle Town either. Drive a little past Kapalua (still going north of Ka'anapali) and there is Honolua Bay. Snorkel there - it's great! Tons of fish and coral and it's free. You will actually see some of the snorkel boats there. Then continue north to the Nawale Blowhole (not sure of the spelling). You can hike down to it and let it blow you away!

Reviews.Title: “Relieved And Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: racine
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for the 11th time or so and decided to go discount which we've never done. Was a bit nervous about the reviews on this place, but it was so inexpensive I couldn't pass it up. Warning: I'm a hotel snob and don't do well with "yucky" hotels. This place isn't fancy, but was exceptional for the $ and that's why I'm giving it a great rating. Don't come here expecting the Grand Wailea, Hyatt or Four Seasons. Expect it to be clean, well-kept grounds, friendly staff (but again not the Ritz), updated rooms with granite, good solid food, well-priced/strong adult beverages and a really fun pool w/slide. Close to lots of other places and hotels where you could easily spend double to stay and eat. Spacious rooms w/upgraded carpet, comfy beds and linens, & new bathroom. Plenty of extra towels and pillows. Flat screen TVs, fridge & kitchen were huge pluses. Only downside to the kitchen was that there's no stove, but we used the hot plate to make pancakes, portugese sausage, etc & it worked extremely well. The pool area was very, very clean and our 7 yr old loved the slide! On Friday they had a BBQ and I think we got a burger/chip plate that was $5.? The restaurant has surprisingly good food with fresh fish specials like Mahi that were very competitively priced. Not fancy, but you could easily pay double for something of the same quality or less nearby. I ordered a top notch mai tai that has a surprising kick to it for $5. Our son thoroughly enjoyed the activities and there was plenty of quiet room for adults. Maybe I went not expecting a lot because of the reviews. We never swam on the beach because of the rip tides and it just wasn't very inviting. Do not let that stop you however. We walked down the beach to the nearby Westin with a picnic and swam with turtles. We also drove to Black Rock, nearby Napili, etc. I was worried about the time share push. I warned the front desk that if we were bothered with the timeshare hard sell we'd probably come unglued. Not a peep out of them the whole time -- not one word. The staff was always very polite, friendly and helpful. Solid, clean, fun, lots of bang for the buck. Go, have fun and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: TataandNana
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional. All the staff was helpful, friendly and accomodating. We thought the location and amenities were great. Activities and entertainment were great.

Reviews.Title: “Always have good experience”
Reviews.Author: sagav
Reviews.Content: It is so nice to be right on the beach and be able to walk for miles on same beach. We request the ocean view 2 bedroom/2 bath which has views from every room of the beach. For the price, it cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “You can do so much better for your money, pushy salespeople, unsafe railing on the top floors”
Reviews.Author: redmusewrites
Reviews.Content: If you want a fantastic timeshare resort to stay at, try the Westin just a couple miles away. Infinitely nicer. My parents own a timeshare and chose this hotel to vacation at while visiting Maui. I live on Oahu and flew over to see them. Having done many "staycations" because of living in Hawaii, I can genuinely say that this place is not worth the money especially when everything costs an arm and a leg being out here as it is. If you're going to spend your hard earned money on Maui, don't do it here. You can't miss this place, it's a bright pink skyrise off of Highway 30 just past Lahaina. It's rather run down and outdated in my opinion compared to some other resorts I've been at. My parents agreed to attend a " timeshare presentation" in exchange for some discounts on excursions etc. My father is a hard sell, and after the woman clearly became frustrated at not being able to win him over, exclaimed loudly not once, but two different times " Well I certainly wouldn't attend a presentation like this if I had no intention of buying anything". That was unprofessional and uncalled for, especially because they're already owners!!! She also nosily questioned my single about her marital status and if she kids and upon learning she was a single mother told her "it must be hard". RUDE. Keep your thoughts to yourself lady and maybe you'll sell more timeshares! We were on the 9th floor and while I will say the views were spectacular, the railings outside are totally unsafe for small children! There's a huge gap where a small infant can easily fit under and fall through. They have locks on the sliding doors at the top but if you don't remember every single time to lock them your child could unlock the sliding door and slip outside. They need to fix that. The AC broke and one guy came up to fix it then said he'd be back and never came back! The next guy claimed he fixed it but it didn't work and we were all hot in our room. Couldn't open the sliding door because there's no screen to keep out the bugs and can't leave sliding doors ajar with an 18 month old in the place. According to my mother, advertises "Full Kitchen". Instead what we got was a crockpot, a blender, and a skillet. No stovetop. Last time I checked a full kitchen had at least one burner to cook on!The glasses were all tiny juice glasses and we had to request some steak knives to eat our steaks that we grilled outside because there were none. Tip of the iceberg was, after 5 days we ran out of coffee and they refused to bring more up without charging us. We were livid, especially we hadn't so much as asked them to clean the rooms yet, we thought it a minor to request to be charging for especially when it was just cheap wholesale hotel coffee. Bar food was average, unmentionable and drinks were about $9 each for something like a pina colada. One other reviewer mentioned the beach isn't that great either. Agreed, it was full of coral, the current was way too strong for children, and the water dirty

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: sunshine760
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at "KBC" which is apparently what the locals call it. I had no issues with being harrassed to tour with the resort, in fact i actually was never even pitched anything until I seeked out concierge service. I did attend a sales presentation, it was very high pressure and took about 45 minutes longer that we were told. The rooms themselves were very nice and spacious. From the outside, the pink exterior made me think this would be an older resort, however once you get inside, the landscaping is beautiful, the rooms are very well appointed. There is no full kitchen however you can ask for a very large "Electric Skillet" which we were easily able to cook for a group of 6! We did have some issues with the front desk staff and some room mix ups but considering the size of the group, I was still overall impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but beware of swimming at beach in front!”
Reviews.Author: Mamaof2ww
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at this location and love it. My family and I have stayed here over 5 times. However, the beach directly in fron of the hotel is not suited for swimming or snorkeling. It has a very strong current and a lot of coral. While we were there a man and his wife were swimming out front. He got stuck in the current and drowned. It was a terrible situation. PLEASE don't swim there. If you go a few hundrred feet to the right or left the beach is lovely and perfect for swimming and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice! Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_Visitors
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from our fifth trip to Maui (tenth to Hawaii) in the past 13 years. This was our favorite island resort choice by far. We had an ocean view on the 11th floor. The view was awesome, but the best part is that unlike all the other condo's we have stayed at on the islands, the view/lanai was available from the living room AND the bedroom. The Lanai was a bit narrow, but with spectacular views overlooking the pool, we quickly adjusted to the long-skinnny model. The gorgeous pool area, outside elevators, multiple fountains, coy ponds, and open walkways added the extra touch to really make the entire experience one to stand out and remind us why we work the rest of the year! Close to Lahaina for dining and shopping, and just out of reach of the common Kahana daily rain showers. So the big positives; clean, quiet, gorgeous surroundings & views, pool, friendly staff, ocean front property. The minor negatives (in comparison) parking at $16 a day is steep and spaces are made for compacts only. Could have done without the 1.5 hour sales pitch on timeshares (but worth the savings on our activities). The Hot tub is TINY. From our room we thought the kiddy pool was the hot tub (to comfortably accommodate a resort of this size). Sadly mistaken to find the hot tub was barely larger than any backyard! It was way overcrowded EVERY night. Sad to see our time come to an end. We would (and have already) highly recommended this resort. Already looking forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Attacked at check in”
Reviews.Author: hellohawaii
Reviews.Content: I love coming to Maui , but ths time it was too stressfull right at the check in. A very thin older lady with a low,low voice grabbed my husband and myself right at the front desk ( and it was 9pm at night, we had been travelling for 11 hours| She was trying to be friendly, but way way too pushy, with her shell lei greating, and trying to make us sign up for a timeshare presentation right then and there for 100 $ for dining/ We finally got away ater saying no 5 times, And the next day we got several calls to come back down to "sign up". Sorry, we don't like to be pushed was my response. You'd think in Hawaii they could use a different timeshare approach. I couldn;t believe it. I still love Maui though, and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another place”
Reviews.Author: kbylsma
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place. It is a huge high rise, not my idea of a Hawaiian vacation. They really do nickel and dime you here. If you want a lounge chair facing the ocean you have to pay outrageously for it! If you rent a car be prepared to pay $16 a night to park it. There is some sort of tax just to be there of about $5 per day. You have to pay to use the laundry machine, there are none in the rooms. You have to pay for internet service. We could not get an ocean view room once we got there which was very disappointing after spending all that money to get there. The unit we got sleeps 4. My husband and I had the master bedroom and my daughter and mother had the living room. The only bathroom was through our bedroom, which meant no romance for us all week. There was some kind of fan in our bathroom that would go on and off all night. The kitchens were very basic. Microwave only, no stove or oven. We tried to use the BBQs downstairs several times, but it was like being in a wind tunnel. They say they have scuba diving there and they do, but you have to pay $$$ for a boat trip. They will not just rent you a tank so you can go off the beach. It was so windy in that location the whole week we were there it was disappointing. (Not their fault I know.) It was so windy that they had to have the Luau in a conference room in the basement area. Yuck. My husband and I decided we didn't want to go to a Luau inside like that, and it took 2 days to get our money back. There pool area was nice and clean, my daughter loved the slide. The staff was friendly. The rooms were clean. The timeshare vultures were there in full force.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great value”
Reviews.Author: padellfam
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why this hotel is #1 on Maui. From the service to the location, our experience was absolutely wonderful. We have never had a better family vacation. The Kaanapali Beach Club truly has it all. The rooms were great, if the kitchen was a little on the small side. However, we hardly spent any time in the room anyway, so it didnâ€™t matter. We had a great time on the beach, and going around the island. We would return in a heartbeat. Iâ€™m not that much of a vacation guy, but my wife and I went to the Kaanapali Beach Club for our honeymoon and were very pleased. It was very romantic, but there were a lot of things to do. We walked on the beach at sunset and laid by the pool. There were many aquatic activities available: snorkeling, surfing, fishing, etc, though we only snorkeled, which was fun. The service at the hotel was courteous; the concierge staff set us up with many opportunities. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: CDBayArea
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews and this being a timeshare exchange that we had waited 2 years for (Maui) I was somewhat wary about this place. BUT, to my joyful surprise, it turned out to be a great vacation! I had been warned to look out for the timeshare pitch when you arrive. The concierge asked if we were interested, we said no and they left us alone for the rest of the week that we were there. I had requested an upper floor with ocean view and that is what we got- not directly over the ocean but definitely a side view from our balcony. These are suites (old Embassy Suites) that have been updated and modernized. The only thing we didn't get was a flat-screen TV and I really did not care. The rooms were HUGE and bright and airy, the kitchenette was perfect for our needs, mostly breakfast, some lunches and an occasional take-out dinner. It was Spring holiday for many, so lots of young families and kids in the pool. But not to worry, plenty of pool space and besides we were there to whale watch --saw whales breaching every evening from the beach - and snorkel -best snorkeling at a public park walking distance from the hotel. Can highly recommend whale-watching excursions with Trilogy and Maui Adventure and luau at Old Lahina Luau (the most authentic). All very accessible from the Beach Club. There is a supermarket right across the street and some restaurants. Happy Hour at the Ohana Bar is pretty good, I loved the Kahana Banana. But since we had a blender in the room, we saved some bucks making our own margaritas (good liquor selection at the supermarket). We had rented a car (just do it!) and drove up and down the west side for beaches and snorkeling and to visit all the towns--they are all different and each have their own special charm. Staff was friendly, responsive and attentive and we had a great time. There was a fee ($16) for parking but as we were on an exchange, that and anything we ate or drank there were the only in-house costs. Wireless is free down by the reception area. Highly Recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Lots of helpful hints- so read up!!”
Reviews.Author: LMilly
Reviews.Content: So its clean, lots of friendly people, we had an updated room (they're in process of updating all the rooms, they've done 4 floors now) TONS of towels available, consierge to schedule all your events. So check in- requested a ocean view, but they didn't have one, so they gave me a partial view which overlooked the pool/ocean. Still very nice. The hotel used to be an Embassy so all the rooms are suites...bonus. At check in they will take you and schedule any events you'd like to do that week- not a scam. They really do just schedule them for you. We surfed twice while we were there and once the hotel booked it and the other we did directly- it was the same price. They DOOOO however after scheduling all your stuff try and get you to do the timeshare meeting. From reading past reviews I avoided it like the plague! They do offer you a deal on your activities prices, but it wasn't worth it to me. Like I said we had an updated room which was very nice. If you wanted to cook, you had literally every appliance that you'd want including a griddle! There is a grocery store just across the street, which is super handy. Bathroom was HUGE and the bed was comfy. Parking is 16 bucks a day whether you self park in garage or vallet. We opted to vallet and give them a couple buck tip so we paid 18 bucks. Either way it worked out fine. There is tons of room by the pool and free beach towels that you can exchange as many times as needed. Free scuba lessons too! The ONLY "rip off" thing I would say is breakfast. Its 15 bucks a person (which lets face it...in HI everything is expensive!) but really probably not worth it. There was as starbucks not far, so we'd get that or just make coffee in the room and bought breakfast from the grocery store. We did eat dinner once in our hotel, food was pretty good, but yes expensive. FOLKS lets be honest you're in Hawaii....everything is expensive. We budgeted 100 bucks for every dinner and we were most of the time right on or a little under. Just a fair warning. Pool area does close at 10pm, which we thought was kind of early, but I guess all hotels pools around there close at 10. Maui really wakes up at 6 and goes to bed by 10. Hope that helps! We had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: cindy021
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week at spring break in end of March 2010. Lovely hotel, loved the rooms with big soaker tub and shower. Nice Lanai's off master bdrm and living room. Had pool and ocean view. No stove but all the appliances to cook a meal. rice maker, grill, BarBQ's. Pool was wonderful! Everything I wanted it to be. Grocery store right across the street. Could easily make it a 41/2 star with some paint changes and do something to the interior of the hotel by the elevators. But didn't really care as only see it when you go to your room. Lobby is nice with big parrots in cages. No waits to get a lounge chair, plenty. The fitness center is extremely small. Such a big property don't know why they didn't make it bigger. No room to even put down a mat to do floor exercises on!!Didn't mind the just once maid service but I think garbadge should be picked up every 2nd day not just once! They need a mirror in the master bdrm. Plenty elsewhere though. Plenty of lovely white towels. King bed very comfy.Would definately book here again! Lovely holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great first trip...Definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mauifan2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 9 days in Maui. We really enjoyed the hotel. We arrived the night before the tsunami. We were presented with a gift card to get our "free" gift the next day, but we knew about the time share and declined using it. During the tsunami the staff were very informative and diligent about ensuring our safety. We did get groceries from across the street, very convenient, but pricey. We booked all our activities prior to going to Maui and knew we only needed breakfast and lunch stuff. We had dinner a couple times at the restaurant and found it very good. We did use the bar for drinks along poolside; just put it on our room tab. The beach was AWESOME!! We had many walks along the beach and it was great to swim in. The ocean was warmer than the pool. I loved the whole feeling around the pool with the waterfalls and the koi pond. Nights were cool during our time there, so recommend a sweater. The staff were pleasant. We had rented a car and never used the valet, no need because the garage was conveniently near the elevators. Still paid $16.00 a day. I think that was a little expensive, but having a vehicle was the best thing ever...especially a convertible. The only problem we had during our stay was the washing machine stopped working during my load of laundry. It took a while for someone to come up to look at it and then I had to go up 2 floors to use another one. They need to update their machines. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation? Fun and relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Mailbill
Reviews.Content: Great pool and so close to the ocean that I could hear the waves put me to sleep at night. Perfect place for the whole family!

Reviews.Title: “was expecting so much more from a 4 star hotel than a sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: NurseShelley77
Reviews.Content: First of all , I LOVED MAUI. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about the island and her people. My trip was wonderful and I hope that some of my info can be used to help at least one traveller make their stay on Maui a great one. We were the "guests of an owner" at Kaanapali beach club, so we were roped into that glorious timeshare sales pitch. ONLY do this if you have the time to waste...they WILL hold you hostage all day long! The only thing that makes it worthwhile is they give you $100 woth of vouchers to spend at local spots (which was the equivalent of eating out at a nice place for two with drinks) If you do schedule for the sales pitch BE SURE to book your discount activities before you do the seminar...they didnt tell us this and we got hosed and missed out on saving lots of cash on our outings! Our room was on the 11th floor and smelled musty and dirty....like a wet moldy dog! The rooms looked a lot nicer in their brochure so dont be fooled, no ALL rooms look that good! The model they show you during the sales pitch is gorgeous, and I have to say if our room had looked like that, we would have been incredibly happy! Otherwise, the hotel staff (not the sales staff) is great, they are accomidating and friendly. Ask for Dave at the bar, he is wonderful. The food at the resturaunt is so-so, but for the money you spend you could have eaten somewhere nicer. But is it convenient. Breakfast buffett for 2 was thirty bucks. If you rent a car, definately do the Road to Hana. Stop in Kahalui at the Shell at the corner of 36 and buy the CD tourguide. It is worth the 20 dollars and you will learn so much, and see things you otherwise would have missed without it! While on the road to Hana, stop at Kak's Thai food stand...she is quite the character. And if her friend Diana is there, she may serenade you with her ukelele like she did for us! Be sure to take your camera, extra batteries film or memory card! We did the Maui Ocean Rafting whale tour out of Lahaina and they were great, eco sensitive whale lovers who got you up close without the crowds! Plus the price was much much cheaper! We chartered a Marlin fishing trip with Start Me Up out of Lahaina and DIDNT catch a single fish!!!! Other boats were coming back to the harbor full of Mahi mahi...hmmmm??? We took Pride of Maui from Maalea harbor to snorkel Molokini Crater and they were great...the boat was a lil bit older than some others, but so much less crowded...we had less than 20 people and the crew was AWESOME!!! They grilled a killer lunch and waited on us hand and foot, plus the captain was a mellow fellow and we jammed to UB40, Bob Marley and Don Henley on our trip. And honestly...the BEST mai tais I had on the island were on the Pride of Maui! Definately check out the upcountry...If you are adventurous, leave Kaanapali beach and head north...this rund into a very very very narrow one lane road, but you will see Maui at is finest. The local stands and people truly show the flavor of Maui. Stop in and buy some of Julias Worlds best Banana bread. Watch for locals and thier hog hunting dogs, as they can sometimes be in the road. Kahalui can be reached by this road...but its gonna take a while to get there. If you dont want to go too rough and country with your upland adventure, go south into Kahalui and take the road to Kula and on up into Ulupaulakua Ranch and Tedeschi Winery, be sure to look at all the historic points nd you may have to ask for help locating them. There isnt exactly a tourguide, and the people at the Winery were too busy with wine tasting to tell us about the Hawaiian cowboys, or poniolos. Snorkeling the beach at Kaanapali is great! Just walk up the beach toward black rock, or drive up about 3 blocks. Snorkel anywhere! Be sure to take your cameras as turtles frequest this area! Lahaina is the bomb, shop, shop and shop some more. Then eat at Kimo's then shop some more!!! Did I mention, I love Lahaina? Check out the history then head to the harbor and book something to do! Then come back and eat at Kimos again and shop some more! Be sure to immerse yourself in the culture and learn as much as you can, Hawaiians appreciate that, dont be just another tourist. You will be glad you learned something about such a beautiful place. Ther is a Wal Mart in Kahalui....they sell kitchy souveniers there for about 1/3 the price than the other places. In Lahaina on the corner of Prison Street right across from public parking is a little store that has Tshirts 7 for $20, Whalers General Store had pretty competetive prices. Check out Maui Hands for a one-of-a-kind souvenier. I got a hand made sterling silver hibiscus necklace that I treasure from there. Also, on Lahainaluna Street are a couple of local ladies with a vendor booth that sell stuff pretty cheap, right next to Boss Frogs....Also be forewarned...all the CHEAP tickets places in Lahaina want you to go to a timeshare sales pitch in order to get their CHEAP prices, the only one that doesnt require it is Expedia booth there at the wharf. Oh, and in Lahaina, go to Local Boys and eat shaved ice ! They are the BEST ever! But my best advice during your trip to Maui....take lots of pictures!!!!!!! Hope this helps! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but kitchen was very small”
Reviews.Author: gsl10408
Reviews.Content: Place was very nice, kitchen was very small and hard to cook in. For the most part, staff was nice. The locals that were staff members weren't as nice as the ones who moved their from inland. One lady wouldn't help me (she was a local) b/c I was dealing with another person and made me wait 3 days until she came back to work. That was a little frustrating, but other than that, had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Ka'anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: rSmith040
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last week of March 2010. We had a wonderful room on the 11th floor that looked down on the pool and resort grounds, as well as at t he ocean. We watched the sunset from our balcony two different evenings and watched whales from the balcony in the mornings. We could also see the side of the mountain and watched farm machinery harvesting what we guessed was pineapple. The pools were wonderful. We took a free scuba class provided by Tiny Bubbles in the resort pool and then scuba dived right from the hotel beach. We walked all around the area and discovered the beach walk boardwalk south of us. We skipped the time share stuff. They did ask us to participate at arrival and any time we asked the concierge for info. We just said no. They quickly gave up. We loved Maui and the Beach Club and hope to come back soon. On the down side, there is a daily parking fee of $16, maid service was only once a week, the only time they even came in for trash or anything, we quickly realized we needed to set trash outside the door for pickup. There were fees for internet, fees for HBO/movie channels, but we weren't there for tv anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Time at KBC”
Reviews.Author: pdxgram
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Maui multiple times over the years. We stayed at the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Club 3/22 through 3/29 for the first time and we werenâ€™t sure what to expect based upon previous reviews, but I am happy to report, we had a wonderful time and loved the resort and had a positive experience with all of the staff, especially valet and the pool restaurant staff. They were friendly, courteous and helpful. We traded our timeshare through Raintree Vacation Club. We arrived a couple of hours before check-in time, but were able to check in and meet with concierge early. We let him know right up front that we had no interest in scheduling a timeshare presentation and he didnâ€™t pressure us. We did receive 3 phone messages from others over the next couple of days encouraging us to come down to meet with the concierge, which we just ignored since we had already told them we werenâ€™t interested. We stayed in suite 619 which looks down on the mini-golf game and parking lot below and has a decent ocean view when you lift your eyes (itâ€™s all a matter of perspective). It was great to watch the whales out in the ocean every day. Unlike some other reviews, our room didnâ€™t have any musty smell. The suite was spacious, clean and perfectly suited our needs. The king sized bed and pillows were very comfortable. As stated before, there is no stove or oven, just a microwave. Upon check-in there was an electric skillet and a blender already in our kitchen. We were able to access free wifi from our room. The pool area was spacious with plenty of seating and umbrellas. There is a childrenâ€™s pool area with a water slide. The children there seemed to be having a great time. One evening there was a free movie night by the pool. A portable movie screen was set up and the lounge chairs were positioned around it. We had a great view from our table at the poolside restaurant, where we ate several times. The staff at the poolside restaurant was great. We had eaten lunch there first while we were waiting for our room after checking in the first day. The second day we returned for dinner and our very sweet server remembered our names and our conversation from the day before. While we enjoyed the meals we ate onsite, most of our meals we ate while out and about. Here are a few of the things I highly recommend: a sunset dinner at Kimoâ€™s Steak House in Lahaina; lunch at Mamaâ€™s Fish House in Paia (both were worth every penny); taking the walk along the beach walk that begins a couple of resorts down and follows the beach all the way down to Black Rock; a whale watching excursion, if you are visiting during whale watching season (Our outing on the Pacific Whale Foundationâ€™s â€˜Explorerâ€™ boat was AMAZING!); and Warren and Annabelleâ€™s Magic Show (the show is hilarious! But if you plan to see it, make sure to plan ahead and get tix in advance, since the shows almost always sell out).

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSleboda
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to give KBC a poor rating but... service is everything. Check in was difficult and our room was not ready by 4:00pm as 'guaranteed'. The valet left our luggage out, unsecured... my husband went back to get my laptop, no one asked for ID or even notcied. There were two different hostess' at the Ohana bar and grill,both were unpleasant, borderline rude and showed definite favoritism. We have stayed at 4 other hotels in Maui. ( The Marriott had a more welcoming staff and better location. The Paia Inn staff were extraordinary ) For our money and time, we will go elsewhere next time we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cangirl_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights. The room was great - very clean, huge bathroom, and amazing bed!! Very relaxing to sit by the pool though they need more umbrellas - there were very few around the area. Staff was very friendly. The restaurant was good - daily happy hour, live music, good food. You have to pay for parking. Location is good but there are nicer beaches a bit further away. However there is a new board walk in Kaanapali - can walk all the way to Whaler's Village if you want, and there is a nicer beach further down. Duke's nearby was great for lunch, as well as the Pizza place just across the road. Definitely check out other beaches in the area. We have stayed in this area twice now but next time, we will try a different location for the better beach and avoiding the trade winds. Hotel is great though and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “You'll enjoy, here are some tips...”
Reviews.Author: Lamcee1
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the resort the after the tsunami was suppose to hit. It was hilarious because in the stores in town they were selling t-shirts that read, "I survived the Tsunami- Hawaii 2010." I was going to get one, but thought I'd be perpetrating a fraud since I came the day after and didn't even live through the hype and fear like others. The resort itself is about 40 minutes from the airport. The drive is gorgeous along the ocean. There are spots along the roads to get out and take pictures, beware, the road is windy and gazing tourists can drive carelessly and only one crash could end up in the ocean. The resort itself seem to be in resort central. And this Diamond property is just as good as the others, perhaps better. Ok, the tips I'll offer are for folks that are trying to spend their money wisely, if you're a high roller just know this place is great and enjoy. Tip# I would rent a car while staying in Maui either in town or at the airport, they have shuttles and public transpo, but the freedom of a car is worth the experience. Tip#2 There is a small grocery store down the street that is open sort of late, but DO NOT buy your groceries there, take a 10 minute drive to Lahaina and go to one of the bigger grocery stores there, cheaper and more selection, plus lots of other shopping. Tip#3 There is no oven, but they do provide an electric skillet, keep that in mind when you buy your groceries. Also, they have a WONDERFUL courtyard full of PROPANE grills (yea- no messy charcoal) along the beach with a lovely pond. The grounds are beautiful. You feel like you are experiencing Maui without even leaving the premises. Rooms are clean and spacious. Bathroom and tub relaxing, bedding, furniture seem high quality. Free wireless worked fine for me in the lobby. How fast do you need it on vacation anyway. Tip#4 Save yourself a few dollars and park your own car in their garage. They have elevators to take you up to the main floors. The valet folks can be pushy though. It is $16 a day to park in the garage so budget that expense. Front desk staff was forcing themselves to be nice, but who cares, fake is better than rude. Tip#5 The tides were high and not good for swimming or snorkeling along their beach, but you can walk as far as you want behind other resorts, what do they care. The walk and sunsets are spectacular and you can watch the whales doing mating dances for each oher from your cabana or lounge chair. After about 4 or 5pm, you can sit in the cabanas for free, staff leaves, and there is no one to charge you, nice for sunsets. They provide scuba trips and snorkeling gear at the resort. $35 for snorkleling all week including the gear. Scuba is about $80 for 2-1/2 hr and they train you, take you out in the ocean and you actually do get to see interesting sea life, one lady saw some kind of shark fish. Sounded like a good deal, I wasn't remotely interested in getting up close and personal with any kind of sharks, fish, minnows, etc. Not my thing. Some folks packed their own snorkeling gear. To snorkel on your own you may need to drive down to Lahaina or along Kaanapali Beaches to find good spots. I saw lots of people on their own at different beach parks raving how better the water was at the beach parks than at the resorts. The pool is lovely and beautiful and right next to the beach as well as a restaurant and grill. Tip #6 The restaurant has unbelievable ribs! Drinks are expensive, but hey that is what I came here for to eat, swim, shop, and sight see. The wait staff was rude and I told one off and made a scene who then got her manager involved and they were overly friendly then, but fake. There are also a ton of restaurants in Lahaina, 10 minutes away along the bay. You have to go down the little shopping strip full of vendors, hippies, bars, clubs, galleries, movie theatre, restaurants and a production called Ulalena- a must see! Tip#7 I agree, book all your sight seeing tours on your own or online, most places have online specials. Plus, the concierge lady spent most of her time talking to the presentation staff and totally ignored me. The manager had to get her attention. Get brochures from her desk. The presentation staff was nice, but had me sit there for about 10 minutes before someone even talked with me. It was a waste of my time since I already own with Diamond, they wanted me to add the Hawaii collection. Get real, how often am I going to get to Hawaii. Plus, Hawaii IS part of the US Collection, so why would I do that. When they realized I wasn't an idiot, the thing only lasted about 40 minutes. Tip#8 Don't buy anything from the gift store. Everything is sold in Lahaina $20 cheaper. But DO buy from the guy who carves things in the lobby. He's a nice guy and trying to support his family. Times are even harder for the locals than in the mainland. Don't just stand there gaulking at him, taking pictures of him carving and not buy anything, how rude! Tip#9 They have a Luau on Wednesdays for $60. That's totally up to you. I thought it was free. I wasn't going to pay $60 for a meal and entertainment everyone else can stand around and see for free. Plus, there are plenty of Luau's to go to with better entertainment, that cost the same. Tip #10 I island hopped and didn't get too many days to just do nothing. This resort is beautiful enough and with Lahaina so close, you can do nothing at the resort and enjoy yourself, make time to do nothing. Island hopping is expensive because there are no more ferries only airfare, but like I said I went there with certain intentions to sight see and shop. If you do island hop be prepared to spend over $1,000 per person for airfare and tours, but worth every penny. Polynesian Tours or Adventure Tours are wonderful. Aloha! The pictures they provide on their site are real, so what you see is what you get, fortunately. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice stay but avoid the whole timeshare thing”
Reviews.Author: mesillagirl
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel through a private party and got an excellent deal compared to the online prices. I read the reviews before we left so I was already well aware that we would be asked to attend a timeshare presentation. When we arrived to check in the bell boys said they would valet park our car as it would take us awhile to check in because we would have to meet with the concierge. We already knew the concierge was the one who would try to get us to go to the timeshare presentation. The girl who checked us in was very nice. She gave us a welcome folder, our keys and our pool towel cards. If you don't return your towel cards at the end of the stay you are charged $50.00 per card. She then told us to meet with the concierge who would tell us how to get to our room and explain the resort. We said ok but we didn't meet with her. We went back to the bell boys and gave them our room #. We got to our room and saw that it was a handicap room and didn't have a tub. I called downstairs and ask for another room. She said the only one available didn't have as nice of a view it had a view of the mountains but I said I would rather have that, so they sent the bell boy up with our new keys and he moved our stuff to the new room. The rooms were nice enough. No burners but they brought us an electric skillet to use. The bathroom was very nice with a large soaking tub. The pillows were uncomfortable but housekeeping brought up feather ones. We were there during the Tsunami warning and the hotel was great about moving anyone on the 2nd floor up to a higher floor and keeping all the guest informed. We bought a bunch of groceries just in case and ended up giving them all to the bell boys when we left. The only negatives during our stay was we wanted to book a dinner cruise and went to the activities counter at the resort. The woman who worked there tried to talk us into going to the timeshare presentation for a better rate. I told her we weren't interested we want to pay the full rate yet she kept on about it. She didn't want to take no for an answer even trying to throw in a free 3 day stay in Sedona. NO NO NO!!! The dinner cruise was canceled due to the tsunami so I had to meet with her to reschedule and she again started pushing the great discount she could give us. Really NO means NO we don't wanna go!!!
