She was really pushy and unfriendly. The other negative was the pool would run out of the towel cards so I was worried I was going to get charged the $50.00 for the towels. The pool guy said I wouldn't but each time I stopped at the front desk on my way back to the room and ask for 2 cards just in case. All in all the hotel is nice and in a great location. You can see the whales from the beach. I would stay here again but book my activities from someone in town and avoid the hotel concierges. Also want to mention parking is $16.00 per day and internet in the room is wired and is $9.99 per day. Free wireless in the lobby but it is slow.

Reviews.Title: “What?”
Reviews.Author: sunnshinesally47
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before I went to this place as a sampler package. I was thinking that this wasn't going to be all that great as to what I had read, but I love Maui. I was very pleasantly surprised! Every one was very nice and helpful! The rooms were very nice they were a bit musty but controlled with the doors open (who would not want the doors open with that that beautiful sounds and air?) The Suite was very large and had 2 queen beds in the bedroom as I was traveling with my best friend. There were even 2 sinks on opposite sides of the bathroom from each other. The service was exceptional. The blender came quickly and the skillet came the next day (we didn't use it) The time share people were nice (of course they would be) I told them right up front that i couldn't buy but they still talked with me for close to 21/2 hours but worth the hotel stay. We both had a blast!!!! If you want an easier exit to any presentations then don't ask questions. Ive also learned that most people that write in reviews had a bad experience and people that had a blast like us don't. We had the mini golf view but could see the ocean too. The Lani was skinny but there were lounge chairs out there that you can sit on and watch the ocean too (partial view but enough) The pool is super nice with plenty of chairs and a lot of umbrellas. The surf isn't for swimming right there but walking on the sand to the restaurants was good and there are plenty of beaches near by. Any way don't be scared by negative reviews! This was a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Was Pleasantly Surprised !”
Reviews.Author: kleighKansasCity
Reviews.Content: After reading a fewl reviews, I was a bit skeptical of staying here but we had prepaid our stay several months ago. Here are some things I would point out for anyone planning a trip and staying at the hotel: 1) YOU DO NOT HAVE TO GET SUCKED INTO A TIMESHARE PRESENTATION!!! At the checkin, they do indeed tell you that to finish the process they have a person show you to the VIP Services desk. They offer you a $100 dinner certificate for sitting in on a presentation. Simply say "NO, you have no interest in that". That totally ended the discussion then and there. We were never asked again about participating. End of story. No problem with that. 2) We stayed on the 10th floor overlooking a parking lot but with a mountain view. I would have loved an ocean view but we didn't opt for that nor did we request it, which was our fault becuase it sounds like some people can get it just for the asking. However, we were on the go so much that we didn't miss it as we were out in restaurants who had nice ocean views for dinner, etc. 3) We had a one-bedroom suite. It was quite spacious for the two of us. If I had children, I would definitely opt for a 2 bedroom just to get away from them and let them have their own space. As mentioned throughout, the bathrooms are huge. Two sinks, a large tub, and large separate shower...all of which is nicely tiled. The beds are incredibly comfortable. Overall furnishings in the living room area were tropical in style, with lots of space in the dresser and other pieces throughout the rooms. Kitchen is newly remodeled with nice granite counters. Nice flat screen TVS in both living and bedroom areas. Really nice long closet with full mirrors on both sides. The closet opens from both the bedroom and the bathroom. Rooms were very clean but did have an odor...but it wasn't bad enough to move or even make me go out an buy a room freshener. 4) Some other reviewers commented on not having a stove. This was not a negative for us because there was a huge brand new Cuisinart skillet in the kitchen cupboard which was perfect for making eggs/bacon in the morning which is all we needed for breakfast. You could easily fix skillet meals if you wanted to. Also, there was a new stainless Cuisinart Coffee Maker which makes up to 12 cups of coffee but serves one at a time which was a very nice feature since it kept the coffee warm without burning it. Also, there was a really nice toaster. All of these appliances were Cuisinart. Nice dishwasher and they provide dishwashing liquid, powder, and all serving pieces and serviing ware. Very nicely furnished. 5) I am a DeCaf coffee drinker and the amount of coffee they supplied would only last a couple of days. My husband rang up the front desk and within 30 minutes of arriving, they had another half dozen coffee packets for us. We bought our own splenda and creamer (I have to do that in most hotels anyway) 6) Staff was just super. My husband is the type where if anything is wrong or he needs anything, he will call the front desk. They were very cordial, bent over backwards to accomodate our needs, and overall incredibly responsive. 7) We only ate at the outside grill one time..otherwise we ate elsewhere. Didn't do their buffet, but we did go to the one at the Hyatt Regency. It was incredible, but it was also $35 per person.... so that makes the $15 one at the Beach Club sound pretty good. Most other mornings we cooked on the skillet or went to local places. 8) Location is fabulous. it's easy to get to anywhere on the island from the Beach Club. We went all over the place and found that Kaanapali is a great jumping off point. Some other recommendations below. 9) For a Luau go to the Hyatt Regency's Drums of the Pacific. Great food and fabulous entertainment and right next to the beach. 10) For snorkel and sailing, you absolutely cannot beat the 1st class service you get with Alii Nui. Huge new catamaran, fabulous service, great breakfast and dinner and wonderful overall experience. If you are planning on whale watching, you may want to do this first as we saw 3x as many whales going out and coming back in as we did on the whale watch trip we took. 11) Go to Mama's Fish House. A bit pricy but food was excellent. Overall, staying at the Beach Club was a very good experience with lots of amenities. Yeah, $16 for parking may seem alot, but try parking a car in D.C. or a NYC hotel. Keep that in perspective. Also, remember you are not paying Hyatt Regency or Four Seasons hotel prices for what you get. You will get great service, a nice room, and a great experience if you keep it in perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Good, BUT”
Reviews.Author: BillHeald
Reviews.Content: The location and the facilities were very good. BUT $16 a day for parking and $10 a day for internet were outragious.... Beware of the Timeshare sales....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: onemoretime
Reviews.Content: We always stay in resorts and prefer to be pampered while staying in Hawaii. This condo thing was new to us. We traded our Disney Vacation points for a condo in Maui (to be honest it was the only one available) We knew going into it that it wasnâ€™t a very good trade but hey â€“ we wanted to go to back to Hawaii and this would make it very affordable. We were told we would not have an ocean view but hubby asked nicely and we ended up getting one. We also had a view of the car port but hey I could still see whales from my lanai. Overall we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel â€“ and our room was lovely. Did not care for the check in process where they try and make you sign up for a tour. I even knew about it and kind of got suckered in. It left a bad taste in my mouth. They check you in and then are like go with so and so to finish your check in. Just say no. We watched so many people checking in get forced to listen to someone selling timeshares. We ate dinner once at the restaurant and were pleased. Happy hour drinks were awesome. Beach was pretty rough while we were there so we didnt snorkel there but spent plenty of time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Maui 2008”
Reviews.Author: ShonS
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, nice pool area, rooms are clean and nice. Good, friendly service from staff. Been there 3 times - 30 days total

Reviews.Title: “Fifth Time is a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: spikeinlf
Reviews.Content: A must-do trip! Seriously, if you get the chance, GO! I will live there someday. I don't know when or for how long, but I love the Islands, the culture, the natural beauty, the people are fabulous! Spend at LEAST 10 days, otherwise you will feel rushed and the 9 hour flight will not have seemed worth it. Must go to Mama's! Best food, service, location combination that I have ever experienced ANYWHERE. Period. You will pay for it, but if you go, relax, take your time, enjoy! Aloha and Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: enjoytropical
Reviews.Content: We just came back after a week's stay at the Ka'anapalli Beach Club. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the mezzanine floor (like being on the second floor) and had a side view of the ocean. The suite itself was beautiful, roomy master with a king size bed and the bathroom was huge with 2 sinks, soaker tub, seperate shower and toilet room. We were very comfortable there. We did not eat in any of the in house restaurants, instead made use of the kitchen in our suite. Within walking distance is a small strip mal with a large grocery store, pizza place, taco place, movie rental etc. Yes, this is a timeshare and we were led to a side table as soon as we checked in and were encouraged to listen to a presentation. We politely refused and were not bothered again. The grounds at this hotel were beautiful as was the pool area. There were quite a few people snorkelling in the ocean right by the hotel. We will definately stay here again if we chose to go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: webeenthere
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare, remember that. At full price, this would have been a very disapointing hotel for the posted price. Ambushed by the timeshare crew before you even get your room key. Good location, clean rooms, nice staff, overpriced restaurants, not much to do after dark unless you drive to some other location. Twelve dollars a day to park your car. Great beach and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Whale-Watching Location”
Reviews.Author: ita7
Reviews.Content: Negatives--Upon arrival, Rupa attempted to persuade us to attend a time-share presentation, but we firmly said "no" 3 times and she finally accepted. She did not tell us that maid service was only on Thurs and Monday, but as the trash piled up we finally called, and housekeeping said that we should have been informed and then came and got the trash. The air conditioning filter was dirty in the bathroom and needed cleaning. Ate dinner on our first night at the resort restaurant, was just OK and overpriced, and no room service is offered but found good dining across the street . Positives-- The room, especially the bathroom, was large and comfortable. The room and resort was quiet and peaceful, no problems with noise from other rooms or excess noise from activities (e.g., Karioki). The view from our 11th floor lanai was outstanding and we saw dozens of whales every time we sat outside. The whale-watching along the Kaanapali Beach was better than any location we experienced on our drives around the Island. The beach was very nice and not crowded and we enjoyed the snorkling right on the beach-- tried Black Rock but it was jammed with snorklers and not really much better variety of fish than right off the resort beach, in my opinion. The grounds were very nice and will maintained, with large swimming pools and plenty of lounge chairs, waterfalls and poi-stocked ponds were nice touches. Staff was friendly and helpful. There were plenty of available spaces in the parking garage, that, along with the self-parking option, made it easy to get in and out for island excursions. All in all, KBC was one of our favorite resort sites and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “beauty everywhere”
Reviews.Author: maryjoe0777
Reviews.Content: We found the grounds of the hotel to be lovely and lush, including the lobby. The service was professional. All rooms are suites and the same except for the view. Our unit was very spacious and extremely clean and very comfortable. When you first enter one sees the living room and dining area . As you look right , the kitchen with full refrigerator , dishwasher and microwave, coffee maker.The bedroom is seperated by doors that can be left open. the bathrooms are huge and closet doors open on either side or both bedroom, bath . cool & easy . the lani or balcony was very long opening form both the bedroom and living room. It was very narrow. View was great, ocean, beach . easy walk across street for groceries. Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Annyka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 9 nights and 10 days here at the KBC early January 2010. We were on the 7th floor facing the ocean, pool, and lobby entrance. It was a wonderful view! We also stayed here January 2009 as well. W/ the price of our unit, we knew that we had to sit through a timeshare presentation which we weren't so excited about doing. 5 days in to our trip we met w/ Chuck and he knew that we had no intentions of purchasing. We never misled Chuck to thinking that we were ever interested in purchasing. As a result, we were fast tracked in our presentation w/in 1 hour. Chuck was great and seemed to know from the get go that we were definately not going to purchase. As current owners of a timeshare (on the Big Island), we would recommend Chuck for those that go through a timeshare presentation. He was understanding, informative, and laid back. ASK FOR CHUCK! Needless to say we were on the beach shortly after our timeshare presentation. I'm convinced that the 2 1/2-3 hour timeshare presentation reports come from individuals who have displayed at least a minimal level of interest in ownership. The bottom line equals do not show a minimal level of interest and you will be back on the beach in no time like we were!!! We had another wondeful time at the KBC. We did not rent a car and used public transportation. The Times Market across the street, along w/ Subway and other eateries are just a few minutes walk across the street. There are a lot of ABC stores that are like a drugstore/convenient store, one of which is located just north of the property. I would disagree w/ the need to rent a car unless you plan to travel the island; otherwise KBC is a pick up point for public transportation for only $1.00 per person per ride. I can't wait for our next trip and would definately stay again at the KBC.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed, dismayed, dissatisfied .... but NOT surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TJGHudson
Reviews.Content: Exchanged points to stay at the Kaanapali Beach Club in January - 2010. Upon entering the lobby to check-in, the first thing we noticed was the lack of decor and floors that 'looked clean' but upon closer inspection were worn and stained. Front desk personnel were amiable and efficient. Checked into our room - a nice corner unit with a view of both the West Maui mountains and ocean. However, we noticed a musty smell and thought that the room had not been used for awhile. We proceeded to open the sliding doors to 'air out' the room. After setting up the room and enjoying the view on the lanai we closed the doors and went to dinner. Returning to our room we could still detect the odor, but dismissed it as a minor inconvenience. I went to the bedroom to setup my laptop and while waiting for it to power up I looked to my right and saw a long black streak coming from the vent. The streak was ~five feet in length and the width of the vent starting at the vent and continuing over the bed. Needless to say, I was not pleased and called the front desk. I was informed that a maintenance man would come up and look at the 'problem'. He arrived and looked at the black swath and said, "That doesn't look good .... I will have to talk with the manager". After waiting 30 minutes, I proceeded to the front desk. The desk clerk stated that she had talked with the manager. I asked why I had not received a call. I was given no reply. I asked what they were going to do because I was NOT going to sleep in a bed with a 5 foot swath of black mold on the ceiling. Desk clerk said that they could not do anything that night because they were overbooked. I replied that was not acceptable and she stated that she had been given authorization by the manager to give me a $50 credit. Again, I replied that was not acceptable because we were NOT going to sleep in that room. After a few similar exchanges the desk clerk said she would call the manager again. After another 10 minutes she returned stating again that they were overbooked but the manager would try to find us accomodations at another resort. After another 20 minutes the desk clerk told me that they had found a room (in the resort) and that we would be moving to the new room. I replied that if they were overbooked how did they now find a room and asked to have the manager call us. As expected, I never received any call from anyone for the entire duration of the stay (one week). The resort is a former Embassy Suites that was sold to Diamond Resorts. The resort lacks the ambience expected from an oceanside, Hawaiian resort. It is in a state of slow deterioration .... no decorations, areas that used to house Embassy Suites activities e.g., manager's reception, restaurants, etc., are left vacant or sparsely occupied. The pool is a cement slab that has no appearance of anything tropical. Other than providing a 'unit' the resort offers little more than just a room. If you are looking for a more Hawaiian and/or resort experience I would NOT suggest this location.

Reviews.Title: “We really exicted about being back”
Reviews.Author: jewelswa
Reviews.Content: they have changed the name but we thought it would still be somewhat the same or better.We got a great deal on room,car,plane but when we got here they added a charge of $16.00 a day for parking which adds up to a extra $230.00 dollars. Thats really steep when you are staying at there hotel and eating at there hotel. Parking should have a small fee not hundreds of dollars. So buyer beware!!!!!!!!!!The question is would I recommend this hotel to friends,this is our first day will have think about that.my family will be here Sat. will see if they are better at service as the wk. goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why there would be any good reviews...”
Reviews.Author: katetkins
Reviews.Content: After reading great reviews and getting this hotel for a good price we booked our one week maui vacation at Ka'anapali beach club. We tried to cheack into our hotel and immediatly were told that the hotel was over booked for the night and they would have to put us in Ka'anapali shores hotel next door. For the major inconvenience they gave us free parking, ($17 a day) and upgraded us to a ocean view room. This didn't seem like a fair trade for a bad start to our vacation. The hotel next door checked us in for a one night stay and were not very understanding or friendly about it. The hotels pool was closed and the room wasnt very nice. Very outdated furtinure and a uncomfortable bed. The next day I was told the Ka'anapali beach club would try to get us into our room as early as possible. We ended up sitting around waiting for our room to be ready til 4:30. The hotel it's self is extremly outdated! The room looked over the cheesy minigolf course and the patios were not private at all. Everytime we entered the room we were taken back by the smell of mildew. The restuarant down stairs was awful and over priced. They advertise happy hour specials half off all the drinks and then tell you after you get your large bill it is only some of the mixed drinks. The pool was ice cold and not even heated. We were extremly unhappy with this hotel and were frusterated we didnt book with a brand new hotel close by for the same price. Ka'anapali beach club needs to put some money into this dump before trying to charge people what they do... and the people that wright good reviews for this place must be comparing it to pay by the hour motels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for families. Rated highly for a reson!”
Reviews.Author: olystacy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBC in January of 2010. Our family of 4 (children 8 and 11) thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We rented off of craigslist and stayed in a corner unit which gave us a direct view of the ocean, pool, and mountains. We had a wrap around Lanai which was perfect for whale watching, and relaxing. It isnt real wide so you cant set a table out there but it was still nice to sit out and chill. THE UNIT - itself was gorgeous and spacious. The kids said the hideabed wasnt comfortable but then again, I have never slept on one that is. The bed in the bedroom was comfortable. The bathroom is huge and the bathtub is a nice soaking tub. The kitchen doesnt have a stove but you can get an electric skillet brough up to your room if you wish. The hotel was kept up very nicely, clean, and safe feeling, with fast elevators and easy self parking. THE POOL - was warm and clean with plenty of beach chairs to be had. We have stayed in other places where if you dont have a towel on a chair by 8am you are out of luck, Not true here although people to reserve their chairs early which I dont think they are supposed to do. The ambience by the pool was low key and the evening very nice with Hawaiin music (live) played from the restaurant on the terrace. Tiki torches and waterfalls made the experience as well. I WOULD STRONGLY SUGGEST YOU AVOID THE BUFFET. It was gross and worse than most continental breakfasts you eat at lower end hotels. The omelet station was the only saving grace but even then they didnt have very many ingredients to choose from). The rest of the buffet was nothing worth mentioning. Hashbrowns were deep fried jo jo type potatos cut up (like jack in the box). GROSS. Even at 15 this was not worth it. Subsequently we did not eat anywhere else on the property. Across the street there is a place called Pizza Paradiso - They had awesome breakfast burritos (grab and go) for 4.95 and were quite filling. Cheap, filling, and portable for on the way to the beach. TIMESHARE- They do try to bombard you as soon as you check in by telling you they have to complete your reservation....you then walk to a desk where they start in. I immediately told them no and they seemed to respect that although they called later in the week promising a 3 day free stay at their resorts for taking a "survey". PLEASE. We didnt do that either. I saw a couple in the elevator obviously on a timeshare tour and they looked like they were being held hostage. No thanks. The KBC does charge for local phone calls - and do not advertise that - so beware. THE BEACH - is nice out front but not for swimming. We saw people kiteboarding on windy days and others snorkeling occasionally but an employee told us that there are bad riptides and showed us warning flags and buoys. Needless to say we didnt go farther in than our knees. Maybe this is just the case in the winter? All told we would definately go back to this condo. We have stayed in several places in Maui and we would return to this property first.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is paradise”
Reviews.Author: Sactownhammer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on Maui more than a dozen times, from five stars to three. Kaanapali Beach Club would rate in the middle. This resort allows you use of a small kitchen{like a condo), but with the amentities of a resort with restraunts. If you want a five star timeshare, go to the Marriott Ocean Club or Westin Ocean Villas. Both fine resorts, but with steep price tags to purchase ($30-50,000). I puchased my timeshare at Kaanapali beach club through ebay, way cheaper than the resort. For the people complaining about the internet, stay home, why go to hawaii to surf the net when you can surf the waves. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare pitched ruined our stay”
Reviews.Author: cwebbrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for 4 nights. When our travel agent booked this hotel we were told we would have to sit through the timeshare pitch. We prepared ourselves mentally, but what we encountered was beyond our worst expectations. We were on one of the top floors with an ocean view. It was nice, large and clean. The grounds are beautiful. We were escorted to "VIP services" after we checked in. There is nothing "VIP" about it. This is where they take a calendar out and try and get you to sign up for all the excursions the hotel as to offer. This is also where they sign you up for the 2 hour (but it was really almost 3) timeshare pitch. We didnt think we had a choice, and had to say yes. But I think you can say No. DO THIS! Its NOT WORTH the $100 voucher. NOT WORTH IT! We were bummed that you had to pay $16 for parking, but a car is necessary in Maui. We chose to do the "pitch" two days into our stay. We were greeted by an aggressive guy named Kai. He basically grilled us and harassed us for 3 hours. He was "intrigued" in why we had a nice room on one of the top floors since normally they are reserved for "special members." We basically told him straight out that we were not interested in buying. He became very angry because it was his "day off." Stopped filling in questions, started to ask questions and then said "you know what, it doesnt even matter...rather you buy or not, I am still going to make money." He was a jerk to say the least. He told us the reason he got a divorce was because he didnt take a vacation w his wife. He then basically told us that this would surely happen to us if we didnt sign up for our "guaranteed vacation." The manager then came over- we thought this is where we could sign out, but no! The manager basically said we would end in divorce as well if we didnt guarantee a vacation. Telling honeymooners they will get divorced is not a great sales pitch. It was honestly the worst part of our vacation. We then felt like outsiders, since they basically told us we did not belong there since we were not members. After they FINALLY (3 hours- THREE!!) let us sign out, and then we sent us out to another sales lady who tried one more time to get us to sign. We also had to rate everything and lied because we were afraid of the repercussions. I would only stay here again if we didnt have to go through the sales pitch. I cant even express to you how horrible this was.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for a better trip.”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner031
Reviews.Content: We booked KBC for our wedding/honeymoon. The property is beautiful, staff is extremely helpful, pool is pristine, food is great, beach is fantastic. The wedding was held on the property, and the staff helped to make our wedding perfect. The rooms are great, bathrooms are luxurious, bed was very comfortable. Minigolf was fun too. The ONLY negative was that our room had not yet had the kitchen renovated, so there was no stove/oven in the kitchenette. The front desk has crock pot or electric griddle available to use, and they also have great gas grills and picnic tables available for guests, so it worked out well. I LOVE KAANAPALI BEACH CLUB!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: babyrn1
Reviews.Content: Ka'anapali Beach Club was amazing. The pool was huge, the beach access was great and the dining was delicious! We didn't have the best view of the ocean, but we were on a borrowed time share week and got put in the back of the complex. The time share agents are very smooth and will talk anyone into buying a week of timeshare in Maui....well, almost everyone! The 2 hour presentation was well worth $100 off our snorkeling trip! Our room was very clean and comfortable. The kitchenette was nice to have so that we could eat breakfast and lunch in our room. The staff was very accomodating. Parking was convenient and safe. We would definitely consider going back!

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Nightmare!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HannahVancouver
Reviews.Content: Do not, I repeat do NOT go to the time share presentation. The promised 90 minute presentation was 2 1/2 hours. We were literally held hostage. After explaining we had to think about it, the salesman sent for the manager who was the most insulting verbally abusive man I have ever encountered, he kept getting us to buy, when we were finally allowed to sign out we were sent to another person with the same pitch of how we had to buy, had to get up and demand to sign out AGAIN, only to be sent to another person for a final signing out. Unbelievable!!!! Do they seriously think you will buy from them with this abusive, insulting,accusatory sales pitch, never seen anything like it!!! If and when I buy a timeshare it will most definately not be with them. Stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average but good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: mauiguy1120
Reviews.Content: Average but a good deal for the price: We stayed there for ten days not knowing much about what to look for with little time to research and booking online based on the rates, details, and photos from this site. We have no complaints; just liked some of the other resorts nearby on the west side of Maui. I would be willing to pay for more luxurious accommodations but for what this place offers itâ€™s ok. Also if youâ€™re always going somewhere to see and do things then this place is a will suit you fine and again a good deal for your money but just not fancy or luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great property to enjoy a perfect week - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: bdgoulet
Reviews.Content: We booked this week and were told not to expect an ocean view. We arrived at night and were pleasantly surprised to wake up to a view of the ocean and the island of Lanai. The property was up to date, clean and well appointed. The on-site facilities were more than adequate. The grill was situated next to the pool and had a great ocean view. The pool was large and very well maintained. There was even a waterfall pool within the pool to enjoy. The pool was being maintained during our stay but the work was unobtrusive and each day a section was roped off for maintenance with very little, if any, inconvenience. The property is right on the beach and there is snorkeling almost in front of the property. Snorkeling and scuba equipment is readily available to rent at reasonable prices. The suite itself was very spacious and again well appointed. Granite countertops everywhere, home theater components, 2 IPod docking stations. Resort staff were all very friendly and helpful. Bedding was very comfortable. Very quiet environment with mostly the sounds of the many fountains and waterfalls and the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Been there many times, will be back many more times”
Reviews.Author: haroldsresort
Reviews.Content: It has everything, for all ages, all types, on the beach, alot of the rooms do not overlook the water, so if you want that, make sure you request ( and pay ) for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room but watch out for the timeshare pitch”
Reviews.Author: NateAlaska
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel but it did have its downsides/limitations. The check in was nice - they offered cold water or punch as you walked into the hotel. Once you check in, they ask to schedule your appointment with the activity desk. We did do that and the people at the activity desk were happy to set up activities for us but we ended up not needing the help since we already had activities set up. Also, several times while we stayed there, we got a little pressure on signing up for a timeshare - in which we had no interest. I didn't really care for that but put up with it. Room: Our room was beautiful and spacious. The hotel is a former Embassy Suites and it shows. There was a living room and kitchenette separate from the bedroom. There were TVs in both the living room and bedroom. The bathroom was very spacious and nice - it included two sinks, a jacuzzi tub and a separate shower. The balcony was narrow but a chair fit on it. Our room had a partial view of the ocean. Pool: The pool was quite large and included a slide (it wasn't open while we were there), a waterfall and more than one hot tub, as I recall. In fact, one waterfall ran into one of the hot tubs. The sand beach was just outside of the pool area. Fitness Room: This was in a separate, small building in the pool area. It included weight machines and several cardio machines, including the elliptical that I used and a treadmill. There was also a water cooler and a TV. The facility was air conditioned and nice. Food Service: There was a open-air bar and cafe next to the pool area. Across from that was a take out area, where you could get breakfast. There was a large area with many tables in the hotel, as well. I assume that is where the former Embassy Suites served their free breakfast. The hotel was not using the area while we were there. As a cheaper alternative for meals, there is a strip mall a short walk from the hotel that has a few restaurants and a grocery store. Parking: This is in an underground garage built into the hotel. There is a daily charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay over all, but expect aggressive timeshare sales person”
Reviews.Author: okazuyafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed this please few years ago and had excellent experience so we decided to stay again. The room was upgraded since then. Has big and new bathroom, nice furniture, and clean room. The property is right on the beach. The beach has lots of rocks so we went snorkeling and swimming to other beaches, but this beach was nice to just relax and watch the sunset. Service is good over all and staffs are friendly. What we didn't like the most was that right after we finished check in, we were sent to this timeshare sales person. This sales person tried too hard to sell the time share to us. We told her we are only visiting for vacation, but she didn't give up and even asked us how much we earn for combined income!!! Very disappointing. $10.00/day internet access is non-sense nowadays, I think. But we were able to get WiFi signal most of the time we wanted to use internet so we didn't need to pay $10.00 fee. Our room was above the miniature golf. Kids were noisy, sometimes. Also, I sensed that "Aloha" spirit was missing compare to few years ago. It was Embassy Suite back then. Not sure if that is the reason or bad economy? They still offer great service, but the atmosphere was different and didn't have much of Aloha in the air as last time.

Reviews.Title: “Usually better than this....”
Reviews.Author: travelswithmimi
Reviews.Content: Kaanipali beach club is our favorite. We usually stay twice a year and this time we had a few concerns. We had a room over the mini golf course and there was a very strong smell of mildew...probably because there is never any sunlight reaching the room. Right after we checked in I went to take a shower and there was alot (more than a handful) of very long black hair in the drain. The shower had not been cleaned (icky) but the housekeeping staff came and cleaned it that evening. There was an old pacifier on the floor in the bedroom. From then on the service was excellent...I'll certainly excuse the first day. The beach is perfect and even though the currant was a bit rough there is a great place to snorkle and the boogie boarding was the best I've seen there. Happy hour is fabulous for watching the beautiful sunsets with 1/2 price drinks. Try the molokai monkey (but only one if you want to remember it the next day) The kids menu at happy hour offers $2 items so it was wonderful to have the grandchildren occupied as we watched the sunset. The regular menu has some awesome entrees and the portions are huge. We split a sandwich and fries at lunch and fed three people from it for about $11.00. The pizzas are really good and a small pizza fed the other three people. The pool is always nice and warm and offers a section for children. This was my main concern: We were given some tickets to the luau and since one of our party had never been to a luau we decided to buy another one so all of us could go. The food was great...the show was extremely amateurish. The performers were mostly grade school/middle school aged children and I found it hard to watch them "shake their coconuts". They were cute but it was like a dance school recital that cost alot of money to watch. The older girls had multiple tatoos that did not go with the island appearance they should be portraying. If you get tickets for free, go for it but if you are paying....go to the OLD LAHAINA LUAU...its got a fabulous show and food and the price is pretty close to what we paid for the luau.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RyanSurrey
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved my stay here. It's got an amazing pool, huge, and located near the beach. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The rooms have great bathrooms and comfortable living quarters. Very quiet, never heard our neighbors. The location on the beach is top notch, and the restaurant on site is great. Housekeeping was thourough and trustworthy. Many barbeques on the property made cooking dinners fun and on the beach. Only a couple minor complaints, there is no stove in the room, but housekeeping brought up an electric skillet and rice cooker. Parking is $13 a day. Internet is $9.99 a day (but we found free wireless signals from the hotel next door) I would stay here again, anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in a nice area.”
Reviews.Author: Frey29
Reviews.Content: This was a nice and clean condo right on the beach. The pool area was newly remodeled and was great. Nice electronics in room--even ipod docks. The staff was helpful, but they are tenacious sales people. They nickel and dime you at every turn i.e. we wanted to use the volleyball net at the pool, but you had to buy a volleyball--not check out, not rent, BUY.

Reviews.Title: “Ok as a hotel but not a fair trade as a Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: rellyrooly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located actually closer to Kahana than it is to Ka'anapali. It is on a decent stretch of beach that is good as long as there isn't any kind of weather. We had multiple red flag warnings while we were there so the water was not safe for children to swim as there was a massive undertow and riptide. It really didn't pose too much of a problem for us though as my kids enjoy the pool as well. This resort is a Diamond Resorts timeshare/hotel. We stayed as a trade with our Disney property through Interval. While the room was spacious (bathroom is huge) and clean, this was not a fair trade IMO. This resort does not have washer/dryer units in each property and that is a real disappointment to me. I just don't understand why a timeshare wouldn't have that. That is one of the selling points of a Timeshare. Also, with baggage fees as they are these days, you want to be able to pack less and wash more. This would totally stop me from buying here. Also, there is not a full kitchen, just a kitchenette. No stove or oven. While that matters less to me than the lack of washer/dryer, it is still an issue. Timeshare people do like to know they have those amenities. Sometimes we like to buy a frozen pizza for the kids and that can't be done. The property is pink as other reviews have mentioned. It could be classed up a bit with another color. The lobby has potential as does the entire property. It just needs a facelift. The rooms are ok; some of the furniture is tired. The sofa sleeper was very worn and the mattress was not comfortable as you could feel the springs. The master bed was comfortable. Didn't like that we had to pay for internet, most timeshares offer internet free at this point. There was never a problem with getting pool chairs or cabanas if so desired. They could have used some music at the pool as well as servers for drinks and food. I really enjoy having a drink and relaxing at the pool and not having to walk to get it myself. I am on vacation....;) All in all, we enjoyed our stay. It is what you make of it. If I had a choice, I would definitely choose the Westin Ocean Villas over this property. We have stayed at both and the Westin is just nicer over all plus has the amenities that the KBC is missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would be awesome for families!”
Reviews.Author: WhereShouldIGoNext
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and loved it! We had a spacious one bedroom condo with a view of the mountains. (It's cheaper than the ocean view and we actually really enjoyed the mountain view.. we saw some beautiful rainbows!) This is a timeshare property but you can also book with them. We like staying in timeshare properties because they are bigger and feel more homey. There is a small kitchen, a big living room, a nice bedroom and bathroom. We really enjoyed it here and recommend it for a relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Price, view, location and service, all adequate for Maui”
Reviews.Author: spoonyoda
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Club is a modern condo like hotel. My wife and I stayed in a room with a Master Bed, LARGE bathroom, pull out sofa and kitchenette. We had a partial ocean and mountain view which was fine for our purposes. When we wanted to get out and see either one of those in more detail, we would go to the main floor and had easy access to both views. The beach in front of the Ka'anapali Beach Club is not expansive, but there is plenty of room to play or "walk along the beach." We planned on spending most of our time away from our room, but wanted to have somewhere to cook some food if we wanted. There is a grocery store within a half mile and the kitchenette was perfect for our uses, including some basics in silverware. There was not a breakfast buffet option available when we visited which was dissapointing because my last visit here had one. The buffet previously was excellent. There is as an alternative option, since you have the kitchenette, a farmers market every couple of days down the road in the opposite direction of Lahaina. We would go there when it was open and buy some fresh fruit, bread, muffins and preserves for a nice breakfast. The resturant on the ground level by the pool is decent but not great. You will pay the same or similiar prices as decent resturants a short drive away. The greater down side is don't expect "quite" when you're at the resturant, that is not its intent from what I could tell, but you do get some excellent scenery. All in all the Ka'anapali Beach Club is worth going to. "Cheaper" stay, clean, safe and friendly. Good location for shopping and general site seeing. I would recommend a stay there and would stay there myself again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “First impression was not good.”
Reviews.Author: Hamptonmom
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong we had a great time. Maui is sooo beautiful. The lobby is badly in need of an upgrade. Because it is an open air lobby its a little weathered. Only one restaurant and a snack bar (which cooks the food for the restaurant). Not a great menu, but the pancakes are to die for. Service is average rooms are nice and very clean. Not as pricey as we expected but we've been told with the economy prices have gone down a lot. Maui is a bit too commercial for my taste, Kauai is just right for us quiet and rural.

Reviews.Title: “great R&R spot - comfortable & relaxing - poor valet/bellman service”
Reviews.Author: wisch22
Reviews.Content: front desk & housekeeping staff are personable, efficient & helpful valet (bellman, luggage 'helpers') are ** not ** friendly or helpful - with no one else there, 3 guys stood around gabbing until we decided to finally make multiple trips to unload our car - without the help of one of their carts - which we were told were only available for their use ... we were put in the position of having (**) to tip them for a service we didn't want or doing it ourselves after an exhausting travel day - not (*) the best 1st impression the room & amenities were quite lovely the happy hour was a waste of time -- just 50cents off the price of a LIGHT beer - no thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location, GREAT TIMES!”
Reviews.Author: pheenixdark
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my trip to Maui. My wife and I were on our honeymoon and were able to visit a lot of places, drive the road to Hana, jump off cliffs, hover over a volcano, and eat some pretty tasty dishes. Needless to say, after a long day of activities, it was relieving to know that we stayed in good hotel with a decent view (not great), and lots of space. My wife had the 1 bedroom suite on the "Garden side" of the hotel. It was facing a Star Mart and some beautiful hills. We would have loved seeing the water, but we did get enough of the ocean while we were there, so it's alright. We had no worries. The Pool is awesome, the hot tub is hot, the beach was easy to get to with some clear water. The squaking Parrots in the lobby were a good accessory to the place. Free wireless internet was only available in the lobby, not in the rooms, although the rooms did have a paid wired connection, but it was not worth spending money on. Staff was helpful and nice/courteous. The bartender we had one day at the pool kind of sucked (mojitos), so we only had 1 drink at the hotel (which we bought... the rest were home-made). The rooms were clean and cool (good a/c) and the microwave, fridge, and sink were a BIG help. We were able to save a lot of money on food (or spend our "saved" money on better meals). The furniture did seem out-of-date. It was wicker chairs with padded seats. Being a big guy, Im afraid to really "plop" down on wicker because it seems rickety to me. So, didn't like that, but the beds were comfy, and the bathrooms were spacious. The toilet had its own little room, so someone else could be in the bathroom at the same time as you with out disturbing you. Shower was decent sized and hot, but i wasn't feeling the shower head - not a big deal. All-in-all, my complaints were minimal and of preference, but everything was spectacular and worth while. Thanks KBC!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh-mazing”
Reviews.Author: jhshort77
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here May 12th-19th and it was awesome. The room was big and comfortable, the view was amazing, the staff was incredibly nice. It was very close to food, shopping, and attractions. The beach was calm and the water was clear. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Maui. Our stay was truly amazing and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful in every sense of the word.”
Reviews.Author: edaniel1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Club could not have been better. The resort is beautiful. Everything was kept clean and the surroundings were always pleasant. Take a day to enjoy the pool. It is absolutely marvelous...and the slide is for all ages...take advantage! Our room had a great view, and it wasn't even facing the pool or the ocean directly. Maui is beautiful no matter what direction your facing. Every room has a balcony and that is something that not all resorts can offer. The beach is clean and there is great snorkeling right out the front of the resort. In the evening, there was a sea turtle that poked his head up at sunset, right on cue. Use the resort's restaurant. It is priced well and the drinks are great. We ate our best meal our last night at the resort. Anyway, Maui is marvelous. Perfect in every way. And the Ka'anapali Beach Club is a tribute to those qualities. Stay here, you won't regret it. We hope to return many times. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: gabgab13
Reviews.Content: His parents own a timeshare here so we were luckily enough to get this a wedding present. This is a gorgeous time share. The grounds are beautiful and the location is great. It is in between the two major resort areas. So easy to get everywhere but we were on a nice quite beach. The rooms are huge and I mean huge. And it is beautifully decorated and the living room and bedroom are connected to the balcony. The view was great. We had a partial kitchen. It was missing an oven and stove but had everything we needed. If you needed a grill there were some grills next to the beach. The grounds our gorgeous with waterfalls and koi pond everywhere. It seems if you are a owner you do not need to pay for parking which was great. Everyone we met here was very helpful and friendly. The concierges there were very helpful when we needed help getting to places. The pool area was big, with a slide and waterfalls. Unlike other hotels I have been to it is hard getting a chair around the pool but this place has enough chairs for everyone, so I could always find a place to lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, but I think we'd go for a condo next time”
Reviews.Author: BraveTrout
Reviews.Content: We are RCI members and stayed at a Diamond Resort in Florida, did the timeshare presentation, and declined (as we have RCI). They offered us a "sampler" whereby we paid about 900 US to stay a week at the Kaanapali Beach Club anytime in the next 18 months. I called a week before we decided to go and had no problem getting in for the dates we wanted. The resort is in a great location, as others have noted. Kaanapali is my favorite place in Maui, touristy enough but not in the city. The resort has lovely grounds. The pool is nice. I was hesitant to hit the ocean as I thought it looked rough, but it was great and if you snorkel out by the buoys, there is decent visibility - my husband was out there most days for at least a couple of hours. The desk staff were friendly - not overly so - but certainly accomodating. We didn't have to pay for parking. I don't know if this applies to everyone or not. I certainly did miss pool side service for drinks, but it saved the temptation of having a nice blender drink so saved us some money! Room was good. We have been in better, but it was nice. Good size. Full fridge. Terrible view - our ocean view was a bit of ocean and looking down was a cheesy mini-golf course. Patio was really small. We didn't sit out there at all. And there was some sort of generator out there so it was really noisy all the time. That said, not every room can have a perfect view and we spent so little time in the room, who cares?! The room was musty & smelled yucky. We complained at the front desk and were advised that we needed to keep our A/C on all the time due to the moisture in the air. It makes sense, everything is damp all the time, but it was too bad. I would have loved to have the fresh air and breeze...but we turned our A/C back on...and once you are in the room for a bit the smell kind of fades away...we did buy some Febreeze and spray is daily and that helped some, but only temporarily. This is the one and only reason I say we would stay somewhere else, like a condo - it would be nice to be somewhere quiet so we could open our windows and night and hear the ocean, and then wake up to fresh smells... Definitely recommend the Farmers Market just a little bit north for produce - the grocery store across the street is really pricey. The gelato at Pizza Paradiso across the street is amazing! And you must go to CJ's - just a little south torwards Lahaina - for lunch & or dinner. Really yummy. It is just before the overpass in the little shopping village past the golf course on your right. Oh, finally, the timeshare presentation experience. We had to go as part of contract for the "sampler" we were a part of. The girl who met us was the most informative and friendly of any we have ever been to. She was not pushy in any way and was easy going. That is, until we said no. Then she just closed up. I understand it is hard to hide one's disappointment, but if she had held on about five minutes more I would have told you that this was the most reasonable timeshare presentation ever - ok - I still will - not painful in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but a few things would prevent staying there again”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoLishie
Reviews.Content: Daily parking fee and fee to use the internet in your room (plus no wifi) are the two things that would prevent us from staying here again or recommending this hotel. These days internet is an easy thing to provide via wifi and it feels like they are trying to squeeze more money out of you with both of these fees. Also beware of the timeshare harassment. If you want to stay in Ka'anapali, I'd recommend The Mahana, 2 doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful week in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiian_Hibiscus
Reviews.Content: Have been staying here for years. Just keep coming back. Some years are better than others. The staff including the valets, front desk, pool shack, and housekeeping are very friendly and helpful. The pool renovations are nice. Plenty of poolside lounge chairs. You can also rent cabana's to keep out of the sun. Pool area needs more umbrella's for the hot afternoon sun. Beach has some great snorkling when the water is calm. Short drive to many of Maui's beach beaches. Dining by the pool is adequate, nothing special. Rooms are in need of updating. The furniture is getting worn and doesnt smell very good. Carpets could use replacing as well. Hopefully Diamond resorts is going to keep updating this resort to keep attracting repeat stays and buyers. Love that the property is no smoking. Can't wait to return in the years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and busy”
Reviews.Author: MsGodmother
Reviews.Content: Resort rooms are very large and nice. Front desk was very helpful and was able to place our friends and us on the same floor. We had a view of the pool and ocean. Pool and grounds are well kept and nice. Only drawback is there is one waterfall that was on 24/7. Very loud. Overpowered the sound of the surf. It is part of a Koi pond and I am sure it is needed for the fish. There is a wonderful dive shop on site. It has finally made the Diamond web-site. You can dive and snorkel right from the resort beach area. They even do "reminders" in the hotel pool every day. We discovered on day 3 that if you have the balcony door or front door open at all the A/C is OFF. As we left the flip lock in the door to allow our friends easy access we got pretty warm. Valet was fast. Our friends had free parking so we did not have to pay the daily fee, just tips. Housekeeping for us was one time as we time share traded. They did a nice job. Our friends had a problem with housekeeping taking the extra coffee filters but the front desk came through and replaced. The key to this resort is "ask the front desk" they will take care of it.... There is a towel exchange - works well and you don't have to use your own beach towel at the resort. Restaurant on site is tasty and priced about $$. It is a resort on Maui. There is a grocery within walking distance - eggs were almost $6 for 12, it also sells beer, wine and hard liquor (a shock for us Texans). The resort does not have full kitchens, however we asked and they provided us with a large electric skillet, crock pot and a blender. Toaster, microwave, fridge, sink and dishwasher are room standard. There is a Costco near the airport, a stop there on the way is smart, especially for beer, wine and liquor - you may have to get the large one but it costs a lot less than the small one at the grocery. We, of course, attended the time share update, no hard sell at all. We already own in Lake Tahoe and are happy with what we have, we got the update and sat around for 1/2 hour as you must stay there in the presentation area for the full 90 minutes to get your gift. FYI do not allow that room key near your phone or a magnet it will deactivate. We saw several people with this problem but the front desk fixed happily each time we were there. I would like to see the property add some greenery and flowers to the flower boxes on the building - it is a big pink pyramid. There are some craft and plant vendors that come in and it is fun to see what they have to offer All in all a good vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place- great time-great value”
Reviews.Author: mjny91
Reviews.Content: Taking a family here which includes three kids couldn't have been a better choice. The grounds are large and the kids enjoyed roaming around. The feast by the sea could have been better, but in all fairness they had to have it indoors due to wind that night. I would assume it is much better outdoors. Location is perfect, and the pool and beach option was great. If you are taking children along, this place is very nice and is budget friendly.Very close to other beaches. I would recommend heading a few miles north to Napili bay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: marycray
Reviews.Content: Last year on our first trip to Maui we stayed at the Sheraton (at Black Rock); while there we purchased a "sampler package" for 8 nights for $900 at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. I'm pleased to say that our stay exceeded our expectations. Upon arrival we were upgraded from a mountain view to an ocean view suite. Actually, we looked over the mini golf course, and could see ocean, hotels and even a bit of the mountains. The room was great, very large, clean. There were tons of extra pillows and towels, and we did not run out of towels even with four of us, and there being room service only once during our stay. I thought I would miss daily room service, but I didn't. Having the partial kitchen (no stove or oven) was very helpful, as we were able to eat breakfasts in our room, which saved us several hundred dollars. The pool area was lovely, and everything always looked very clean. The beach is very nice, though I prefer the south end of Ka'anapali. There are a bunch of rocks as well as some reef just off the beach which, combined with the somewhat rough water, made it a poor choice for swimming. The red warning flag (meaning high surf/do not go in water) was flying our entire trip; I wonder if they ever change this? The beach was fine for wading/splashing or lounging. We only ate at the restaurant twice, and it was fine. My one complaint: the orange juice tasted canned. At a place like this I expect fresh, or at least refrigerated juice, but canned o.j. tastes nasty! We never did use the snack bar, as when we wanted to do so it was either closed or too busy; they need a better system or more help there. We used valet parking the entire trip, which was a good decision for us. My complaints are minor: the dining tablein the room was weird, looked dirty even though it wasn't, and could be replaced; there were "rubs" some places on the wallpaper; there was no fan in the toilet.. All in all, I'm happy to recommend this resort which, at about a third of the price we paid for the Sheraton, provided better dining, a far superior room, and an equally nice time in all respects other than the beach.

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMaui2009
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. It is not a Hyatt or Four Seasons and the price reflects this. If you want extreme pampering you will have to pay for it at a true 5 star location. We stayed in a deluxe ocean front room and it was the most fantastic view we have ever had. The balcony is a little narrow, but was adequate. The room was spacious, with the largest bathroom we have ever had. The room did have a musty odor that comes along with a tropical environment but was very clean. The onsite restaurant was adequate if you just didn't want to leave the resort for an evening, but is not recommended for much else. Take the 4 mile drive to Lahaina for scores of awesome restaurants. The pool was recently redone is in top shape. There is a separate kiddy pool with water slide, a hot tub and another small pool with waterfall which was really only useful for picture taking. The pool shack staff was friendly but there were a few rules we didn't like. No chase lounges (pool chairs) were allowed to be used on the beach. You could rent a lounge chair (with collapsible shade for those who do not like direct sun) for $25/day if you wanted to sit close to the beach. There was also a full service PADI dive shop on site. The beach is all sand and you can walk for over a mile and a half. For swimming, it is okay. There is coral which makes for good snorkeling, but not great for small children. Beware of charging incidental expenses to your room ( i.e. a drink at the pool bar or a coffee at the onsite snack bar) there was a $5.90 additional charge per use. Use cash or a credit card. We spent 10 days here and although there are a few little quirks, we loved it and will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff, clean, good in house restaurant”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousBean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon, so we were a little disappointed that they wouldn't upgrade us to an oceanside view. Instead we got the hillside view with construction below. That's my only complaint. We got a free bottle of champagne. Our hairdryer blew up on me the first day there, but someone came within about 20 minutes to install a new one. I really appreciated that. The concierge is extremely helpful with making your reservations for excursions, etc. Super clean! The food and drinks in the restaurant were delicious. I couldn't believe how huge our bathroom was. We had a king suite with the room and separate living room/kitchen. I thought the location was pretty ideal, although next time I think Id like to find something closer in Lahaina, although, I don't remember seeing any hotels right in town, so it was good enough. Great pool! Overall a wonderful experience. Recommendation: when booking, ask to be in a room not near the construction. It wasn't horribly noisy to the point of asking for a new room, but still woke me up some days earlier than I would have preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina is still a great place to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Lodaddy
Reviews.Content: I am just returning from our 10 day stay in Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Club near Lahaina. My wife & I & 2 boys age 13 & 10 had a great stay & I wanted to post some things about our trip as in planning my trips I have found these reviews to help me so here's hoping I can help someone in return. We left just before the tropical storm Felicia was scheduled to move closer & provide needed rain so our weather was picture perfect except for some extra wind in Kaanapali that was unusual but easily tolerated & helpful to stay cool versus hot sun pounding on us. We were reminded the very 1st day about Hawaii's sun when my wife forgot to sun block the boys & our youngest got red but we just coated his face from there on & made him wear a shirt. The KBC is being actively renovated & I saw some good improvements. New astro turf on the mini-golf, Pool was already redone, rooms were updated & still the best deal around for space in a condo. There is still lots of room for improvements as they still have only one restaurant open & space is wasted for the other restaurant areas. The Teen club had Wii, guitar hero & playstaion & my kids discovered this on the 3rd to last day so thankfully they did not waste Hawaii time on video games. Valet guys are great & worth the $13/day parking & a few extra dollars when they bring the car. Very conveinent. Beach is great & inner tubes & boogie boards available if desired. Snorkeling is fair but I did see 2 turtles in the water from land in the evening & morning crusing the beach 20 feet from shore. Everyone is extremely nice even the consierge girl when I informed her we had booked our excursions direct. On our tours we did Molikin on Quicksilver. THis boat is great if you desire shade as almost all areas are inside. WE have done this tour before & you eventually get beat down by the hot hawaii sun when you are in it for 6 hours. Snorkel at Honalua bay for free & it is not the 180 ft clarity like Molikini but you can get 3 feet from turtles if you stay calm & relaxed & not chase them as most people do. We did that exactly & it was quite a site until the others rushed in causing the turtle to dive & disappear in a cave. Facing the cove the right side is better but the left is also good especially the cliff wall area & caves in fron of them. We did Fleming beach w/boogie boards & it was a blast. I got sand everywhere on my body but is was worth it as my youngest learned to bb & he was very happy atfer riding a dozen or more waves. This park is great w/picnic facilities, shade, bathrms & showers. Only about 5-10 minutes from KBC as well. Honalua bay was extrordinary as we spent 2 morns hee snorkeling one side 1 day for about 1&1/2 hrs & then did the other side the next day. The beach is all rock & say hi to Jimmy the land owner next door. He likes to think he can tell everyone what to do but he is harmless & does live next door & I am sure he has had some vandals at his place. WE drove the road to Hana, each & everyone of the 57 one lane bridges & I forgot how beautiful that drive is. It has to be one of the top 10 scenic places in the world. The 7 sacred pools is great for fresh water swimming & hiking but no snorkeling. The park rangers will stop you from cliff jumping so get it in quick before they tell you no. Call the highway dept as they are currently building retaining wall nets during the week causing som long delays. We luckily went on the weekend when they donot work. You can also drive completely around coming out at the winery & again seeing some great extra views & the rugged eastern south coastline. This is an all day event so plan for you kids. We also spoofed our kids later in the week saying we were going to do the Road to Hana again only to surprise them w/a helicopter ride which is alos great but pricey. They best part was our kids reaction to doing the road again. Priceless. Haleakala is also great but we saved it for our last day & had limited time. I saw some people riding horseback out of it. Next time I will go into the volcano on horseback to save my old knees the hike. Lahaina & the banyon tree are still a beautiful calming place. THe pioneer n is fine for a reasonable 12$ fish lunch or dinner. Bj's pizza is great but takes 45 minutes. Put your name down & walk around. Worth it. Bubba gump shrimp is ok & very fast. Drinks at most other place all around are still only about $5 & I am from Dallas where drinks are running 7-9$ so I am ok w/$5. Shops are shops & it is still fun to eat & cruise the main drag & get an ice cream. Oh to be young & go spend a year or at least a summer there without a care. Last was our Lua at the SHeraton wher they have a Don Ho type guy that is good but I heard the Hyatt has a better Lua with more excitement & drums. Last is that Hawaii has gone smokeless. Our hotel was smoke free all resaturants are smoke free, dinner cruises are smoke free, Lua's are smoke free. ANything that has to do w/public dining is smoke free. While I am a casual smoker this was a littlebit of a nuisance but one I was not aware of. Aloha & we shall return. ML

Reviews.Title: “Can't Recommend This Place”
Reviews.Author: staborsky
Reviews.Content: Although I made a reservation one year in advance, the check-in staff gave my room away so someone else. So at check-in, the clerk gave me a "scenic view" room instead of the "partial ocean view" room that I had reserved and paid for in advance with points. After a lot of discussions and three days of frustration, they finally gave me a partial ocean view room. It's shocking that Diamond Resorts International treats owners in this manner. It's obvious that being a member in good standing at this resort means absoutely nothing. DRI is more interested in trying to woo "potential" owners than keeping its current owners happy.

Reviews.Title: “Old but decent”
Reviews.Author: Hoagies
Reviews.Content: First off, you cannot miss this resort. It is the only pink building in Maui and a pretty good size. We are owners and our ocean view suite suprised the heck out of us. It had up to date furnishings and quite spacious. Whenever we needed something, the staff were quick to assist. The actual building could use some renovations, but the grounds were well kept. The pool was newly renovated, of course, we have no idea what it was like previously. The resort's professional photographer was a nice amenity and because we attended the presentation, the shootings were free. The photographs we purchased were very nice, but on the pricey side; but we did receive them in 2 weeks. We had lunch down at their restaurant and it was alright. The valet staff were quite efficient and friendly. Housekeeping only came once while we were there for a week, we were disappointed with that. All in all, we would recommend this, even if the outside was not as up to date or as luxurious as the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “i would never stay here ever again highly do not recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: ashleehinkson
Reviews.Content: first let me say this, i am not a negative person. i never write reviews. it has to be really bad to complain. so let me first say that the only part that was good was the greeting into the hotel from there it went down hill. when we checked into the room it smelled musty. the furniture is old. we called for the room to get sprayed and no one came until 3 days later when we called again and let them know no one came the first time we called. first my boyfriend proposed to me the first day we were there and his sister went to the front desk to ask them for a bottle of champagne that she was going to buy and they said no no they would send one up. when we first checked in my boyfriend and his father let the front desk know that he was going to propose so this was not the first that they had heard about it. so we called a day later to tell them that we never received the bottle of wine. we told them we wanted to purchase one so it wasn't like we were just trying to get something for free but i know in my experience that a bottle of korbel is about $5. We did a presentation with the resort to look at a time share and we told them of this and they said it was unacceptable but yet still never did anything about it. we probably told them about 5 times and no one ever did anything about it. there were remotes missing to televisions in the rooms. the internet service down in the lobby that is free is horribly slow. overall i couuld not let this hotel get me down but i would never stay here. i have worked in customer service and this was really unacceptable service and just made the trip instead of smooth made there something to complain about which is not what we wanted for our engagement week. we did enjoy the time in hawaii and just stayed as far from the hotel as we possibly could. the marriot beach club is amazing and beautiful. i would recommend staying there ashlee hinkson

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort! Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: susymcalderon
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent down to the shuttle service. Our flight was delayed and I was concerned we weren't going to have transportation since we arrived very late. They were there and drove us safely to the Ka'anapali Beach Club. Everyone at front desk was very friendly and helpfull. The room view was excellent and so was the room. Very roomy, you can actually sleep 4 very comfortable. The Couch is a pull out bed. The bathroom was huge. The room was very clean. We loved the pool. It was never to crowded and for those who have kids there is a seperate pool with a slide. The hotel also host a movie night for kids. Everything is close by. There is a grocery store at walking distance right behind the hotel. It saved us some $$ since we purchase things we can have for breakfast. There is also a shuttle stop right ont he property that will take you for just $1.00 to Whalers Village, (where all the shops and restaurants are) once you are there there is another bus there that will take you also for $1.00 to dowtown Lahaina. We did not have to rent a car because everything was at walking distance or there was shuttle service. If you are not sure of which bus or shuttle to take, just ask the drivers they are more than happy to help you. The Ohana Grill at the Ka'anapali Beach Club had excellent service and the food was great. The beach is just a couple of steps away and you can actually walk along the beach to several other beaches and resorts. There is also a very CLEAN gym. Everyone there was friendly, and courteous. I don't see how any one can complain because their priority is excellent service so you go back. The lobby also serves a tropical punch every day for free. The lobby also displays beautiful tropical birds. I can't wait to go back. I had an awesome time and the Resort was excellent. Every room has a beautiful view. Check out my pictures

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: ben584
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to KBC for our, "Babymoon." Thinking that we were going to a secluded island paradise, I was initially a little disturbed by the Outback, B&N and Pizza Huts that were nearby, but all you have to do is drive North from the hotel, and you are quickly in the backcountry. My reccomendation would be anytime you are leaving the hotel for the valley or South Maui, to take the time and head North around West Maui, (as long as it's light out.) It's probably a little better than the Hana highway in my opinion, (mostly due to the fact we saw maybe 2 cars the entire length both times we did it,) with less waterfalls. The beach was great for snorkeling, not so great for swimming. Large waves and coral are the main problems, or benefits depending on what you want to do. The pool was nice, but generally occupied by screaming children. The rooms were large, comfortable, and newly remodeled. Don't judge KBC by what the exterior looks like, (ugly.) Also a lot of the travel sites haven't updated the room pics since they remodeled, so check with the hotel website. The trip was a success due to the value and Maui being one of the most beautiful places on Earth, but I would say if you are going for a romantic stay, try somewhere else, (on Maui.)

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: 2007honeymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBC for the first time in May 2009 (became "owners" in September 2007). It was fantastic. We stayed in one of the deluxe ocean view rooms, and loved it-- we got to watch the luau (on Wednesday night), people watch, catch sunrises and sunsets, and even had a few bird visits. The pool reopened our last day, they did a great job with it. Lots of chairs available, great poolside restaurant and bar... ask about Happy Hour! Yay! Also, the pool slide is fun! Not just for kids. Promise. Room was totally spotless, bed comfy, pillows fluffy, bathroom huge & awesome (good size shower, corner tub, 2 sinks, closet accessible from bathroom side and/or bedroom side). Smaller kitchen was ok, would rate that in the middle (fridge and microwave, dishwasher. You can request a skillet). The staff was pretty helpful when we had questions, and they were always friendly. Only downside: we had some technical difficulties with our A/C. Staff tried to help. We finally opted to just sleep with the lanai doors open and call it good (we were on 7th floor) Suggestions: rent your snorkel & ocean gear in town- we really like Boss Frog's or Snorkel Bob's. You'll get a better deal there than in the activities hut by the pool/beach.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Juleszee
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the KBC was good. The resort is average but provided us with just about everything we needed. The location is great, nice pool, good food by the pool and a decent bar. We had a mountain facing room so we spent many nights on the patio near the bar drinking the delicous lava flows watching the sunset. We also spotted several whales and dolphins from the beach out front. The rooms have been updated and are nice but it would have been better to take some of the large bathroom area and put a stackable washer/dryer in each unit. I did laundry once on our trip and it was a pain because the w/d are only on every other floor and there is only 1 of each. Also, if you book the 1 bedroom expecting kids/another couple to camp out on the pull out sofa be aware that there isn't much privacy in the main bedroom. The closet doors open from both sides between the bathroom/bedroom (see picture) which is a little odd. And they don't lock. The location is convenient to many things, the property is nice and overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need for Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: Socalreporter
Reviews.Content: We stayed as guests of a Diamond Resort owner. She booked us a deluxe ocean view suite. The unit is very comfortably arranged with ample seating in the living room, a small dining room table with four chairs, and a roomy bedroom with nice bedding on the king-size bed. The bathroom is very oversized with a separate tub and shower. The large bedroom closet opens into the bathroom also. Maid service only comes on the fourth and last day. This was a little inconvenient. Luckily there are lots of extra towels in the closet. The travel-size toiletries are not replenished unless you make the request. Since you can't fly with larger toiletries, I picked up items I needed at the nearby Long's Drugs. Our white water view was lovely, and the balcony had two chairs and two lounge chairs. We enjoyed watching the sunset on a lounge chair on the lawn adjacent to the beach. KBC has a luau that provided a nice ambience on one of the nights with live music and Hawaiian dancing. The luau is $60 a person if you want to actually participate in the meal, but otherwise, the music provides a very nice background to your sunset cocktails. On another night, they set up an outdoor movie. The pool is large and nicely landscaped with ample padded lounge chairs. The hot tub is tiny in relation to the rest of the facility. The beach is very nice, with a slightly steep incline into the water. Farther up the coast toward Napili/Kapalua, there are amazing snorkel locations and beautiful beaches to explore. Back towards downtown Lahaina, Black Rock is the place to be for snorkeling. There were a variety of stores and restaurants in close driving proximity. We hit Long's Drugs a couple of times, and it's attached to a small mall with a small food court that is a good change of pace if you want something quick to eat there or take back to your suite. Extra daily charges include parking ($13), Internet ($10), and room tax ($5). Although this property seeks to be an upscale 4-star resort, the slightly shabby condition of the furniture, the little smudges and single splatter of food in the microwave, and the mismatched toiletries with limited maid service do detract from this image.
