On the whole, though, it was an extremely comfortable spot with an almost perfect location. I would gladly stay at KBC again.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, don't expect perfection”
Reviews.Author: maddogmd11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Diamond Resort owners and decided to try this resort. The resort is easy to locate and about a 45 minute drive from the airport. If you are from a big city and use to a lot of light at night driving you will be amazed at how dark, dark is in the middle of the Pacific driving at night, but it is not a bad drive. The lobby is very nice and well maintianed. It's great to just sit in the large open air lobby and people watch. On friday night they have a large outside projector and screen in the pool area and show family friendly movies. I thought this was great and the kids seamed to really enjoy it. The hotel is not brand new but it is fairly well maintained. The grounds were very nice and it is directly on the beach. While we were there they closed the restaurant because of renovations. This was for safety as the restaurant was located right next to the pool area which was being resurfaced. I don't believe it is permanent as alluded to in other posts. Our room was great. We had a a "Deluxe Ocean Front" and the view was outstanding. Fortunately there was no rain at all while we were there and we spent time out on the balcony watching wind surfers, whales and sail boats while relaxing. The room was nicely furnished and the bed was comfortable. The bath was very large and all was very clean. There is not a full kitchen but this did not bother us. There is a large ridge and good size microwave. We didn't come to Maui to cook in the room. The location is great with easy access to all the west side of Maui has to offer. There are many other resorts in the area and we spent time at the Sheraton and Wyndham. The Wyndham has a great breakfast restaurant right on the beach and it is a great walk over. the Shara ton's black rock ceremony is free and not to be missed at sunset. The pool was being resurfaced during part of our stay so we used the beach instead. Once it is resurfaced I think it will be much improved. The setting is very nice and it is easy to keep an eye on kids. Overall there were not a large number of children when we were there and the pool was very pleasant while it was open. The one thing I didn't like was having to pay for parking, I think it was 11 bucks a day. If you take the "time share tour" you get a voucher you can use for parking costs. I didn't avail myself of this opportunity as $100 bucks is not enough to go through one of those! They have Valet parking at no EXTRA cost and the valet staff is first rate, very friendly and helpful. I spent so much time getting info from the valet staff about places to go and good local places to eat that I believe the 100 was well spent. Everything considered the hotel was not perfect. However we generally don't expect perfection. The resort was clean, the staff was very helpful, the room was very nice and frankly more then we expected. We have booked a return for next year so that should give you some idea of our approval.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GrandStud
Reviews.Content: Disappointed for a variety of reasons. First, pool was closed during our stay plus we were never informed by either our timeshare company (Interval International) or DiamondResorts before we checked in. Hotel clearly informed us at check-in about the pool closing but never attempted to compensate us or anyone else for the inconvenience. Parking is additional 12.50 a day fee. High speed internet is additional cost ($15 per day). During our stay, two of the four restaurants were closed which forced us off property most of the time. And to top off our vacation, we agreed to sit thru the timeshare pitch which was a big mistake. Our timeshare sales person was poorly trained, not very organized and just plane bad at what she does for a living. Overall you could say that we did not like Ka'anapali Beach Club and will never return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Resorts is RUINING this once-great resort!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler831
Reviews.Content: We have owned here since KBC was the Embassy Suites and have returned year after year. Before Diamond Resorts took over the management (two trips ago), we used to love this place, but Diamond is ruining our once-fabulous home away from home! We felt the difference the first time we walked into the lobby after Diamond took over. The warm ohana feel was gone, replaced by a cold corporate sales atmosphere. Our personable helpful concierges (who used to search out the best deals on the island and give great personal service) had been replaced by unknowledgeable Expedia employees who just wanted to sell us what they had to offer, and didn't care about our interests. The welcome breakfast, which used to be a lovely full buffet with fresh omelets, where we learned about the best activity "deals" on the island, had been replaced by dry rolls, coffee and a sales pitch. (No wonder hardly anyone attends these any more.) The owner discounts for booking through the concierge were gone. (Expedia had the nerve to tell us that the discounts had been incorporated into their regular prices, but a simple price comparison showed that this was a lie. How stupid do they think we are?) The free daily cocktail receptions, which used to be great community-building events, were gone. Daily trash pick up had been eliminated. (They told us that if our trash needed to go out, to put it in the atrium walkway outside our room for guests on all 12 floors to see. This is not only incredibly tacky, it is a violation of the house rules.) To decrease trust of Diamond even further, these reductions in service have been accompanied by HUGE increases in maintenance fees. Our fairly new (and perfectly fine) bedding had been replaced by creepy feeling POLYESTER SHEETS and ugly dark brown accents in this TROPICAL CLIMATE. Whose dumb idea was that?? Obviously not someone who had to actually sleep (or rather, toss, turn and sweat) on those sheets. (Oh, I see. The sheets have a diamond pattern woven into the fabric--all the better to be reminded who is responsible for these decisions.) Aside from the corporate atmosphere and horrible management decisions, the building and grounds are as nice as in the pre-Diamond days. Right on the beach with snorkeling (and turtles!) steps away. Whales out front, in season. Large suites with huge bathrooms, beautiful wooden furnishings. The kitchen appears limited, but we have found that the full fridge, microwave, electric skillet (obtained free from housekeeping) and beachside BBQs are adequate for a two-week stay without our eating out once. (Additional kitchen supplies--like a decent corkscrew, better knives, a blender, etc--would be nice.) For those who are confused by all the pink--this color is of historic significance. It is a particular pink that was used by Hawaiian royalty and is meant to honor traditional Hawaiian culture. I don't understand the recent comments about outdated furnishings. A few years ago, the rooms were all upgraded with granite counters, fresh paint, new drapes, new tile in kitchen and bath and elegant tropical furnishings. The gold carpet that one reviewer said looked like it was from the 80's was actually installed after 2005. The grounds and koi ponds are beautiful. They still have the torch lighting at sunset. The pool resurfacing in April 2009 was completed over a month early(!), so we who came in late May expecting no pool were pleasantly surprised to find it ready. I hope that Diamond Resorts straightens up their act and starts making policies for the benefit of the owners and guests, rather than for Diamond. Bring back our warm friendly resort! I've heard lots of owners complain mightily, which is a really bad sign. Also, Diamond has changed the sales policies so that I would NEVER buy from them. They do not sell deeded property like we purchased. (One can still buy it directly from owners.) Instead they sell interests in a trust controlled by--who else?--Diamond Resorts. Yeah, that's a name we can trust!

Reviews.Title: “good times!”
Reviews.Author: db0ne
Reviews.Content: We generally had a great time on Maui staying at this resort. First of all, the pool renovations didn't affect us at all - they seem to be resurfacing the pool itself, there was no noise, most work seemed to be done while we were out exploring during the day, and nothing other than the pool itself was closed (at the time - your experience may differ!). As we were leaving, they did close the outdoor patio portion of the restaurant/bar due to the actual painting of the pool surface which they expected to cause a bit of a mess, but from what I gathered this was only for a few days so if you're reading this you shouldn't catch it. We used an Interval International timeshare exchange for a room and were generally pleased with the result. A few notes, though: * Parking is $13/day, and Hawaii Occupancy Tax is $5/day. These are waived if you're a Diamond Resorts timeshare owner, but you have to pay them if you're doing an interval exchange. This is more than a little ridiculous - if you're exchanging with another owner you should get all the benefits that owner is exchanging. I didn't appreciate this obvious money grab by the resort. * Despite the pool renovations, I'd actually recommend staying on the pool side of the building, as there's an air conditioning unit or some kind of generator on the other side which makes quite a bit of noise - enough that we closed the doors at night. * The "Concierge" at the resort is actually an obviously for-profit separate entity, called "Expedia Local Experts". They are very helpful, but definitely interested in booking you as many activities as possible - I'm quite certain the staff there get a cut of absolutely everything they book, and I can't count how many times I was asked to do a timeshare presentation, I imagine they get a large payment for that. We enjoyed most of the activities, but at their insistence we booked a bus trip to Hana rather than driving it ourselves. They told us that day was the last day the road out of hana was open, but their information was wrong and the road had already closed - this meant rather than doing a loop of the island we drove twice along a nauseating 617 hairpin turn road, and missed many of the better sights. I don't recommend driving to hana as long as the road out is closed, and I am extremely displeased with expedia for their false information and failure to rectify the situation afterwards. * Happy hour is 5-7, but only 3 of their signature cocktails are available for $4 - Pina Colada, Mai Tai, and Lava Flow. The Lava Flow at this resort is the best I had on this trip (it's a strawberry/banana pina colada), it's made with a deliciously hefty amount of real bananas and real cream. The Mai Tai is deadly strong. We had one of each every day we were around during happy hour. Still, it's a downer that their other drinks aren't discounted as much - Suite Sunset is delicious as well. * Walking to the nearest out-of-resort beachside restaurant in Whalers Village does take over an hour, even if you're a young, energetic person you won't want to do it every day. Fish at beachside restaurants on Maui is generally very overpriced (especially with current CAD/USD exchange rates ... $34 turns into $42 and that seems like way too much for a fish that was caught locally. There's a couple plate lunch/dinner restaurants in Lahaina that serve good portions of mahi mahi and other catches for $8 though - look for the cheaper places outside of the area near the port where the cruise ships stop. Bussing to Whaler's village (for $2) is convenient, the stop is next to this resort, but last bus back is $8 so expect to cab back for $14-15 (with tip) a couple times. That's about it for the resort. We had some great experiences on Maui worth mentioning though! * Pacific Whale Foundation runs some awesome, and relatively cheap snorkelling trips - we did the Molokai and Lanai trip for about $65. It includes the equipment, breakfast and lunch (we had pastries, juice and coffee for breakfast, and bbq chicken breasts and hot dogs with pasta salad for lunch), and open bar on the boat after the second snorkelling trip with a good selection of drinks. I *highly* recommend this trip, it was informative and fun. * Surfing in Lahaina - also awesome. We went with a company that gives you a free rental after the 2 hour class. Unfortunately the surf was out that afternoon after the class, and we were leaving the next day so we couldn't make use of it (they offered to give us a free rental the next day instead as they were closing due to the lack of waves) - I recommend you call them directly and ask when they suggest you do it, and do it early in your trip because you WILL want to do it again. They guarantee you will stand (and they're not kidding, you will probably stand on your first try with their tips), and the waves in Lahaina are some of the best in the world to learn on. * Booking activities in Lahaina seems to be far cheaper than through anywhere else. We were bombarded with offers of helicopter rides for $100 per person (this was definitely legit, even though it was at least double through expedia - they were just trying to fill empty seats for the next day), and crazier things like Luaus for $15, etc... I suggest looking into this before booking with the "concierge".

Reviews.Title: “Wish we would have known”
Reviews.Author: Dirtbag35
Reviews.Content: We were not informed by Robert - email address [--] - that we would not have access to use the pool during our stay. We have a swimming 3.5 yr old, that was tough to swallow being the pool was the main purpose for choosing KBC. No one seemed to care while we were there too. This guy Robert has to stop conducting business like this and preying on unaware travelers.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it better when it was Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Selina100
Reviews.Content: Our stay was alright and we made the best of it. I agree that many things about this hotel has been taken away for cost reasons. The staff is nice and helpful, but we felt Embassy Suites had a sweeter deal going on than Diamond Resorts. One thing all readers should know is re-construction and updating of the pool started on April 12th and the pool will be closed we heard for months. As guests of owners we were only given made service once a week and yes we put our trash outside of the room too. Our trip was what we made of it and we were not going to focus on the things we didn't like, but on being together as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Rated #1 of 70 Hotels in Maui by the Trip Advisor Popularity Index”
Reviews.Author: LoveMaui1
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that this Resort is rated so high. We spend 2-6 weeks per year in Maui and have stayed at a number of different Resorts in the Kaanapali area. We don't care for the Kehei area, so we always stay on Kaanapali Beach. It is beautiful, uncrowded, convenient and warm and dry. We had our favorite place nearby, but when we first stayed at Kaanapali Beach Club, we were hooked. We have compared most all of the various resorts in the area as far as ammenities and price and this is where we now stay every time. Sure, some things have changed. They no longer have daily maid service, however if you need anything, they will gladly respond quickly! Most of the other timeshare resorts have done away with daily maid service too. If you need that, go stay at a hotel. These rooms are suites by the way. This Resort was originally the Embassy Resorts at Kaanapali Beach. All of the one bedrooms are suites regardless of view category. These suites are 820 square feet which is about twice the size of a hotel room. Most of the suites have been upgraded with new furnishings and flat screen tvs. Embassy Suites is no longer involved in this resort which is why the daily free happy hour is gone. Sure, it was great, but who else does it? It was supported by the sales department and now that the resort is 97% sold out, they discontinued it. Same reason they discontined the daily breakfast buffet. Thats just a fact. The good news is that this is an ocean front resort with large suites, kitchen, a wonderful staff and reasonable rates. All of the lounge chairs around the one acre pool have been replaced with nice padded lounges and there are many of them, so you don't have to race to the pool at 9:00 AM to save one. The pool is presently being resurfaced so beware, it will not be open again until approximately June 20th. Next to the pool is the Ohana Bar and Grill for food and drinks and they do have a reasonable happy hour from 3-5 daily. We are returning this October and looking forward very much to it and the new pool! Great location with golf, shopping nearby and snorkeling or diving right out front with your own resident sea turtles!

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Travelduo100
Reviews.Content: Quite a bit has changed, and almost all of it not good, since Diamond Resorts International bought the Ka'anapali Beach Club. We just returned after spending a week there, as we have done annually for the past 6 or 7 years. We were very disappointed with what is happening to this resort. Diamond has done away with most of the amenities that made the KBC a "gold crown" resort. Last year they stopped serving the breakfast buffet and did away with the daily afternoon complimentary cocktail reception. This year we found that the North Beach Grille (a nice, on-site restaurant) had been shuttered. The only "restaurant" at the resort is a fast-food snack bar that is real tacky. This year, as another cost savings measure to boost profits at the expense of the guests, they did away with the daily pick-up of the trash and garbage in the rooms. As a result of the maids not picking it up, frustrated guests merely bagged or boxed it up and threw it out into the hallways. We saw piles of trash that sometimes sat in the halls for more than 24 hours. To compound our disappointment, we encountered a flea infestation in our room. After finding and killing several of the critters, we informed the front desk. We were advised that the room would be "treated" ASAP. The ball was dropped, and this never happened. We continued finding several more fleas during our stay. Upon returning home, I wrote a letter to Diamond's CEO. I got a phone call from an employee who, after calling again once she completed her "investigation", advised me that what we found were not fleas, but more likely, "seasonal fruit flies!" This was a total insult to me intelligence as I'm 65 years old and I know big, ugly fleas when I see them!!!! It's a real shame what Diamond is doing to this once fine resort. I truly cannot give it anywhere near as high a rating as previous reviewers have. FYI: The only swimming pool will be closed for repairs from April 20, 2009 until June 20, 2009, that is if all goes as scheduled.

Reviews.Title: “KBC is my favorite home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: katodelot10
Reviews.Content: I would just like to Thank the Staff @ KBC for yet another fabulous time !! Jessica Ocegueda our vacation and sales consultant is professional,knowledgeable and extremely personable.She spent time with us well beyond her job description... I'm so pleased with my purchase!! She is a credit to the KBC and Diamond Resorts Sales Team!!! Sherry Straka our Concierge/Activity Consultant kept us busy...She also went out of her way to make our stay on Maui fabulous. She has a bubbly personality and is an asset to KBC. Julie and Her Son Joe who spend so much of their time coming and going with the birds who grace our lobby areas.They touch the hearts of every guest young and old with their feathered friends. I especially enjoyed the white tiger yoga and the aquatic exercise program which were the highlight of my trip this year.The instructors were awesome!! Please don't ever cut this program!!! KBC is also walking distance to an array of shopping and eateries or just grab the trolley or bus if going down to Lahaina. The staff makes KBC and KBC is my favorite home away from home!!! I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Room was great; check-in was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: mumsie2u
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our daughter and her family. Since we were coming to KBC from another hotel, they arrived at 1:30PM which is before the 4PM check-in time. They notified the front desk that they were there and asked if their room might be ready. "No, but we'll call your cell phone when it is ready." When you get that reply, you sort of assume that they'll notify housekeeping to get room # whatever ready because the guests are on property. This does NOT happen at KBC. At 4PM, they were given the key to the room but when they went up to the room, they found out that the maid had not yet cleaned the room. In fact, she didn't finish cleaning the room until 5:30PM. Not good! We had an extra night at our other hotel so we didn't get to KBC until the next morning. Since we'd planned an early morning snorkel at Black Rock, we arrived at KBC at 8:30AM and let the front desk know we were on property and could they call us when our room was ready. "Oh yes." Usual response. We told them what had happened to our daughter's family the previous day and they assured us that this would not happen again. Though we kept checking at the front desk all afternoon, we were always told that our room was not ready. Finally, when we went up at 3:45PM, they said the room was ready. It seems that there is not communication between their housekeeping department and the front desk. It is such an easy problem to fix and would sure make a big difference in the attitude of the guests if communication did exist. Our room, and our daughter's were just great. They had a "recently renovated" room (floors 2, 3 and 10 are "recently renovated") with the flat screen TV's and newer furniture and we had an older "renovated room without the flat screen TV's. It was fine. The beds and bedding in both rooms were new and in good condition and comfortable. I agree with a previous reviewer that the kitchen utinsels are insufficient. We had two formerly sharp knives that guests had used as screw drivers or something. It would be nice if they'd put an electric skillet in all rooms but we made do with just the microwave, refrigerator, and dishwasher. There is 1 coin-op washer and dryer on all even numbered floors. They worked fine. Ice is on the odd numbered floors. The pool was fine but we understand it is about to be shut down for a month to renovate that plus the kiddie slide.. We never had a problem finding available chairs or towels. Though the KBC does have a ridiculous "towel pass." When you check in you are given one towel pass per guest which you are supposed to give to the towel hut by the pool in exchange for a towel. You are told there will be a $50 charge per towel if you don't turn in the proper number of towels. This isn't really true and is a dumb way to try to control towel theft. I am not sure who would want to steal even one old, worn out pink towel. One amenity we've used before is their showers in the men's and women's restrooms on the lower level for after you've checked out and are waiting for a nighttime flight. Though the men's shower was "out of order", the women's was great. They even provide a nice changing room and a hair dryer. Parking in the self-park garage is excellent. There is no need to do valet parking. Overall, this hotel is slightly above average and a good benefit for families with kids because of the size of the rooms. We are owners so we were not bombarded for the timeshare presentation. When we bought, there was no pressure. They tried to pressure our daughter to view a sales presentation but she and her husband were very firm that they did not want to do it so they were left alone. We ate at the Ohana Grill on property a couple of times and had good service and the food was fine and not as expensive as other hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “KBC - Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: zzcrum
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui several times but always stayed on Kaanapali Beach proper (closer to Whaler's Village) or Kaapalua. Overall, this resort and location were a disappontment. First the good points - nice beach and pool area. Decent restaurant for lunch. Spacious bedroom and bathroom. What we didn't like - the balcony is so narrow it is basically useless. We had just spent a week on Kauai, where we returned to our suite each day and drank wine from the balcony as we watched the sun set. Most of the rooms at KBC have no view of the sun setting and the small balcony makes the rooms with a view less enjoyable. In fact, my husband and I took wine down to the beach area on two evenings and watched the sun set. On each occasion, we looked back at the hotel and no one was on the balcony enjoying the beautiful sunset. Why? You would have to stand the entire time. There is only one restaurant. We were told the nicer restaurant closed this past year due to lack of use (revenue did not cover costs to keep it running). Except for the good pizza place in the strip mall across the street, you need to drive everywhere for dinner. Since we had a car, it was not a big inconvenience, but quite different from staying in the middle of Kaanapli or Kaapalua. In the evenings on previous trips, we would take nice strolls along the beach or in the resort area. However, KBC is in a very crowded area and there is no feel of Hawaii when you are walking around the resort. The pool area is nice, but the slide is for children only and the hot tub was co-opted by parents and their small children while we were there. No matter what time we went to the pool, there were always a few parents and kids in the hot tub. To be honest, I don't feel comfortable in the same hot tob with kids in diapers. Probably would feel differently if the children were mine, but they weren't. Don't bother making any activity arrangements through the concierge. There is no discount and it takes a long time. We bought two excursions through them. The first, a Lanai Golf trip had no flexibility in dates whatsoever, which was problematic when we had 40 hour gusts that morning. However, if we had scheduled directly with the trip provider, we could have switched to another day for no fee, as long as they had availability. The second excursion was to a magic show. Although the show was fine, it took two days and three trips to the concierge desk to get our tickets. Again, no discount, so we could have just booked directly with the show. Fianlly, there is a little too much pressure to buy a timeshare. I finally had to say - We are on vacation, don't call us anymore. This resort is showing its age. Although they are fixing up the rooms, the common areas are worn looking and don't have that Hawaiian feel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation and friendly staff but outdated”
Reviews.Author: Serenity_9
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday March 10th from a 10-day stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. The staff was friendly, the rooms were cleaned every day, the pool area was clean, and the beach area, although small in front of the hotel it was amazing to watch the whales from our room, from the pool area and from the beach. You can find so much to do on the island. The staff was very accommodating and helping us to plan activities that were very reasonable in price. We enjoyed our voucher every morning for breakfast and the food was good. They have a great burger that my husband and I had for three meals (we split it) - The California Burger. The only negative was the timeshare presentation we did. We said right off that we owned a timeshare property in Cabo San Lucas and would not be interested in one at this resort. We decided that we would never do another one again after this one. Even after we told them that my husband has prostate cancer and would be having surgery soon and that I had just been laid off of my job they still pursued. We liked staying at the hotel except the furniture and uncomfortable was very outdated and the pillows were horrible. I brought my own luckily. We will go back to Maui and we would consider staying at this hotel again. Maybe the next time they will have updated the furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach in fantastic area”
Reviews.Author: travelhunterOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Kaanapali Beach Club timeshare in January/09 and here are the points of interest as follows: The room was a 1 bedroom with part kitchen which if you are used to timeshares you would find very lacking. There wasn't even a kettle to boil water for tea. I had to ask for an electric frypan, since they neither had a stove nor oven.That said I felt that everything else about the room, furniture and the whole building was of very good quality, modern and I very few complaints. The only thing was the very small balcony. You could not lay in the sun there but really, you were on one of the most beautiful beaches in Maui and if you prefered the pool, there were always lots of lounge chairs to be had. The pool itself was well kept and large. The grounds were kept to perfection . Maui itself of course has lots to do and is beauty everywhere you look. I would definitely recommend it to anyone, unless you wish to cook a lot in your room, then maybe look somewhere else. ET

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected....”
Reviews.Author: CAIMARad
Reviews.Content: We just got back from one week visit to Maui and stayed at KBC. I generally do not write reviews of our trips or resorts. However, we had an unexpected great time at the hotel, I thought I would share some of our experiences and notes. I read most of the recent reviews on tripadvisor about KBC before I left. I got a good idea of the hotel as well as some of the perks. We've been to Maui multiple times, but this was our first time at KBC. Our trip was truly enjoyable and relaxing. We were one of the unfortunate travelers to Maui who had no rental car. I booked with Advantage Rental Car 6 months before our trip. However, 2 days before we left to the island I got an e-mail from them stating they closed shop and thus, I have no rental car for the week. I spent 48 hours on the phone as well as the internet looking for a car. There were literally no cars available to rent. We had to make it to the whole week at the resort without a car. We certainly didn't want not having a car ruin our trip. On the contrary, our trip was just fine. KBC is a resort that one can stay for the week and not go nuts. We had an ocean front 1-BR room on the second floor (room #210). Not only were we able to see beautiful sunsets from our balcony, but also countless whales jumping out of the water everyday. Both experiences were magical. We couldn't have asked for a better room. Every night, we had the ocean waves put us to sleep. Every morning, we had the beautiful blue skies wake us up. As stated in the previous reviews, our 1-BR room was huge, plenty big for the four of us (me, my wife, and our two sons, ages 4 and 6). The bathroom was gigantic. Everything was updated. My sons watched cartoons on the flatscreen tv in the livingroom and we watched movies on our flatscreen tv in our bedroom. We cooked breakfast in our kitchen every morning. We asked for a hot skillet. We cooked pancakes, eggs, french toasts, etc in the mornings. For the most part, lunch and dinner we ate at the hotel's restaurant. The food at the hotel restaurant was amazing. Not only was it a great deal (especially for the kids at $2 for a cheeseburger and fries, hotdog and fries, pizza, etc), but the food was very good. We ordered the BBQ ribs four nights in a row. The meat was so tender and soft, it just fell off the bone. The sauce was very tasty. In fact, it was better than the ones at Kimos. We had lunch at Kimos one day and compared the two. KBC won hands down. People said Kimo's was an awesome place to see sunset. We thought take-out food from the hotel restaurant and eating in our room with the view was truly amazing and to die for. In fact, we did this several times and it was much better than any restaurant in Maui. The restaurant's prices were cheaper than most good restaurants in Lahaina. The resort also had minature golf where we spent an enjoyable afternoon playing with the kids. However, the best time was spent on the beach. The beach was right outside the hotel and next to the swimming pool. We would make sandcastles and then to the pool and hottub. We thought it was very nice having our own beach and pool next to each other, it was truly easy and pleasant. On this trip, we spent time at the Westin resort hotel as well as Kaanapali Beach Hotel pools with our friends who were there at the same time. The Westin has a great pool, but their single small hottub was for adults only. Kaanapali Beach Hotel didn't have a hottub. Needless to say, my boys enjoyed KBC pools/hottub/beach much better (including our friends). The workout facilities were free. It had both weights and aerobic machines. We never had to wait for anything. Parking was free to the timeshare owners. In fact, we heard it was free for both valet as well as self-parking. Of course, we didn't experience it first hand since we had no rental car. Within a short 5 minute walk was a supermarket. The prices in the supermarket were better than the Safeway in Lahaina. We bought a gallon of milk for $5 as well as food and drinks for the whole week. The refrigirator in our room was plenty big. We could store a whole week's of food and drinks without any problems. We also had washer and dryer down the hall to do laundry in the middle of the week. All in all, we were very happy with KBC. The place, views, and facilities were perfect for us. We couldn't have asked for anything more in a luxury hotel. We're looking forward in going back to Maui and KBC, but next time, with a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Pink”
Reviews.Author: Grotbo
Reviews.Content: We got the scenic room, meaning non ocean view, on the cheap for one week in January 2009. It was via an ad on redweek.com for $929 for the week. This ad led me to Dreamtravel which seems to be just Tonya Williams. I did the payments via Pay Pal to her well before trip and she returned confirmation numbers that had no relation to any travel system you could verify. It was only two weeks before we arrived that we actually got a confirmation number for the timeshare plus itself. So in the end it all worked out. On top of this was $13 for parking and $5 tax per night. So in end it worked out to $150 per night. For the price of a one bedroom it is hard to complain, but if I was paying a larger amount or traded in an expensive resort to this place I would have been disappointed. Good: Grills are nice although sometimes difficult to light. Get cooking utensils from front desk. Free water is available pool side and various locations. Bathroom is huge and has good layout with two separate sinks (one vanity and one pedestal). Rice cooker is available from housekeeping for no extra charge. Tons of towels provided for in the room. Free scuba lesson available in pool. Issues: Pink is overwhelming. At least rooms are neutral colors. Kitchen is lacking a cook top. Internet charge is $10 per day. From balcony I was able to pick up a free one, although slow. Rooms are very dated. Looked like carpet from 80s. Bed was not comfortable. Pool has small water slide with paint chipping on it. Main pool has lots of cracks and rough surface on bottom. Three sets of two elevators were present, but this is not enough for size. Laundry is only one per floor ($1.50 wash / $1.25 dryer) and is busy often. The main Kaanapali walkway only comes up to Westin timeshares. Thus you have to walk on beach for first 1/3 mile. We made it to Whaler's village in an hour walk, but not something to do in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Pink Beach Club outdated”
Reviews.Author: sallylyn77
Reviews.Content: I had read several positive reviews of this hotel/condo and booked using a discount code from Travelzoo.com. The property looks wonderful on the Diamond Resorts' website, however, the rooms and furnishings were outdated. We had a one-bedroom ocean view and the room was pretty large, as was the spacious and newly updated bathroom. We were unable to cook anything in the room because it did NOT have a stove or oven, simply a full-size refridgerator, dishwasher and microwave. The pool area was nice and the hotel is directly on the beach with good swimming. The hotel was centrally located, just a few minutes north of Ka'anapali Beach proper and Old Town Lahaina. We also had difficulties checking in early. We arrived at 1pm and tried to check in, only to be told our room was not ready yet and that they would call us when it was ready and that they guaranteed it would be ready by 4pm. We went and ate lunch, came back and the room was still not ready. Since it was raining that day and we had our luggage in a jeep, we really couldn't go shopping or anything so we literally sat in the lobby for hours waiting on our room to be ready, which it finally was at 3:55pm. The hotel does not have daily maid service, only twice weekly. We put the "Towels Please" on our door, but no one ever brought towels for 2 days. We finally had to call to have them run some up. Like I said, the location was good, the room was big, but outdated. I wish I had spent the extra money to stay in a nicer property to enjoy the beauty of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Another good review”
Reviews.Author: randomdude
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Kaanapali Beach Club. I am an owner there. This was our third time at this hotel. Overall this is a good place for both families and younger adults. The families with kids (like me) all congragate at one end of the huge pool and the 20 somethings all hang out at the bar end of the pool. It's a good arrangement. Instead of me writing a novel, go read the reviews of beeeechbum and/or purduegolf1 posters. I agree with their comments, even though I'm an Illinois alum and I hate to agree with a purdue guy. Only other thing I can add is that Star market (2 blocks away) has great location and good variety (full size grocery store), but the prices are high. Gallon of skim: Star Market= $7.50, WalMart near the airport= $4.75. These are real prices I paid the week of Jan 10-17, 2009. This is a very good 4/5 place. DRI needs to do a some improvements, but it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: coquifpr
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Maui and stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. The hotel is wonderful for so many reasons: - Big and nice swimming pool for adults - Very nice kids pool with slide - Great beach with direct access - Great location close to many other resorts - Close to Lahaina town (5 minutes drive) which is very nice to go to at any time of the day with many shops and restaurants - Close to Whalers village( high-end shopping and nice restaurants and a 1 mile boardwalk on the beach) - many small shops across the street from the hotel (Subway, Java jazz, a 24 hour supermarket...) - The hotel restaurant is very casual with good food and affordable prices - They have a GREAT kids menu! for all the families who have kids, this hotel is VERY kids friendly. the items on the menu are all 2$ each! and the portions were big - The rooms are soooooo spacious! also great for families. we had a masterbedroom, living room, dining table and a kitchinette with a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, toaster, utensils, plates, cups... the houskeeping lady would clean our kitchen daily, put the dishes and everything in the dishwasher and turn it on, we would come to the suite and everything would be clean. - We had two plasma tvs in the room, iphone docks, Yamaha stereo/dvd system - Barbecue area, which was great! we went to Costco the first day and got chicken and meat and did barbecue 4 times - There are many activites at the hotel: Karaoke night, movie night, scuba diving lessons, star gazing.... -The guest services desk was great! the staff were very friendly, you should go there one day and book everything trough them, they actually give you lower prices and they make the reservations for you, which was great! - The staff were very friendly and helpful! - The parking is the same price ($13) daily for self parking or valet! - If you want to take the timeshare presentation, you get $200 for activities or dining. we didn't want to take it at the beginning, but then we saw all the people taking it, so we did, and we used the $200 for a 5 hours snorkling trip on Quicksilver, wich was great! it you want to go snorkling this is the best! it was 5 hours of non stop entertainment, fun and good food I would love to go back to Maui and stay at the same hotel, because honestly I couldn't ask for anything more for me and my family

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Kaanapali!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaShaka
Reviews.Content: This resort was in our timeshare listing (RCI) and we were able to snag it for our 35th wedding anniversary. They kindly upgraded us from a garden view (view of Maui mtns) to ocean view for no extra charge, which was overlooking construction (see pictures another poster posted), the pool, and the beach. The construction noise began at 7am, which was bothersome to me, a light sleeper, but never woke my husband up. The waterfalls on the property do "sound-proof" some of the construction noise. - The landscaping on this property is beautiful; the rooms are suites, totally remodeled, very comfortable. The lanai's are spacious. The whole resort is clean and we found all the employees to be efficient and friendly. (It is no longer owned by Sunterra, but Diamond Resorts, another time-share agency, who was generous with their "time-share-presentation" gifts: a $200 value, which my husband used to fly over the volcano on the Big Island.) [Caveat: time share presentations are rarely their 90 minute promise...ours was 3 hours...but that had nothing to do w/ the actual property, so just be forewarned if you choose to go the time-share-presentation route.] - The in-house gift-shop called Lamont's carries a lot of necessities and gifts. You can self-park or valet park, but either way, it's $15/night. There's no open parking at this resort. (A nuisance BUT you also don't see cars anywhere on the property, which gives it a more relaxed resort feel.) - If the noise from the pool or construction is a problem, ask for a room on the other side...they are scenic too, but you will not see a sunset. I'm guessing the construction of the property nearby will be done w/n the next 6 months, so should quiet down by summer '09, but check into that before booking. - The suites have a partial kitchen: a microwave, but NO oven; full-sized refrigerator; full-size dishwasher. There is a grocery store, small coffee shop, gift-shops w/n a 5 minute walk, which was very convenient; rental car companies w/n a few blocks. - Snorkeling is good at the resort's beach..but head for Honolua Bay (about 15 minutes north) for the best, though! - This resort is family-friendly...the kids will love it as much as you do!

Reviews.Title: “Great water location, rooms need help!”
Reviews.Author: cubirop
Reviews.Content: When we first got to our room it smelled like urine. I called the front desk and they told me someone would be up to help address the problem. 1 hour went by with no call or knock so we went down to get dinnner. On the way down I stopped by the front desk and they said someone was going to come to our room. Whe we arrived back at our room 2 hours later there was no show and I called the front desk again. I was told they were sending up house keeping. After waiting another hour and no housekeeping or calls I went down to the front desk again. The problem was never resolved, luckily for me my brother was the one sleeping in the living room. On new years I went to the bar at 9:50pm and was told that I could not get a drink because the bar was closed, which it actually doesn't close until 10:00pm. Then I saw them serve other people 15 miutes later on the other side of the bar. The wireless internet didn't work in my room, and was sparatic in the lobby. I had to pay 10$ a day to have interet in my room. The beach and pool are the highlight of this resort. It's steps away from the ocean. This is a family resort great for kids. Don't expect much for the staff or room quality. The best thing about this resort was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring with a few upsides”
Reviews.Author: KranJams
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed here on three separate occasions under three different brands and its apparent the current owners are not investing much in service or infrastructure. On the upside, rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable (renovated under the previous owners). Beyond the rooms, though, there really isn't a lot of positive to say. Service is almost nonexistent and unaccommodating (for example despite requests starting several months in advance and arriving exactly at the 4 pm check in time, we were lectured we should have requested "connecting" rooms rather than "adjoining" rooms; only the general manager was able to help us). Only half the elevators worked and not once did we see anyone repairing them. Garbage put outside the door stayed uncollected for almost 36 hours. Only two of the four outdoor barbecues worked. Plus they nickel and dime you for everything (e.g., $8/hour for a boogie board or snorkeling gear). PS - definitely bring your reef shoes for the beach, which is very rocky.

Reviews.Title: “3 visits- all great”
Reviews.Author: beeeechbum
Reviews.Content: My parents have a timeshare through Diamond (used to be Sunterra) and I have vacationed at this resort 3 times. Once for my honeymoon in 2005, once as a family trip with my parents and grandparents in 2006, and the most recent was last October just with a friend for my birthday. I am going again in March 2009. The hotel: The hotel is a few minutes north of the main beach in Ka'anapali on it's own little beach with 2 other hotels, so you can lay out and it's not super crowded. It's big and pink which is good because it looks distinctly different from the other hotels, and you can easily spot it on the way. The grounds are beautiful and it sits right in the sand. There are two restaurants, but I have only eaten at the bar/grill which is poolside and ocean front. The food is okay, they have a good pulled pork quesadilla... There used to be a happy hour with free drinks and a guy singing/playing guitar 4-6, but that is no more. Now they have drink specials. All of the staff at the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. We had one problem and I will tell more about that in the rooms, but it was handled well. There are 3 banks of elevators, and sometimes there is a wait for one, but the others are close by, so you can just walk over to another one if yours is taking too long. I did not go to the timeshare presentation myself, but my parents did. I have been to the presentation in Avila Beach, CA and my parents said that the representative was a little snippy when they asked about incentives for signing (they had previously been given roundtrip plane tickets when signing) and she basically told them that they weren't hurting for business there so they didn't need to offer such incentives. However, we got a few free luau tickets because they went on the tour, so it was worth it for us. Other than that, I've had NO bad experiences with staff. The rooms: The 1 bedrooms are very spacious. The bathrooms are huge with a stand-up shower and a big round tub- not jacuzzi, but the same shape. I think it's like a roman tub? And there are 2 sinks in the bathroom, so you're not fighting for the sink or mirror while getting ready. The bedroom and living room are also large. There is a sleeper sofa in the living room and a tv/dvdplayer/cd player. The kitchenette has a full-sized fridge/freezer, a microwave, dishwasher, sink & dishes. Some of the rooms have toasters/blenders/electric griddles, but if your room doesn't, you can call down to the front desk and they will send one right up. I believe that the 2 bedroom units also come with a range. There is a balcony that can be accessed from doors in the bedroom or the living room. If you are getting an "ocean view" room, I recommend requesting a room on the pool side. The view is a little nicer. Both sides have an ocean view, but if you are on the non-pool side, you can see the dumpsters and stuff... On one of my trips, we had a "deluxe ocean view" room. Luckily, I had been there before and stayed in an ocean view because our "deluxe" was in exactly the same spot as our regular ocean view room. We booked the deluxe thinking it would be one of the rooms in the very front with an unrestricted full ocean view right over the sand. We went to the front desk to complain, and the manager was very nice and gave us a $100 or $150 (I can't remember) credit toward our bill so we could use it toward the bar/restaurant or parking or whatever. Apparently there are some rooms that are kind of gray areas and can be booked as either ocean view or deluxe ocean view. So he gave us a map of the hotel and showed us which rooms we would want to request a couple of weeks before our stay. So I suggest calling and requesting a room in the front if you are getting a deluxe ocean view 2-3 weeks prior to your arrival date. Nearby: A short walk and across the street, there is a small shopping center with Pizza Paradiso which is delicious. There is also a little Mexican restaurant/bar and a Star supermarket as well as some other things. I suggest going to Costco instead. It is on the way to the hotel from the airport and you can buy your liquor/beer/snacks there. They have a different selection than the mainland Costcos I've been to. They have Malibu rum and Mai Tai mix and stuff. They also have a lot of macadamia nut stuff, so you can get all of your coworkers chocolate covered macadamia nuts there =) There is a bus stop next to the hotel that will take you to Whaler's Village which is a shopping center adjacent to the main Ka'anapali beach that has Coach, Louis Vuitton, Honolua, etc and they have the Hula Grill which has a barefoot bar and Leilani's restaurant. The bus will also take you to Lahaina. The Hard Rock in Lahaina has an awesome view as well as some of the other restaurants, but my favorite was a restaurant called Lahaina Store Grille & Oyster bar. They have rooftop dining and you can go around sun down and get a couple of drinks while watching the spectacular sunset. There isn't really anywhere right next to the hotel to go out at night except for the one bar, but we were there for Halloween last year and took the bus to Lahaina and a cab back and the cab was like $20 for 4 people from Lahaina to the hotel- not bad. Maui: I would not go to Maui without a rental car. The hotel is about a 35 minute drive from the airport and if you don't have a car, you can't drive up to Hana and other things that are fun to do. Hana is definitely a must and you can buy a CD guide at pretty much any grocery or liquor store or ABC store. I have been to Hana with and without the CD and the CD is pretty helpful. It tells you about certain places to stop that you wouldn't otherwise know about. If you are wanting to snorkel, I say go off the shore and snorkel around Black Rock at the main beach in Ka'anapali. You don't need to pay to go out to Molokini. There is better stuff around that rock. There are tons of fish and even sea turtles if you go a little further out. The Maui Ocean Center is also full of interesting stuff including a sea turtle tank and a hammerhead shark tank. There are some cool things in Wailea including the Tommy Bahama bar which has some really funny drinks. I got a s'more martini that actually had a toasted marshmallow in it lol. Beware of 5:00 traffic when driving around the island because it SUCKS. You can't pass and you can get stuck on that little 2 lane highway for awhile. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is all around a great place to stay in a great location. It's not 5 star, but I would say 4 star. If you are looking for 5 star, you will be disappointed. Most people don't go to Hawaii for the room anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious, Wonderful OceanView, Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Purduegolf1
Reviews.Content: As an owner who bought at KBC 4 years ago, my husband and i went back for our 5th anniversary. I had heard bad things in the Forums about some of the changes...no more complimentary happy hour or breakfast buffet...and these are true, but we were given reasons that seemed understandable...i will share later what they were. Pulling into Kaanapali, you can't miss the tall, pink building. A lot of people complain about the color inside and out, but it doesn't bother me at all. I live in Florida and i just attribute the color to being tropical. We pulled into valet around 4:15 and check-in was easy. Everyone was very nice. Went up to room #616 which is an oceanview and it was perfect. Since we have been there before, my husband and i knew what to expect. This time, we had 2 friends with us and they were amazed. The big family room, huge bathroom and wonderful view of the ocean and the miniature putting green. The kitchen does not have an oven or stove, but we called down to the desk for an electric skillet and it was there in less than 5 minutes. This definitely came in handy. As did the full size fridge. The furnishings were the same that i remember. Not by any means old or worn out. Tommy Bahama style. Apparently, some of the rooms have been upgraded with flat screen tvs, but we didn't get one. But it didn't matter. Our tv was just fine. Anyways, we didn't come to Maui to sit in our room. Our bed was very comfy, the pillow was almost too fluffy for me. Our friends said the pull out couch was fine--afterall it was free for them!! We attended the welcome presentation the next morning in the downstairs lobby and we were upset to see there wasn't any hot food this time, like the last one. Only muffins and danishs--and they weren't very good. This gave us a great chance to book some activities and set up our required presentation. We also learned about a workout program that was available everyday of the week for just $50 and it included yoga, pilates, and a pool class. I only got to take advantage of 2 days, 1 class the first day on the front lawn doing yoga and then 3 classes a couple days later--this one included the water workout class which was my favorite. Wanted to take advantage of it more, but hey, vacation plans got in the way. Still worth it for only $50. Got to sit by the pool a couple of days. Enjoyed that a lot. Never had a problem getting 2 or 4 chairs in a row the whole stay. The pool is a little old, but i understand they are going to be re-doing it April-June. Not really neccessary, but i'm sure it will look fantastic when done. Towels were never a problem, just bring your towel ticket with you and trade it out. The hot tub was wonderful. The waterfalls are pretty to look at and the waterslide looked like a lot of fun for the kids. Never got to sit on the beach, but we took portraits on the sand and it was very soft and nice. Not very wide, but enough room for whatever. From our room view this time around, we noticed 4 grills down by the beach that we didn't even know where there--or even if they were in the past. We took advantage of them one night and it worked out great. Loaded up the food onto plates, brought silverware and drinks and headed down. The men grilled and the women sat at the picnic tables and enjoyed their wine. As far as other food, couldn't tell you. As mentioned, there used to be a breakfast buffet, but no more. Didn't feel like paying, so we just went to the store and bought breakfast foods for the AM and saved money. Dinners were all eaten out except for the one grilled. As far as an explanation about the no more breakfast buffet, apparently many owners that didn't take advantage of it complained and instead of raising owner's fees to include the cost of breakfast, they just did away with it. That's fine--i can eat in my room. The one thing that did disappoint us was the complimentary happy hour that existed back when the place was an Embassy Suites. It was always a nice event to kick start your evening and to save a lot of bucks in the alcohol department. But again, the explanation we learned in the timeshare presentation was because a few people got a little tipsy, feel down, the Maui Board of alcohol got involved and they put a stop to it. The hotel tried $1 and $2 drinks, but apparently, that broke the rule as well. So, now they do a 50% off happy hour down at the pool, and that was really fine with us. Good drinks for about $4 instead of $8. We were very glad to see that our favorite bartender, Dave, was still there since there is no more happy hour. He is the best! Loves his job. Anyways, we would either have a couple drinks in our room before going out to dinner, or we would stop by and sit with Dave for a little while and enjoy a cocktail. They even had karaoke 2x that week--Wednesday i think and Saturday--that was a lot of fun. The guy that runs it is a very good singer and a nice guy. Participation was good...not overly crowded that you couldn't sing a couple of times. I have read complaints about the elevators, but we didn't experience anything unusual in a building that has 12 floors. Never waited more than a minute for one. They did maintenance one day which closed our elevators, so we just used the next ones over. No big deal. The concierge desk was helpful booking activities. As owners who were doing a presentation, we were given $250 Mahalo Dollars that we could apply towards activities, but had to be used in full. Our friends got this money as well. Lastly, we did our timeshare presentation and they tried to get us to upgrade with "new program" they now have. But honestly, one week in Maui is all we can afford, as nice as it would be to stay for longer. We didn't take it and they did not pressure us, nor my friends. But we were there for 90 minutes or longer and we did have to go take a tour of the same type room that we were staying in which was a bit ridiculous. But whatever...worth the $250 per couple. We got to go ATV riding and whale watching with that money. Check-out was fast and easy. Since we weren't leaving until 11:40pm, we stored our luggage at the hotel, did our things during the day and went back to pick up our stuff before heading to the airport. We just packed the clothes for the plane separate so it was easier. Overall, our stay was wonderful, perfect, terrific...heck it's Maui! Can it be bad? KBC was just as nice as i remember, that is why we bought in the first place. I do a lot of travelling and don't expect the best all the time. But this really was. Anyone who says it is old or run down or ugly needs to go stay at the Four Seasons or Ritz and pay a fortune! Leave this place to those who really love it! Until next time KBC, i am only expecting the same or better! We will be counting the days!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Hazel123
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice corner suite on the northwest corner, which provided the most incredible view from West Maui. That said, Maui isn't the type of place you spend much time in your room, and the room was the best thing about this hotel. The public areas are a bit outdated, and the dining options are completely lackluster. The pool and beach access are good, but there is very little action in this area of Kaanapali. Therefore, you need to drive in order to do anything other than lay poolside. As a runner, I was disappointed with my options (or lack thereof) for places to get a few miles in. All in all, this hotel is fine if you just need a nice place to rest your head, but if you're looking for a hotel that plays into the overall experience of a trip to Maui, you should stay in one of the properties farther south in West Maui (e.g. Hyatt Regency, Sheraton), where you'll have great in-hotel dining and nightlife options, and you can take the walking path between properties for a change of scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gizzie
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two kids stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club November 1-11. We had never been to Maui before, our only comparisons being all inclusive resorts throughout Mexico. I booked the first week through a timeshare exchange, and the additional 3 days through Expedia, which caused some confusion with front desk, but all turned out alright. My criteria in booking this resort was fairly simple - wanted to be on Kaanapali Beach, nice room and a big pool! We really enjoyed this resort. Check in went fine, we found all the front desk people to be very nice and helpful. Were quite happy with our room, had a nice ocean view, the huge bathroom that others have commented on, etc. Didn't find the furnishings to be old at all, but I think my son at times found the sofa bed to be a little uncomfortable. We asked for additional pillows and blankets that came quickly. The cleaning service came once during the timeshare week, then daily during the expedia days. We never had a problem with towels, were always plentiful, the garbage you could just leave outside your door and they would pick it up, the cleaning ladies would come first thing in the morning, so we definitely didn't have any complaints. We also used the valet parking, which again was no problem, they were always very friendly, helpful and always appreciative of any tips. The pool was great, and a definite highlight for my kids. They played water volleyball daily (which may not have pleased other guests sometimes??), the temperature of the water was nice and warm, it actually had a deep end (rare in Mexico). The hot tub was also nice, but was usually quite full and the waterfalls were gorgeous. Lounge chairs were plentiful and very comfortable. And the towel card system was great - turn in your wet, sandy towels and get new clean ones!! This is quite common in Mexico, so we didn't have a problem with it at all. We also found the 'movie night' a nice surprise - twice a week they set up a screen outside and play a fairly current movie. The beach was also very nice, but I missed having loungers on the beach. You could use the loungers at the end of the grass on the resort, so I did do that a couple of times. The beach was rocky, but was fine with water shoes. The restaurant/bar were ok. I had drinks during happy hour (3-5) a couple of times, but was strange - my drinks were $4.00, my kids virgin drinks were almost $7.00?? I found that odd, and expensive, so we didn't have many. We ate breakfast there 4 days (included with the Expedia booking) and was very good but the waiters never knew about it, so we had to explain it every morning. We did eat supper there once, I didn't find the prices any worse than in Lahaina, and the food was decent. Great views, and a good kikei menu! My only problem with the resort, and it's very minor, was the gift shop. The lady working there really didn't know what she was doing, made the fellow in front of me (and consequently me) wait 15 minutes while she tried to look up his room number, then couldn't scan the book I wanted to purchase, so just told me I couldn't buy it?! Again, a bit odd. So we're now going through Maui withdrawl. But really enjoyed this resort, and will hopefully return.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware!”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveltropical
Reviews.Content: Watch out, this resort will be shutting down their pool for construction on April 20th-June 20th 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Honeymoon at the Kaanapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: Weareready
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were researching options for our honeymoon in Maui. We knew we wanted a hotel/condo/timeshare with a kitchen so we could save a little money and eat breakfast in the room. We found this listing on Craigslist.com through a couple who was selling their timeshare for the week of our honeymoon. We were a little skeptical at first, but had heard good things abou the Kaanapali Beach Club, so we went for it. When we walked into our suite at the Kaanapali Beach Club, we were amazed. It completely surpassed our expectations! First impression was the size of the suite. It's huge. It has a big bedroom with a king size bed--so comfortable! Then a giant bathroom, almost the size of the bedroom. The bathroom has a separate tub and a standing glass shower next to it, 2 sinks, separate toilet closet and a big double sided closet. The living room/dining room/kitchen area is equally big and spacious. We had no complaints about the decor or furniture being old at all. Everything looked clean, newly updated and luxurious. The towels are copious and the bed was so comfortable, it made it hard to get out of bed in the morining. The kitchen includes a microwave, toaster, frig, coffee maker, utensils, plates/bowls, etc. We also called conceirge and borrowed grilling tools. We ended up grilling on the resort grills and ate at the picnic tables outside one night. The staff was always very friendly from the second we pulled up to the front lobby. Check in was easy. We NEVER felt pressured to attend any timeshare meetings. (Another place we stayed in the Carribean, had people following you around while you were walking to ask you about buying timeshares--this never happened at Kaanapali Beach Club). Everyone was friendly and accommodating--valet, front desk, cleaning people, pool attendants, etc. We didn't have any problems at all. The Ohana restaurant on the resort was good. We had a few meals there, as well as drinks. It is located right next to the pool area, so very convenient for happy hour :) Food was good--not comparable to the pricey island dinners you can get, but it was still tastey and affordable. The pool area is fine--I don't agree with the other reviews that it's old. The pool was always clean and the landscaping is beautiful. Lots of man-made waterfalls and a waterfall pool--make for a relaxing pool day. Plenty of chairs poolside, we never had a problem getting one, and the towel service poolside was great--very convenient. The Kaanapali Beach is right there--beautiful beach, BIG waves, be careful. Overall, we are so happy we were able to stay at the Kaanapali Beach Club and would recommend it in a heartbeat. We hope to go back someday!! Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but we've stayed in better places.”
Reviews.Author: marcsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept. 24 through Oct 1, 2008 using our points from Diamond (formerly Sunterra). The rooms were great. Spacious bathroom with an adjoining room with a king-sized bed. Not the best pool area we've been in, but it was good. However, we could tell was dated. Our little boy loved the slide, even though it is worn down and needs to be replaced/upgraded. We also liked the small waterfall pool. The beach is great as well. As mentioned in another review, I can confirm that the place is quiet after the restaurant and bar closes. We didn't like paying $13 dollars per day to park, even though the valet parking is "free". This is the first resort that we've had to pay for parking on a daily basis. The staff warned us not to book around the next few months as the pool area is scheduled for an over-haul so beware - the place will have construction in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: nigelpam
Reviews.Content: it all started as we arrived at 10pm after 24 hour flight from uk. the bar shuts at 945pm and there is only a small bar locally within walking distance after those hours that opens. the rooms are good very spacious and of good standard. we were not there as timeshare prospects as a friend booked it on his points system and therefore had no intention of booking any extra points. the resort is dead after 10pm at night and although we are not all night ravers we do like to be able to at least drink after 945pm in the hotel . the restaurant which featured in all the advertising moonlight beach setting etc was closed which left the beach bar to eat in where the staff are rude choice of food bad and again closes early. we found the staff unfriendly rude and when we checked out 4 days early to go to another hotel in lahaina there attitude was no better. if you want to sit on the beach all day and go to bed at 10pm it will be fine for you.but for for as a one time trip to maui never again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jemax76
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club in mid-September. It was one of the best experience I've ever had at a hotel. Check-in was a breeze, and when we inquired as to whether we could get an upgrade, they moved us to a room with a partial-ocean view. The young lady that checked us in was completely gracious. Later on our vacation we ran into her at the mall, and she called out to us and was so lovely, even though we didn't recognize her. The suite was large and handsomely furnished. The kitchenette was extremely clean and modern with a terrific round table to dine at, a dishwasher and microwave. The beds and linens were ridiculously comfortable and soft with beautiful coverlets. And the bathroom was simply outstanding with a large soaking tub and separate glass shower. The toilet is tucked away in it's own closet, and there are two separate sinks and mirrors. Though there were only two of us, the suites would be ideal for a family. The pool is fantastic and the grounds and lobby are lovely, with several delightful waterfalls. I can't express my pleasure enough. I will warn about the welcome breakfast. If you choose to accept, you will get a so-so free meal where they tell you about some of the island activities. They then send an individual concierge to each table to sit down with you and encourage you to book through them. If you're uncomfortable with this, don't bother going. If you don't mind a sales pitch and giving up an hour of your morning, go right ahead. We booked a cocktail cruise through the hotel, which was nice enough. However, I was disappointed when I later saw another cocktail cruise offering in a magazine that was substantially cheaper than the "discounted" guest price we were offered. All in all, though, I would recommend this wonderful hotel to anyone. It's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort on West Maui Beach”
Reviews.Author: jasonindy
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 31 through September 7, 2008. So, we just returned home! I am still recovering from my sun burn - beware the sun in Hawaii is fantastic and beautiful but it will burn if you don't protect yourself properly! I had been reading reviews and rants for months prior to our trip and was nervous to be honest. However, I must say that out of 10 Stars (for example), I would give the "ENTIRE" property an 8.5 The staff was super friendly. The front desk was outstanding and always helpful. Our check-in assistant, Christina, could not have been more exciting and helpful. Valet was there if wanted, but we self-parked 95% of the time. It was easier for us! We thankfully had our parking fee of $13 a day taken care of for us (probably because we were ENCORE guests of the resort). The Pool was excellent and we never had a bad time there! The waterfalls were fun and the pool always a great temperature! We do wish they would extend the pool hours. Closing at 10pm is not exactly a nice thing for adults who want to unwind after a long day out sightseeing - even the hot tubs stopped! We took our own beach towels to avoid any issues with the "Pink Cards" - we did not want to pay the fee should we have lost the cards! The beach here at the club is fantastic and there are some snorkeling opportunities just north of the property borderline! Sure, the elevators are a bit slow and one tower is out of service unitl about 9/16, but it only took about 5 minutes or less to use the elevators. Be patient - you are on vacation! We never ate at the restaurants on site; so we can't comment on them! We had a Deluxe Ocean View room - that faced to the north so we could see the island of Molokai and the north shore of West Maui (plus the west Maui mountains to the north) - so other than a direct on beach view, we had an excellent view!! The room was spacious for 3 adults and we used pretty much every inch of it and the bathroom was just big enough for 3 adults. We had to sit through the time share presentation as this was an "Encore Trip" for us. And, to be honest, this was the worst part of the week. It took me 4 hours and my partner 6 hours, but we took the bait and are now owners! Other family members are owners, so it shouldn't be too bad - I hope anyway! But, regardless, the salesman was "direct and to the point and really didn't take no for an answer" but we are smart individuals who know what we are doing. Hey, at least we own "property" so to speak in Hawaii now! LOL! But, the property and hotel is gorgeous (forget the old time decor) it didn't bother us one bit. We look forward to staying here again! Please contact me if you have any questions I can answer!

Reviews.Title: “This is the TRUE Review”
Reviews.Author: NorCali_8
Reviews.Content: Ok - this is my first time I've posted a review of any sort, but I wanted to provide everyone with a review that I thought would be helpful. Please keep in mind there are folks who are very picky and will complain and write negative reviews about every little thing. Yes, we can be particular, but we also realize we're not staying at the Four Seasons (which, by the way, is a great property in Wailea). We've stayed in various places in Maui (usually 4 stars or better), but wanted a suite, without having to stay in a condo (we're a family of 5) and not have to pay a month's worth of salary. So, after much research, we narrowed it down to two places - The Fairmont in Wailea or Kanaapali Beach Club. Obviously we choose KBC, primarily due to the cost (quarter of the price of the Fairmont) and wanting to stay on the west side of Maui. We were not disappointed. At first, we were a bit hesitant based on the reviews and thoughts of staying in an 80's style pink building, but all those negative thoughts went away as soon as we pulled up to the valet. Here's a few tidbits: - the opened-aired lobby was nice - the pool was in decent condition, but GREAT if you have kids (they have a smaller pool - 3 1/2 feet - with a slide) - the room was beyond our expectations (two room suite, microwave, full size refrigerator, sink, dishwasher, two 42" plasma TVs, huge bathroom with separate tub and shower and enclosed toilet and two sinks) - ask for the "most recently renovated room" on the "pool side" with a "deluxe ocean view" - the kid's menu (called the Kieki menu) was terrific. All items all were $2 (great burgers). You can get this during sit-down at the Ohana Grill or at the take out window. - we rented a cabana for a few days ($75, but it's literally on the beach and yours for the entire day (our kids took a nap and ate lunch in the cabana). It was also a great place for them to get a break from the sun. - Get the $15 all-you-can-drink coconut when you arrive. They basically provide all the drinks you want during your stay. - they have happy hour from 5:30 - 6:30 with 1/2 priced cocktails - Charles, the kid's activity director, is SUPER nice person. All the kids loved him. They just started the program, so they're still working on the room and games. - Koi fish feeding each afternoon - the kids loved it. - There's a large market across the street and the prices were actually better than the Safeway in Lahaina. - Great beach (short walk from the pool to the water). So, how do you get the best deal? We had a 7 night stay in an ocean view romm, full breakfast included each day for the entire family (usually costs $12.50 pp), free parking (cost is $13 per day), and 10% off all activities if booked through the activities desk (the prices were very competitive). For all this, we paid about $1300. The catch is sitting through the time-share presentation, which can be as long (2 hrs) or short (30 mins) as you like, depending on the number of questions you ask. If you're upfront and let them know you have no intent of buying, the sales pitch is scaled way back. Don't feel guilted into showing them you're interested. They're used to folks taking advantage of the promotional rate. We actually sat through the entire presentation and they re-offered the promotional package to us again, which we took advantage of for our next trip to Maui. All in all, it took us a day or so to get the vibe of the place, but by far it's the easiest, most economical and family friendly place we've stayed in Maui. The only negatives I could think of was the limited food menu for adults, narrow lanais (unless you're in a corner room) and there tends to be a bit more wind in north Kanaapali (another great reason to get the cabana). If you're not seeking "Four Seasons" type of accomodations and need the extra space, this is THE PERFECT place to stay, especially for the price. As I mentioned earlier, don't believe all the negative comments, this review is a real as it gets. We tend to be hotel snobs and were somewhat hesitant about this place, but we plan to return annually. Anyway, hope this helps everyone who was contemplating staying at KBC. It's a great place for families!!

Reviews.Title: “Garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: pmt3
Reviews.Content: Our family felt the aloha spirit the minute we walked into this resort. Check in was quick and friendly and our room had a beautiful ocean view, as requested. Everywhere you turn there are waterfalls, tropical flowers and wide open spaces. The grounds were meticulously maintained, yet I never saw any gardeners out and about-kind of reminded me of Disney. The tropical pool was very large and never overcrowded. It had a volleyball net so there was always a game going on and a slide that our kids enjoyed. They had complementary cups and coolers full of ice cold water poolside. Best of all, from most lounge chairs you also had a view of the ocean. And speaking of lounge chairs, they all had new cushions that were very comfortable-no slat marks here! The beach was wide, swimable and also uncrowded, with terrific views of Molokai. The work out room is adjacent to the pool and has everything one would want to stay in shape while indulging in lava flows! All with a view your local gym would love to have. Our room was spacious, clean, and well decorated. The kitchens have full size refrigerators, microwaves, and dishwashers, but no stove. I requested an electric frying pan and they brought it right away. Eating out all the time can cramp your activity time (and your wallet), so I didn't mind a little time in the kitchen. A grocery store is within walking distance of the property. The resort also provides awesome oceanfront gas grills and picnic tables-bbq in paradise! Since I'm on the subject, another pleasant surprise was the large $2 kids menu that the resort offered, either eat-in or take out at the grill. They also sold coconut head cup holders with unlimited soda refills for $15.00. The kids seemed happy enough on their sofa bed, and the king size in the bedroom was terrific.
