The linens were especially nice-I should have looked to see what kind of pillows they had, because I would like to buy them for my own bed at home. The patio furniture was getting a little worn, but otherwise everything was in good condition. We were never bothered about (or wanted to)attend the timeshare orientation, but we did attend the breakfast buffet activity orientation our first morning there. They went over the various activities available and you could book them if you wanted, but it was low pressure and convenient. This was our fifth trip to Maui, and we've done all of the activities before, so we spent more time at the resort than we usually do. If you can only fit in a few activities, I'd say definitely see Haleakala, drive to Hana if you don't get carsick, shop Lahaina on art night (Friday eve.) and take a snorkel trip to Molokini. The only drawback to Molokini is the variety of fish will forever make you disappointed in subsequent snorkeling elsewhere. We've been snorkeling arout the Carribean and always end up saying "well that wasn't even close to Molokini'. Our favorite place for an incredible breakfast is the Gazebo in Napili. If you arrive after 8:00, there may be a long wait, but the stunning views and macadamia nut pancakes with coconut syrup make it all worthwhile. Afterwards, spend some time at Napili Bay. If you golf, you should play Kapalua at least once in your lifetime, though we were saddened to see they had doubled their rates in the few years since we had played it. The fees were in the $250 + range. If that's not doable, at least take a drive around Kapalua and maybe get lunch at the clubhouse-the views are spectacular. There are also new hiking paths on the ridge above Kapalua. You take a complementary shuttle from the Kapalua discovery center. We went on an overcast day, and it was a nice hike through some interesting trees and plants. Back at KBR, a torchlighter started every evening with his ceremony, and live music started around 5:00 at the beachside lounge. There's nothing like the sound of Hawaiian music and waves crashing while watching the sunset. Wish we could go back next week!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katiekatie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the resort! We were in a 2 bedroom suite on a corner, not a bad view to be seen off our 4(!) balconies!!! The resort was clean and the staff appeared to be happy to be there and help. The welcome breakfast was a great idea to help sort thru all of the activities and select safe and reputable companies. We enjoyed all of the acitivities that we picked with the help of Kyra (our conceirge at the breakfast). The beach at the hotel is great and the pool is large and was never overcrowded. The food at the resort is good but venture into Lahaina for some great food and spectacular views. The resort offers scuba lessons at the pool and take you out to do an open water dive afterwards, my husband loved this. I enjoyed the Pride of Maui am snorkeling cruise and would highly recommend them, great service, no attitudes great with my 6 year old son!!!!! For surfing lessons we used Outrageous surf, they were fantastic!!!! my favorite activity!!!!!! The road to Hana is pretty, but be prepared to spend all day in the car and to hike (on unsteady rocky, muddy, and VERY slippery) trails to see most of the waterfalls. Glad I did that once, won't do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, especially for big goupr of people who want to share the space”
Reviews.Author: Nabaaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days as part of our amazing honeymoon which included staying in many different accommodation in all 5 Islands of Hawaii. I absolutely loved the HUUUUUUUUUUUUUGE my mean really big rooms of this hotel. Since this hotel is part of a big time share, all the rooms are suits and they have separate big bedroom, nice living room, huge balcony and mini kitchen. - Room' furniture and decor are a bit old fashion and may need to be touched up with new contemporary design. - We were not very impress by restaurants, lets just say OKAY! - Swimming pool is big and fantastic. - View of our room was gorgeous and big balcony in this hotel are huge PLUS. If we had the $, we perhaps bought the time share. I think this hotel is the best for long term stay especially if you are traveling with big group of people or friends. Also, if you are coming to Maui for first time and do not have plan to go to other islands, you may find this resort boring, they do not have any entertainment at resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: VacationMomHouston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Ka'anapali Beach Club resort in Maui. My overall impression was that the ownership was scrimping on maintenance, doing just enough to keep the first impression good while selling timeshares. The location is great (although not on the main part of Ka'anapali) but it is right on the ocean. The pool is huge (although it needs replastering to get rid of the brown stains on the bottom), the slide is fun (when it is attended - otherwise it's closed for a 1 1/2 hr lunch break every day) and there are plenty of lounge chairs. If you want shade, you have to pay $100 for a tent - something that is kept secret until your stuff gets moved and when you ask the person in your chair, you are informed of this policy - very embarrassing! Our room looked nice, but smelled musty. One bed had a trough in the middle, it was so bad, I had to switch beds with my kids. The rollout couch went downhill, but it's a rollout, so what do you expect. Maid service was at 3 pm every day by which time we were back in the room taking naps and showers, so we'd usually just get towels and skip the cleaning. The maid knocked on the door as we were checking out wanting a tip. Mini golf course is fun, although the carpet is peeling, the flags are falling apart and it looks like it needs TLC. The nice sit down restaurant, North Shore Grill which was advertised ad-nauseum in posters all over the place does not exist any more. The time share guy said it was being renovated, but I saw no evidence of this. 2 of the 6 elevators were not working, so there was usually a wait for an elevator. If you are there for the time share presentation, be prepared. They say it's 90 minutes to 2 hrs. We were there for 2 1/2 hrs and I was having my kids call my cell screaming so I'd have an excuse to leave. If you're thinking about buying, say no to their first offer, they dropped the price by 1/2 after we said no. When we said no the second time, he did the used car salesman trick of going to talk to the manager who thankfully was busy (after 15 minutes of sitting there) and didn't come out. Then we were asked to fill out a "survey" which was another sales pitch to come back next year and do it all again! No thanks. BTW there are numerous timeshare resellers all over the place who have timeshares at prices way less than what is being offered - check prices before going, you can probably bargain for a better deal if you really want to get into this. Every time I asked about a maintenance issue, I was told that it was going to be redone - but I didn't see any work occurring while I was there. The scuba was fun, and the food was reasonably priced. I wouldn't go again just because it's not worth the savings to get hassled by the time share people. Too bad it's not still an Embassy suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Knowles53108
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! My husband and I went there on our honeymoon. We really loved the appreance of the rooms and the cleanliness. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. We highly suggest staying there for anyone. Our overall experience was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best Maui location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: FabFiftySoccermom
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club for five nights, July 17-22, 2008. We absolutely enjoyed our stay there and would recommend this property to everyone. The suites were very clean, the staff extremely helpful and courteous, and the best part of all is the location. It has a nice stretch of beach, a huge 1 acre pool, and is only 10 minutes away from many of the restaurants, shopping, and activity in Lahaina, HI. We celebrated our 25th anniversary there and were very glad we chose the KBC. They made our special occasion the best it could be. Our teenagers loved it, also.

Reviews.Title: “My Overdue Review of A Week At The Ka'anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: mauiman98
Reviews.Content: ok...I have waited long enough! So, after much procrastination , I have reviewed by scribbled notes and pondered my memories, and now present for your information and ridicule, my review of my stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Vacation Resort (KBVR) (almost always referred to as the "Embassy"). This review is another "thank you" to all my Trip Advisor Forum friends and local experts who continue to provide so much invaluable advice and information. You made my Maui adventure the fantastic tour that it was. Mahalo! The review of my 8 day stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Vacation Resort on Maui, from 11-3 to 11-10-06: 1. is it a "large, 8-acre, oceanfront resort" as it says in the on-line ad? yes it is! I didn't actually measure the acres, true, but the size of the place as you pull up from the main drag is impressive and it is indeed on the ocean. No streets to cross. No dangerous steep hills to descend. It is truly on the beach and oceanfront! And when I vacationed there it was painted pink! 2. how was the "full American breakfast buffet and sunrise at poolside", as is also described in the on-line ad? It was ok but had I had to pay for it, I might have felt differently. We got our daily buffet comped as an incentive for us to buy. Oh, and it wasn't at poolside. It was presented in the North Beach Grille, in the oceanfront section of the restaurant and we sat almost at water's edge. The wonderful floor to ceiling windows allowed for ocean breezes to sweep in and it had great natural light reflecting in off the ocean in the early morning. A perfect setting for early morning coffee and newspaper reading. You could eat as early as 7AM, which was perfect for us, since we were stuck on East Coast USA time for the entire week! Other than the omelet station, however, I thought that the quality of the fruits and pastries at the breakfast buffet was just so so. But the coffee was Kona, I guess, and it was delicious. Oh, and I got a tip for you: wear a hat to breakfast! The huge windows of the restaurant are opened for breakfast and this is a great thing but the island birds have become accustomed to this and to the fact that parents allow their spoiled bratty children to feed them by hurling bread crumbs from the table out onto the garden paths and the birds have now gotten so used to this that they fly right into the restaurant in anticipation! So be prepared for all manner of birds to swoop in from the beach as you eat your beakfast. You get used to it....you are on Maui, after all! 3. how was the "complimentary manager's cocktail reception at sunset" as is described in the on-line ad? I don't know! Never made it to one of these receptions. Never hung around the resort or got back from our various sorties around the island soon enough. I'm not a big "reception" kind of person, anyway, and I don't drink tropical fruit cocktails. I probably would not have fit in had I showed up with a pitcher of margaritas. Maybe next time? ( Although several comments that have been posted recently seem to indicate that new management has put an end to these sunset rituals.) 4. was the description of the place as "located on Maui's magnificent north Ka'anapali Beach, overlooking the crystal blue Pacific and the lush green mountains of West Maui.....perfect for that romantic 2nd honeymoon or for a family vacation" accurate? Yes! A big thumbs up for the accuracy of this description, IMO! The Pacific was indeed blue or so it appeared from my lanai at sunrise. And the mountains were lush and green. Wonderful to look up at. In addition, and not mentioned in the ad, were the islands off shore. From my lanai, the island of Molokai (I think) was in full view and was another beautiful addition to the total scene. Each sunrise was a visual and spiritual treat. Oh, and BTW, the KBVR is not located on THE Ka'anapali Beach. It is on North Ka'anapali Beach. More about this a little later.. 5. were the condos of the KBVR spacious (as described in the on-line ad) ? Yes! This was no exaggeration! I would, indeed, say that the condo that we enjoyed, which was a 1BR standard unit, with standard ocean view looking west, was spacious! For 2 adults! And that was what we were. And it was the perfect size for us. The lanai was a bit "thin", meaning that you could not extend a lounger out front to back width-wise, you had to turn it length-wise, but it was big enough to enjoy that early AM coffee as the sun did it's thing with the ocean. I enjoyed this orientation. A lanai that got direct morning sun would much less enjoyable, IMO. Trades or no trades, the sun heats things up fast on the Maui West Coast. 6. how did the amenities compare with the descriptions in the on-line ads? IMO, right on target! The best is the bath. The description says that it is a "luxurious, oversized bath area" and I agree. Mind, it is THE only bath, so if you are going to share this space with 3 other adults me thinks that you would be tight, but for 2 adults, it is indeed oversized and luxurious. The wife and I could do all bathroom routines without crowding each other because there is so much floor space. His and her sinks and vanities. Separate jacuzzi bathtub and shower ( a walk-in shower- big enough to drop the soap and to bend over and pick it up). There was decent water pressure and I liked the luxury shower head. Good exhaust too. No problem fogging up the place with steam. The sinks and vanities and floor were nicely appointed. Classy marble sink tops and quality floor tiles. The on-line photos of the bath space found in the 1BR units that can be found on-line are accurate. The private access to the bath from the master bedroom (the only bedroom) is a nice touch to the design adding a bit of privacy in case you might decide to turn the living room into a bedroom for a visitor or 2. Or, God forbid, children! Because, yes, again true to the on-line description, there is a full sized sofa bed in the LR space and it was kinda comfortable as a couch. We never had reason to sleep on it opened up as a bed so I can't comment on its comfort level in that way. I thought that the king size bed was comfortable (I can sleep almost anywhere I can lie down with a pillow and fresh air) and I liked it that the lanai could be accessed from the bedroom as well as the LR. The BR had good closet space. Luggage could be stowed away easily inside it and off the floor. Plentiful drawer space too. Also a desk space, with desk, chair, and lamp, which was a nice surprise. Do not recall if there was an internet connection at the desk. There was an additional color TV (20 inch) in the bedroom which was a nice plus. The bedding was comfortable to me without knowing what the thread counts were! Regarding the "mini-kitchen equipped with microwave and dishwasher" ..., this was as described but also included a full size frig with freezer. And we took full advantage of it, too. We asked for a plug-in skillet which greatly expanded the kitchen space's functionality, especially for breakfasts and for reheating leftovers. There was also a coffeemaker. Tip- pack filters and coffee. We did take out almost every day while in West Maui from the wonderful Honokowai Okazuya & Deli or from the Star Market that was nearby, saving a small fortune in culinary costs. Dining out on Maui, anywhere, can get very pricey! There was a dining area with table and chairs serviced from the kitchen space that was more than adequate for the 2 of us but might have been tight for 4. Overall, the furniture looked to be in good shape. Not plush, not elegant, not brand new.....but certainly serviceable. Diito for cabinets and counter tops. 7. How about the "modern entertainment center" that the on-line ads talk about? Our unit had nothing special. The TV was standard and adequate size (35 inch) but not flat screen and not HDTV and if there were pay-per view movies I never noticed. Cannot recall if there was a DVD Player either! Anybody who thinks that they will spend time in their room looking at movies or TV, especially during their 1st ever visit to Maui, is nuts! But then there is that "perfect for a family vacation" theme mentioned in the on-line ads, wasn't there? So I guess having an Entertainment Center to keep the children busy is an important consideration for parents who foolishly bring their children along to enjoy Maui with them. LOL! Tip: bring some DVDs with you if you must bring children along! 8. "The grounds are alive with lush tropical gardens and interlocking waterways and waterfalls. By far the most spectacular and prominent water feature is the 1 acre pool and a 60 foot water slide with its own splash pool. This creates the perfect environment for a family vacation". This is the description that I read on-line and that, I must admit, appealed to my lust to vacation in Hawaii, at least once. So, how did the real thing compare to this advertisement boast? IMO, It was right on the mark! The place was a wonder. Wonderful openness everywhere so you get the trade winds and the waterways and the waterfalls and the ocean beyond to one side and the hillsides and mountains above, and, well, it sure worked its magic on me. A definite "10", IMO. Great to wake up to, great to come back to, great to just walk around in. And did I mention that the buildings are all painted pink? 9. Other thoughts: The lobby elevators were all glass so you could view the pool/ocean and/or mountains going up and coming down. This got you in a Maui frame of mind right away as long as your wait was minimal. They were not air conditioned and could get uncomfortable if you had to wait awhile inside one while somebody loaded or unloaded their bags or collected their children. But they worked well while we were there, an advantage of enjoying the slow season, and they had obviously survived the flooding of the lobby. However, I understood while chatting with owners who return year after year that this is not always the case. The elevators have been a problem and the resort is planning to update them. That means another increase in the ownership maintenance fees for sure! LOL! Elevators at resorts take a heavy beating as is. Throw in the long term effects of salt water and sand and children.......and.......$$$$$$$'s are needed to keep them going. Wide open spaces. I loved it that the hallways and walkways and balconies and lobby were all open for free flow of those tropical trade wind breezes, but this had its down side when the island got whacked by a series of incredible rains the days before we arrived. The road to the south shore resorts from the airport had had to be closed and there was talk of shutting the access road to the west shore too. When we pulled up in front of the "Embassy" we were amazed at the sight. The lobby was under water! The rain had filled up the various ponds and waterways that surround the lobby and the staff had had to actually sandbag the run off to keep one lane of walkway to the check-inn safely above water. We were very lucky. It never rained again during our entire week, at least not during the day. I loved the openness. Rain is a risk worth taking. Air conditioning. Air conditioning and ceiling fans are a must in Maui, IMO. We were there in late October and it was hot and humid even then. It has to be worse in the summer. Our unit had both a.c and ceiling fans (2) and were we ever grateful. After a day in the sun we could not wait to return to the comfort of our air conditioned condo. And the ceiling fans in the LR and in the BR kept that conditioned air flowing perfectly thru the space. I need that to sleep. There was no electric meter churning out an additional charge for the a.c. but maybe there should be. We are green minded and kept our a.c turned way down while we were away. I hoped that others did too. Parking. Something that I was very happy we were "gifted" with was valet parking. The wife and I were totally drained after being in the sun all day. And we enjoyed the luxury of pulling up at the valet station and having somebody else park the car. The fact that valet parking is provided gives the KBVR that "resort" touch of class and it surely spoils you. Would I have opted to pay an additional $25.00/ day + tip for each coming and going? Ask me in year 2010 when we plan to return! The parking rate at the time of our vacation was $12.00/ day. Remember , that was almost 2 years ago! Laundry. The condo that we occupied did not have a laundry. There was a laundry with coin operated washers and dryers on our floor, and we used them almost every day. I believe that you could also take advantage of a Laundry Service pick up and drop off to your room if you wanted. Dry cleaning too. Most owners that I spoke with told me that not having washers and dryers on each floor was a major point of contention at the moment with ownership. Housekeeping. You get the standard mid-week housekeeping. You could arrange for more....at a price, of course. The bath towels were standard quality. Not plush. But there was an ample supply. Toiletries were provided and replenished. I had no complaints. The place looked clean when we checked-in and we kept it that way. There was no hint of smell of cigarette or cigar which I considered a big, big plus. View. The on-line ads that I studied before deciding on the KBR deceive a bit about the view that can be enjoyed, IMO. Do not be deceived. Unless you get a 2BR unit you are not getting that spectacular oceanfront view that you might have seen in the ads. Those units are very scarce and very expensive. Maybe some day for us, but for now we were satisfied with our view, which as mentioned previously was standard ocean view but on the north side so our lanai got morning shade. We could see ocean and we could see mountain from our setting. Not much of either but enough. The views that the so-called "deluxe ocean views" had were not that much better, IMO. Certainly not worth another $1,000.00 or more! I think that I would splurge another $200.00 to go standard ocean view over scenic view, however, because I love the smells and sounds of sea and salt air! However, I do not think that you can request a specific room or view, unless you are an owner, and even then it is the luck of the draw that decides which owner will get the best of the best views in a select room view category, which I think runs: scenic (aka garden), ocean view, luxury ocean, and ocean front. Some ads will also show a nice photo of the resort's pool with a building that looks to be almost alongside the pool and right on the beach. Again, don't be deceived. This is not the KBVR. This is another condo building altogether and not at all related to the KBVR. Other stuff. The KBVR had a busy concierge and activities desk where we obtained lots of useful and up to date information, including a few money saving coupons. The 18 hole miniature golf course was located on the roof of a building and looked to have weathered those rain storms that I mentioned earlier pretty badly. Our lanai was located directly overlooking this rooftop. I never saw anybody playing golf on it. There was a fitness center somewhere I was told but I successfully avoided it all week. I did successfully find a great poolside bar and met each sunrise there with a bloody mary after a brisk ocean walk. Hint- bring your own tabasco and a fresh lemon. I enjoyed teaching my bartender friend the extrafine details of preparing THE Bloody Mary Cocktail. I also enjoyed watching the NFL games from poolside early Sunday morning while sipping my bloody mary and chomping on a celery stick. You need some vegetable in your diet, you know! BTW, the pool, as mentioned, was a thing of beauty, with waterfalls and waterslides and the Pacific Ocean as a background. At night, it gets all lite up by torch light. Very pretty! Another advantage of vacationing off season is that you never have to stake out pool stuff at dawn and then guard it all day. From reading the reviews of others about the KBVR, this happens at poolside regularly during prime season, as I am certain it does at most resorts. We had absolutely no problems sitting wherever we wanted and pool chairs and towels were easily obtained. I give the pool area and environment a strong 10 of 10 rating for certain. The resort also had its own beauty salon and spa someplace but we were much too busy snorkeling to schedule for stuff like that. The vast, open air lobby had a few shops and the resort offered a calendar of kids programs that could keep the little buggers occupied while the parents got busy elsewhere. There is a children's pool and and of course a games room. Scuba lessons are offered in the pool and next time I plan on taking a few. Maui has fantastic places for snorkeling and I guess for scuba too, if you know how. Hint- go to Black Rock at the Sheraton. It was sensational. The KBVR also offered room service for breakfast and for lunch. Not certain if you could get dinner or not. There was mention of high speed internet availability but I didn't care. I was on vacation in Maui. Ka'anapali Beach. The KBVR has very little actual beach. The on-line advertisements will rave about the wonderful Ka'anapali Beach Scene but in truth, the KBVR is not part of that scene. It is part of the North Ka'anapali Beach Scene. People do go in the water in front of the resort, yes, but when we were there (late October) it was unprotected and looked to be rocky and rough. Certainly not for snorkeling. The beach action is back at Ka'anapali Beach and to get there you either hitch, grab a bus or a trolley, or drive your rental. By car it takes 5 minutes tops. Parking can be a chore, especially if you are there in peak summer season. I suggest parking near the Sheraton or actually at the Sheraton. You can stroll the entire Ka'anapali Beach Walkway from there and also snorkel at Black Rock, which is usually chock full of colorful fish. When you need a break, you can order a drink and a lunch or both at the Sheraton. They offer great poolside table service. Just remember to re-apply that sunscreen often. Another day you can park at Whaler's Village and shop and do some people watching as you stroll the along the paved beach walk. Usually there will be a band or 2 playing in the Mall or at one of the many outdoor restaurants or bars along the strip. Restaurant Tips- You will read that Mama's Fishouse is "number 1" but there are many number 1's on Maui. You are paying for Mama's notoriety big time. Unless you have a "must do" lust to take a photo at popular Mama's, and have the desire to drive all the way back across the island in certain traffic, for at least 60 minutes, in 1 lane, bumper to bumper, then I suggest that you pass on Mama's and the dinner for 2 that will easily cost you $200.00 or more plus tip. We were disappointed...can you tell? If you must go, go for lunch, early on a clear day, and enjoy the view and then travel up to Paia and stroll around. Find the Paia Fishmarket and wander around until you find the take out section. It was way in the back when I was there. Sense your mouth watering and your stomach churning as you smell those wonderful smells wafting away at you from the many varieties of take out suggestions that are available to you that day. Now find an appropriate bottle of wine or 2, be sure to pick up a cheap corkscrew, and head for the beach and maybe a sunset. Enjoy. Other restaurant suggestions: We enjoyed a great dinner at the Makawao Steakhouse where I savored some wonderful sushi, a bowl of Maui onion soup and a great prime rib (end cut) in front of a lively fire started in a huge fireplace that took the chill out of a previously (when we got there) chilly room. It's worth visiting Makawao Town too, so go early and visit the artsy shops. At the Ka'anapali Beach we had a great lunch at Leilani's Beachside Grill (downstairs) and enjoyed people watching as the crowds strolled or roller bladed or skate boarded on by! Another restaurant tip is the many waterfront bars on Front Street in Lahaina, which offer reasonably priced lunches, and if you go anytime near sunset, you will enjoy some of the best sunset views on the island. We also enjoyed a fine dining experience at a restaurant in Lahaina called David Paul's. Expensive but very worth it, IMO. More about that later. And I mentioned it previously but let me praise it once again....the Honokowai Okazuya & Deli on Lower Honoapilani Road. Wonderful take out dishes. I especially enjoyed their spicy fish of the day concoction. Ditto the Star Market, right across the street from the KBVR, which also offered lots of take out choices that we took advantage of. The Maui Real Estate Rental Market- On any given day you can see 10 or more offers to rent 1BR condo units at the KBVR, just like the one that we enjoyed. The market for the summer of 2008 appears to be in the $699 to $799.00 range for a 1 week stay (7 nights). Higher in July, lower in August. You can buy a unit on the resale market for $4,000.00 that can be used EOY. Management at the KBVR has changed though, so buying a private resale might be a bit tricky now. Annual maintenance fees run $1,800.00 and up at the KBVR ! Ouch! And this is about 1/2 what it is at other prime resorts on Maui. With the air lines facing big trouble trying to hold prices down while fuel prices escalate, I'm thinking that the travel situation to the Hawaiian Islands just might be in a general state of chaos very soon, with prices jumping up and then down again as the major players try to fill their half empty planes at the last minute. This may affect rental demand on Maui as soon as this Fall. If I was a "bidding" man, I think I would study this market very carefully and submit a few low ball offers.... if I could take some vacation in the Fall. If you could get a 1BR condo at the KBVR for 1 week for...say $500.00...then you would be sitting pretty and could spend that savings on a couple dinners at Mama's! LOL! Activities. My favorite was the bike ride down the Haleakala volcano. I used Maui Mountain Riders and they offer a sunrise trip from the top to the ocean, with a stop for lunch. Takes all day but great views and super photo ops. A chase car (actually a truck) follows all the way ready to repair and/or replace any bikes or bikers that go down along the way. I had to get my bike replaced when the brakes locked up. There are only a few short sections of flat traveling that requires vigorous pedaling during the entire trip. Most of the time you spend gawking at the views and trying to keep a specific distance from the biker ahead of you while you coast and brake and turn. My wife decided not to chance the bike ride and they let her ride with the truck driver. She got a personal, narrated tour from him as we descended down the mountain. Another "must do" activity is an off shore snorkel trip to the Turtle Reef, which is a coral reef located off a south shore golf course. The reef supports a nice variety of fish and rays and eels but the big draw is the huge green sea turtles that hang around and that surface now and then for a gulp of air amid lots of hysterical shouts from snorkelers who get scared shirtless when these monsters come up right beside them. One was my wife! LOL! This activity included a trip out to Molokini, which was fun and a thing to do, once, but the snorkeling that day was not nearly as good as it had been on Turtle Reef. I also recommend at least 1 full day in Lahaina. Bring your coupons. We had the opportunity to enjoy Halloween in Lahaina and this celebration gets rowdy early. Lahaina is the old capital of Maui and the core of the novel, Hawaii by Mr. James A. Michener, which is a must read before you go, IMO. As mentioned, in Lahaina, we treated ourselves to a very pricey dinner at David Paul's Lahaina Grill, and we were wowed! And not just by the price. Everything was perfect and the portions were enough for a 2nd meal later in the week. If they offer a rack of lamb, and you like rack of lamb, then go for this treat. It was done Pacific Rim style and was delicious. Also offered as a special dessert of the day was a luscious chocolate eclair kind of thing. Yummy! An advantage of being from the US East Coast is that we got hungry early on Maui and this motivated us to get to restaurants early. I suggest that you do this if you want choice eats at David Paul's. They sold out of most of that days dinner menu items by 7PM and closed. We lucky patrons who were inside were then treated to at least a full hour of impromptu song and dance by various members of the bar staff and kitchen staff. We were all delighted. It was one of the greatest of the great days and nights that we enjoyed on Maui. Save your pennies though. The David Paul's Restaurant is easily as expensive as Mama's. We passed on all of the luaus while on Maui, since we were heading for Oahu and a stay on Waikiki and our hotel had its own luau, right on the beach. Some of the other many activities that we didn't do were: helicopter ride, road to Hana (road was closed), visit to the brewery, hike the Iao Valley, vist the South Shore Maui resorts, play golf, catch a fish, see a whale breech, learn to surf, and eat at about 90 of the several hundred restaurants that I had targeted before I left, based on the suggestions of many of our TA members. Conclusion. OK, What I have left out? The Ka'anapali Beach Vacation Resort is probably still referred to as The Embassy by most locals and it is still erroneously referred to as the Ka'anapali Beach Club (KBC) in Lahaina by some uninformed sources. But now you are informed and you now know that the true name, at least for the immediate present, is the Ka'anapali Beach Vacation Resort, and it is located neither in Ka'anapali Beach nor in Lahaina. And it has undergone yet another ownership change. Some say this was needed. Others are not too sure about it. New ownership usually means higher maintenance fees! There was renovation going on while were there but we were up and out of our room long before the banging began. I questioned a few owners about this and was told that many of the condos are being completely refurbed. New appliances, new TVs, new counter tops, new furniture, new bedding....the works. That's when I realized that we were in a newly refurbished unit!. The stories that I then heard about the "old" units were distressing. There would have been trouble had we chanced on 1 of these. But...no harm...no foul...so they say! We enjoyed the week that we spent there very much and would definitely go back again, no matter what it was called, if it was just the wife and I. I am assuming that all units have been refurbished by now. But, I would not book the 1BR condo if I was bringing along another adult couple. Instead, I might try to book a 2nd 1BR unit. Given the rental offerings that I see recently, this may be doable for the same price as a 2BR villa at another resort on or near Ka'anapali Beach. The 1BR 1bath unit, although spacious, is not enough for me to share with 3 other adults while on vacation. I think that the 1BR 1Bath condo unit at the KBVR is a good value for 2 adults..... maybe the only true resort value on Maui with 1st class amenities and a perfect location, close enough to most everything yet far enough away to offer some space from the big crowds. Compare with similar offerings at the Ritz Carlton, Marriott, Hyatt, Hilton, Westin or Sheraton and see if you don't agree with me. When I shopped them, the KBVR offered savings of as much as $100.00 per nite over Studio or 1BR Units at most of these big names and they had not nearly the space or functionality of the KBVR condo that we enjoyed, which was approx 750 sq ft. plus lanai. Please let me know if I can answer any questions that you might have about the KBVR (Embassy) or about planning and enjoying Maui in general. There was a major development underway in the North Ka'anapali Beach neighborhood while we were vacationing but it was far enough away to not be a bother....then. It could be a different story now. There is also a big pool maintenance scheduled for 2009 so you want to inquire about that for certain if you are considering planning something around then. If any of the restaurants that I mentioned or any of the other suggestions that I made are now inaccurate, remember that my recollections are from notes made almost 2 years ago! Hey, good advice is worth waiting for, you know! LOL! But seriously, I'll be happy to share my thoughts with you, just as so many did with me as I planned my first visit. Thanks for listening! mm98

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in our favorite destination.”
Reviews.Author: the_proms
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more times than I can count. It has always been my family's 'hotel' when we go on vacation. In the past few years, I have noticed the service has gone downhill. I must say this hotel is PARADISE, well...it was. I have always looked forward to going here for the peace, the relaxation and awesome pool. We arrived there, got our room and booked up there. The rooms hadn't changed in 10 years. Still completely outdated, and for being mainly timeshare owned, that surprised me. We did the time share scheme and did their walk along. We went along with it, and they were sweet and more than happy to talk with us. When we said no, our timeshare guy was great, he knew we weren't going to be buying. When his "boss" heard this, he came over and did his used car dealership talk with us, and we continued to decline. He then got hostile with us, and pretty much degraded us for another 20 minutes. It was ridiculous and from that point on, I made up my mind to NEVER stay there again. From the first time we stayed there, there was music by the pool, waitresses and waiters walking around taking orders by the pool, eating outdoors for breakfast, etc. NOW, there is none of that. No music, no outdoor breakfast, no poolside service. And the staff is far from happy to be there. Too bad, I loved this place, and now it's nothing more than a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Club is a delight!”
Reviews.Author: DallasGogirl
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful condo resort right on the beach in Maui. The 1st room they showed us to overlooked the parking lot and the grocery store. We asked to be moved and they gave us a room w/ a partial ocean view and overlooking a koi pond. Really nice. The big bathroom was fabulous. Beds were very comfortable and we had a nice kitchen. We went to the farmers market down the street and had wonderful fresh fruit everyday. We did the timeshare presentation in exchange for a 5 day/ 4 night stay w/ breakfast everyday and a rental car for $600.00. Great deal and the presentation was painless and they were very nice. We would go back again. Nice staff, beautiful rooms, grocery store right by hotel. Very nice beach. The pool area was being worked on but it was fine. No complaints. Aloha! :)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value”
Reviews.Author: Jack1959
Reviews.Content: Great Value! We live on Oahu and searched for hotels with Kama Aina rates. That means discounts for locals. We got a very good price and the service was excellent. The room was a bit dated but clean and the service staff that cleaned the room was as good as any other hotel I have been to (and that is many fine hotels as I travel for work). The food was very good but not fantastic. The hotel is near a small shopping center which contains a couple of resturants. They had better food but they were also a bit more expensive. The hotel itself is right on the beach and right near Black Rock and the Sheraton. The beach was clean, the grass was cut short and all the grounds were well taken care of. They charge you a per diem for parking but getting in and out was easy and with the price of the room, the parking cost wasn't horrible. Sorry, I can't remember the price of the parking. The pool area was clean and neat and had an outdoor shower to clean off from the beach. There were plenty of lounge chairs with shady areas and sunny areas. The bar and the snack food area reminded me of being on a cruise. Well located (near the pool), it allowed some of the guys to catch up on the east coast sports. The "snack" bar had more than snacks and I ate too much. Basic pub fare but jeez, some of these places offer prepackaged cookies and chips as pub fare!! Lastly, some of the places on Maui are beginning to charge a "resort fee" ... I don't know what that is but this place doesn't charge a resort fee which I appreciated. Had a great vacation and enjoyed the time at the hotel to relax and enjoy the sound of the surf during the day and the Hawaiian music played but a live Hawiian band at night. Jack

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LosAltos_CATraveler
Reviews.Content: Great family vaction with our 3 kids (ages 6, 4 and 18 months). The pool and waterslide were great. The room (oceanfront corner unit) was well appointed, very clean and roomy enough for the whole family. The staff/concierge were always helpful. The breakfast buffet was overpriced ($17.50 per adult) and not recommended. Fortunately, the kitchenette in the room allowed for preparation of breakfast. Overall, very pleased with our stay and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for rest & relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Ashburn_Pats
Reviews.Content: We visited KBC for our 10-year wedding anniversary. My husband and I are in our mid-to-late 30's and were not traveling with children. We had traded in our timeshare week for a week on this property. The property is lush and green. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. Anytime we had questions, they were attentive to our needs. Their happy hour at their casual restaurant is very nice. They have 1/2 price fruity drinks during happy hour. The food was expensive (as are most things in Maui), but pretty good, especially when we didn't feel like going off-property. The bartenders are pretty personable and friendly. I had breakfast in the mornings at the nicer/fine dining restaurant. The buffet is pretty basic and has omelets and such. The views of Lanai from the restaurant are amazing on a clear days. They also have a casual take-out cafe for fast-food type stuff. We didn't try this cafe during our stay. We had a pretty sizeable room for the two of us. It was a one BR, king-size with living room and pull-out sofa. It had a dining room and kitchenette, with a full refrigerator, microwave, sink, toaster, and most kitchen cutlery. My only complaint was about the timeliness of room service. One day, we had been out all day and by 3 pm room service had not serviced our room. They arrived just as we got in at 3. Call me crazy, but I think room service should be done by then. We were in room 906 in the Ohana Tower. The room had a balcony with a couple of chairs, a small drink table and a lounging chaise. I frequently sat on the balcony on the lounger reading early in the morning or right before sunset. We overlooked the adjacent property and the pool, but had a good side view of the ocean. The only thing that I was only slightly annoyed about, which KBC could do nothing about, was the early construction noise of the new property next door - - truck noise and such. If you're a sensitive sleeper, you may want to request a room on the other side of the resort. I used the spa for a pedicure. It's by no means high-end, but gets the job done. The ladies there were very nice. Parking is $13/day in the garage regardless of whether or not you self-park or use valet. From what I understand, this is pretty standard for properties in Maui. Parking was never a problem. The elevators were a bit slow, especially coming from the lower level to upper levels, but we weren't really in a rush for anything, so the wait was the wait. The pool area has a waterfall pool area, a hot tub, a large pool, a kids pool and a water slide. It's pretty substantive and we never had issue finding open chairs at any time during the day. For those of you who want to work out while on vacation, they have a small work out room with cardio equipment, free weights, and nautilus equipment. From my view from the balcony, the work out room seemed to be well-used, especially in the mornings. My husband hit it a couple of times, but I was no where near there during this vacation. The beach that the resort is on is really pretty and didn't have many people on it. I'm thinking that we were there during non-peak, but I was really surprised that it wasn't bumper to bumper people. We were able to hang out really anywhere on the beach. For eating off-resort, we hit Pizza Paradiso, in the shopping center across the street from KBC. I wish we had hit it earlier in our trip. It's pretty good stuff. Also, we were about 15 minutes from Old Lahaina town, where all the restaurants and shopping are. There's a convenience store (ABC store) to the left of the resort, within walking distance. It's good for getting your macadamia nuts, magnets, and cheesy Hawaiian souvenirs. You can also hit the Safeway in Lahaina on the way to KBC to grab groceries for the week if you want to eat in a couple of times. I think that's it. All in all, it was a great experience. We would visit the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ka'anapali Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: pat2008_8
Reviews.Content: What a lovely resort! THis was our first trip to Hawaii EVER, and the open air lobby was beautiful. The pink is something else, lemme tell you. The front desk staff was very helpful (especially Cindy.) We were booked for a one BR w/ two double beds and the pullout in the lving room. Traveling w/ two teen boys I was a little doubtful as to how it would all work. After the first night, we asked to switch to a king BR instead. Not only was it not a problem, but the new room had a sensational view on the 12th floor! The bathroom was enormous! Granite in the kitchen and bath, high end. The TVs were regular as opposed to flat screens in the first room, but w/ views like that, who cares? Every morning to wake to those views were a delight. The breakfast was standard but convenient and the coffee was great. Omelet man? A hoot! The pool was never too crowded (spring break) and the bar and snack areas were also convenient. My kids LOVED the minigolf! Plus they also played real golf at the Ka'anapali Kai. Shopping on Front st. was fun, also dining and shopping in Whalers Village was great. Not too far away w/ our rental car either. We went snorkeling on the Quicksilver, it was ok, next time we'll just try off the beach at the hotel. The gym at the hotel was clean and most equipment was newer. Housekeeping did a great job. We had a super-late flight the day we left and the front desk was very accomodating with a late checkout. P.S. The towel thing ($50 per towel if lost!) was scary, but you get the hang of it and it's fine. I understand why they do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the disabled”
Reviews.Author: GEOHAGER
Reviews.Content: we had the pleasure of staying at this resort for a perfect week."I am Disabled and this resort was perfect for me to get around on a scooter.The room was large and great for a right hand only person. We rented a Beach wheel chair for spending time on the sand watching the ocean,plus lots of Whale activity.We will definitely return,Hopefully for more than a week.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: FamilyManUSA
Reviews.Content: My family (my wife and kids ages 7, 9 and 11) made our first trip to Hawaii in February 2008. Our trip to Maui was fabulous, and the Ka'anapali Beach Club was the main reason why. While I have read some reviews that tell of unfriendly staff and/or substandard rooms.......we experienced neither (and we are not timeshare owners). The staff at check-in was great. We were able to get into the room before the posted check-in hour. Our room was very nice and very clean. We had a "mountain view" reservation, but ended up in a room with a view that was 50% ocean and 50% coast line and mountains (see photo). The bathroom was huge with separate tub and shower, two sinks and room to do a fox trot in between. The King Bed was very comfortable and the pull-out was okay (but for the kids - it was fine). It was nice having the DVD player in the family room. There was plenty of closet space for luggage and clothes. Our package included breakfast - which was an awesome way to start each day. Coming from the east - we were early risers each day and really enjoyed the tables by the large windows looking out at the beach (see photo - nearly on the beach) and watching the daylight come out (and seeing the whales splash about). The main part of the buffet was good. The variety of food and drinks was terrific. The omlette station was fabulous. The omlette maker was tops (with his style and charisma - bam!!) and the omlettes were terrific. Lunch allows you to make good use of the small kitchen (fridge to keep the drinks cold and plenty of storage for the food/snacks). The eating area (and other furniture) was very nice. The AC worked very effectively and efficiently. The drive to Lahaina is no more than 10 minutes. Very convienient for an evening dinner run (with tons of options). While the possibilities are endless in Maui - we chose to spend a significant portion of our time at the KBC. The pool is great, the beach is literally steps away. In fact, if you rent a one of the covered "cabanas" (which were reasonable), you can watch the kids in parts of the pool and the beach (or all relax and enjoy some family time with a great view, but out of the sun for a bit). We enjoyed both pool and beach. Instead of chosing between the pool and beach each time you go down, they are so close, you actually do both. The slide was great for the 7 year old and we all enjoyed the water volleyball. There were plenty of beach chairs (and towels) available and the poolside bar and snack shop were closeby and very good (and reasonable). The putt-putt course was a fun time for the family. We did experience a couple of elevator hang-ups (slow elevators) - but we just went to the next tower and used the elevaors there. It was really not a big deal. And, as for the pink walls on the building, we liked the tropical feel it gave. Best of all, this was a convienient and safe environment for the family. If you have a room in the tower near the pool/beach, you can be from room to beach chair in approximately two minutes. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone that enjoys a stay at a resort with very nice (and spacious) rooms, friendly service and convenient access to a large pool/beach area.....all at a very competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: zippetyzee
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and had a great time. Our room was renovated and very spacious. Me and my husband were traveling with 2 kids (12 and 15). Our room had 2 full beds in the bedroom and the kids alternated nights on the couch (sleeper sofa was uncomfortable, so they opted to sleep on the couch instead). We did sign something at check in about the 50 dollar deposit for towels, but never had to do anything. When we wanted towels, we simply asked the front desk and that was all - NO DEPOSIT was ever requested and at the end of the day we simply put the wet towels in a basket and got fresh ones in the morning. The information in the room states that housekeeping is only twice a week unless you pay extra, but housekeeping came everyday and cleaned our room (including the dishes). We booked our stay through Hotels.com and maybe that was why. They charge 13 dollars a day for parking (self or valet). We were not pressured at all to sit through a timeshare meeting. We told the concierge that we weren't interested and that was that. The concierge was helpful at booking excursions, but I recommended shopping around a bit. They do give you discounted rates, but you may be able to get even more discounted rates through the countless activity wholesalers you'll see advertised in every pamphlet or magazine. Tips: -The Star Market accross the street is extremely expensive. The Safeway in Lahaina is a little cheaper. (everything is expensive in Hawaii) -Heard good reviews about Bubba Gumps, but was disappointed when we ate there. Recommend eating at Leilani's. -We used the book "Maui Revealed" to guide us on the road to Hana instead of the much advertised CD. Start out as early as possible. -We went bottom fishing instead of sport fishing, since me and my 12 year old niece were not likely to haul in a Marlin. Everyone caught fish (the biggest was a 18 lb snapper). We used Absolute Fishing and rented the whole boat for 4 hours for $550. - We also did horseback riding (Ironwood Stables), helicopter tour (Air Maui) and Snorkel tour to Molokini and turtle town (Quicksilver) - we enjoyed all of it.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: aprata
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom oceanfront on the eight floor. We rented from the owner directly the week of January 4-11 2008. We decided to stay here because we had previously toured the hotel and we were shown a one bedroom apartment which we liked. The apartment we were shown was newly renovated, but the one we were given upon check in was not - there was no flat screen tv or new furniture. You may want to ask at check in if they can give you a renovated unit. The pull-out sofa is not exactly comfy to sleep on. Overall I was disappointed with a few things - one, the pool is in deep need of maintenance, there are cracks on the bottom and sides; two, there was a heavy smell as soon as you headed on the beach to the left to walk, I believe there is some water maintenance or some sort of similar facility close by where the smell comes from. The balcony is so small you can barely sit there on a chair, you get light headed since you are so close to the edge. Location is not great either - there are two-three hotels close to each other in this area, and there are some stores right across, but this area is nothing like the nice stretch of beach and nightlife at Kaanapali Beach (where the Westin, Marriott Ocean Club and Hyatt Regency are). On a positive note, the grounds on the property are well kept, and the units are in decent condition. The hotel prices for food are typical for Hawaii - overpriced, mediocre food, expensive cocktail drinks in plastic glasses. The new covers on the pool chairs (they are naturally pink to match the horrible color of the hotel) are very comfy - they did not have them when we were there in May 2007 - but they are soaking wet in the morning - and it takes a while before they dry. Finding dry chairs at 7 am was always a challenge. Overall, I would not stay here again. It is ok but nothing spectacular, especially for the price. We will stay at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club in December 2008, see how that compares.

Reviews.Title: “All Rooms Not Created Equal”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle96
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the former Embassy/Sunterra version in Poipu, we were expecting comparable things from the Maui property. We were quite disappointed; our kids, ages 13, 15, and 17, said that they wouldn't go back. Our room, 603, was terrible - no tub, cheap shower curtain, broken telephone-style nozzle with clogged holes, minimal water pressure. Access to the bathroom was only through the bedroom. During the timeshare presentation on day 5, we realized that we were in a handicapped room that hadn't yet been renovated - our bad luck. The standard rooms are really quite lovely, not that we got to try one out. Hotel has a policy regarding towels, each of which requires a $50 deposit. Two days into our visit, my sons put their towels on a pool chair and went for a swim. Thirty minutes later, the sacred towels were gone, along with a room card. The concierge was unsympathetic, so there we were, down $100 already. Timeshare salespeople were fierce. After 3 hours, the saleswoman went into the lobby and tried to sell to my kids. I still can't believe it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: 3doglovr
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed here as part of their mini-vacation promotion that they use to get you to attend a timeshare presentation. We ended up buying but we had been considering a timeshare before we stayed here anyways. The presentation was not at all pressuring. That aside, we absolutely loved our stay here. I've read other reviews that complained about birds in the restaurant, long waits for elevators, inadequate beach, etc. We did not have these types of issues. While the elevators in some of the towers are closed for repairs, we never waited too long for the lobby elevators. There were always things to see during our short waits anyways. The beach was fabulous and even though it was spring break week, there was plenty of room to play in the pool or relax at poolside. Our stay included breakfast each morning in the hotel restaurant and it was better than most complimentary breakfasts we have had at other resorts/hotels. Of course there are birds flying around but it is an open air restaurant on the beach! Many of the local places are the same and we never had a bird land on our table. Our little boy loved watching them. Our room was huge, and included a very large master bedroom, gorgeous bathroom and equally spacious living/dining/kitchen area and it was spotless to boot. Daily housekeeping was fabulous and they even ran our dishwasher for our dirty dishes everyday. There is not an oven or stove but the front desk sent me up an electric skillet when I requested it. I had booked a scenic view and they upgraded us upon our arrival to a corner oceanview room. Our little boy loved playing mini-golf on the property and going to the pool and beach. There are also several large exotic talking birds in the lobby that he couldn't wait to visit everyday. The valet staff were always friendly and quick to retrieve our vehicle and their services were included in our package as well. Our rental car was also free in our package through the hotel. Our only complaint was that during our stay, the resort instituted a new policy requiring a $50 deposit for each hotel beach towel. We did get that deposit back once the towels were returned. I understand a deposit since many people were leaving their towels on the beach and taking them off property but I thought $50 was too steep. Some people started using the room towels once they instituted that policy. That aside, the hotel exceeded our expectations and we are looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place-- but caution”
Reviews.Author: debnlupy
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club rooms and facilities are nice. However- When booking a Ocean View room, keep in mind that the Beach Club's defination of Ocean View room is any room that you can see the ocean from the lanai. That includes a view of the ocean over the top of the roof of the condos next door! I booked 2 Ocean View rooms and one was surpurb and the other had an over the rooftop ocean view. Also, the front desk staff is totally inept at their jobs. They do not understand that the customer standing in front of them is providing them a job and an income. At every visit to the front desk, I learned not to interupt any conversations between employees (which are always happening) or any of their personel phone calls. If you happen to be rude enough to do so and ask for some service- you will recieve total rudeness in return, so be sure to wait till they are done!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: luvtrvling
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and 3 kids and can't say you can get a better property for the money. We've been to Hawaii many times and have stayed at several "nicer" properties, (Westin Kaanapali, Sheraton Kaanapali, Hyatt Regency in Kauii, Hilton Waikoloa on the Big Island) but can honestly say, you can't find a better deal than the Kaanapali Beach Club. It's not the Westin, but it's certainly a nice property for an amazing price. The property is dated, but clean and maintained. We constantly saw employees painting railings, dusting stairwells, etc.. However, the blue floor tile and pink paint are dated...if you're expecting new and updated, you'll be disappointed. If you can overlook that, you'll be pleased with a great location and great price. We booked directly through the hotel (phone number on website) and paid $945 for 5 nights, a rental car, and breakfast. I was a little wary and had low expectations for our room, but was extremely pleased. Without asking for it, we were put in a 2 bedroom unit. Two twin beds with a bathroom, a king bedroom with a bathroom, as well as a living area with a pull out couch, dining table and kitchen. We didn't have an ocean view, but the space to spread out was worth it with the kids. We stocked up at Costco prior to arrival and were able to eat most meals in. The room was clean and had everything we needed. Again, it's not a 5 star, but it's more than fine if you're looking for a great location at a great price. At check-in we were invited to obtain our "welcome gift" at the concierge which we knew would be a timeshare pitch. We never contacted the concierge and were never asked to listen to a timeshare presentation. Another nice surprise was the free breakfast for all five of us. The booking info stated, "free breakfast for two", but upon check-in we were told the breakfast was for all of us. Breakfast was typical buffet food, but served its purpose. The fresh fruit was delicious. Cooked to order omelettes were available if you were willing to wait in a short line. The man cooking omelettes was quite an entertainer! My hubby waited every day and was entertained and delighted by the "happy, joyous man" who "loved life and his job" as my husband put it. A full breakfast for five people was a huge moneysaver! Yes, the elevators were a pain and the two closest to our room were out of order and we had to wait maybe five minutes for the elevators sometimes. That would be my only complaint... how minor though for spending five nights in a beautiful location for such a great rate. To make up for the slow elevators, the valet always retrieved our car in record time. We waited no more than two minutes for our car and the valets were always smiling, friendly and able to give advice if you asked. Happy hour nightly from 4:30 to 6:30 was great. Wine for $3.00 a glass and live music at the pool was super. There is a kids' menu with all items for $2.00. Not sure if that's offered all the time or just at happy hour, but what a deal. Beach views from this property are great. As with most of West Maui you can enjoy views of Lanai and Molakai. The beach was sandy and you could easily get in the water. The red flag was up the entire time we were there...not sure if this is standard practice as a [--] or if the conditions truly warranted it. Many people, including me, went in the water and had no issue. I'm a strong swimmer, but not an idiot. I would not enter the water if it seemed dangerous. Rocks are in the water about 4 - 5 feet out. We didn't snorkel here so I can't comment on that. There's a small gym overlooking the pool with brand new equipment. Hubby and I were able to work out each morning and watch the kids swimming in the pool. There are maybe 6 cardio machines and eight leg and/or arm machines. Not a lot, but in brand new condition and able to accommodate a basic workout. Property is very conveniently located to Whaler's Village as well as Honolua Bay (amazing snorkeling!). No more than a ten minute drive in either direction. There's also a Star Market across the street and within walking distance for groceries. I can't say what a great experience we had at this property. Taking your family to Hawaii is no cheap undertaking and this property makes it affordable and pleasant. I'd highly recommend it for a family or anyone wanting a nice trip, but not expecting a five star property. There seemed to be quite a few families there, so if you're looking to get away from kids, this may not be the place. If you're looking to be pampered, this may not be the place. For those desiring a nice location, nice views, nice staff this is the place. I'd definitely return to the Kaanapali Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return here”
Reviews.Author: Ackers00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the beginning of November, 2007 for a week. My biggest complaint is that it wasn't long enough. We exchanged one of our time-share weeks with RCI. Tried to get 2 weeks but couldn't. This resort is fabulous - great location on the beach, wonderful pool with onsite scuba lessons, scuba diving right from the shore, good restaurants, clean and comfortable accommodation, spacious suites, friendly and helpful staff and onsite gift/convenience store. Only drawback was the price of the parking. A bit steep in our opinion. However it was very secure. We were invited to an introductory 'breakfast', which we suspected was a time-share presentation, but as we'd never been to Maui before we went to see what was available in the way of tours etc. We had the breakfast and stayed to hear about the tours and shows, booked a couple of things and then left before the presentation started. No-one hassled us to stay when we said we already had a time-share in Mexico. So that was fine. We'll definitely be returning to this resort. However next time we'll ask for a room overlooking the pool instead of the back alley!! But in Maui even the back alleys are quite beautiful. What a place!!

Reviews.Title: “our second home”
Reviews.Author: dagdud
Reviews.Content: we first went here for our honeymoon in 1990. went back in 2000 and also bought a week here. we have been back in 2005 and 2007, each time buying another week. we have found this resort to be unbelievable. because we never set our expectations to high, we have been amazed that everytime we go it gets better. from the people to the location, we might find something as good but not for the same money. we are always treated like royalty here. i am sure one reason is that we treat the staff with respect as well. a vacation here is what you make it and how you handle adversity. in hawaii the relaxed atmosphere always enables us to see the big picture, this is the best place to relax and enjoy life to its fullest...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: marcosflores
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a big family vacation for five nights. I thought the hotel was very nice, but I guess I'm easily impressed. We had an ocean view room, but it really faced the pool. Still, we could see the ocean pretty easily from our balcony. The rooms seemed clean and welcoming to me. I loved the bathroom. It was huge. We ate the breakfast buffet every morning and they had plenty of variety. I would definitely stay here again if I ever get to go back to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: Lissy1111
Reviews.Content: Our kids stayed here and they were right about it. They had complaints of Bed Bugs in their room, while never seen they woke up with bumps and rashes on their back and stomachs. And they were on their honeymoon to make it even worse. But this was a couple years ago and we thought we would try it for two nights while in Maui. IT WAS HORRIBLE like they said. Take peoples advice when they say it is bad. The resort itself is very nice, pool area very large. Water was freezing and treamendously windy. Very close to Lahaina and was very quiet despite being so large. Rooms large, and looked clean.... they weren't. We checked out after our first night. We all recommend the wailea side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MHOV
Reviews.Content: Wife & I have owned at KBC since 2005, We had a deluxe ocean view that was INCREDIBLE. We could sit on the deck and watch Whales all day. Most of the staff is very friendly, pleasant. Ohana grill needs to be updated, More tvs. We had to go in town to watch the super bowl. Steve Cloobeck who owns Diamond Resorts is slowly updating the property. While we were there all brand new fitness equipment was placed in the fitness room. The elavators need to updated, Sometimes you'll wait 10 mins for an elavator. We had a great time and look forward to going back in a couple yrs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad decor(pink paint w/ green tile)”
Reviews.Author: daisyandduke
Reviews.Content: Went for a time share presentation and after 5 hrs ended up buying. They gave us a room to stay at for our last night which was very nice. Once you get past the color pink and the dated green tile you open the door to your room and fall in love!!! The rooms ROCK! Decorated with Tommy Bahama furniture, has a living room and a full kitchen. There are 2 balconies, one from the master bdrm, one from the living room. We really LOVE the rooms. We are hoping that someday they will match the decor outside as well. That PINK paint and UGLY green tile must go. Something like saltillo throughout with a light taupe paint would look gorgeous . Just one possibility..... lets get rid of the pink please!!!!!!!! One more complaint, the food at the northshore restaurant was quite awful. My husband ordered the ribs which was excellent. i ordered the most bland fish of the day (MAUI MAUI) which I normally love and it had nooo flavor. For the price you think you are guaranteed something tasty. so we'll pass at the restaurant in the future. Too many great places on kaanapali beach to choose from. Hope this was helpful,. Still not sure if we made the right decision to purchase 3500 points. please let us know your own experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow, Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Yippiehoo
Reviews.Content: This place was beautiful! We had booked an ocean front room but got a side room on the top floor. We were disappointed at first. The front desk found an opening our last 2 nights to be ocean front. We actually loved the top floor room. It had been re-done and it was gorgeous and huge! We had a view of the moutains and the beach. Our oceanfront room was on the 5th floor and you could listen to the waves and watch whales. Our package included the breakfast buffet. There were many choices of fruit, hot food, cold food and even a guy who made omelettes. He was very entertaining. The dining room had fish tanks that lit up at night and were really cool. I took a quick dip in the pool. It was nice but cold. The hot tub was great though. Went to the timeshare meeting. It is an option for you. If you can withstand it, you get some spending money out of it and a 2 night stay at one of their timeshares. Hint: the parking garage can get full on the first level you go into. If you drive down one more level you usually can find a spot close to the stairs which is easier to get to than driving around trying to find one or parking far away. Beach is not crowded here. I got some really cool handmade jewelry from 2 different people who had tables in the lobby. They had stuff that was different than the normal jewelry you see everywhere else. Prices were good also. We definitely would go back here. Soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: adamskiclan4
Reviews.Content: Our family had such a wonderful time that we didnâ€™t want to leave. The Kaanapali Beach Club was a fabulous place to stay. We had visited Maui in the past and stayed in a beachfront condo, which was very nice and practical with 2 small children. This was our first time visiting the Kaanapali Beach area, and with our children ages 7 & 10 now, we wanted to stay in resort setting. The Kaanapali Beach Club was very accommodating and was perfect for our family. We had a beautiful ocean view room on the 11th floor facing the North, toward Napili, 2nd unit from the direct ocean front. The view was incredible. We could see the coastline for miles away. The first day as we walked into our room there was a full rainbow right outside our lanai. The rooms were very nicely decorated with a Tommy Bahama Tropical theme using dark woods, granite counter tops throughout, a large bathroom with plenty of room for all four family members, without feeling crowded. The sheets, bedding and bath towels were very cozy and smelt fresh and fluffy. The kitchen offered a full refrigerator, sink & dishwasher, but no oven or stove. However, if you call House Keeping, they will be happy to bring up an electric skillet. We started our mornings off with eggs, Hawaiian toast and Kona coffee every morning on our lanai, AAAAHHHH!!! Everything was more than comfortable. I canâ€™t express enough how enjoyable it was. There were many things that we loved about KBC. To name a few, the location was perfect, not overcrowded compared to The Whalers Village area. We were always able to be seated without a wait. The beach was perfect for swimming, snorkeling, boogie boarding and playing in the sand. The pool was child friendly with a small slide, rock waterfall, water volley ball and Jacuzzi. The pool offered complimentary towels and beach rentals, as well as poolside service. There are several restaurants on the property the made our stay convenient. The Ohana Grill is a ground level outdoor grill with a view of the pool and ocean with plenty of choices, as well as a $2.00 kiekie menu. The North Beach Restaurant is fine dining that is on the ground level direct ocean front with a fabulous menu. There is a cafÃ© and snack bar near the pool, as well as a breakfast buffet that we didnâ€™t try. This resort also has a miniature golf course and an arcade. Everything about this resort was wonderful with plenty to offer. I will rate this vacation as the best family vacation so far and will definitely stay at the KBC again when visiting the island of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kaanapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoW_traveler
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach Club (formerly the Embassy Suites) is still one of the best values in Kaanapali. It has a great location, nice beach, decent gym, and great views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: odellrob
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely week at the KBC. Excellent location on the northern portion of Kaanapali Beach. The hotel is right on the beach, making the walk from the bar to the beach very quick! We stayed on the 10th floor directly over the beach and enjoyed fabulous views of Lanai and Molokai and spectacular sunsets and rainbows during the light rainy periods. The lobby and restaurant areas are very nicely done and comfortable. The remainder of the floors are rather bland...no plants, no decorations, no nothing...and the pink color of the building is somewhat bothersome!! The room was very nice. A one bedroom, living room, dining area and kitchenette. The bathroom was very large with two sink areas. Two mounted flat screen TV's were also provided. The only downside was the entire property has gone non-smoking. Good news I guess for lots of people, but a real pain for those of us who partake of tobacco! Naturally, smokers flaunted the rules and smoked off to the edges and on their balconies. Overall, an enjoyable trip but not worth the money they charge for it I think. We stayed at the Westin KB three years ago and would go there again if we ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great. Okay for a few days, but buy there? Not me.”
Reviews.Author: Sonoran_Skies
Reviews.Content: The bed was wonderful! Location is good. Check in was just fine. The room was clean, newly redone and spacious. Nothing you'd call a kitchen though --no stove top or oven -- so calling it a condominium is not truthful. Nor is there a washer or drier. Buy there? For 41 grand? Not bloody likely. There is no kids club, they'll give you a brochure for some nanny service that charges $18 an hour for one child. Their concierge service is nice, but very focused on their own service providers. They'll go out of their way to discourage you from using service providers they don't know. They have no real activities for guests. They'll tell you that their services are 10% off, but it's the same or even more than the same provider's website prices. If you're a diver, you'll end up finding your own shop. I can recommend Lahaina Divers in Lahaina. Food was expensive, $7.50 for a 6 oz rum and coke (well price) and $13 for a hamburger. The pool is nice and well maintained. Grounds are very pretty and very nicely done. Very nice beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer1379
Reviews.Content: We stayed here by exchanging our timeshare week in FL and were pleased with the hotel. The front desk wasn't overly friendly and I did feel second class checking in. The person checking us in said we wouldn't have housekeeping everyday (unless we paid $75.00 a day), we had to pay $12.00 a day to park and we had a discount cocktail hour. The person next to us had free parking, maid service everyday and an open cocktail hour. The difference I was told was due to the package difference. All these options were included in his package, but because we were timeshare, we didn't have the inclusions. -- So, just know that if your renting the unit per day, look to make sure you have these things included - and those that are staying on exchange - don't! Units are very clean and the grounds are kept up very well. I never heard any noise from other rooms and only once heard people in the hallway. Beach outside the hotel is very nice. We had a one bedroom with kitchenette - doesn't include an oven nor a washer and dryer. There are washer and dryers on every even floor (12 floors total) and for $1.50 for wash and 1.25 per dry you can wash clothes - and they sell single use detergent right next to the washer for 1.00. We had a good time here and would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at The Pink”
Reviews.Author: adipocytes
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here back in June '07, and overall, we were pleased with the facilities and the staff. The rooms were very nice, though our room was directly above the hotel's massive air conditioning unit thingys; unfortunately, this is where the section with wheelchair accessible rooms & bathrooms are. Therefore, we really couldn't enjoy the balcony very much nor keep the sliding glass doors open because it was too noisy. The food wasn't too badly priced, considering this was Hawaii. One other note: apparently, there is a water waste treatment facility nearby. You could smell it sometimes when turning left off Honoapiilani Hwy onto Lower Honoapiilani Rd, but we never could smell it at the resort itself. Overall, it is a decent, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great oceanfront resort”
Reviews.Author: swandak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. We found it on craigslist. The timeshare owner sold the last 5 nights of his two week stay as he couldn't stay there the whole time. So we got a great deal! LOVED the oceanfront location. We were on the third floor on the corner and it was heavenly opening the doors out to the lanai and listening to the waves all day.
