The sunsets were gorgeous, and the sunrises were, too. We came to Hawaii for our 25th wedding anniversary and were looking for somewhere quiet and relaxing. We never heard any of the other guests, and it may have been the time of year, but the resort didn't seem to be crowded. It did get busier as the week went on and as the weather got nicer. We stayed at the tail end of a big storm, so the 2nd level parking lot was flooded. There were still sandbags in the open air lobby to keep the water out and wet floor cones everywhere. They had to move the cushions from the furniture inside, too. But we loved it. No stove, but they will bring you an electric skillet if you ask. The hot tub was lovely. Very nice pool. Nice beach out front. The room was lovely. It was VERY clean and the bathroom was HUGE. The tub is deep, but short. We'd definitely come here again, maybe not a the company's prices, but if we could get a resale from an owner. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “nice resort”
Reviews.Author: wndrwmn818
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a week with friends who had booked a package through the resort. Our friends had stayed at the resort in 2006 for their honeymoon. We had 4 adults in the one bedroom unit. There is a king bed in the bedroom & a sleeper in the living room. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is quite large. The toliet has a seperate room which was helpful given that there were 4 of us sharing the bathroom. Our room was on the 12th floor and had an amazing view of the ocean & beach as well as the mountain. We even saw a rainbow one day from our balcony. We were very pleased with the property. The building and grounds were clean and the staff was friendly. The resort used to offer a free happy hour daily, however they no longer do this. They do offer reduced prices on certain drinks and have live music for happy hour. We had breakfast included daily with our package which was great way to start our day. We had stocked our fridge for lunch & snacks but we also ordered food at the pool a few times. The food was good at both locations. We liked this resort and plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: camkis
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous facility, the condos are perfect, large bathroom, beautiful views, very upscale. Just prepare to pay for parking, even if you do self-park and not valet, there's about a $10/day charge. Other than that, no complains, it was absolutely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Update on Ka'anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: louismarelise
Reviews.Content: We've just spent two weeks at this resort with twin 20 month olds. What a GREAT place to stay. The staff was so friendly. Great pool area and one of the best beaches in Western Maui just 5 yards from the pool. The best snorkling (other than at Molokini), was right there in front of the resort! We stayed in a one bedroom suite and the rooms (living room and bedroom) offered great privacy with a flat screen TV in each area and the twins taking naps didn't even know of our existance in the other room (and vice versa). We discovered a small children play park along the beach just 1/2 a mile up the road from the resort, with a tide pool that is perfect for toddlers. I think this resort is very well suited for parents with children of all ages. They have remoddled the resort recently and I would certainly place this resort between a 4 and a 5 star resort. We were very impressed with the spacious suites and huge bathrooms. I found the suites and the balcony area very well cleaned and believe me my twins crawled in every area. I think an important change is that they've stopped the happy hour from Oct. 1, this year. They now only offer 3-4 drinks at a discount price between 4:30 and 6:30 pm. The resort does offer relaxing live music during this time, which is at least a perk. They still offer an incentive if you attend a 90 minute time share meeting (with no obligation to buy). The incentive is 10% off an excursion offered through the hotel and mahalo (thank you) dollars which you can use towards hotel incidental charges or excursions and restaurants ($100 to $200 depending on the season). This was welcome to us as we used it towards the parking fee they charged per day. This is the only negative I can say about this resort. They have underground valet parking, but charge you $12 per day and that does not even include the tips you'll likely be giving the valet driver. There isn't really an alternative parking. On the positive side...the valet drivers are exceptionally friendly and it's good to be greated with such friendly smiles and a cool car. I highly recommend this resort and plan to stay here again during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: chim52chim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon from 9/2-9/9 of this year. What an amazing place. We had a 9th floor ocean view facing south and what an awesome moment when you watch the sun set over the water from your balcony. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying at the best hotel in Maui. Also I would like to suggest you see Mark in the concierge desk to set up some memorable trips around the island!!!! A+++

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LoveMauiMn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct 9-16 for our anniversary. We got 2 rooms right next to each other as one of the few connected rooms was not available. One for my parents and one for us (with a toddler). We were in the middle tower on 11th floor facing north (a partial view of ocean and mountain). We were facing the back road but we didnâ€™t care as we were on 11th floor. We were glad that we were not facing the south as we could see major construction. Both rooms were clean and spacious. We loved its bathtub and having two sinks were very nice. It will be nice to have a full kitchen but the electric skillet was sufficient for us. We did not eat at the restaurant and we did not use much of their amenities except getting beach towels everyday. My husband mentioned to one of the hotel staff that we were celebrating our anniversary. They brought us a card and a bottle of Champaign. It was great location. Valet parking was nice. We did not have any problems with elevators. We received prompt responses from the staff when we needed. It will be nice to have two laundries on the each floor. If we were to come back to Maui every year, we would buy this timeshare because of its location and its spacious room. Instead we ended up buying the timeshare with a different company as we wanted to able to have more options. However we did not spent much time on getting information on their timeshare and we did not attend one of those sessions.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: My group stayed at this resort from October 1-8, 2007. We absolutely loved it. We had two different rooms. Both had a view of the pool and the ocean. I would absolutely stay here again just based on the location. The property is beautiful. We did not encounter any problems with the elevators or anything about the hotel. The only complaint I have is that it seemed to take forever for the hot water to start working in the shower. We had the free breakfast the first morning. The food was alright.... It was a meeting to encourage you to book activities through the hotel. There was some good entertainment. The concierge staff was wonderful! I would definitely stay here again. My group stayed here because one of the people in my group was able to use her mother's time share to get us rooms. If you come and are not an owner, you will not get hit up for a timeshare presentation unless you admit to making more then 65k per year and are a homeowner. I personally would not suggest paying $12 for the buffet breakfast. I was not entirely crazy about it (potatoes were not good, eggs were average at best), although the omelette chef was very entertaining if you want to wait several minutes for an omelette (I did not). We did this once and ate breakfast in the room all other days. The drinks are also spendy. I ordered a Jack & Coke at the Ohana Bar and Grill. It came in a small disposable plastic cup and was $8.95. There is a Costco right as you are leaving the airport. Next time I go, I am stopping there first! On the drive to the hotel you will run into a Safeway at the Lahaina Cannery Mall. There is also a Star Market across the street from the hotel. It was a bit pricey (not sure if those were standard Hawaii grocery prices or not). There is also an ABC store about a block or two from the hotel as well. Parking was $12 per day and maid service was $4 per day. We had a great time in Lahaina eating at HRC and Bubba Gumps. It is fun to walk along Front St. at night, there was live music at some places. You get the beauty of Maui during the day and fun nightlife in the evening. I also highly recommend taking a kayak/snorkel trip or a snorkel cruise and taking a guided hike. The snorkeling is breathtaking! The road to Hana was an amazing trip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooner's Dream!”
Reviews.Author: woodrowswife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We were able to go thanks to his parents' Sunterra timeshare ownership. We stayed for 6 nights and loved every minute! We got a bottle of champagne in our room and had a beautiful view of the pool and ocean. You are eligible for a complimentary breakfast buffet the morning after you arrive if you attend their Island Orientation, which is actually quite helpful in terms of learning about and reserving activities for your trip. It was nice that we could book our activities through the resort staff and it would be charged to our room, rather than having to pay up front. The resort also offered several discounts for booking things through them. They would leave your tix at the front desk and it was that easy! We recommend renting a car if you are traveling to Maui, it came in very handy. Parking here is $12/day and there is a daily room tax of about $4-$5. You can park yourself or there is a free valet service, which we took advantage of. The breakfast buffet that the resort offers is $12.50 per person and wasn't that magnificent. The nightly manager's reception was from 4-6 and offered limited selection of free drinks and some light snacks. We only went once, and found the drinks to be too strong. The grounds there are absolutely beautiful, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The pool was never crowded and was very clean. Rooms were spacious and clean as well. The balconies are nice and long but not very wide. The bathroom was wonderful with a see-through shower and a soaking tub, as well as two sinks! Full-length mirrors on both doors of the closet in the bedroom and bathroom. TVs in the bedroom and living room. Some newer rooms had flatscreen TVs on the walls, ours were in entertainment centers but still nice. There were two restaurants on site; we tried the Ohana Bar and Grill and found the food to be quite tasty, but a little overpriced (as is everything else in Hawaii!) Our favorite drink at Ohana Bar and Grill was the Molokai Monkey- delicious! But at $7.75 a drink, we only had a few!! Overall, we thouroughly enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant time”
Reviews.Author: jemma024
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one week as part of our honeymoon check in was fast and friendly . we also received two lots of champane left for us in our room with a congrats card. the room was big and clean we had a lovely view and had no complaints the hole trip the resturants had such taste food the setting was magical the staff were very friendly and chatty the pool was a good size and the beach had comfterbale double sun beds and cabains to rent out you had loads of things going on if u wanted a break from relaxing by the pool etc. it was a perfect place to go for a honey moon i cant wait to go back in a few years

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel/Timeshare!”
Reviews.Author: moilchix
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and highly recommend it. The staff was very friendly, and we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room. The room is the best I have ever seen. Very spacious, clean, and updated. We loved the breakfast, happy hour, pool and beach. I would say the restaurants are too expensive at the hotel, but there are plenty of less expensive ones close by. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, especially for a honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: Dawni14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the second week of our honeymoon a year ago when it was the Embassy Suites and we are going back with friends in Nov for an anniversary trip. We had a great time on our honeymoon. Our room was wonderful- they mistakenly booked us a room with two double beds and upon hearing that it was our honeymoon they promptly gave us one with a king bed and upgraded us to and ocean view room on the top floor. Spacious room and bathroom and the kitchenette was fine for us. Service was great, we had no problems at all. The pool was a bit crowded, but so are most resort pools. I am a very picky eater and I thought the breakfast buffet was fine. The restaurant has doors on the front that are open to see and hear the ocean, so yes, there were some flies near the fruit and birds flying around at times, but the food was fine, especially the fresh made omlet bar with chefs who were very entertaining. As someone else mentioned the self-park fee and valet fee are the same so why not just valet and save yourself the trouble of lugging your own luggage when checking in and out. Self-park on other days as we did and we had no problems. So what if your spot isn't near the door and you have to walk a bit! We took the timeshare tour to get money to use at various restaurants, etc. There was no pressure to buy and no anger when we said we couldn't buy one at the time. We got $200 and a free lunch for sitting for 90 mins and learning about Sunterra. Not too bad in my opinion! The free happy hours with live music everyday were great too. all-in-all a great place and we can't wait to go back in Nov!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: ThatBrownGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. No complaints. It's a timeshare, so unless you get a deal (that includes a presentation), it can be pricey. You need a car to get around, but why would you? Maui is paradise, but oceanfront property and DAILY happy hour that goes for 3 hours? Hang loose, enjoy the view and take it easy!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: OHtraveler4
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here July 14-July 19, coming from the Sheraton Waikiki (Honolulu). I booked 5nights / 6 days as part of the timeshare package. Upon arrival, I was embarrassed of the outdated giant pink building! Our room appeared nice, but had an odor of possible wet carpet left untreated. Our room was a scenic-view room that overlooked the mini-golf course .. which gave me the impression that I was staying at a Motel 6 that certainly could not be located in Hawaii!! Upon hearing my disappointment, the hotel staff was VERY accomodating and willing to refund my stay or upgrade my room. I settled for the upgrade (the rest of my family was rather pleased with the hotel). We were moved to a room with a partial ocean view room, which actually had a beautiful view of the ocean and pond below. This room had no odor! The size of the room was outstanding for my family of 4 and had beautiful granite counters and tile. The bathroom was HUGE! and gorgeous!! The beach area was so-so, but I prefer a more populated area (the best beach area is near Black Rock). The pool area was nice and my daughter enjoyed the water slide on the first day only (the following days it was run by another staff worker who very strict). The snack area / beach restaurant needs to invest in new (clean) seat cushions, and could use to lighten up on the pricing. The breakfast buffet was good (omlets were the best), but because breakfast was included in our package it was great! The concierge desk was very helpful when planning our liau and surf lessons. The also gave great tips for our Road to Hana, but HINT: pay the money and go on a shuttled tour!!! Overall, our stay at the Kaanapali Beach Club was nice and the deal was unbeatable! However, my next trip to Maui will be to the Sheraton Maui hotel located right next to Black Rock. The Sheraton Maui is more my style and what I expect out of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mched
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and 2 daughters ages 6 and 8 stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club July 29 - Aug 5th. We purchased this timeshare through a timeshare re-sale company last year, sight unseen. I must say that we were pleasantly surprised with this resort. I read many reviews complaining about the staff, we did not encounter any problems at all. We found them to be very pleasant and helpful. The location of the resort is just a few minutes drive from all the places we wanted to go like Whalers Village, Front Street, Kapalua etc. The longest drive we had to make besides to and from the airport was when we went to the Maui Ocean Center Aquarium, which was definately worth it. This resort may not be as large or as nice as the Marriott or the Westin, but it is well worth the trip and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience!”
Reviews.Author: PaulDarlaCa
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club with my family. The accomodations were very nice. We had an ocean view 1 bedroom suite. The rooms are large with a kitchenette and family room. The bathroom is very roomy with a two sinks and ceramic throughout. The huge swimming pool and surrounding landscape with Koi ponds throughout set the mood for relaxation. The service and staff were friendly and accomodating. Would love to see an ugrade to furnishings, although some of the suites were very well appointed. The location was close to Lahaina and Kaanapali shores, and plenty of snorkeling. Needless to say we loved it, as we ended up purchasing a timeshare through Sunterra! One very happy family.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy at Ka anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: wildheart59
Reviews.Content: The staff is soso friendly. The rooms are nice. when we were there, at the beginning of summer, June 17-22, the minature golf was closed,and the wind was blowing so hard you could not lay out at pool or beach. If you did you had to anchor everything down and the sand pelting you was not fun. The beach is not kid friendly it is rough waters. Half of the arcade games were not working. The food in the morning is Basic buffet food. No rice or noodles. And watch out for the birds bombing for food in the morning. The pool slide is for the young. Not a place for teens.

Reviews.Title: “ColoradoFamily”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoFamily05
Reviews.Content: First, I will say that we have been owners of a timeshare here since 2002. Since then, we have stayed here each summer sometimes for 2 weeks and lately for 1. While I would call it a resort, I certainly would not compare it to the Grand Wailea or others at this level. The KBC was once an Embassy Suites Hotel and is now is a timeshare. At this point, I think it is moslty owners staying but they do rent rooms to use capacity and to attract buyers through various deals. My family and I originally went there summer 2002 booking it as though it were an Embassy (which is a preferred accomodation when travelling as a family-- we have 3 kids)-- so we were a bit suprised at the time to find it really was a timeshare-- I think it was owned by Goldman Sachs at the time but there have been several ownership changes since then, one very recently) To me, it is still on the level of an Embassy Suites. The rooms are comfortable (I agree with some of the reviews on bedding-- mattresses are only OK and nowadays, many hotels are suppying much better mattresses). I believe all rooms have received new furniture over the last 2 years and most also have new TV's (though ours in June did not). The bathroom is huge and there is that odd feature of sliding doors in both the bath and the bedroom that you can pass through. Each room has a terrace. Some face the mountains and some are ocean front or ocean view.The kitchenette is just that-- a kitchenette. No stove, just a fridge and a microwave (and a dishwasher). It is not a condo with a full kitchen.There are a couple of grills on the ground level but in general, you cannot prepare big meals here. It fine for light breakfast or lunch. We do stay in the deluxe oceanfront and we do get a high floor each stay. The views are excellent. The grounds are clean and well maintained. For food, the grill is fine and the restaurant is good, not great. They still maintain the Embassy tradition of a free 2 hour cocktail gathering daily with limited choice. We probaly do this once or twice each week. The pool is good but is outdated based on other new hotels. The beach is decent, probably best suited for snorkeling. The elevator service can be inadequate when fixes/maintainence is underway. Rumor has it the new owner agree on the elevator issue and plans to improve. Perhaps, we'll see. We use this place primarily as accomodations. We almost never spend a day on grounds-- there's just so much to do. Napili beach for example is 5 minutes away and is routinely listed as one of the 10 best in the world. But we also drive to the other side of the island to go to McKenna, Chang's or even Fleming close by. These are among the very best beaches in the world, so why stay on grounds? Same with the pool-- it is nice but our use tends to be late afternoon when we get back from a day away. The time of year we go (late June) is definately family time. There is very little to do at night other than to walk to the Jazz bar nearby or drive into Lahaina or Kaanapali. But that's fine with us as we are a family and not seeking late nights. We stopped doing the breakfast years ago. While it has been upgraded, It does get tired and the price has tripled since we began visiting. The restaurant is pretty good-- certainly there are better in Lahaina and nearby. But we always go to it at least once. We have found the rooms and general areas to be quite clean. We have never experienced bugs but I know from friends that live in Maui that bugs are a huge issue in general due to the lush environment. We have found the staff to be friendly (agree with other reviewers that the Valet folks are tops). This may be due to our status as owners, I cannot say but have always found it this way. My wife and I visited Maui last january without the kids. We stayed at the Renaissance (due to be demolished later this year I believe) and it certainly was a true resort-- fancier, facilties, etc.. But it was also over $500 night in mid January (off season) and some of the high-end resorts in Wailea go for $700 or more in season with a smaller room. The KBC, when it rents like a hotel is considerably less expensive. Even compared to other local Timeshares (Westin, Marriot) it is not as fancy but the KBC purchase price is a fraction of these. So on balance, we love the place. It is exactly what it tries to be-- clean, nice, fair price-- and I expect we will be visiting for may years to come.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily1
Reviews.Content: We just got home after 7 days at this hotel. We booked online and got a great deal by agreeing to go through a timeshare presentation. I called ahead to request a room on a lower floor because I read about the elevator problems. We got a room on the 4th floor. The elevators were slow and sometimes not working which was very frustrating. Check in was smooth. We were pleased with our room and our partial ocean view. The bathroom was a very nice size and clean. The mini kitchen was just right for our family of 5. We went to Safeway and bought drinks and food for lunch. The bedroom was a bit outdated, the bedding was worn out and the TV was very small. The living room TV was larger although it was not a plasma as advertised. There was also a DVD player. My kids slept on the sofa bed so the sleeping arrangement was very good for our family. There were some stains and chipped paint in the room. The breakfast buffet was okay. I definitely would not pay for it. It was included in our package so we ate there most of the time. The omlette guy was very nice, but the other staff was not as friendly at breakfast. We ate dinner at the North Beach Grill one night and the food and servie was excellent. It looks like another restaurant in the evening. The pool was just okay. It needs some renovation as does a lot of the hotel. My kids enjoyed the slide and it was nice to have the beach right there. We rented a cabana for 3 days for $90. It was a great deal since the beach was so windy and it protected us from the flying sand. Plus, they do not allow other chairs on their beach. It also helped when we asked them to pull the cabana up near the pool since it was difficult to find empty chairs. The lady at the pool Barb was very nice but the other guy that works there was lazy and rude. He did not want to move our cabana and asked my son why he wanted fresh pool towels. I did not expect to be treated that way on this vacation. Luckily he was not there on the other days. The hotel grounds were kept fairly nice but certain areas could use a fresh coat of paint. Parking was not good. They were usually full or the spaces were too small. If you park at the lower level there is no elevator which made it difficult with my kids and carrying our luggage and groceries. The hotel offered a happy hour. It was simple and nothing too great, but it was free and there were many people there taking advantage of it. My kids enjoyed the miniature golf ($5 per person). We ate at some great restaurants on the island- Sansei, Pineapple Grill, Mama's Fish House (pricey but worth it for the view and location) and Aloha Plate (reasonable prices) and the North Beach Grill in the hotel. All in all, we got a great deal on this trip and I feel like we got what we paid for. Yes, there are negatives (elevators, parking, outdated bedding, the need for renovations around the hotel, certain service issues) but they are things that we could live with for the price that we paid for this vacation. We went through the timeshare presentation and even though it sounded like a great deal to buy one we ultimately decided not to because in the future we would like to stay in nicer hotels with better service and ammenities. But for another trip on a budget, we might consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall”
Reviews.Author: Olizgrl05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort as guests of the timeshare owners. We loved everything about it. The rooms were excellent, the staff were always polite and our view was great. They offer free cocktails from 4-6 pm, 7 days a week. Personally, having a view of the beautiful mountains isn't anything to complain about considering when you're in Maui, the least thing you want to do is spend your days/nights inside of the hotel. Anyone who stays as a guest at a timeshare, is typically asked to attend the 1 hour seminar, which we've done in the past. We knew prior to the seminar that we weren't planning to purchase through them, so we played good cop/bad cop. We were offered one final chance to buy a Encore package, which included one week at the resort (location depends on how early you book) Breakfast Buffet for your party for a total of 7 days (which is excellent) and countless activity discounts. We purchased and we were told this amount will be applied towards our purchase of a timeshare, should we choose, which we won't because we're making a purchase from a timeshare sales company. I too have heard many negative things about RCI, so if you do purchase from them or a current owner, make sure they're not still with RCI. The resort has since switched to II or Interval International, a points system. Works great as our friends use it all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & grounds”
Reviews.Author: kzywyfyx
Reviews.Content: Even though Hotels.com had this hotel listed as 'Kaanapali Beach Vacation Resort', it turned out to be 'Kaanapali Beach Club', when we finally found it. We had a wonderful one bedroom suite with a partial kitchen and king sized bed with a large bathroom. The bathroom had a separate tub and shower, but the tub was not a whirlpool, which seemed a little strange but it was stil very nice. We had none of the problems some other previous guests seemed to describe in older reports on this hotel. Our only complaint was that the room we were in was over the loading dock area and we often heard the backup beepers of delivery trucks early in the morning making their deliveries. I didn't care for the opern air configuration of the dining room as it allowed birds to be present, flying in and out at their leisure and landing on and feeding on the tables whether fresh or used.

Reviews.Title: “Buyers Beware”
Reviews.Author: PooDooVooDoo
Reviews.Content: As a timeshare owner at KBC, I want to give my opinion as to two things you need to be aware of prior to putting ink to paper with regard to purchasing and owning a time share here. The first is that every time you visit be aware that they are always trying to sell you some thing. One of the first things you are asked when checking in is if you want to set up a meeting with your sales rep to get a "hotel update". What this turns into is a sales opportunity for them to upgrade your annual room package, number of weeks per year or if you are on an every other year package - converting it to an annual package. The sales issue ts so out of control that when my brother (a guest of mine) went to book an activity through the hotel, in order for him to get the 10% discount, he had to sign a form stating that if he did not show up for a 90 minute timeshare seminar that they were going to charge his credit card the discount they had extended to him. The second thing is concept of "banking time". If you decide that for some reason you are not able to use your package, you can "bank" that time with the company that manages the timeshare program. That company is RCI. The hotel and RCI are two separate entities. If you bank your time with RCI and want to use it at another date, RCI does not guarantee that the room you paid for is the one you will get. You end up getting whatever they have available. We were forced to bank one of our years due to the fact that it is virtually impossible to book any time at KBC during the summer. Although we paid for, and continue to pay maintenance fees for an ocean front unit, the only thing we were able to get was a "garden room" that slept less people. When I called the resort to complain, they said they have nothing to do with this and call RCI. If you really want to buy one of these units, I would strongly recommend looking on eBay. There always seems to be supply...

Reviews.Title: “Had a BLAST!”
Reviews.Author: keybjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBC through my parents timeshare co. and got a very good deal. We checked in on Friday June 8th at 3:30 (check in is at 4:00) and were told our room was not ready. My step son got sick on the way from the airport to the hotel and when I told the desk lady that she talked to her manager and they were able to get us into a room right then (on a lower floor but still with an ocean view). We were told the room we were originally booked into was on the 7th floor but was an unrenovated room. We found out later all that means is the rooms on the 4th floor and higher don't have the flat screen tv's otherwise everything else is the same. The rooms are very nice and spacious. The air conditioning works great! There is a dvd player and a small cd player in the bedroom. There is a microwave, large refrigerator, coffee pot and toaster. They will bring coffee for one pot every day and will restock creamer and sugar daily too. House keeping will take your trash out and bring fresh towels every day. They come to do a full clean about 4 days after you arrive. We weren't terribly impressed with the full clean...we had to have them come back and clean both sliders (full of kid prints) the closet mirrors in the bathroom and bring a top sheet (w/o an unknown stain) for the pull out bed. To their credit they came back and did all that right away. They also brought me xtra hangers the first day w/i 15 min of my call. The kids LOVED the pool and water slide! The beach was also very nice. There is alot of reef shallow on the beach so water shoes are a good idea. We rented a boogie board and snorkeling gear. The equipment is $5 a day per person. The kids really enjoyed using it. It was a little frustrating that by 10:30-11:00 most of the chase lounges had towels on them indicating they were taken. Also they ask that you don't take the chase lounges onto the beach. You can reserve a covered seat/lounge on the beach but there are only about 10 of these and fill up fast. The activities desk was very helpful and booked several activities for us and gave us directions etc. We ate at the Ohana Grill three times and thought the food was pretty good. ALL food on Maui is expensive. We ate all breakfasts in the room and several lunches. We ordered pizza up to our room one night and it too was expensive. There is a complimentary happy hour every day, althought the selection is limited, it was nice! We thought the property was very nice and great for our family vacation! The staff was friendly and helpful and we had no complaints about cleanliness. We would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “AN UNFRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: schoolgirl2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay. We have been to this property 3 other times when it was owned and operated by Embassy Suites. It has now been bought out by Sunterra Properties, and is quite a bit different. The staff - with the exception of the housekeeping and a few of the valet parking guys - were unfriendly and business-like. The staff that ran the morning breakfast were by far the worst. They walked around and monitored what everyone was doing. You could no longer seat yourself, bring food to your room, eat outside in the outdoor balcony, and most of all, even bring your own coffee (starbucks) in. No longer is everyone's breakfast free. Two adults are included in the price only. Any child 12 and under will be required to pay $12.00 a day. As for the happy hour this property offers, that too has changed. You used to be able to at least bring non-alcoholic beverages out of the area (soda's etc.) No more! They have a guard-dog at the door who states that if you want to drink anything, you do it within their confined area. You are not allowed to bring any chairs or chase lounges on the beach. If you would like to sit on the beach you can pay $35.00 a day for a wooden double chase lounge that is covered, but expect to return it promptly at 5:00PM. This is extremely hard, especially when the property right next door (the Kaanapali Suites) allows their guests to move chairs and chase lounges directly on the beach. Nothing is for free at this hotel. Not even a small kick board to use in the pool. The rooms have been renovated. They are very nice, except the master bedroom lacks privacy. There are three ways into the master, two of which can lock, and one way through the closet, that can not. The pool is large, but incredibly boring. No bells and whistles. The guy who mandates the one water slide closes down for some of the afternoon to take lunch. With a property that big you'd think they'd have two people who could rotate, in order to keep it open for the kids. All in all, it's not a bad property, but with the new management the energy appears negative, over-controlling, and business-like. If I had to sum up how the new management has dictated this property be run, if would be this way: The almighty dollar rules the roost. It's definately apparent that this is a business and their main concern is keeping costs down and maintaining rigid control (especially in the breakfast department.) One last quick note. There's far too many properties on Maui that have a higher priority for pleasing their guests. The smiles on their faces are genuine and they appear to take pride in welcoming you to their island. Check them out. Unfortunately, this is not one of them any longer. The dinners at the North Beach Grill are fairly reasonable, but again the atmosphere appears tense and unfriendly. We found outselves going to dinner at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel a number of times. Simply because the staff is so genuine, friendly, warm, and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DRCarlson
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two son (age 13 and 28) stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Club for spring break. We had a great time. Though we didn't get one of the newly refurbished units, ours was very clean and well maintained. We thoroughly enjoyed walks along the beach, and laying out by the pool. There was some problems with people savings several chairs early in the morning for hours till use. Our sons learned scuba diving from the instructor here, and they were very impressed with the instructor and his staff. After scuba diving in the pool, they proceeded to the ocean right in front of the hotel and swam with the turtles. The breakfast buffet and omelet bar at the hotel was fantastic. The omelet chef is quite the character. The snack bar food was just so so. We enjoyed the wonderful weather and atmosphere the most. The staff was great and very thorough.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: islands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one of the weeks we were in Maui. This place wasn't bad at all. All the help that we dealt with were great, very freindly, & helpful. We had a one bedroom suite on the 8th floor. The room itself was very clean and had everything we could need for cooking or whatever. We never ate at the resort, mostly out or we shopped across the street at Star Market & made our own breakfast & lunch. The beach wasn't that great but it was ok. We didn't use the pool because of all the screaming kids. Overall we would stay here again. A big bonus is their parrots!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mani_and_me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from April 30th-May 6th. We booked though AA vacations and paid for a scenic view, we got a free upgrade to an Ocean View room since we were celebrating our honeymoon, they even sent up a bottle of complimentary champagne. Our stay here was great. Everything was great about our vacation. The only complaint would be the elevators close to our room. One was broke, leaving the other for 12 floors, which made the wait time long. After a couple times of waiting to long we started using the other elevator just down the way. From check in to check out, we did not have a bad experience. The staff was great. Breakfast buffet wasn't the best, it was free, so you got what you didn't pay for! The omelettes were good though. We had breakfast here about 3 times during our stay. We had dinner a sunset dinner here food was good! I am from LA, happy hour here means watered down drinks. Not here, happy hour was cool, even thought there was a slim selection the drinks were good (not watered down). We booked a few activites through the concierge but found out we could book it cheaper elsewhere. We still got a discount since we did the time share presentation. The room we stayed in was a nice size, it was what we wanted, my husband and I usually do not like being cramped up in a small hotel room so this was perfect. It was like a small apartment. All in all I would stay here again. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Go To The Westin Resort on Maui”
Reviews.Author: mamajan4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned on April 1, 2007 from The Kaanapali Beach Resort in Maui, Hawaii. I have been to Hawaii many times and have never had an experience as this one. We were invited to go to Hawaii with our son and family. As we are going on another big trip with the family in June we wanted to go without spending a lot of money. We were invited by Embassy Suites to a timeshare property at a reasonable rate and decided to stay at this hotel since it was close to where my son and family were staying. We arrived at the hotel to check in after flying all day and were greeted by a gentleman that must have had a bad day. We went to our room and thought our bathroom was strange to say the least but we ran out to meet our son. When we got back to the room we went right to sleep and in the morning I realized they had put us in a handicap room. No tub, one sink, shower all one with the bathroom. We asked for a change of room and they said they only had one and we had to share the balcony with another room. Not satisfactory to us but got absolutely no satisfaction with anyone behind the desk. Finally we went to the promotion people where we signed up for our room and they were wonderful and changed our room after losing a day of our trip waiting to move. The one thing that was very nice and good size were the rooms once we got a regular room in the renovated area. Breakfast everyday was somewhat of a zoo unless you arrived early. I did not care for the buffet food but did hear people say they liked it so to each his own. Our experience with the timeshare people was awful as by this time we would never buy anything in this hotel. We sat down with the realtor and told her the problems we had with the hotel and she left and brought over the manager. High pressure and downright insulting us telling me some people had open minds and some didn't. Where do you think he put us? Yes you are right and applied all the pressure he could which made the situation worse. WE DID NOT BUY! The conciege desk did not help us and knew nothing about restaurants and were not very helpful or pleasant. They just wanted to sell where they made money and not help the customer. The last thing I would like to say we found out the Embassy Suite Hotel had been sold out to Sunterra Resorts. If this is how you are treated by Sunterra Resorts forget them and go to the Westin Beach Resort Maui timeshares where they treat you as though you are special.

Reviews.Title: “Our best vacation yet”
Reviews.Author: mrsswenmikk
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 children (ages 10 and 12) stayed here March 21-29 and had a fabulous time. It was our first time to Maui and we were there to celebrate our anniversay. The room was very nice and perfect for a family of 4. We were on the go quite a bit so we did not enjoy the pool and beach as much as we would have liked. Breakfast was good - especially the omelets and we went to happy hour a couple of times - would have been nice to have it outside. The kids enjoyed boogie boarding in the ocean and they liked the mini golf. The concierge staff were awesome and really helped us plan and schedule golf, snorkeling, surf lessons, luau and reservations for Warren and Annabelle (this show is awesome - I highly recommend it!) Although we did not like the slow elevators or getting a call to not smoke on the outside lanai, we did purchase a time share and look forward to coming back - either here or at a property in Kauai. I agree with others who say the valet guys were great. My 10 year old enjoyed tipping them each time we picked up our car. One last thing - the facility offers some activiites for a fee - I wanted to do the lei making and didn't realize we had to sign up ahead of time - then, the class on our last day there was filled up. If you are in Maui on a Saturday morning I highly recommend the swap meet in Kahulia (near the airport). It runs from 7 am to noon and you can get all your souveniers and gifts at great prices. Costco is also a great stop to get snacks and to get your pics developed before you head home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianBreezes
Reviews.Content: Aloha! My family of 2 adults and 3 kids ages 7,7, and 10 just returned from a 7 night stay. We arrived on 3/25/07. We were in Lokahai Tower, room # 332. Frankly, I liked being on a lower floor. We booked and received a "scenic" view. On the lanai, you could see the sidewalk and the West Maui mountains. I thought the view was fine. We didn't spend tons of time in the room anyway. Let me begin by saying the resort is CLEAN. I even saw men cleaning the grout with special brushes in all the areas that had tile. I was impressed. Pool and other public areas were IMMACULATE, and I am picky. Our unit was renovated with LOVELY plasma TV's, a HUGE bathroom, NICE fixtures, and a kitchenette. We asked for and received an electric frying pan and a rice cooker. We ate several meals in the unit to save $. We did NOT attend the nightly FREE cocktail hour...not interested as we do not drink. Included in our package was breakfast for 2 each day. I REALLY like a breakfast package. I HOPE they will reconsider how they do the breakfast, though. PLEASE...just give everyone breakfast. This is NOT a cheap place to stay. I bought breakfast for my 3 kids at $6 per day. Not much $, but the whole process was time consuming each day. They were given tickets, they had to check our room # on a BIG list, mark the tickets, etc. I wish they would just give it up! Give everyone breakfast just like the cocktail hour! That said, the choices were good. The omlette guy was a hoot! Very kind and funny man. Plenty of fruit, eggs, waffles, oatmeal, etc. Choices varied a bit each day. I enjoyed eating there and watching the whales and surf with my family. Another thing I LOVED was the valet parking. The valets were KIND, funny, and helpful. I felt spoiled. We felt like royalty for 7 days with this service. There was, of course, a charge. $12 a day. Again, I wish this fee would be included in the room price as you feel nickled and dimed to death sometimes. The pool was WONDERFUL. My 3 kids LOVED it and the waterslide. The pool was the PERFECT depth for them. It was hard to get them to go into the ocean with such a great pool. For older kids it might not be as exciting, but with my kids it was a HIT. They had lots of fun with many other kids and adults over 7 days. Things I didn't like: $.85 cents for a phone call. Please! $12 per day fee on the valet parking $6 per day for each kid to eat breakfast Just get rid of the silly charges and charge me more for the room! Ohana Grill and Bar on property...worst pizza I have ever had! tried dinner there, too...VERY mediocre! Overall, we had a WONDERFUL time. This is a FANTASTIC choice for families in that the suites provide extra space, and you get resort ammenities. This is NOT a 5 star resort. BUT, it is a GOOD 4 star family place in a GREAT location with wonderful ammenities for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: mdcrim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Club for 5 nights through their "minivacation" special that included rental car, breakfast buffet, nightly reception (free drinks) and parking For the price paid, not a bad hotel. We got lucky with the room assignment-was booked for a scenic garden view but ended up in a deluxe ocean front-could see whales from our balcony! The hotel itself was sufficient. There seemed to be some maintenance issues-in our tower only one of two elevators was working most of the time, leading to major waits (people were waiting for 2-3 full elevators to go before they could get on...). Also, both pool tables, the air hockey table and 5 of the video games were broken in the game room. The breakfast buffet was great-fresh fruit and decent assortment of breakfast items, changing daily. The restaurants on site were really good. The pool was decent and there is a separate, smaller pool that has a waterslide, which was fun for the kiddies. The beach was nice, but narrower than I expected. Word of warning-I had the WORST mexican food I have ever had at the mexican restaurant in the shopping center that was walking distance from the hotel. Yuck! We did the timeshare presentation to get $200 in vouchers and to have our son enrolled in the kids club for free. Of course we did not buy, but what they did not tell us was that Sunterra was in the process of selling off its European properties. The day after our timeshare presentation, Sunterra announced that it was selling ALL of its properties, so I don't know where that leaves the timeshare people... Anyway, this was a decent hotel, sufficient, but I would not consider it a 5 star by any way, shape or form. We may have had a skewed opinion though, as we had just come from the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club in Oahu, which was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Ver Pleased”
Reviews.Author: usernanc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Club for six nights in February. This was our second trip to Maui. The last time we stayed at a very expensive hotel, this time we tried a less expensive route. We found the special on the hotel web site. I wasn't expecting much, but turned out to be very pleased. The hotel was very nice and offered everything that a nice hotel does (valet, two great restaurants, a snack bar, bar, gift shop, activities desk, pool towel service, beautiful grounds and very nice pool). Our room was a very large with very nice furniture. The only disappointment was the bedding. Our package included a free breakfast buffet each day that had made to order omelets, potatoes, freshly baked goods and fresh fruit. We also enjoyed the free two-hour happy hour. The complex is very large and the pool area / beach can get very crowded. The hotel does have a spa but it doesn't offer Oceanside massages. If you are interested the complex next door does. Our favorite part of the trip was the old lahaina luau. Make sure to book before you get to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectation”
Reviews.Author: tginmn
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation package with NWA WorldVacations and the hotel description under described what we found when we arrived. The room was a large suite overlooking the front drive and listed as scenic view because it wasn't very high not because the view wasn't nice. The suite had a seperate living/dinning area with a nicely equipped kitchen with granite counter tops. The bathroom was very spacious with two sinks. The grounds were beautiful with lots of water falls and a very large outdoor pool on the beach. A block away was a small strip shopping center with a supermarket and a several inexpensive places to eat. There is a free happy hour every day. The staff is very professional and friendly. This place is a Suteran timeshare but the sales pitch is optional and they are very low key about it.

Reviews.Title: “A Whale of a Time”
Reviews.Author: indijones
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are owners every other year at this property. Therefore, we were excited about getting the chance, after two years of waiting, to stay there. We were not disappointed. I found the staff friendly and helpful, all with positive attitudes that I met. I found it also to be clean, with cleaning going on all over the place. Our room a deluxe ocean view on the 12th floor, had a nice view of the ocean but also of the gardens below and pool. At first I was upset with this, as I checked in during the evening and thought I had very little view. But when the sun came up, I saw that my room was above the condo's that were sitting in front of the ocean and that we could see all the whales and activity on the ocean up to Black Rock. I thought the breakfast was good, and Freddie the omelet maker was a hoot...bam! Only went to happy hour once, as we were very busy doing other things. The room itself was very roomy and comfortable, especially the bathroom. I believe this is a great place to stay while in Maui, especially for families that need more room than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MoeFolsom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Ka'anapali Beach Club. The weather was absolutely spectacular and the whale watching was worth the trip. We got a better view from the beach than from the whale watching trip. Don't forget the binoculars! The beach and pool were great. My husband and I are in our 50's and the crowd at the resort seemed to average older than us. Not a whole lot of night life action here. The action was definitely near Whaler's Village hotels and Lahaina. The worst part of the trip was the $12 a day parking fee for either self parking or valet. If you are looking to relax and read a good book, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBC!”
Reviews.Author: mauisnow
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach Club was great! The staff was friendly and prompt, our room was clean and modern (with 2 flat screen tv's), and the location was perfect. Since the hotel sits right on the beach, it was easy for us to hit both the beach and the pool. I have absolutely no complains about our stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our Wonderful Honeymoon stay!”
Reviews.Author: DecLove06
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical after reading some of the reviews of this hotel. But as soon as we walked in the lobby I felt a little more relieved. It does need some updates but overall isn't that bad-that I wouldn't stay here again. We were promptly greeted at the front desk by the nicest employees. The bellmen brought up our luggage very quickly too. The room was very nice-we did have one of the updated rooms where we did have a plasma TV in the bedroom and living room! That was a plus. Everything was spotless! No bugs anywhere! The only thing that was a little disappointment was we were overlooking the mini-putt putt course. We still could see some of the ocean adn mountains-very little. The bathrooms-very nice. I loved the jacuzzi tub. The restaurants were okay to above-average. There wasn't anything wrong anytime with the food-it tasted very good. We liked at night time to go down to the pool-side bar and have a drink. We did do the valet parking-very nice guys working and got our car in no time. The Spa:( I guess my main disappointment-defiantely NEEDS an update! We got the honeymoon special and that was great (jet-bath and massages). Just the spa itself is very 80's. I would stay here again but never would pay $400 a night. There were a lot of people here but it was over the New Year-so we kind of expected that. THe timeshare presentation wasn't too bad. It took us about 1.5 hours. We didn't buy but considered it. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: boston333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and loved it. We booked a timeshare package which included rental car, breakfast, happy hour, and room for $170/night. You really couldn't beat the price for the Kaanapali Beach area. The rooms were very spacious and clean, and the kitchenette with utensils, microwave, etc. came in handy. The pool is huge and the hot tub was really nice (it does get crowded). The resort also offers a free scuba diving class, which we had fun trying out (if you want to then scuba dive in the ocean, there is a fee). The hotel is not on the main strip of hotels where big hotels like the Westin are located, but we drove down a couple times to look around. After spending some time there we were actually happy that we were staying at the KBC, as it is quieter and more informal. If you can get a timeshare deal, this resort is definitely worth it. As a bonus, since we are in our early 20s and are not yet homeowners, we didn't even have to listen to a timeshare presentation. The sales staff left us alone.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: stlterp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the X'mas holidays, using a timeshare trade. My wife and I are in our late 20s and had been to Maui before, staying at the Kapalua Bay Hotel (since demolished) last time... If you are looking for pool side service, a great beach and luxury, this is not the place. However, it serves as a nice base to explore Maui. If you go, ask for a room in the 'Ohana Tower' - it is the closest to the water and has the best views. Our room looked to the South, and had some ocean view (mostly obscured by buildings) and a bit of the pool, as well as construction adjacent. The room itself was spacious enough - King Bedded, large bathroom with separate bath and shower, twin vanities, etc. Living area had a nice kitchenette (sink, microwave, dishwasher and fridge, along with basic utensils), along with a dinette table and living room area. Definitely an older/family crowd here - a lot of kids - probably not a good honeymoon spot. The location is also not on the main stretch of Kaanapali Beach, but somewhat north towards Kahana/Napili, and not easy walking distance to Whalers Village, etc. There is a convenient strip mall nearby with a Star Market (large grocery store) where you can pick up drinks, snacks, etc. We hardly spent any time at the resort - would go out during the day and explore the island and better beaches, and might return for a late afternoon swim. There seemed to be people content to spend their entire vacation by the pool for reasons beyond us. The beach in front of the hotel is so-so - often windy like the rest of the area, and not good for swimming. We never ate at any of the restaurants on site, choosing instead to take advantage of the many great restaurants on the island, including Sansei, Gerard's, Sushi Paradise and others. Had very little interaction with any of the staff, beyond the front desk, who were fine. Housekeeping did one complete cleaning during the week, and towel service daily. Parking is easy enough in the garage, not sure why anyone would use the valet service, as it was never hard to find a spot to self-park. In summary, probably a good value for the island. Certainly not a place for luxury or romance, but it's fine for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: matt.kim
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time at this property. I booked our stay through their website under the timeshare presentation package. We were all really happy with the property; well worth the money. The car rental was included (we did upgrade for a small price), breakfast was free for the 4 of us. All the employees were very friendly. The only rude people we encountered were other older guests who obviously had unrealistic expectations. I travel a lot and am always amazed at how rude some people are. If you expect $400 a night accomodations for $150 you are fooling yourself. Keep an open mind and you will be pleasantly surprised when you arrive. The timeshare presentation ended up taking 2.5 hours, however we did not feel pressured and felt it was worth our time. We did purchase another vacation package that was offered after we made it clear we were not interested in the timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation at a good price”
Reviews.Author: jollmanjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from Nov 25th to Nov 30th and did not know what to expect from the vaious reviews. I stayed at the hotel about 10 years ago when it was still the Embassy Maui. As far as the exterior, not much has changed, but the interior has all been redone. We stayed on a timeshare promotion that included a rental car, daily breakfast, $100 gift certificate, and 5 nights for $749. This was for a scenic view room, but when we arrived we were informed that we received a double upgrade to a deluxe partial oceanview. The room was located on the second floor, which was more like the 4th floor (e.g. LL, L, M, 2, 3, etc.) so it was plecnt high for a good view. We had a nice view of the pool and the ocean. The staff was friendly when we arrived, not anything special, just very cordial. The rooms were great as we received one that had just been renovated. The small kitchen contained a dish washer, refrigerator, and microwave (all whirlpool brand) and had granite countertops. The bathroon was pleanty large with a granite topped vanity and sink on one end and a pedastool sink on the other. The bathroom has new ceramic tile as well as a seperate shower and jacuzzi tub. The furniture was nice in the front room consisting of a sofa and two oversized chairs with an adjacent table and 4 chairs in the eating area. The best part of the rooms in my opinion is the fact that there were two 37" plasmas hanging on the wall in the suite, one in the bedroom and one in the front room. The suite also had a DVD player and receiver that was meant to be for music, however, with a little rewiring you can connect to the TV and rent movies from the video store accross the main road. The breakfast was good, but like anything anything else it gets old after a while and all tastes the same. When its all said and done, if you can get this on a timeshare promotion you can't find a better deal out there. The timeshare wasn't bad, but after saying no 4 times my wife got really short with the lady and told her we had to leave. In and out in 1 hour 45 min.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: alexthemadgreek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our Honeymoon, it was awesome! I do not have one negative comment. The rooms were clean, service great, beaches beautiful, and it is a convenient location. Just go!

Reviews.Title: “Okay - Not Bad, Not great - just okay”
Reviews.Author: SunnySeattle
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 day/6 night stay at a great price (a little over $800 including a rental car). As other people have mentioned this special rate is in exchange for sitting through a 90 minute timeshare presentation. I want to preface this by saying that we are low-maintnance guests - when we read reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor before the vacation we were rolling our eyes at folks who complained about the quality of the free snacks at the happy hour (c'mon - they are FREE). We assumed people that complained about the staff were just high-maintenance people who expected to be treated like they were at the Westin. Well, once we were at the hotel we understood. The front desk staff, for the most part, is quite rude. It was standard for them to say nothing and just stare at you when you walked up to the front desk. When you asked a question or made a request the response was often exasperated. It just seemed as if all of these people were really not fond of their jobs. That said most of the other staff was friendly - the waiters, the concierge, the happy hour bartenders were all nice. The hotel is in a pretty good location but the beach out front isn't too hot - while we were there they had the red warning flag up the entire time. I have a feeling they may leave it up all winter since it was even up when the ocean was calm and toddlers were wading around without incident. The hotel was built in 1988 and it looks like it. It's pink with aqua tile - very Miami vice. The rooms were fine - quite big and although we had a renovated room the furniture itself had not been replaced - it was pretty cheesy and the bed was REALLY uncomfortable. Maybe the new beds are better, but neither of us had quality sleep the entire stay. The grounds are nice, not extensive, but nice with a big pool and plenty of space to lay out by the pool in the sun or shade. The free happy hour every night is okay - granted the snacks consist of a party mix made up of cheetos, doritos, sunchips and pretzels, but as I said earlier - it's free. The happy hour takes place in an area of the lobby that was maybe a bar once - but now all it's used for is the happy hour. Basically from 4-6 every day it's a bunch of (mostly) elderly people sitting indoors (at outdoor furniture sets) drinking out of plastic cups and eating out of paper dishes. We are not ones to walk away from free booze, but we skipped this on more than one occasion in favor of paying for drinks somewhere with a view and nice atmosphere. All and all - the place is fine. We had no big problems, and it was a nice place for a home base from which we had a great vacation. It is just a little old and it feels like it - despite the renovations. If we had paid any more than we did, I definitely would have felt that I overpaid. The average guest is probably in their 60s - if you are looking for a young crowd you won't find it here. The timeshare presentation was longer than 90 minutes - we were there for over 2 hours and finally just had to get up and start leaving before they took no for an answer (it is NOT a good deal). After we made it clear we were not buying we were offered another great deal for a weeklong stay at another resort in the Sunterra family next year and we took that. Oh, and lastly - I'd skip the in-house salon. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice until....”
Reviews.Author: hyperchickmom
Reviews.Content: We recvd a wonderful deal for 5 nights that included breakfast, rental car, and cocktail hr. Upon arrival, we were very pleased with the hotel, staff, and room. We were upgraded from "scenic" view to a 4th Flr deluxe oceanview..overlooking hotel pool. The cocktail hour was ok, but we only went on our first night... Breakfast was very good! By the 3rd morning we found out that besides the buffet, you could have your omelete cooked to order...so that was really good, but wish we had known sooner. On our 4th night, we had dinner in our room...each room has a kitchenette, bar counter, dining table and chairs. We were in a rush and left our dishes in the sink...Well, that was a BIG MISTAKE! Upon arrival and cleaning up that evening, we were infested with ROACHES! Tiny ones crawling up the back wall of the kitchen area...on the kitchen counter, the bar counter, and a few on the table. UGH! Then in the bedroom, we found a huge one in the ceiling! Needless to say, we did not sleep good that night. We had called the front desk, but housekeeping was closed..did we want security to come up? There was construction two floors below ours...The next day, we spoke with hotel manager and moved to 10th floor oceanview corner room. This was extremely nice and we did not see any bugs...I would have given the Kaanapali Beach Club 5 stars, but cannot due to the bug problem! We purchased a time-share, but then backed out after little incident. They were very nice about it, offered us ENCORE opportunity which we agreed to...so we have another good price to be able to enjoy a 7 night stay at any Sunterra location within 18 months. We loved Maui, location is excellent. Just a few minutes from the Kaanapali strip with shopping, hotels, beach and snorkeling at black rock!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were very niceWE”
Reviews.Author: rckrchk
Reviews.Content: Well after reading several reveiws regarding the hotel staff and how rude they were we were ready for anything. We found the opposite the hotel staff were very nice and helpful. The rooms were very beautiful. The grounds were nice. The location was awesome. My gripes the Lobby , furniture and floors were from the 1980's. TheHotel elevators were dirty. there was a smashed banana on the glass elevator for the whole week we were there. The food stunk. If you walk next door on the path by the beach the food at that hotel next door was very good and much cheaper. If they redid the hotel like they re did the rooms you would have a world clas resort

Reviews.Title: “EVR is now Ka'anapali Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: pauljaz1
Reviews.Content: 14 day stay, Room 541 Check-in was pleasant and smooth-no problems; Booking activities was easy and the concierge had good information; All food services have good service, great food and selection; Room cleaning consisted of one linen service per week or as requested and daily bathroom and kitchenette light cleaning-they were always in and out and we never noticed; Pool- one large pool-small childrens slide and small spa was adequate for our needs; It's not in the same class as the Hyatt or Sheraton pool that has more kid friendly amenities. Beach access and size was adequate-snorkling saw many fish; Remodeling two floors at a time, we were in a completed remodel which basically consisted of a bathroom makeover (tile floor and shower, sink areas); Underground parking facilities are good; Bellhop service appeared to be on their toes everyday; The Lower Lobby game room had about 21 games, 5-6 were out of order- the best value was the air hockey-most games are getting abused or outdated or do not work 100%. Our 7yr old daughter sat with child services during our timeshare speil and they were fantastic people and took great care. Although this resort is nestled inside of condeminium row, we never felt crowded, and other services were available nearby (Star market grocery, dining, gas station) Nightly torch runner that runs around the grounds and the pool to light torches and blows through a large shell. I only give them a slightly low mark for not being prepared for the October 15th earthquake. But, that seemed to be almost everywhere as we headed to the airport that day. I think it really showed you have to take care of yourself. There appeared to be no damage, but again, we left within one hour of the event. And some days only had one of two elevators in each tower working making for a longer wait at times-especially when the maid service and remodel crews were active.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Chelsa
Reviews.Content: Well, I must say that I was quite scared after reading such negative reviews about the Embassy, but to my superise it was wonderful. My husband and I stayed at the Embassy for our honeymoon from September 25th-October2nd 2006. From the the start things when great. When we arrived two hours early a room was ready and when we mentioned that it was our honeymoon we were up graded to an ocean view on the 12th floor and a bottle of champange was sent to our room. So, I'm unsure how people can say the front desk is unpleasant. They were more than willing to anwser any questions and with a smile. When we got to our room we were amazed. It was huge, clean, and more than enough room for two. I must say I didn't find the sheets on the bed to be a problem and I thought the bed was quite comfortable. We enjoyed the FREE cocktail hour daily and the FREE chips. It's free why complain and the chips were mighty tasty. We meant several wonderful couples espically one honeymooning at the resort and actually ended up booking several activities with one couple through Mark at the activity desk. Mark was very helpful and set us up with great snuba, helicpoter, and luai trips. The beach is small but you can lay on it and swim in the water. I guess you might complian if you sit at the resort all day. THe pool was more than nice. Yes, the slide is small but I'm 28 and thought it was fun. We did participate in the timeshare presentation. I have to say that they did try and pressure us and were quite obessive with selling. I don't think it's worth the discounts that you get. The only negative I could say is that the elevators take forever. Hope this helps. All I can say is the place is great and in the perfect area. It's not really a place to party. We were in bed by 9pm each night. It's MAUI beautiful and fun. Who wants to sit at a hotel all day!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here through an owner's referral. Got a good deal for 4 nights and paid for an upgrade to an ocean view. Our flight was early so we got to the Embassy before rooms were available. We received friendly greetings from both the valet parking attendants and the front desk. The front desk staff was particularly friendly as we had told her specifically the type of room we wanted (upgrades, king bed and ocean view which we had of course paid for). She said she would work on it and offerred to call us on our cell when a room was ready. So we left our luggage and went to Whaler's Village for lunch. We got a call within the hour. Our suite was on the 11th floor, updated and larger than we expected. A nice sized living room/dining room combination, with an open style kitchenette. Oddly though the kitchen had a normal sized fridge, microwave and dishwasher with dishes etc but no stove top. While a coffee maker was provided, no kettle for us tea drinkers. Housekeeping did not have one to offer either. The bathroom was gorgeous with two sinks, a large walk in shower and closed off toilet area. The long narrow balcony overlooked the ocean from two angles. Lovely. Only problem was there was no screen for the door so leaving the doors open at night was not an option because of the bugs. The bedroom was a nice size with a small tv and ample closet and drawer space. While the suite was upgraded, was surprised that the bedding was old school, flat sheet. With all of today's hotels at all levels upgrading their bedding to duvets etc, not sure why Embassy isnt doing the same. Another minor point is about their happy hour. Previous reviewer is correct, bar staff could be friendlier and can upgrade their snacks (come on cheese chips in a bowl?). I was expecting a poor beach by the way it was described in other reviews so was pleasantly surprised that it was nice enough to sit at, swim in etc. Another minor point is the Embassy doesnt let you take the loungers down to the beach and if you want one with they have on the beach there is a $15 hefty fee for two. Also found that the lounge chairs which were provided did not seem to be cleaned. Minor point but one to note when you are trying to upgrade the facility. Location is ok (about 10 minutes to Whalers Village and, another 10 to Lahaina depending on traffic). Shopping plaza across the street is good and definitely go up to the next plaza and get the fantastic take out food from the Okosawa (sp?) Deli. The mahi mahi with lemon caper sauce is incredible!! We were obligated to do the time share presentation because of the referral but also got $200 in coupons that were good at several good restaurants (Mama's!!) and shopping (Hilo Hatties). The presentation took 90 minutes, no pressure (we already own time share somewhere else) and while tempting no-one should ever have to make such a decision as this type of purchase in a short period of time as they tend to expect. Would definitely go back if given a similar offer.

Reviews.Title: “The best for me and mine.”
Reviews.Author: michaelnterra
Reviews.Content: First let me warn you before you read this, Im an owner not only of one week but three at Sunterra Beach Resort. I just booked our next vacation for july 07. Basically and truly its not the most over the top fancy- posh- movie star quality place. Its a place for normal guys like me to give my family three weeks a year in paradise. Most of the people we have met are workers like us teachers,cops,fireman professional types this is not a singles place or a party place the bar closes at 10pm. Its a relaxing relaxing location. This is a place to meet other owners and talk about the other trips they have gone on or to play a mean game of spades or poker during the receptions. We seem to always run into people that remeber our to boys its always fun to meet owners again! Have your kids go down the water slide and have the best waterslide guy in the world make sure no one takes cuts. I can make our own dricks and brink them in a cooler I can goto the market and bbq steaks shrimp whatever.. we enjoy our time here and its silly to see reviews that the mades didnt make our beds or take out the dishes from the dishwasher. They will if you pay them :) but that not the deal and your told that at check in..... Hey like I said I cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Front desk BAD... room NICE”
Reviews.Author: kdanyo
Reviews.Content: Before staying at this resort my husband and I checked the reviews and everyone is right about the front desk staff.... they are horrible! They are rude... When we checked in my moms room was not ready and wasn't ready for 4 hours with no explanation! They handed us a sheet with a bunch charges that could be possible.. I asked what one of the charges was about the girl behind the counter said "just sign below... it says that these charges were explained to you" THEY WEREN'T!!!!!!!!!! The room was absolutely beautiful but it was a rennovated room!!! The entire stay we heard BANGING AND DRILLING (thats why the price was cheap) on the 10th floor (we were on the 12th) from 9am - 5pm.. but that didn't really bother us too much because we were never in the room!! The BELLMEN/VALET guys were VERY sweet and nice!! They actually told us which elevator to take to our room since the nasty front desk people just gave us our key and we asked them what room number!!!!! NO CUSTOMER SERVICE WHAT SO EVER at the front desk! BUT we were in Hawaii and we wouldn't let it bother us!!!!! Overall the room was very HOMEY!!!! I would go back just for the comfort and convience of the room, there was a supermarket across the street so we stocked up on drinks, snacks, and cereal (the free breakfast was nasty)....

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes you get what you give”
Reviews.Author: KUDAD
Reviews.Content: We purchased a two bedroom floating week last November, and were staying here for the first time. The reviews in summer and fall of 2005 were pretty favorable, but I have noticed those since the first of the year have been about 2:1 positive. So I arrived with eyes open to see if some of the bashing was deserved. My findings were as follows: Bell/valet/maid service=attentive, cordial, courteous; front desk = prompt, professional, courteous at all hours of the day and night (jet lag!); grounds = clean, well-maintained; restaurants = grill is fine, not fancy, is pool-side and main restaurant is 4-star quality with excellent service and commensurate prices; beach = narrower than down south but busy with lots of guests; pool = huge, in much use, attractive but not posh; wind more than down south (Lahaina and Whaler's village area), but as one who is used to wind, I prefer it to a humid calm; suite was huge with a large full wrap-around lanai and four sliding windows. The south side was easily 8-10 feet of depth to the patio; kitchen lacks a cooktop or oven, (no complaints from the cook); but has full refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher. I would suggest they add stackable washer/dryers in the 2-bedroom units, as they are the furthest from the coin-op machines, and, with more guests, are more likely to be used. There are only 18 2-bedrooom suites in the whole complex, with the remaining 400 being 1-bedroom. Of the latter, about 44 are scenic view, 50 are ocean front, and the remainder are ocean view. This is a young family resort, only a block from a large grocery store and a busy strip mall with alternate restaurant options. Kids older than 13 will probably be bored as it is far from the Ka'anapali beach action, not to mention Lahaina. Also, owners are treated very well, with complimentary parking and discounts at all merchants and restaurants. There are a number of units available from resale agents locally and over the Internet, so don't be pressured by the salesmen on site. About all they can offer is SunOptions, which assigns points to your unit, but ends up adding about 40-50% to the purchase price. If you can exchange within RCI or II, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: ijia
