Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy from 8/18-8/25/2006. Our first impression was good, the lobby was beautiful, the parking garage was very clean and well kept. The elevator is SLOW, SLOW, SLOW. We were on the 2nd floor so we took the stairs most of the time. I don't know why the walkways leading to the rooms are so dirty; I saw a suspicious dark red splotch on the floor leading to our room every day we were there. The room was not a remodeled room, so it was as clean as they could get it, but it still felt slightly grimy. The refrigerator was spotless which was great. They were wonderful with the maid service and they were more than generous with the towels which was great. Why they can't use a fitted sheet instead of flat I'll never know, but it was kind of irritating. The service everywhere was pretty bad. We didn't valet, so I don't know about them but the front desk people acted like they'd been trained to not care. We went to the happy hour once and the bartender was so disgruntled and tossed our drinks to us in such a rude way, we felt like cattle. Even the receptionist at the spa was slightly chilly. (but my husband and I got the best massages ever, so don't let the receptionist scare you away). The only person in the whole place who looked like he enjoyed his job was the omelette maker at breakfast. If you've been there you know what I mean. Great personality. Speaking of breakfast, it was fair. On our last day the eggs and sausage were cold. But the omelettes were always great and the fruit and pastries were good. The potaoes, egg and breakfast meat were hit and miss. We stayed on a timeshare presentation deal, so we got a great deal on the room. The presentation was extremely low pressure. So low pressure in fact that the lady was practically begging us to tell her we weren't going to buy so she could find someone else to talk to. We were actually curious and wanted details, but we had to beat the info out of her. She wasn't very good, because her questions made me feel stupid and even stupider when I answered them. Needless to say, we didn't buy. Overall, I would say there are much nicer places to stay in Kaanapali, but if you're on a budget and get a good deal, you will have a nice stay. We loved the amenities, nice pool and towel service. The location on the beach is great, we did some wonderful snorkeling right in front of the Embassy and saw lot of beautiful fish. The beach was very windy and the sand did hurt when it pelted you. It's a very pleasant walk from the Embassy to Black Rock and you can even cut through the Sheraton to the resort side, but it's a long walk and probably not much fun after dark. I loved this vacation, it was beautiful and full of memories, but when I go back, I'll be at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “another great time in maui”
Reviews.Author: pdudztx
Reviews.Content: We've been to maui many times and this year we tried this location as a time share owner...yes, if i had a magic wand i would maybe update some of the grounds or outside decor, but the newly decorated room was great. Housekeeping brought us the extra small appliances we requested. We had a balcony with a fabulous view and breeze - over the pools, looking out to the beach. We liked the location and we could walk to the strip center across the street for pizza, snacks and ice cream as well as the local bus picks up at the bottom of the driveway. We ate one meal at the casual restaurant - nothing exciting (stay away from the sushi), but it was nice to have the coffee shop on site for snacks and drinks. The workout room is small, but the walk down the beach was gorgeous. The on-site convenience store was quite nice; it had as much stuff as most of the tourist trap stores in town and the prices were not higher. We found the employees terrific - extremely helpful and very friendly. We met several families staying in the hotel when we were on some day excursions, as were we, they all were quite happy with the hotel and the accomodations. A definite yes on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Bon4
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if a nice beach is important to you! My husband, two children (ages 5 and 7) and I stayed at the Embassy for a week over Fourth of July. Overall, we thought the accomodations were great. The room was spacious and perfect for four people. The little kitchenette was clean and really handy for snacks and drinks etc. Beware of what they refer to as the "ocean view" room--We had a view of the miniature golf course and the parking lot next door, but if you leaned over the balcony and turned to the side you could see the ocean. Outside of the rooms, the hotel itself could use some updating, but overall it was fine. Our kids loved the pool. For their ages it was perfect. However, we were really disappointed with the beach and the weather. The beach was not nearly as pretty as other beaches in Maui. It was not very clean (lots of depris from Fourth of July days after it was over) and the sand was not very nice. Obviously the weather is out of their control, however, as someone else stated, it would rain over the Embassy, but two hotels down the weather was great. It rained for a good part of the day on six out of seven of the days we were there. In addition to that the wind was so strong during our entire stay that you couldn't read a magazine by the pool as it kept blowing away. As a result of the wind we also did not spend time on the beach as the kids got pelted with sand during gusts and complained that it hurt. Therefore, we spent a lot of time in the car driving to nicer weather and beaches. We booked our stay directly with the Embassy and did do the timeshare presentation, so we got an amazing rate on the room. It was well worth it. On top of the great rate you get free breakfast and free parking. Excellent value! The presentation was 3 hours long, but there was no pressure and we did not end up buying a timeshare. After leaving the Embassy we spent the second half of our vacation in Wailea--That is clearly where the sun is!

Reviews.Title: “Good Affordable Family Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jonyquest
Reviews.Content: We decided to return to the Embassy Suites after 4 years. We had stayed at the Westin Hotel 2 years ago and although it was a great hotel, the rooms were very small. I have a family of 5 so the extra spacious separate bedroom suite at the Embassy was very welcome. The hotel hadn't changed much since the last time and the staff was still very friendly and corteous. Parking is $12.00 a day whether you valet or not. The beach was very nice and you could walk south from the Embassy all the way to Black Rock in the morning during low tide. Walking north on the beach in the morning revealed many tide pools and shell collecting. Night strolls along the beach were also very nice. It was a beautiful walk in either direction. A daily Happy Hour from 4-6 offered a chance to get free drinks and relax if you were around the hotel. Beach dive Scuba in front of the hotel revealed a nice reef with many huge sea turtles. You can get right up and touch them if you want!! I saw maybe 12 Large sea turtles on my dive as well as many reef fish. There is no longer any cocktail service around the pool but the bar is not a far stroll from anywhere around the pool. This is a good location hotel and is probably one of the most reasonably priced!!! It doesnt have the luxurious pools and slides like some of the upscale hotels but the pools are very nice and it has a small water slide for the kids. We still enjoyed ourselves very very much. We booked through expeida and did not have to do any timeshare presentation which was nice. All around, a great family oriented hotel with lots of room and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “So So Stay at Embassy”
Reviews.Author: TeXTraviler
Reviews.Content: First, our family owns a time share here so we decided to use it. Many other reviews we read are dead on. Place is not luxurious but also not a dump--it is accurately an Embassy Suites (though it isn't). Staff is not particularly friendly (not rude, but not happy employees either) or particularly conscientious. Not particularly well maintained (the parking garage floor is spotless, but the common areas of the hotel floors were pretty dirty-what's with that?). For example, there are dishwashers in every room. On one the day that our room was to be cleaned, I ran the dishwasher after breakfast. The maid did not unload it, she just added the coffeemaker to the clean dishes and re-ran it (the dishes were still hot from being washed when she came in). Lazy... Breakfast is really expensive ($12/person) and not wonderful (canned orange juice and pineapple juice in Hawaii?). Other meals were pricey for what was served. Beds are ok, but bottom sheet is a flat sheet, and they only clean the room once a week, so you are stuck remaking the bed every day and waking up on the mattress itself. A false fire alarm went off at 4 am for 1/2 hour with loud announcements (I have seen several other complaints about this). Our ocean view room was really a view of the parking lot, though if you went out on the balcony and leaned over you could see the ocean. Water slide was lame, and only my six year old thought it was fun. Rained on this hotel for 2 days but not at the neighboring hotels (it is very weird but rain only feel in a small area of the island, on this hotel and another one). Not a particularly good area to play in the ocean due to the tides, and water was murkier here than most other stretches we saw, again due to tides and reef structure. The concierge booked our children for hula lessons both by phone and in person when we got there. We went to the lesson to be told that there hadn't been hula lessons in months. Unfortunately, we were too late to go to another location for one. Finally, avoid the time share sales pitch. It is 3 hours long (not 1 1/2 hours). Further, they should give you a $250 allowance towards activities if you attend the time share meeting, but if you bbook through the hotel, they will only give you $150. Otherwise, hotel was fine. Rooms were a good size, kitchen good except for no stove, location was ok for Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jank123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in July on the vacation package, which is a great bargain. After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a bit apprehensive, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We found the staff to be friendly and attentive, the view was spectacular and the pool was great. Separate kids pool with slide, which was nice. We were so impressed we ended up buying a timeshare, although the presentation was fairly low-pressure. Nice location on Ka'anapali, not so crowded as the main drag around Black Rock (where Westin, Sheraton, etc. are located), but still close to everything. Our only complaint was the beach was really too windy and narrow to spend any time on, but Kapalua and Black Rock were a few minutes' drive away and the snorkeling was great. Try the Trilogy snorkel day tour to Lana'i, it's wonderful. Breakfast buffet was a good deal, although very crowded after 8:00. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Embassy!!!”
Reviews.Author: rmca31
Reviews.Content: I booked the minivac on the internet website. What a great value. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the nightly cocktail parties. The drinks were great! We also did the time share presentation. No pressure from any staff. Don't miss this deal. Great location on the # 1 beach on Maui. We will go back!!! One of the best vacations I have ever had!!

Reviews.Title: “Whale watch from shore!”
Reviews.Author: hamarcus
Reviews.Content: We initially stayed at Embassy Suites Resort Ka'anapali on our honeymoon in 2003. We were so impressed with the accomodations and tranquility of the resort and island that we returned for our second stay in Feb '05. The resort feels like your perfect home away from home with full size ameneties in the room (fridge, microwave, dishwasher, nice sized kitchen area). We enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet, eating poolside was a great way to start the day. There are grab and go restaurants and a grocery store across the street from the resort. The Store located within the resort is well stocked and has lots of items to choose from including souviners, clothing, jewlery, and some food items. There is also an ABC store located within walking distance from the resort (3-4 blocks) for any other essentials. In the afternoon/ evenings we enjoyed the free daily Happy hour. Valet parking is available, very convienent and staff was always very friendly. Our favorite memories of our Feburary visit was that we could see loads of whales from our Lanai or from the pool/ beach area. Of course you get an even better view of the whales on one of the whale watching tours. In the pool/ beach area there is a kiosk where you can rent kayaks, snorkle gear, boogie boards, etc. You can also learn to scuba dive in the hotel pool and from there, make a dive off shore from the resort. Also very nice and convienent, there is a salon located within the resort which offers manis, pedis, and massage. We can't have enough great things to say about this place! The location is great, staff (especailly at Concierege) are fabulous, accomodations are A+.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Embassy I remember...”
Reviews.Author: sommerlovin
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week of our honeymoon here (July 1 - 8) in a deluxe ocean view owner's suite (we bought the week on Vrbo). We came from the Hilton Hawaiian Village (Oahu) and then the best hotel in the universe, Hotel Hana-Maui. We were really appalled by the reception from the bellhop(s) at valet and the AWFUL reception desk staff. We brought our car into valet, opened the doors, popped the trunk, opened back doors... the three valets without any other customers just continued their conversation as we unloaded. It got to the point that I thought it could possibly be Candid Camera: Maui. The possible Candid Camera charade continued as we were found our way to the reception desk (through a gorgeous open-air lobby). I went to the "Owners Express CHECK-IN ONLY" labeled line. Seriously, that was the sign above the line. The recepionist just looked at me, so I said, "Hi! Bradds, B-R-A-D-D-S." He continued to STARE at me, so I repeated our last name and spelling slowly. Finally he said, "What do you want from me?" I literally rechecked the sign above me to make sure I wasn't possibly in the "Sign up for the underwater basket weaving class here" sign, and said, "Checking in." Let's just say the conversation went downhill from there. He literally said, "The computer couldn't possibly be right. It says you are owners." Ok, so I wasn't dressed in Prada, but come on! Who says that!!!!?? Well, I was sad that we had left the Hotel Hana-Maui, and it's PERFECT customer service, so I thought I might have had a bad taste in my mouth or maybe a bias. Sadly, I was mistaken... the service at the breakfast buffet were Nazi-like ("No! You may not come in. It is 9:31! We close at 9:30. Doesn't matter if you have breakfast ticket." to the couple behind us in line, no kidding.) Well, deluxe ocean front was a stretch, but it was a beautiful room. The bed stunk, they also use one flat sheet instead of a fitted one, so it was all wrapped around us all night... and they only change/fix linens once a week, so it was kind of a hassle. If you are still reading this, there are really nice things about the Embassy - great pool!!! Lots of seats, towels, very clean, nice wait staff and excellent frozen drinks (although lunch was $12 chicken sandwiches). We also thought the grounds were in need of some maintenence - peeling paint, etc - but overall beautiful!!! Our housekeeper was genuinely a little piece of sunshine when she changed our towels daily. The valet ended up doing a great job. The location of the Embassy is a few minutes north of Ka'anapali - we thought it was a great location ($20 cab ride to Lahaina). Overall, it wasn't as nice as we thought it would be, but we were on our honeymoon and we had a GREAT TIME. :-) You will too, just don't let the service get you down!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites NOT SWEET AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: DeeVaDee007
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful flight and beautiful car ride, we thought everything was going to be perfect. The first point of contact (at Embassy Suites) with the employees who never greeted us as we had been received at the airport and the car rental facility was very dishartning. The non greeting staff set the precedence for our stay at the facility. The customer service has alot of training to brush up on. We too signed up for the package deal thru our travel agent. We booked 6 months in advance for a group of 16 people consisting of 4 different families. We were spread out over three different floors, We requested King size beds in all the rooms, I checked in first and received the correct bedding on the 2nd floor. The next family checked in and was given a room on the 10th floor with two double beds. When asked why we were not receiving the rooms closer together and the accomodations we requested. We were told we pay for the room not the accomodations. Have you every heard anything so ridiculous from a supposedly "5 star facility". The next family checked in again on the 10th floor and the final family was given a room on the 5th floor. And guess what it was a miracle! They were given a room with a King size bed. How was this possible when they are overbooked and they have nothing available, they are sending people to other hotels. What a bunch of BS! They probably would have not hesitated to send part of our party to another hotel with no consideration of our group. We spent alot of time away from the facility. We as a group had discussed this trip for about two years and planned it six months in advance. We like to do things right. I can say that had we been better received, all four families probably would have purchased the timeshares. They missed out not only on our business but on future business as well. We are all Business Professionals who have alot of work Colleagues who were looking forward to our return. There is nothing nice to say except, stay at the Sheraton or the Hyatt in Lahaina for the best value for your dollar. They truly are 5 star facilities, we went to the Luau and the Spa Moana at the Hyatt (pricey but worth every penny) and when we visited the Sheraton, they showed us their accomodations and were very pleasant in answering our questions. We will return to Maui, but not to the Embassy Suites they have left a very nasty taste with us. Don't let the photos fool you. Atmosphere does not make up for poor service. Our beautiful $$ Ocean view was right over the minature golf course and we had the pleasure of waking up every morning to delivery and trash trucks all seven mornings, who needed a alarm clock?

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: toddlynn3
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Embassy Vacation resort on June 24th for 4 days. It was a great place to stay and we would recommend it and stay there again. On the plus side, the scenery was gorgeous, the pool and grounds were beautiful, breakfast buffet was great and the room was nice. The concierge staff was great and can book all of your activities such as luaus, etc. Housekeeping staff was always friendly when you saw them in the hallways. Negatives-front desk not very friendly, just there looking uninterested in their jobs. Also, the timeshare presentation was a very high-pressure presentation and I would not recommend doing it unless you really are going to buy. All in all, a great resort, just skip the timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations--Staff has Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights June, 2006. We stayed on the minivac, which was a great value. We got 6 nights, plus rental car, breakfast buffet and tickets to a luau ((Drums of the Pacific) for about $1300! That's a great price for that area. We had a one-bedroom, one bath condo with mini kitchen. The room itself was quite nice, the view very nice, the pool and beach, were, in my opinion, great, the breakfast quite nice. Would we come back again? Not on your life! The problem was the staff and their attitude. The whole point of the minivac package (this place usually goes for $400/nt) was to entice you to buy one of their units, and you had to sit through a timeshare presentation. Fair enough. Actually, the ts people were quite nice and informative and we enjoyed the presentation. They weren't the problem--the hotel staff was the problem. They acted like we were some sort of nuisance from the moment we arrived. The valet parking was about the worst experience I had in my life while traveling. When we arrived, tired and stressed, they didn't even smile or say "Welcome". Instead, they made quite an issue of filling out a damage report on our rental vehicle so they wouldn't be charged for any previous damage. They didn't even help unload our bags, and actually attempted to drive off while we were unloading! They loaded our bags onto a cart, pushed it into the lobby, and it just sat there for about 20 minutes with no offer from anyone to bring it up to the room, so we finally assumed we were supposed to take it up ourselves. Well, we did, then got a phone call asking us to bring their cart back down, and informing us it was against their rules for guests to use their carts. Well, why didn't they tell us that as we were taking it--obviously they knew who we were, or how could they call us? I told them if they wanted it they could come get it. Then, a few minutes later, our phone stopped working. We also discovered that Internet service didn't work. I I had to walk all the way back down to the main lobby to complain and was told to go back to the room and call them when it was working!!!! From what, a phone that didn't work? I insisted I wasn't leaving the lobby until it was verified the phone was working. I spoke with the manager, who told me they had other guests to attend to, I wasn't the priority, they would send up someone to repair it when they "got a chance". I asked if we could be transferred to another room and was told the only rooms available were ocean views and my package only included a mountain view. I pointed out that our pacaage did include a working phone! They then told me if I was so unhappy I could find another hotel! I told them that would be fine if they would make the arrangements and we wouldn't be charged anything more. Finally they fixed the phone, but it took about 3 days to get Internet service going. The servers at the breakfast buffet acted like the guests were a nuisance. Lines were backing up while tables were empty. They never came over to clear away used dishes or bring coffee, water refills (took forever to bring the first ones). Finally we put our used dishes on a nearby clean table and got up to get our own drinks, for which we were told not to do that, it was "against their rules for guests to serve themselves". Every time we used valet parking they acted annoyed, rushed (although they weren't busy and valets were just standing around talking). We were seriously considering buying a ts and might have been talked into it by the Sunterra people, who, like I said, were quite nice, however, we had a taste of the place and wouldn't want to come back for more. We spoke with several owners while there who agreed that the attitude and level of service were quite poor. Also, they advertise that they have laundry facilities on site, which is technically true. One washer and two dryers every other floor, no a/c in the laundry unit (just a little aclove off the hallway) no change machine, dirty laundry tubs and dirty machines. Its really a shame the staff has such an attitude, this really is quite a nice property but we would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-star, but not horrible either”
Reviews.Author: arrosen
Reviews.Content: We went to the Embassy Maui (no longer called or affiliated with Embassy Suites) on a Time Share offer. $1,190 for a week, but we had to sit through a 90-minute sales presentation. When we arrived, the rooms that we were supposed to be in were not available, so we went to the cocktail happy hour. It was fine, but nothing special. Beer, sodas, Mai Tais, Rum Punch, Margeritas, etc, but no blended or special order drinks. Basically, they had bottles of tequila, rum, vodka and mixers. There was also a chip mix to snack on, but nothing more. Eventually, our rooms were ready, and they were able to upgrade us to a 12th (top) floor ocen view suite. The suite itself is very nice. Quite large with a mini-kitchen, a large living area with a pull-out sofa and a separate bedroom with a King bed (or 2 doubles). There was also a patio overlooking the ocean...very nice! The bathroom was very large, recently remodeled with granite and new tile, but offered no privacy. There is room for 10 people in the bathroom, but there are no walls or separators. Also the closet from the bedroom opens up into the bathroom, thereby decreasing the privacy even more. Not a big deal if it is just you and your honey, but something to keep in mind if you are travelling with kids/teens. The kitchen has a full-sized fridge, a microwave and a sink (with no garbage disposal). A cooktop (or range) is sorely missing, as is a decent trash can. The hotel itself is technically on Kaanapali beach, but it is about a mile north of the "real" Kaanapali Beach where the Sheraton, Marriott and Hyatt are. The beach here (at least during the week we were there) was unusable. The surf and wind were both extremely high which made for very dangerous conditions. As I understand it, it is ALWAYS very windy at the Emabssy, while that is not true a mile South. The beach at the hotel is also very narrow, and doesn't offer much room to lay out or play. The pool is very big, but there are no "features" and there is little shade. There is a waterfall pool (sorta cool) and a kids pool as well. The slide they advertise is for little kids only and empties into the kids pool...nothing special unless you are under 6. The pool area has lots of chairs and a few umbrellas, but the pool is not a "happenning" place as it is at some other resorts. There are very few people hanging out, and there is no poolside food or beverage service. There are also no pool activities or planned events. Our package included a breakfast buffet which was alright, and certainly worth the price. The hotel overall seemed like it needed to be remodeled. The railings throughout the hotel were rusty/dirty, the windows on the top of the atriums were so dirty that you couldn't see through them, the bathroom (even though recently remodeled) had mildew in the tile grout, and the pool chairs needed to be cleaned or replaced. Again, nothing was horribly dirty or gross, but you could definitely see the age of the place. The staff also was just OK. No one was mean or rude, and all of our needs were met, but no one went the extra mile. They did what they had to do, but nothing more. The sales presentation was fine, although our sales rep (Annie) wasn't able to answer my questions about the details of the program. At the end (after we said no), they offered us another week at their Kauii resort for $1165, which I purchased. Overall, we had a great time, and for the price, I can't complain. If, however, you are paying more than $150/night for this place, I would seriously consider looking somewhere else, like the Marriott or the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay on Maui--stay at the Embassy Suites. Just recently stayed there for 5 days. The rooms are very large and spacious. The staff is wonderful. The Breakfast was no ordinary Continental Breakfast, it included a chef who would prepare your omlets anyway you liked them. All in all a 5 Star stay. I will most certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pink pyramid”
Reviews.Author: Islandykzy
Reviews.Content: Much Quieter,except Sat. & 4-6pm FREE daily happy hour social. Time share low/no pressure. Very good prices and stock in store. nice game room, great lounge areas, nice large pool w/ plenty of chairs/ loungers. decent beach. WE had a suite (all suites) on 10th w/partial ocean view which was a free upgrade. Suite was not one of the remodled ones but we found it great. Super lg. bath ,2sinks,lg.tub, seperate shower.nice grounds w/ 2 free gas BBQ to use. many Parrots & wild birds singing in large lobby. All in all we would go back in a minute. We liked the staff, the feel,the look, the valets, the placement on the island, even the non remodled room. If you want a place that doesen't look like a casino and feels like hawaii w/ enough luxury this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Embassy!! Not at all luxury...more like an upgraded motel 6”
Reviews.Author: melisacnp
Reviews.Content: For my honey moon we did a 2 week hawaiian honeymoon, the first week was at the Hilton Vacation Club on Oahu....IT WAS WONDERFUL!!!!( see that review) The second weeek we headed to Maui, This resort was awful, we rented it from an owner- this is a timeshare resort. The first room we were given was filthy!! The walls I could wash the dirt off of with a washrag and the shower was the same. We promptly told them this was not acceptable so they gave us a different room on another floor, it had the same 80's look...tacky. The room was cleaner though so I called down for cleaning supplies and did it myself ( I am not risking athletes foot or any other infection) we stayed afterall it was paid. The bed was the most awful mattress I have ever slept on, it was as comfortable as sleeping on the floor! I had a suspicion we were given a crappy room even though they knew we were renting from an owner and it was our honeymoon. We took the timeshare presentation for 200.00 in gift certificates from quality restraunts( Mama's Fish house is the BEST!!). Of course they showed us this wonderful updated room...very clean. I then told the sales person that it was a joke we were renting and were given a room that was below par when compared to this we were looking at. He preceded to tell us only 2 floors were not updated floors 3 and 10.... I told him we had on on 7...he was caught in his lie.. he became very defensive!! Needless to say we did not buy! The accomadtions were just not what you would expect on this island! My advice is to save your money till you can afford a nice hotel! My back hurt so bad after this experience I had to get adjusted from the doctor several times after we got home! I wouldn't have nearly been so upset but the housekeeping was less than to be desired and prior to checking out they knocked on our door not once but twice asking when we were leaving! And we we did leave they were standing outside our door...HOW TACKY!!! Much better accomdations exist, I would not chance getting one of these rooms we got!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had bought in 2003 and this was our first time back. We loved everything about this resort. The buffet breakfast is just lovely now. The omelet station really added to it and it is so nice in the dining room with REAL silverware and dishes. The upgraded furnishings in the room are lovely and the staff is wonderful. Nightly cocktail party is a real plus. We stayed one week later at Embassy Poipu and were so disappointed after our great week at Embassy Maui. Poipu was more of a condo than a resort! Can't wait to return to Embassy Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort for Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Maui. Last year we stayed at a hotel on Maui. This year we decided to stay at the Embassy Resort. I now understand the difference between Resort versus Hotel. I will never travel this far without staying in a resort again. The Embassy was extremely well kept up. The rooms are in the process of all being renovated. At check in I requested a renovated room. My request was granted and we stayed in room 614. Very clean! Nice decor. This was a one bedroom unit, with a small kitchen. We had our two young children with us, 2 & 5. The Embassy couldn't have been more perfect for us. The pool area has a separte kids section, with a waterslide. The beach is located right by the pool. It was perfect to play on the beach. The Embassy has restaurants, shopping, kids activities, happy hour at the bar, karoke in the evening. It was perfect. I have read on some other reviews about the breakfast not being so great. I felt this was one of the greatest things about our trip, we stared each morning with a great breakfast. There was many different items to choose from, something different each day. The kids had a great time trying new things. All of the food was prepared wonderful and kept very fresh. I would difinetely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just another day in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Stepp89
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Tuesday afternoon: me, my husband, and our two kids (age 13 and 10). Our room was ready promptly. Nice accomodations on the 11th floor, although we were put in a handicap accessible suite. The room was not updated like some had been and that was a little disappointing, but then again we spent most of our time outside anyway! There's a market just a block away, so we stocked up on groceries for the week. Keep in mind the fridge is small and there's no stove/oven in most units. We bought microwavable dinners and sandwich fixings for lunch. Breakfast was provided and was delicious! The line to get in to breakfast was only a short wait (if you go early by 8:00). Happy hour was a blast, with good mixed drinks, wine, and great Coors beer. The snacks were cheetos, doritos, and pretzels. Several days there was live entertainment and one day there was a cooking demonstration with free samples from the Embassy's head chef. The pool area is beautiful with two waterfalls and an overlook to the ocean. The week we were there, the pool heater was turned off due to a propane shortage, making swimming a bit chilly. The pool is linked to the beach, so when the water was too cold the kids swam in the ocean. We ate at the Ohana Grille the last night we were there. I highly recommend the Mahi Mahi sandwich! We ate dinner and watched the sunset from our table. I cried at dinner and was sad we had to leave our time in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but we found Better!”
Reviews.Author: SAndrea91483
Reviews.Content: I went with my fiance's family and there were five of us total. When we first got there, there were problems checking in and we had to wait over an hour despite being told that the check in time was earlier. The grounds were beautiful. They put us in the "ocean view room" we had reserved, where you could see a bit of the ocean way behind some trees and buildings. The room itself was okay looking but there were tons of ants getting in. Also the room had a musty smell and one of the people in our party has severe asthma, so this caused them some breathing difficulties (this is a problem they've had with certain hotels in the past as well). We were supposed to spend six nights there but after the first, we switched to the Marriot. The rooms there are roughly the same size as the ones at the Embassy, and had TWO bathrooms (which was a great conveniance to us). Also, for the exact same rate as the Embassy, we got an ocean view room that was directly ON the beach. The pool was amazing as well and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my choice”
Reviews.Author: DMonette
Reviews.Content: I am a new timeshare owner of the Embassy Suites. I purchased my timeshare sight unseen. I had been to Maui a couple of times in the last year and after falling in love with the island, decided to look into timeshares. I stayed at my new timeshare this past week, from March 6th-13th. From the moment we arrived, we loved the place. The lobby area is open with beautiful, colorful birds and ponds filled with koi. You will find many sofas and chairs to lounge in at this level and also in the lower level. I saw people using their laptops for wireless internet in the lobby areas. The suites have been nicely renovated. The tile in the kitchen and bath room has the appearance of stone. The counter tops were granite slab. I was very happy with the roominess of the suite. I checked out a Marriott Suite and it just didn't compare. The Embassy's suites are larger, with more counter space in the kitchen and a full size fridge as opposed to a half size that fit under the counter. The bathroom at the Embassy was huge and the bathroom at the Marriott was teeny tiny. There is a room safe, 2 T.V.'s, DVD, stereo, hair dryer, full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher, dishes , silverware, Mr. Coffee, and toaster in the suites. Sure the Marriott has a nicer beach, but that wasn't as important to me. If a bigger sandy beach is more important than the accomodations, then you will want to look elsewhere. Although, this beach was big enough for me, I can see that it lacks the appeal of other nicer beach areas. The swimming pool was very large with a slide and smaller pool for children. The restaurants were just okay. Nothing to write home about, yet, I had eaten at many other places in Lahaina and Whaler's Village and have not found anything that makes me want to return. Prices are higher, but that is to be expected in Maui. We bought a case of drinks at Costco before leaving Kahului and shopped at Star Market across the street from the Embassy for breakfast foods. It saved on some of the food bill during our stay. The Embassy has a manager's reception each evening with a snack mix of cheetos, doritos, etc. The drink choices were beer, mai tai's, margaritas, wine, and rum punch. We discovered we enjoyed the margaritas. It saved on our liquor bill having our before dinner drinks there. The staff were very accommodating in every way. All were pleasant. Jose in the outdoor grill area was a lot of fun. He was an excellent server with a nice sense of humor. Parking was not as treacherous as I had read. It isn't any worse than a parking garage in San Francisco. As owners, we didn't have to pay the $12 per day fee. I won't post pics of the room because mine look just like a previous posters, however, I will include pictures of the outside, lobby and birds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy for a week in February. It's a great place to stay, the rooms are nice. The pool area is wonderful, scenic and right on the beach. There's not too much swimming in the ocean going on as the water is a bit rough, and the break isn't conducive toward boarding or surfing, however the kiteboarders in front of the resort were a blast to watch! I read in a review below to avoid the managers cocktail hour. I wonder why one would want to avoid an open bar for 2 hours every evening which includes beer and mixed drinks? (not watered down ones either)Not to mention its a great social setting. Ate at the North Beach Grill for dinner and was pleasantly surprised, good food. The lobby is active, attractive, large, and quite inviting. Everyone was very, very friendly and helpful. The VIP Concierge booked a tee time for me, made dinner reservations, and also arranged a ride to the airport. You can also book activities in the lobby as well at the Concierge and that's extremely convenient. It's a high-rise place to be sure, but one that I'd stay at again. ps. In case you wonder why I didn't mention the room.. it was quite nice, not impressive..but what the heck, who's gonna spend THAT much time in their room anyways?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: jml5q
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy November 26 thru December 2 for the second week of our honeymoon. We got the room through a timeshare trade. We were given a newly renovated room and champagne upon our arrival. The suite was great and had a full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher and coffee maker. The bed was pretty comfy, my only complaint there is that the sheets seemed too small for the bed and had trouble staying in place. The comforter could also use an upgrade. We used the concierge staff to book a snorkeling trip and we sat through an hour timeshare presentation to receive $100 off the trip. Every evening from 4-6 they have a free happy hour in the lobby area with free wine, beer and mai tais. We ate in both restaurants and they were both very good. Overall, this was a great place to stay for a week and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but is being remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Slickd23
Reviews.Content: The Embassy was undergoing some renovations when were there in September. The Hotel is in a great location and was not crowded at all. The pool is nice and the water at the beach is calm. The renovation is not bad, a litlle noisy during the day, but did not bother us as we were out doing the many great things. The hotel offerred a daily happy hour with free drinks and a free breakfast. The price was right for this place and it was relaxing. If you are looking for a good place at a nice price this is a good choice. If you want luxury, stay at one of the hotels up the beach a little at Kaanapali. Take advantage of the concierge, they do a soft sell for time share, we did not do it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: South535
Reviews.Content: Whew ! Where do I start. We traded through RCI. They do tell you in advance that rooms are scenic view, however we knew ocean view rooms were available and they refused to up-grade because of contract with RCI. Most resorts up-grade if rooms available, not them. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE !!. I asked about adding an extra day to my stay. One employee quoted one rate and another employee the next day quoted another rate, $100 higher the next day. Then employee proceeded to call me a liar, that there was no such rate. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE !!. Pool was nice even though pool side service was non-exsistant. Beach was nice but not to suitable for swimming. Food at the breakfeat buffet was the worst I've encountered. If customer service and high standards are what your looking for-keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: afranssen
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nicely furnished, bathroom is very nice. Swimming pool has lots of space and sunbeds, but hardly any shade nor umbrellas. I do not recommend the restaurants nor the managers cocktail. The breakfast is mediocre and has long waiting lines and the pool bar is the same quality, but other than that I would recommend the stay, especially with children

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: laughing808
Reviews.Content: We spent a portion of our honeymoon here. The room was very nice and spacious. The view was ok, partial view of ocean and hotel's rooftop putt-putt golf course. There are two restaurants on the preimises, both were good. The pools were nice, and beach access was just a few feet away. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful week on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Daverasta
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another wonderful week on Maui, December 9-16. We are timeshare owners, and this was our second stay at the Embassy. I agree with what's been written in most of the recent reviews. The Embassy is a great place for families (we took our 4 year old), the remodeled rooms are very nice, now with a full sized refrigerator/freezer and upgraded furnature. The main pool is quite large, there's also a small kids pool with a waterslide. And of course you are right on the beach, with short drives to the main Kaanapali beach strip and the shops and restaurants in Lahaina. Recommended restaurants include Roy's in Kahana, The Hula Grill and Barefoot Bar on Kaanapali, and for a huge breakfasts (and great bloody marys) Moose McGillicuddy's in Lahaina. Although the name is Embassy Suites "Resort", this hotel doesn't really meet my definition of a resort since for example there are no tennis courts or golf course and a limited spa. It is not in the same class as, for example, the Hyatt, Four Seasons, etc. So, if you are expecting that level of "resort" you will be disappointed. However, for what it offers the Embassy is an excellent choice for your stay on Maui. Finally, the Embassy is trying to sell timeshare units. None of the other guests I spoke with complained about the sales presentations or tactics, but if you are considering a timeshare purchase I would suggest researching the resale market.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AlenaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be wonderful. The staff was very professional and nice. We are thinking about buying time share there next year. It's a good deal for families with little kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodations right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: inthewind
Reviews.Content: My husband and I relaxed at this beautiful resort for a week in November, 2005. Our suite was a large 1 bedroom overlooking the ocean and a huge pool- complete with balconies. Rooms have mini-kitchens including all but stoves. They have a good fitness center and activities crew (to set up trips). The only negatives were the extreme prices and poor food at the poolside restaurant, broken internet and stereo cable, thus lack of internet access in our suite (they were never able to fix it) and we would warn everyone to just skip the miniature golf - it simply is not worth the cost. Yes, they do charge for everything except the pool towels. All of that aside, the location is wonderful, the staff is helpful and friendly and the beds are comfortable. Just be sure to get a room with ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Our exprience was great.”
Reviews.Author: KEVBUD
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week (nov 13th to 20th).The place was great.We was in a ocean front suite.Great room, great views.Would recomend for any size family.We were married there on the beach. And we are seniors.Great place to visit and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value oriented resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed Nov.7-13, The rooms are very good sized, @ 850 sq,ft. Our unit(room 227)needed a update due to overly worn funiture. Our bed was hard but an "egg crate" was quicky provided when requested. We recieved new sheets and towels each day. Our dishes were also cleaned, daily. The pool area is large for this price range. The breakfast buffet is like college food. No bad, lots of choices but the hot food is usually cold. The happy hour is also average. They use no name off brand alcohol except for the beer, which is Coors. One snack is provided. Like most moderately priced resorts, $10.00 is charge each day to pack your rental car in their parking lot. Their webb site makes the Embassy Suites look luxurious. This resort is more in the moderate range but at the high end of that scale due to the larger rooms and nice pool area. Overall, ES is still a good value oriented resort in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort to spend your hard earned vacation at. It was our first trip to Hawaii and couldn't have spent our time or money any better. Very large rooms, great service and wonderful pool and atmosphere. Will be back year after year!!!!!! Very polite staff. Great restaurants. Close to all the Maui attractions.

Reviews.Title: “This a hard place not to like”
Reviews.Author: LIkestoTravelNJ
Reviews.Content: We were on the second floor with a view of the ocean. As others have described the rooms are quite large, the breakfast is certainly edible and plentiful. Happy hour is a nice addition as you get ready to watch the sunset. The only possible negative is the fact that the resort isn't attached to a beautiful beach. The pool is huge with plenty of chairs. The staff was as helpful as we needed them to be and would have loved to have bought a piece of the place but the trip is just too far from New Jersey to make on a regular basis. Otherwise this is a great hotel for families in particular. Large rooms with multiple TV's make it easy for children to feel at home. It's five minutes from Whaler's Village and ten to fifteen from Lahaina. The strip mall with grocery stroe and several small restaurants provided needed groceries and lunch fare. All in all a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Embassy Suites, Kaanapali!”
Reviews.Author: bclady5
Reviews.Content: What an excellent resort. We come here every year, and have never been disappointed. The rooms have all sorts of room for a family of 5 even! My kids, ages 11,13 and 16 also had a great time. We stayed there over Halloween 2005, and had a great time on Front St. (just minutes by car down the road) on Halloween night! We loved the Complimentary Breakfast, and the Complimentary Manager's Reception. We would never stay anywhere else when in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: none00
Reviews.Content: Pluses: - Big rooms, bathroom was huge with 2 sinks. Great shower (sufficient water pressure/flow). Refrigerator, microwave, sink, plates, utensils, etc. - Staff was very friendly/helpful. - Breakfast buffet was quite good & varied daily. - Central location close to many sites/activities. Minuses: - Bathroom was not cleaned that well. - Elevators were only access to other floors - we were on 2nd floor and would've loved to access staircase instead to save time. - Birds attack/eat your food at breakfast (outdoors) - even with a lid on it! So you always need to guard your food. - "Scenic view" room wasn't ocean view. - Parking stalls were very small.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon in maui”
Reviews.Author: kimandremy
Reviews.Content: We spent the 1st half of our honeymoon at the Embassy Suites hotel. Friends of ours recommended this hotel to us- they spent their honeymoon here several years ago. We enjoyed the large room and spacious bathroom. Our view was partial ocean view- we basically overlooked the miniature golf course with a side view of the ocean. We considered changing rooms, but did not as the price was considerably more. We hardly spent any time on the balcony so it didn't matter. The grounds were very pretty and well maintained. The conceirge was helpful and friendly. We liked this hotel because the beach was only used by hotel guests and was really quiet. We would definitely recommend this hotel for couples/families looking for a quieter beach. We enjoyed travelling a few minutes down the road to the Sheraton and shopping, but were VERY PLEASED that we were not staying there. The beach in front of the Sheraton was very crowded and noisy. We felt the location of our hotel was great- right in the middle of everywhere we went. Downtown Lahaina is seconds away. The breakfast at The Embassy Suites was typical "free breakfast" fare. Nothing fancy but it was fine. We wanted to eat the rest of our meals outside of the hotel so we could experience the rest of the island. Go to Hawaii and enjoy a beautiful place. Mostly a family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You will like it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just returned from a 7 night stay at the Embassy Suites in Maui. Our room was on the second floor, which was a little disappointing since it overlooked the putt putt golf area on the 1st floor roof. We could see the ocean however and could catch the sunsets in the evening off our balcony. The room was clean and the kitchen area and dishes were spotless. The bathroom was huge and clean. One sink had a faucett that would not turn off completely. Our only complaint with the room was the television remote was useless. We changed batteries and it still wouldn't work. No big deal though...who wants to watch much TV while in Hawaii? The room had a safe which was also handy. The pool area is nice and we had no problem getting chairs. Beach area is clean and if you travel a little to the south you can find a terrific place to snorkel. The pool provides towels which are clean and large. The breakfast every morning is a big plus. The selection was good each day, however the eggs were cold each day we were there. Also, watch out for the birds who like to dive onto your plate if you get up from your table. The happy hour between 4 and 6PM is nice too, however the drinks seemed a little watered down. Not bad for being free! We did the timeshare thing, which was a first for us. No pressure, and the salesperson was cool about the fact we didn't purchase. 80% of the timeshare presentations end up with no sale, so don't feel bad about turning them down. Take advantage of the great rate they offer with the timeshare tour. They also have highspeed internet connections in each room. It costs 9.99 per 24 hour period. Just plug the provided Cat5 cable into your laptop and you are connected. Very nice bonus if you want to be on the internet while vacationing. The staff was professional and very helpful. The only problem I had was getting an early checkin. I tried at 2PM, they gave me a pager and said they would page me when the room was ready. I watched 4 other families check in around 3:15 and finally asked at the desk and they said, Oh, your room is ready. They apparently forgot to page me. This is a great place for families with kids. My kids ages 6 and 10 had a terrific time and having the extra suite where they could sleep was just simply priceless for us. Overall, a great place to stay while in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: MY Wife, 3 kids and I spent 5 nights at the Embassy begining 07/17. We got a corner room on the 10th floor 1039 which although not a renovated room was very nice. It had a extremly large balcony which overlooked the pool and ocean. Our packeage called for a scenic view room so we were extremly happy when we saw it. The check in went very smoothly and we found the staff quite helpful and friendly. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that rollaway beds were complimentary as part of our package also. We used 2 of them and each of the children had thier own bed to sleep in. We had also spent 2 nights in honolulu, the 5 of us crammed in a regular size hotel room, not on the beach, which cost about 125 per night with this memory fresh in our minds the room at the embassy was a welcome change. Also part of our package was the timeshare presentation. We were a little nervous about this as almost everything we had read said to avoid these like the plague. The presentation was quite informative and almost pleasant the salesman was not high pressure and let us make up our own mind. There were some good points to being an owner although not right for us. We did our required 1 1/2 hrs and it was over no sweat, well worth it for the price we paid for the room. We booked most of our activities prior to arriving which was good. we did a snorkel trip, Zip line adventure, Parasailing and luau. The zipline was by far the groups favorite activity. The snorkel trip was not bad but it was an extremely looong boat ride. We ended up choosing the slowest boat on Maui and left from Lahaina harbor which is farther from the snorkel spot. It was and 1 1/2 hr ride out and another 1 1/2 hrs back. The catamarans from Maelaee(sp) harbour make the trip in about 30-45 mins one way. the one thing we should have done was plan more time for just sitting at the pool or beach the hotel has excellent facilities after all isn't the point of vacation to relax? Anyway all in all it was a great experience and would definitly return to the Embassy again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice would do it again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 9 night stay at the Embassy. I was a bit anxious before we left from reading the reviews but ended up being pleasantly surprised and happy with our stay. I was not expecting the Ritz and it was not at that quality but it was similar in value/quality to other Embassy Suites I have stayed at. We had a family of 5 with 3 teenagers and 2 adults. It was fine for us as we were not in our rooms much. The bathrooms were huge. Had no problems with the showers and towels etc. Service was good everywhere. We used the fitness room, breakfast buffet, valet parking, cocktail hour, and took the timeshare tour. I have no complaints about any of it. The only problem was the elevator because one was not working near us. I asked to be moved and they were accommodating. We had an older room and it was OK but saw an updated room and they were very nice. I would recommend this for families of any size or age. Honeymooners might want something a bit different. I would think about buying a timeshare here if I was returning every year. For the money this place is a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Big family traveling -Great resort, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Maui, Hawaii-Great time-Very nice resort. July 3, 2005 Family traveling with kids. 12 of us althogether, 4 kids (ages 4,10,12,13) 2 sets of parents and 2 sets of grandparents. Everybody liked the resort. If you are afraid of heights or have little ones, ask to be on a lower floor. The hotel has 3 towers with open atriums. So if you are on the 10th floor and come out of your room you are in the atrium with only a railing between you and the the lobby down below. Request room 1029 it has an extra large lanai/balcony (fits 12 comfortably) with a great view which we used to eat take out, relax and go over our day. Most lanai are only about 3 1/2ft wide by 12ft long. 1029 also has an adjoining room. All suites have a private bedroom with a living room/kitchenette/dining area. The kids have a pull-out sofa in the living room with a TV and stereo system. Bring your own CD's, not too many radio stations. Breakfast is free, you get about the same thing everyday, the food is good but gets boring by the end of the week. There is a full- size grocery store,Star Food Market, across the street. You can buy food, snacks, soda, beer, wine and even take-out. There was no stove in our room, only a microwave. We bought peanut butter and jelly, fruit, drinks, popcorn, spaghetti-O's, beer, soda and laundry detergent. Laundry room on even numbered floors. 4-6pm free manager's cocktail party near the lobby, the limited drinks were very good and the only snack was party mix. You can bring down your own crakers and cheese. Pool- big, clean, plenty of lounge chairs with a slide, volleyball net, hot tub and waterfall. Towel service. Beach-nice, clean. Little ones swim in the morning, very calm water. Bigger ones later in the day, the wind picks up and so does the surf. But it's still summer so not very good waves for body boards. Snorkle right off the beach. Rent equip. from an off-resort shop for under $15 for the week. This way you have it when you go anywhwere else on the island. Mini-golf is available @ $3.75 per hour and there is a nice game room in the basement. Pizza-the kids only liked Pizza Hut, not the local shop Going to 2 islands? Make your first stop-say Maui. Stay for 6 nights unpack, relax and enjoy. Then pack whatever clean clothes you have left in a small bag and move-on to Oahu for 2 nights. This way you are not living out of a suit case which is hard to do with kids and all their stuff. We went out of Philly, long plane ride, if you have recently potty trained child or heavy sleeper, bring a pull-up or 2 and change of clothes in your carry-on. My little one wore a pull up on the way home (night flight). It saved me a hassle. Old Lahaina Luau-good for adults not so much for kids. Very traditional. Very nice show but not enough action and kids didn't like food, went to MdDonalds afterwards. Try luau with fire batons. Also kids liked the Magic Show Kapanaha very much, lots of fun. Grandparents also liked it. You can book activities on-line ahead of time. While were were there people were being turned away becaue they didn't have a reservation and it was a 2 day wait to get them. If you book before you go you have 24 hours before the scheduled time to cancel so it gives you flexibility. We booked our snorkle trip and luau before we left. Also try, parasailing ($60), surfing ($20rent) and submarine(kids are free). Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Stay”
Reviews.Author: sigam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Embassy. Overall, we were very happy with the resort. The room was great, and so was our ocean view. Other than the front desk employees and Ohana Express employees (not at all friendly or helpful), we were extremely impressed with the service and friendliness of the staff at the Embassy. Poolside/restaurant staff as well as the valet service was outstanding and always friendly and helpful. We loved the pool and the lounge chairs available (free) oceanside. The food and smoothies poolside were very good, and the North Beach restaurant was also great, with a super view. Our only complaints are that we were not allowed a late check-out and there was NO attempt to work with us on this. Also, a breakfast tray was left outside our room from 9am one day to 10 am the following day. We reported it twice, and it was still not retrieved until the next morning. We were disappointed since the rest of the service had been so good. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy. The beach location is nice and relaxing, and not too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Louise_1980
Reviews.Content: My husband, three kids, and I stayed six nights at the Embassy in June. This is our second visit. I agree that this hotel is hard to rate. It is perfect for my family â€“ kid friendly, pretty casual, nice pool, great views. We cannot fit comfortably in a standard hotel room, so the suite concept is perfect for us. We were fortunate enough on this visit to get an updated room which was nicely decorated. We had a partial ocean view, so we had panoramic views of the ocean, pool, and mountains. We spent all our spare time sitting on the large balcony enjoying the view. We liked the free breakfast. It is certainly not gourmet or cooked to order, but there were plenty of choices, and we enjoyed sitting next to the ocean every morning. We also liked the happy hour. The kids thought it was fun to get the snacks and have â€œdrinksâ€�. We are pretty easy to please. I do not consider this a budget hotel. It is in Hawaii, so everything is beautiful. It is also not as plush as some of the Kaanapali hotels such as the Hyatt. However, we saved a lot of money on breakfast and the cost of getting two hotel rooms. The kitchenette was great also. There was a full sized refrigerator which we filled with drinks, fruit, and the makings for one or two meals. After being at the beach all day, it was great to relax in the room with a simple meal. On this visit, we were able to swim at the beach right by the hotel. When we last visited, in the winter, the water was much too wild to safely swim. The casual restaurant by the pool was pretty good. We were able to eat and watch the sunset while my older children swam in the pool. The torch lighting ceremony was fun to watch at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites for our Honeymoon from June 27th to July 6th. Had a room directly facing the ocean, great view. Excellent atmosphere at the resort. Very big room, enough for a family of four. Only complaint were the kids that were running through the resort unsupervised at all hours of the day and night. (Parents need to keep on eye on your kids with all the problems lately, Aruba) Not the resorts fault though. Overall, wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy is above average”
Reviews.Author: CaKazmom
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 night stay. This hotel is nice, we had good service, no problems. We do not own a timeshare here, so were given the older rooms. We did have an ocean view, but it did overlook a roof top and mini golf course too. I felt the bathroom was big and clean, but the fixtures were so old, they didn't turn on very well and the shower was too hard. But again, for the price, it is not bad....just don't expect the Ritz! The breakfast was pretty good, but at times the line would be a 20 minute wait, then the next morning, no wait at all. Went to the time share presentation, I was told 90 minutes...he took 3 hours! But, we did not buy. The pool was okay, but they really need to upgrade the jacuzzi situation...maybe add another one. One evening it was so packed, there was no room for anyone else! Overall, for the price we paid for our entire family, I would say this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “I changed hotels service awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never been so dissatisfied with a hotel. There were four of us who had saved for a chance to spend a week in Maui. We arrived at the Embassy Suites. We were told we had a room on the sixth floor. We asked for a lower room. One of us has a problem with heights and anxiey attacks. The clerk on duty said your luggage is being sent up I can't do anything about it, come back down if you don't like the room it has just been remodeld. I repeated again it is up too high, we can not stay in that suite. She handed us a card and turned around. 10 min. later my sister in tears and face deathly white, we went back downstairs, she said thats all I have you'll have to find a room somewhere else. My sister and her husband went to a hotel called Paki Maui and had a much better room and service then we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with kitchnette for small children”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old son, and I stayed here during Memorial Day Weekend. The room itself is large with a separate bedroom, living/dining room, and bathroom. The hotel rooms are older and need remodeling, but that is reserved for the timeshares that they sell. You can take a timeshare tour that lasts about 60 to 90 minutes. We took this option and got a $200 credit to eat at restaurants and buy stuff and it really wasn't that bad (about 60 minutes) because we were not interested in buying a condo. The beach is convenient and the waves are calm for small children. Breakfast is good with a fruits, eggs, and is a good way to start the day off. Our room had a partial ocean view overlooking Molokai and we got a 5 day / 4 night package over the Internet for $790 including taxes and parking. I would recommend this to anybody thinking about staying in the area and needing a room with a kitchenette (no stove/oven). You really don't want to cook on vacation anyways. The bathroom had two sinks, a shower, and tub that made bathing our toddler easy. The location of the hotel is about 2 miles north of the other major hotels along the beach strip of kaanapali. I would stay here again even though the room is not the cleanest, but then again what hotel is! It had the amenities that we needed and breakfast was outdoors in the morning shade of the building with a great view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: msteacher44
Reviews.Content: My family returned yesterday from 8 days in Maui. Our stay at the Embassy was great. We found the service, the food and especially the pool area perfect for us. My husband and I ,along with our 16,13,and 10 year old visited several hotels along the same strip but found nothing as suitable for our family than this one. Please feel free to email me for more info. Iwould love to share anything to make your trip as wonderful as ours!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice large room, but so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: ptirvine
Reviews.Content: ok, lets first start off by saying the the embassy 'kaanapali' is not 'really' located on the famous kaanapali beach that you hear about on the travel channel. it's some technicallity that they can still call the stretch 'kaanapali.' the water is much rougher on this stretch (as opposed to the westin's location). for some reason, it rained there more often than at the westin (same trip, of course). i asked a cashier at the star market across the street about the gloomy weather and he said "this stretch is like this, drive 5 mins. north or south and it will be sunny." i thought he was exaggerating, but he was indeed right! lahaina and the 'real' kaanapali was always very nice, and you can look over at the embassy and see a dark could for much of the day. next, the crowd. if you are looking for a singles type crowd, this is not the place. young children and their parents are the main stay. we have 2 young boys of our own. we fit right in :) hotel is nice, but not great. workout room s-----. pool was nice, but slide was pretty dinky. facility is a little dated. breakfast buffet was ok, but i can't eat eggs and potatoes everyday. rooms were large, which is nice if you have children. small fridge and microwave is also convenient. staff. ok, when i read about the staff not being friendly, i just figured a few people had a few bad experience with an individual. but now i know what they mean. staff is NOT friendly. not rude either, but far from friendly. most of them just looked like they would rather be on the beach, as opposed to working by the beach. my stay. the third night featured a 1.5 hour blackout. i was told this happened before, so don't worry. HAPPENED BEFORE!!?? i hope this was not a fairly common thing. the fourth night featured the alarm sirens going off about 1:00 am to 2:00 am. PA messages saying "we are investigating the alarm" and "the alarm was a false alarm." about 4 or 5 sirens followed by 4 or 5 messages from 1:00 am to 2:00 am!!!!!! i'm not a picky person, but my stay was not too relaxing. bad weather + bad service+ moderate hotel + bad power outage+ bad alarms = bad stay. 1 more note for those who are interested in the time share tour. DON'T DO IT! They would not take 'no' for an answer. sleezy salesperson reminded me of the worst used car salesman you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: WOW_Dad
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Embassy Vacation Resort from 4/9/05 to 4/16/05. The stated check-in time of 4pm seemed a little on the late side. We arrived at 2pm hoping that our room might be ready and they were able to get us in by 3pm. I wasn't able to immediately tell if our room had been refurbished or not, but it was clean, spacious and comfortable for our family of 2 adults and 3 children under 10. Our kitchen consisted of a pretty good sized mini-fridge, a microwave, sink, toaster and coffee maker. They also provided, plates, bowls, glasses, and utensils. If we left dirty glasses in the sink, the maid service replaced them with clean ones. The beach was close and convenient, however, we didn't find it to be one of the better beaches in the area. It was very narrow and there are quite a few rocks/stones right when you walk into the water. We found much nicer beaches just north or south of where the resort is. The pool was very large. We never had a problem finding chairs or feeling overcrowded in the pool. Our kids enjoyed the water slide that they had. One issue we had was that the childrens pool was marked as 3.5 feet deep, and it seemed to get deeper in the middle. It was too deep to let our 4 year play in without an adult right by his side. Our family really enjoyed the breakfast and happy hour provided by the resort. The breakfast allowed us to quickly grab food in the morning and had something to satisfy all of our appetites. They typically provided a variety of fresh fruit, some baked goods, pancakes or french toast, scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon and some potato dish. Additionally they had mini-bagels with cream cheese, toast, cereals and a variety of juice. There seemed to be enough variety to satisfy most people. We were also able to take slices of bread and peanut butter and jelly packets to our room to occasionally make sandwiches for lunch. One of our kids favorite times of the day was the happy hour. They provided a good variety of drinks with and without alcohol. As some others have mentioned there was some snack mix available. This usually helped our kids last until dinner. There was also some musical entertainment from 5-6pm each night. We did find that there was a rather long wait for elevators and 2 of the 6 elevators were not working during our stay. I'm sure at busier times, this would have been a bigger problem. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We only wish that it had a slightly better location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on Embassy”
Reviews.Author: HWlovesmaui
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Embassy the year it opened- it wasn't even completely finished yet. We've stayed there 3 more times since then. I give a mixed review. I love: the rooms- spacious, perfect for families, wonderful bathrooms, showers and tubs, kitchenette is just right, and grounds are lovely. We also enjoy the tropical bird collection they have on display each day, the great large-sized pool, and the un-crowded beach. On the negative side, we've seen the physical condition of the hotel deteriorate over the years. Two of the 6 elevators were non-functioning the whole 2 weeks we were there. An employee told us she'd been working there for 4 months and she'd never seen those elevators run. We overheard a timeshare salesperson saying that bank of elevators "are being refurbished". We were there during spring break and often had to wait a very long time for an elevator. Furniture in the casual restaurant was very run-down and food there was expensive and not good. The nice restaurant was high priced and we never took a chance on trying it. We figured if they couldn't make a decent club sandwich at the casual restaurant we didn't want to waste money at their expensive place. The free breakfast is ok, but they didn't seem to make any accomodations for the big spring-break crowds and we often had to wait in very long lines for the breakfast. As for a previous review saying that this place was filled with older people; I think it really depends on the time of year that you are visitng. We're often there during school break times and it's filled with families with kids. This time, we stayed a while longer, and yes, we did notice the crowd shift from families to more older couples. We didn't see many young couples there. The pool is very large, especially compared to the postage-stamp pools at all the condo complexes surrounding the Embassy. The pool never felt crowded and it was never a problem to find a chair. The beach there is narrow, but the sand is clean and soft and there are no crowds. Service- generally good, though on our first day we switched rooms with my folks who were traveling with us. We called and went down to the desk right away to let them know of our switch. They never did get it right and it caused some confusion when trying to make room charges etc. throughout our stay. We've visited so often, I feel like we should take advantage of time-share ownership. Until the phycial condition of the place and the management /service improves and becomes consistent, I'm hesitant to make a permanent investment here. Overall, their facilities and location suit our family just right at this point.

Reviews.Title: “What a great family vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of five just returned from a nine day vacation. Everything about this trip was superb! This was our fifth trip to the islands, third to Maui and 1st time staying at the Embassy. We enjoyed every aspect of the resort...from the spacious suite (HUUUGE bathroom), to the large pool with waterslide and waterfalls (Wayne, the waterslide monitor, was awesome with the kids), to the always friendly/prompt staff, to the kid friendly atmosphere. The whale watching was fascinating...right from the beach or while eating the variety-filled breakfast buffet from the outdoor patio area...they were so close! Grounds and property were well kept. Strip mall directly across the street (5 minute walking distance) with Subway, Pizzaria(AWESOME!!), shops and large grocery store. Eight minute drive south to Kaanapali/Whaler's Village with many shops and restaurants and beach sidewalk. Highly recommend CJ's Deli for fabulous food at reasonable prices which is five minute drive from Embassy just before Whaler's Village. Walk south down the beach halfway towards Black Rock for a terrific snorkeling spot (recommended by a local). Then there is always Kapalua Bay north of resort. All in all a fabulous place for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy from Feb. 17 to Feb. 23 and had a wonderful time. We had 7 adults and 4 children 15mo., 4, 6, and 10 in our party. The resort is great for families!! There is a water slide for the kids, an arcade, a mini golf course, a workout room for adults, and a wonderful beach. We enjoyed the food at the Ohana Grill located next to the pool it was tasty and well priced. Our favorite by far was renting one of the four gazebos for the day which are located in between the pool and beach. A great location to be able to watch the kids in the pool or at the beach, and a great shady area for those that need it. Since we visited during whale season we enjoyed watching for the many Humpback whales that coast right infront of the resort beach. The rooms are huge espically the bathroom, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We visited the Embassy as part of a timeshare solicitation package and attended their timeshare presentation we enjoyed our stay so much we purchased. I have been to Maui 5 times and having not been to this resort before I read a lot of the reviews and was really worried. I guess some people expect the Ritz wherever they stay. We were in a non - renovated room and I did not find the rooms dirty or infested with bugs. The kitchenettes are great they come with a microwave, sink, all the utensils and a fridge since there is a market located across the street from the resort you can purchase drinks, snacks etc. and keep them cold in your room. A great feature for anyone staying with kids. The breakfest and happy hour were free as part of our package so how can you complain. I would recommend staying as part of a timeshare solicitation if you can since all room rates in Ka'anapali are high priced. We discoved the package deal on the Embassy Ka'anapali web site. We can't say enough about the Embassy it is a beautiful resort in a great location 2 min. drive from Whalers Village, and 10 min. drive from Lahaina. We can't wait go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Amazing, Embassy Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jthomas
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Embassy. Since our travel agent couldn't get us an Ocean View in the price range we had, my wife went to their website, where there is the "Time share special". You know, sit through an hour, etc. It was worth it! Our room wasn't ON the ocean, but you could see it with 40% obstruction. I'm very picky, and this was great!
