We brought our 1 year old, and were accomodated nicely - from the crib that was brought up, to the breakfast buffett (high chairs).. to the Cabannas for rent. Speaking of which, we had planned to explore all the beaches in Maui, but after the Haleakala Crater trip, and road back from Hana, we decided to stay on the beach. The Embassy's spot on the ocean is VERY nice - wasn't crowded, plenty of chairs for the beach and poolside. With the Cabanna rentals - you pay $30/day, but have your own private view of the ocean with adjustable cover for yourself and mate (or in our case 1 year old) made it really nice! Service was top. We had no problem getting help when needed. Laundry machines on each floor made it convenient to economize on amount of clothes brought. The "Time share special" was a nice deal - as we got breakfasts free (otherwise $17/day), parking free, AND free tickets to the Hyatt Luau ($70 each). I'd be the first person to give complaints when justified - but this was nice. We've been all over, this trip was the best. Maui is incredible; if you can plan it months in advance, ask for pure Ocean front view.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy from Feb 12th - 17th 2005. It was our first trip to Hawaii we were very pleased with this resort. It was large and had many amenities. I was afraid to see what we would get after reading review, and was pleasantly surprised we had a remolded suite that looked out to the ocean, the suite was very nicely done and very large it was a treat compared to the size of our room on Oahu. We did speak to others at the beach that were not as happy about there rooms, they had unremodeled rooms. We were told all rooms will be remodeled by end of this year. We did the internet special were we had to listen to a 90 minute time share presention. It went quickly and no pressure, this offer worked out well for us. We did not find that all of the lawn chairs we taken in the morning and you could not find a spot in the afternoon, we did not have a problem with this. We felt the breakfast buffet was ok, they changed the meat selection every day and they would offer pancakes one day and french toast another day, there is cereal and bagels as well as many other options I can't believe people complain about a free breakfast, we were happy we did not have to pay. We found the staff to be very friendly. Our only complaint about Hawaii is it's very expensive. The hotel is in a good location you are just 4 miles from Lahina and about 45 min from the airport. The hotel activity desk told us twice that the activity we wanted was booked so I called them direct and was able to get in. I think they get a certain number of tickets at discount and when there tickets are gone they tell you they are sold out, so try on your own. We did the whale watching trip the resort recommended and it was great. I would recommend the Fest of Lele Laua it was expensive $100 per person but worth it, it is a small more intimate setting compared to the large group setting at a traditional lula were you sit a a large table with many people and stand in line for a buffet, here you sit at your own table and are served a 4 course meal right to your table. I would also recommend the Warren and Annabelle magic show it was great. The road to Hana took us 10 hours from start to finish and we only stopped 6-8 times

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful properity.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is very spacious and close to all the major attractions of Northwest Maui. We stayed January 18th-20th at this hotel. The staff was very helpful especially through the reventations of the hotel. I was very impressed at the level of customer service we received from the bellhops to the managers of the building. Several of the other resorts in Lahaina and Kapulua are just overpriced, rundown, and not very family oriented. One note when you do come just expect to have a great time. Aloha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in 2 timeshare units January 2-9, 2005. We loved the large suites -- bathrooms are oversized and feature separate toilet room and two vanities - a plus for families. We had a very nice view of the ocean & Molokai from the spacious lanai. Weekly breakfast buffet is extra $85 per suite (up to 4 persons) it was abundant but not extraordinary, consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes or french toast, pototoes, baked goods, fresh fruits and yogurt, cold cereal. The 60' pool slide was being refinished and scheduled to reopen on 1/9. The daily hosted happy hour from 4-6 pm was a pleasant break before heading out on the evening's activities -- drinks available are Mai-Tais, Margaritas, Rum Punch, wine and beer, no blended drinks -- they offer something similar to party-mix for munchies. We ate one evening at the Ohana Grill which featured burgers, pizza and the like and live music. The staff here seems friendly, professional and service-oriented. When we arrived at the property it was shortly before the published check-in time and only one of our units was ready for us but we were given access to it immediately. Our second unit was ready approximately 1-1/2 hours after the stated check-in time -- we were offered another unit which we declined -- the property furnished us with a $50 dining certificate and waived the parking fees for both our vehicles. There is a narrowish beach adjoining the pool area -- Finding a pool lounge either by the pool or by the beach and some shade wasn't a problem -- towels are avail on loan (snorkeling equipment seemed expensive, though $12/day). Wear reef shoes for the ocean since there is a lot of coral and rocky surfaces --supposed to be good snorkeling spot. Its also a great place to watch the acrobatic kite-surfers when the wind is blowing right. There is a game room located below-grade near the garage entrance-- it seemed remote -- I wouldn't send my kids down there to play alone. The minature golf course looks lame. Aside from those small negatives -- it was a really nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Try it you'll like it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Resort December 1-10. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The suite we had was very spacious, clean and up to date. The resturant and breakfast bar was good and not too expensive. The pool was nice and big. The concierge went out of their way to help us plan our adventures while we were there and we were also given some discounts. We were able to check in early and still get an ocean view room. We would definitely go back again. Just remember when you read someone's review don't let their opinion sway you. When I read some of the reviews, I was somewhat nervous about staying at the Embassy but I'm so glad we did. We didn't regret our decision at all.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed there two times now and loved it. a little bit pricy , but very nice, left a very good impression on us. close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Maui over the Thanksgiving holiday and had a great time. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but were very pleased with the room, food, service, pool, beach, etc. Our room was on the 9th floor and we were told it had not been renovated yet. I would love to see the renovated rooms because ours was great before renovation. If you expect the Ritz-Carlton you will be disappointed most places you go. Make the most of it. Yes the breakfast is a buffet, so the eggs aren't the greatest. For us the breakfast was included, so no big deal. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. All in all a great experience at the Embassy and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: ToddGB
Reviews.Content: First, the only reason there are only 4 out of 5 is because no place is perfect, Iâ€™d rate it 4.9 if there was the option. Our stay was 10 great days, 8-18 November 2004. My wife and I went to this same hotel for our honeymoon 11 years ago and happily returned. We had intended to look for a different place to stay, just to try something else, and could not find a place that accommodated 5 people, us + 3 children; Embassy did and we will return again next November. We went there on a â€œRun of the hotelâ€� room option, where we would get whatever they had available when we got there, we expected a â€œscenicâ€� view of the parking lotâ€¦ but got a 12 floor Ocean View. We have 3 boys, 9, 6, 6 and the hotel was totally accommodating to them. Granted a bad day in Maui is better then a great day anywhere but the Embassy Suites Resort lived up to its reputation. We are even considering a time-share there. Thank you Embassy!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay and we thought the hotel was average. The staff is friendly, the restaurant food is good, the breakfast buffet could be much better. The potatoes were always bad and the eggs were not very good either. We were happy with our room. For the age of the room, we felt it was in great condition. The pool is nice and always neat. I thought the hotel grounds were very nice. Even though the hotel is undergoing renovation, it was fairly quiet and there was very little mess from construction around the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Embassy! Spend your vacation elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: megalittle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very bad! The rooms that have not been renovvated are just terrible. My family just returned from the online timeshare mini-break. We had 3 rooms amoung us. My husband and I were in a renovated room (we were told there we none available but managed to get into one anyway)...even the 'newer' rooms have problems. Our dishwasher broke, the tub leaked to the poor people below us, the master bedroom wall is shared with the elevator...I could go on and on. The room is very cramped with furniture - just too much and it is mismatched. They went through all the trouble to rennovate this hotel then put the old fans back in! It is just ridiculous - poor quality and workmanship all around. There were so many plugs in the outlet behind the tv that the circuit blew when I turned on the blender. You have to ask for a blender and hot plates that are as old as dirt. The maintainance staff is very friendly which I would have prefered not to meet on so many occasions. The front desk staff was very unfriendly and the timeshare folks were snotty. The other rooms we had were not rennovated and were so run down it was comical. They were horrible - broken down furniture, the worst beds on the planet (the new beds are bad too) and stinky. My sister's room got overrun with chemical odor during the last night from construction on the floor above. Oh, beware of the construction!! They say it won't be that bad! Bull! There were times during the day were you could barely hear yourselves talking in your room. The breakfast was horrible and cocktail reception was hilarious with the cheesy cracker snacks and water downed drinks. Oh and you can't leave the area with your drink. If you are staying on the back side of the hotel you will hear the cooling towers and smell the restraunt vents on your balcony. The views are great in some rooms but doesn't make up for it all the other stuff. Don't pay high dollar for this hotel. On a mini-break it wasn't too bad but don't waste your vacation in a crappy hotel - choose some where else! I have travelled to Hawaii and Maui many times and this hotel is at the bottom!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, runned-down, and depressing”
Reviews.Author: LizzH
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to stay at the Embassy Vacation Resorts, Maui, for an entire week over this past March, but it was so runned-down, horrible, and depressing that we checked out after only one night. The public rooms and our unit were shabby and runned-down. Although our unit was spacious, the beds sagged and bathroom tile was filthy, with stained and ugly grout. The food was terrible. The pool was overcrowded, with way too few chairs. The concierge staff was obnoxiously aggressive about trying to get us to buy various extra activities. When we went to check out prematurely, foregoing our prepaid six additional nights, the front desk personnel didn't even ask us why we were leaving. They were overjoyed that we were leaving, because they had overbooked and needed our unit. They most certainly were welcome to it! We moved to the Kapalua Bay Resort, where we had a most delightful time for the rest of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Great PLace To Go!”
Reviews.Author: pack513
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my Honeymoon October 10th-17th, 2004. My husband and I loved the Embassy! I was a little concerned about going after I read some of the bad reviews prior to the trip. After seeing the hotel and experiencing it myself I am shocked at just how picky people are. We had a great time there. We stayed in a room on the 12th (top) floor. We had a deluxe ocean view suite. The view was gorgeous! We had a view of the ocean, Island of Lanai, the pool, and the countryside toward the mountains. We spent quite a bit of time on the balcony enjoying our view. The living room was great. I admit, the chairs and couch were not of the same pattern but did match in color and were quite comfortable. I can't believe anyone had actually complained about them. The kitchen was also a nice space with a good size fridge, dishwasher, microwave, & sink. We were a bit puzzled at first but the dishwasher since there was no stove to cook on but found that it was nice to not wash dishes on our honeymoon-even if we only had glasses, and lunch plates. The bedroom was spacious and well decorated. Bathroom had a shower stall, two sinks, toilet room, and whirpool bath. We enjoyed every aspect of it. We found the hotel to be quiet. We were right above the Ohana Bar area and were glad that the live music never went late and the bar closed by 10pm. The hotel staff was always curteous and friendly and always willing to help. We went to the guest services desk a few times for advice on trips and were always given excellent information. We were even steered clear of a trip that would have been a total waste. The coctail hour was great! There was live music and even a snack to go with drinks. The bartender certainly did not skimp on the alcohol. Breakfast buffet was good too. They had scrambeled eggs (every day), a meat selection (varied daily), Potatoes (varied daily), and either pancakes or french toast depending on the day. They had a daily fruit bar, cereal, and toast. I enjoyed it every day and found the varied items added the variety I needed but my husband wasnt fond of the scrambeled eggs. I must admit they were a bit runny on certain days but if you ask me its better than having dry flaky eggs. Like others, the birds were a bit annoying at times but it was nice to eat outdoors so we dealt with them. Food was always covered except for the fruit which was in a buffet stand but wasn't exactly wide open. I never saw any birds or bugs around it. We both enjoyed the pool area and I even went down the waterslide! Lounge chairs were plentiful in the sun and shade. We never had trouble finding a place to sit. The sunset torch lighting ceremony was cool. The person lighting torches was always dressed in costume and had no problem posing for photo after photo. The beach area was smaller than the ones I'm used to seeing in Florida and California but it was just the right size. We never felt crowded and found the area was always neat and clean! We had meals at both the North Beach & Ohana restaurants and loved the food at both. North beach was a bit more formal- wait staff friendly at both. My favorite meal was the Hawiian Pizza at Ohana! Traveling on the island is easy, there is one major highway and very few side streets. We traveled the north, west, and east sides. Be aware of road signs as some roads have 90 degree turns. Also note that there are few directional signs to tourist areas. We had trouble finding the "blow hole" and the Twin Falls areas but managed to use our senses and the map to get where we wanted to go. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Maui needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited the Maui Embassy and we stayed in one of the renovated rooms. i must admit, the room was very nice and we had a nice view of the beach and ocean. My main problem is with the breakfast. Becuase most of the hotels in the area are open-air, meaning birds can fly in, you would think that the Embassy staff would be sure to cover the food that they serve.....NOT!! One morning when going to breakfast in the hotel the fruit was covered with sooo many fruit flies that it grossed me out and I did not eat any. The last straw for me was shortly after eating breakfast one morning my stomach starting giving me problems and I became very nauseous after eating the eggs and pancakes. That was the last morning I ate any of the cooked foods. The rest of the days I ate packaged oatmeal and cereal for breakfast. Great place to stay....bad place to eat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our sixth year in West Maui and would have to say the Embassy Resort ranks as one of the top hotels to stay at. The staff was extremely well-informed and friendly, the public spaces and grounds clean and attractive, and the suites are very spacious. The resort has a much more intimate feel to it than most of the Ka'anappalli resorts. The grounds and pool open right up to the ocean, no walkway or hedge seperating the resort from the the beach. The pool is large with smaller pools for younger swimmers. The beach is narrower here than South Ka'annappalli so the ocean is much closer to the resort. Allthough a timeshare resort they don't push it. A simple no thanks on the first day and we weren't bothered for the rest of the stay. The rooms provided great views to the ocean and the bathrooms were bigger than some other full rooms that we've stayed at. Maui is great at any time of the year but even more enjoyable in the fall, which is considered the off-season. Fewer crowds and traffic, easy to get a great table in the restaurants, and the popular sights are much more accessible. The true test of any resort or hotel is given the choice would you stay there again? We most definitely will be returning to the Embassey Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected. The property was well maintained and the rooms were clean, large and comfortable. We stayed for 8 nights the week of Sept 23. No problem with children as most over the age of 6 are in school. The complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour were as expected and both were appreciated. The welcome breakfast was both informative and entertaining. We booked through "Pleasant" and were satisfied with the booking. The "Feast at Lele", luau, is highly recommended. Phone in your reservations at least 3 weeks in advance. Other restaurants we enjoyed were Hula Grill, Kimo's, and the North Beach Grill at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A big pink dissapointment!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Footnote: I stayed at the Embassy back in 1988 2 weeks after the hotel had opened in Decbember, and my rememberance of the vacation was empressionable so I returned...) My husband and I just returned from Maui Embassy and needless to say the "Vacation Ownership" "Mini Vacation" deal was NO deal at all. After we checked into the hotel, we realized that we wanted a different room because of the mold growing on the caulking in the shower door along with the shower door tilled and almost to the brink of breaking off, and the noise of the freeway on the scenic view, and the lack of taste in the room of the mis-matched furniture that had scum stains all over the couch. As we trotted along, we spent one of our precious afternoons listening to a sales pitch regarding the "vacation ownership" program. When we told the sales rep. of our disatisfaction of the room, he admitted to us that the 10th floor has not been renovated and that room number 1032 is one of the worst rooms in the hotel, and that only the "owners" get the use of the delux and or the renovated rooms, however he continued to ask us if we were interested in buying into the vacation ownership. I laughed and said no. How can I buy something that I haven't even experienced the best of? (I'm glad that I didn't spend the full amount that any of the travel agencies were quoting me for this trip). Along with the room discrepencies, the employees of the hotel looked as if they were zombies. Their expression or non-expression said of us that we don't want to be here. The only group of people that ever said Aloha or hello were the janitors in the lobby and the maintence crew, oh and the hardest working person in the entire hotel would have to be the older man at the pool hut. All of the others just seemed stand around and chit-chat while he's busting his ---. Throughout the week, we asked several employees at the hotel, (front-desk, valet,etc.) where we can get "plate lunch." Instead they would reply "I'm not a food coniseour", or direct us to the nearlest "Deny's" type of resturants. We didn't come all this way to have hambers and pancakes. Also the manager's cocktail reception consisted of drinks that were completely watered down served with some cheap, cheesey, chex mix type. There's also a drink police at the front of the reception area. The entire week, we felt like we were doing something wrong, you can't walk around the hotel with your free drink in your hand, but you can walk around the hotel if you pay for your drink at the pool bar. Lastly, the breakfast was fair. There is always some type of meat there, (bacon, sausage links, sausage paties, etc) along with french toast or pancakes, some sort of a fried potato dish and lastly runny scrambled eggs (that's probably not all eggs, it sure didn't taste like 100% eggs.) It's pretty simple there, cheap food, cheap alcohol, run-down hotel from the interior to the exterior, and unfriendly service. Like I mentioned, we had the best time when we walked down about 1/2 miles south of the hotel and went swimming by our selves with no one from the hotel telling us we can't do this and we can't do that. We didn't pay all this money to be babysat!

Reviews.Title: “Maui in September”
Reviews.Author: gisellg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week in Maui. We traded our timeshare for this trip. The hotel is average. Checking in was quick and easy. No pushy sales people trying to sell us timeshares which we liked. Our room was nice. We had an ocean view. We paid the $80 for the daily breakfast. Its not excellent but it fills you up through lunch. We enjoyed the pool. No kids running around which was nice. But then again we tend to take vacations in September when kids go back to school. The beach is nice and the Ohana Grill menu is good. We did not eat at the North Beach Grille restaurant. The bathroom is a treat since it has two sinks and it has a shower and a bathtub. We had an incident with the TV in the bedroom but we called the front desk and they sent someone. We had a new TV with in 30 minutes. The parking is fine. The parking spaces are average. We always found parking. Only complaint is the fitness center is very small. Very limited equipment. You would think no one is working out during vacation but there were a few of us in there.

Reviews.Title: “embassy going downhill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Embassy Resort in May 04. The place is going downhill fast. I usually go here every year, and, by a great stroke of luck, never purchased the time-share. When Embassy decided to timeshare the resort almost 8 years ago, the hotel was great. Good service, fantastic breakfast buffet, and nice update rooms. Now there is no service (they no longer have servers at the pool to get you the high priced drinks), the buffet is horrible, and the rooms are in the condition of a 2 star hotel. I had a hard time getting a room this year, since they no longer book at the hotel, you must go through a broker. They said 8 years ago that they were only going to sell 1/2 the hotel in timeshare....well...now it's 100%. This will be the demise of this resort. Thank god I did not buy, but it's a shame that such a great resort fell into this situation. It use to be the best in Maui in my opinion. If you are an owner (you have my sympathy), here are some tips: you need to be at the pool by 8am to be able to get a lounge chair, otherwise forget it, and since there is virtually no beach, there are not many other options. If you want to have a seat at the afternoon cocktail reception- get there at 530pm, no later, again you will be standing because of no seats, and you can not bring the drink out from the area. If you want to have dinner at the hotel, arrive at the restaurant at 530pm when they open, they offer a discount then that is not too bad, ask for a table by the ocean, and sometimes you will see the whales jump as you dine...this is one goodpoint. Water pressure in the shower is a joke. Try to stay on a top floor--they have few elevators, and if you are at a bottom floor, the elevator car is always full when it opens..bring a snack you could be waiting a long time. There is more sand in the pool than on the "beach?".

Reviews.Title: “Embarassed to be an owner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner at the Embassy for the past 4 years. I've recently returned from a trip to the resort 8/04, and must say this was by far my worst stay...I'm embarassed to be an owner there. I was told during my last stay that the rooms would be refurbished and that many other changes were to be done. The room had a lovely view and was very clean, however, the furniture was in terrible condition and the balcony paint was peeling. The pool lounge chairs were so dirty we had to wipe them off before lying on them. The grill area was filthy and the employees at breakfast watched more of the Olympics than I did!! No t.v. and bagels are allowed for the employees in my office!! Trays were left outside rooms for days at a time....yum, flies on syrup! Happy hour has now been renamed "unhappy hour". Service is not the name of the game at the resort. The employees are running the show, not the management!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visitors”
Reviews.Author: Callpage
Reviews.Content: We are every other year owners and this is our third time at Embassy. Each time we bring people with us and the last time our friends also decided to become owners. This time we were a group of 25, ages ranged from 1 yr to 65 yrs. The kids and adults loved the 1 acre pool area, kiddie pool/slide, waterfall pool and hot tub. This is a beachfront property with a narrow beach meaning the kids are always in view. We went snorkeling in "our" beach and saw quite a few fish. Don't forget to wear water shoes since it can be a little rocky in the shallow area. The breakfast for the family is $85 for the week, each day there were scrambled eggs, potatoes, french toast or pancakes, meat (bacon or sausage), an assortment of fresh fruit, coffee, juices, toast, cereals..etc. The only complaint, some mornings the eggs were cold. Parking is $10 a day (valet or self) but is waived for owners. All the staff is friendly especially the valet guys. The spacious 1 bdrm suites included a large double sink bathroom, separate tub/shower, couch bed, large T.V. in living room w/VCR and CD player. Our unit was remodeled so it had a dishwasher and plenty of cabinet space. They started the remodels from the top, we were on the 9th floor. Our family on the 2nd and 3rd floors had rooms that weren't remodeled meaning they had no dishwashers or extra cabinet space. All units include a microwave and refrigerator with large countertop and sink. Mini Maid service i.e. changing towels and emptying trash is daily, while running the dishwasher, cleaning the tubs, changing sheets is once a week for owners. The children's program Beach Buddies is open from 8-2:30 for children 5-12, but my 10 yr old was a little bored. He attended Beach Buddies at the ages of 6 and 8, he really enjoyed the program both times. The children do arts & crafts, tour the koi pond, swim, watch movies, have lunch...etc. The cost is $40 per child with a $5 discount for siblings. IF you attend the timeshare presentation the cost is $20. The timeshare presentation was not pushy but if you are considering purchasing, do your homework prior to attending. The Embassy has 2 onsite restaurants, the Ohana Bar & Grill and North Beach Grille both had good food not great. We enjoyed Ozakuya Deli, down the road toward Napili (korean BBQ children, mahi mahi, sandwiches) everything under $10. We also enjoyed Kobe Steak House (like Benihana) and Bubba Gump Shrimp both in Lahaina and Rusty Harpoon at Whalers Village.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: Steviek49
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 16 night Hawaii Vacation and spent the last 6 days at the Embassy. We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott for the first 5 days, The Radisson Kauai Beach Resort for 3 nights and The Marriott Waikoloa on the Big Island for 3 nights. We are a family of 4 with two daughters ages 14 and 12. Overall we had a great vacation and the Embassy was wonderful for our family. The Embassy has a beautiful 1 acre pool with waterfalls and seperate area with a kid's slide. It has a hot tub, a beach activity center and a miniature golf course as well. Although the resort can use alittle updating (and it currently is) the overall property is well kept and attractive. The staff is very friendly. The buffet breakfast was welcome and I feel a bargain even at $82 for owners. We are not owners so it was included, as was parking fees (usually $10 per day) and everyday maid service. We came on an internet timeshare offer which brought down my price for a scenic room from $1579 (for 5 nights) to $789 for an oceanview room. They even throw in a compact car ($268) so we saved over $1000 on this deal. The presentation lasted about 2 hours but there was absolutely nom pressure from our sales person. Our room was a 2nd floor oceanview suite ( we booked scenic view)that looked over the lobby and to the ocean. It was over 800 sq feet and had a huge bathroom. This suite probably was not updated since there was a stain on bedroom carpeting and some lights not working properly but the room was great considering the other 3 hotels (all very nice) averaged under 300 ft. The resort is located on the beach and has pretty good swimming and snorkeling waters but it's better south in the Ka anapali Beach Resort Area. I would recommend this resort for families who need extra room and want a friendly a well kept 4 star resort (out of 5 stars).

Reviews.Title: “Complete paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maui is an incredible island, and the Embassy's location just completed the picture. We had two teenage son's with us and the resort was very well suited for families. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning during our weeks stay for just $85 and there was a lot of food and choices. This was a real bargain being that most everything on the island is expensive. We enjoyed the snorkeling off the beach, and saw a turtle and many fish in the early morning. The pool is beautifully graced with waterfalls and beautiful landscaping. We also enjoyed the cocktail hour, which provided free cocktails every night from 4-6 pm, with entertainment some nights, just before heading out to Lahaina for dinner. Our teenagers loved the Lahaina scene! Buba Gumps was a favorite. The Uleana show was great and the Old Lahaina Luau! Both fabulous shows. Lahaina is the place to be evenings, if you have children and teens along! Over all the Embassy needs some updating but this didn't affect the tranquil beauty and adventures we experience everyday there and on the island. Embassy is in the process of updating floor by floor. The new rooms are beautiful!! Our room was very spacious and our view of the ocean and pool was quite beautiful. Staff was courteous at all times, always welcoming us back to the hotel at the front entrance after dinner each evening. I would recommend the Embassy for families going to the beautiful Island of Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: egbob
Reviews.Content: Vacationed at the Embassy from July 15-24. We're every other year owners, so I was wondering if anything had changed over the past couple of years. Well, we had a great time. This is Embassy, remember, so it's a family oriented resort with all the plusses and minuses. We had 2 teenagers. The resort was in great shape, rooms were fine, everything was spotless, service was extremely courteous. food was good from the beach grill. Breakfast was fine, on par with a Denny's or IHOP. Happy hour was fine, and remember, free. Lunched twice at Bubba Gumps, one of my all time favorites. Dinner at Longhi's...great! Accross the street (walking distance) from the resort is a supermarket, Subway and Pizza / Italian. All good and very convenient. Sunrise ride down the crater on MountainRiders... great time, awesome experience. Recommended! I've always found Embassy a great hotel to stay with the family, and this one is no different. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites is great ownership!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners in the Embassy Suites in Maui and we love it. We had purchased two weeks for every other year about a year ago and we just purchased another week when we were there at the end of June. There are good and bad reviews that you will see about this place. We think the best deal is the size of the rooms. The one bedroom suites are very large compared to other hotels. We have a delexe oceanfront room and you cannot ask for a better view. As time gos by, there will be less and less rooms available here for non-owners, as the hotel will become all timeshare owners. There are currently only a few floors available at this time. I read one review that said the room did not have a tub. I find that hard to believe as we have seen a number of the rooms and they all have a tub, shower, and two sinks. The hotel is currently being renovated, floor by floor, at a cost of approximately $55,000 per room. We had a chance to view a couple of the remodeled rooms and they are beautiful. Each one is a little different, but elegant!!! Breakfast is not the best. It is usually included with the booking, unless your an owner, and then its about $80 a week for everyone in your group. Thats a great deal, but we usually don't purchase it just for 2. There are so many wonderful places to eat breakfast on the island, that we usually go out. As far as the drink reception, I think its a great deal. Drinks on the island are very expensive, and this is two hours of unlimited drinks for free!!! You cannot get a better deal than that. These are only well drinks and not blended, but what do you expect for free!!! Embassy is the only resort that does this!!!!! Overall, the good outways the bad. Yes, its a big "family" resort, and you will see lots of kids here. If you don't like kids, this is not the place for you. But if you like large rooms, great pool, and views, this is a great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: kammer
Reviews.Content: My husband, our children (ages 9 & 7), mother-in-law and myself just returned from staying at at Embassy from 6/25 through 7/3. We had a great time! Our oceanview room in the tower had an awesome view of the ocean, pool and mountains. The room was plenty big for the five of us although it could have used some updating. The breakfast buffet was okay, the kids loved it. We only made the happy hour once and it was just so-so, but what you expect for a freebie. This resort is very kid oriented. I wouldn't recommend it for honeymooners or couples looking for a quiet vacation. The staff was very helpful and kind. Nice workout room but small. The resort food was pretty expensive and nothing that great. The pool was very large and nice. The kids loved the waterslide and the waterslide guy was nice and funny. We went to the timeshare presentation but did not get the hard sell since we explained we already had one timeshare. All in all, the Embassy was a great place to stay and highly recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all the honeymoon I wanted!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from there on June 25. We went there for our honeymoon and stayed for 5 days. The moment I walked into the room I wanted to leave. Yeah the room was set up as a suite, but smelled like urine so bad I had to open both sets of balcony doors to try and get the smell out. In our room we didnt even have a bathtub. All there is was a stand-up shower. The breakfast was terrible. The eggs didnt taste like eggs at all. The pancakes were dry. Good thing they had Rasin Bran and Milk. Cocktail reception shouldve been watered-down drinks reception. The hot tub was filled with teenagers the whole night, not some where me and my husband wanted to be. At the grill by the beach, the waiters took their time and it took us about an hour to get our dinner and 2 drinks. Next time I'll stay at a Shearton!!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy okay but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7 days at the Embassy. Totally agree with previous review that it is not too good for couples. Lots of kids running around- I love kids but if you want adult time find another place to stay. The Embassy is very clean but does need updating. We did have a wonderful view from our room. As far as the breakfast buffet, it is what you would expect for a complimentary breakfast. It gets very crowded especially around 9:00 am and it is hard to get a table. People tend to go to the pool early, put towels down for the best chairs and then they never show up. We noticed all the towels but never people. The cabanas were nice for the beach- $25 a day if you rent them for 3 days or more. The staff was very friendly and helpful. You will pay $10 a day for parking whether you use the valet or not. That I think is a rip off -Overall our trip was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “have a wonderful time at the embassy!”
Reviews.Author: tzup
Reviews.Content: Hi, we just got back from a stay at the embassy the beginning of June. We brought our two girls, ages 10 & 13 who had a great time. I was extremely happy with the beach, there was plenty of room and the girls boggie boarded most days, absolutely beautiful. The pool was great and not overly crowded, we didn't even have to try to save a chair as there was plenty of room for everyone. I thought the water slide could be bigger, but everyone seemed happy that used it. The rooms are fantastic, service was wonderful, they are updating a few things which was commented on in other reviews but didn't cause us any problems. We actually went to a timeshare presentation and are happy to say we bought one! Now we can visit the "pink palace" once a year! Don't hesitate to stay here, everything was great! Can't comment on the parking as we taxi'ed and that worked for us. You can walk to a small shopping mall and grocery store with a pizza place and Subway. Also a farmers market a few blocks away with lots of fun things to buy.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience at the Embassy !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Embassy !!!! First off I'd like to say my wife and I are Timeshare owners with RCI ,we put in for a exchange to Maui. We were very happy with the resort as should I say "Megaresort" because it was huge. Since we were there on a timeshare exchange we had to pay 85 dollars for the week for the Breakfast and 10 dollars a day to park in the parking garage. The reviews you've read about the small parking spaces are accurate little has been said that there is a bottom level and those spaces are a bit bigger. The parking spaces may be small but the room suites are just more like an apartment size,we were ecstatic to have that much space!!!! We had an Ocean view and and nice balcony,also they had cable with HBO but we mostly watched Channel 7 "The visitors channel" The room was great just one small complaint the shower head was attached to the ceiling and we did'nt care for that. The managers happy hour from 4 till 6 was alright with mixed snacks(chips and pretzels) ,the drinks were well drinks not top shelf stuff. We went through the Embassy time share presentation and the woman was nice to us and did not pressure us. She knew that we already owned one timeshare and we just said we did'nt need another one. All in All it was a great experience at the Embassy Suites ,we were there from May 13 through May 20,2004. Like I said earlier it was a Megaresort and it was crowded around breakfast ,the pool ,the parking grarage,and the Managers happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Re the Maui Embassy on (North) Ka'anapali, Maui. I always enjoy my visits to the Pink Pyramid. The rooms are large, well furnished with good views. The resort is located beachside with a large pool area, but also near a nice residential neighborhood and farmer's market, plus, a real regular shopping center is a short walk away. The on-site activities are good and island activities are easily arranged. The breakfast buffet is good and saves us money to spend elsewhare on Maui. I found the COVERED parking (all spaces) fine for a careful driver. I am an Owner, and just attended a owners meeting; I can testify that millions of dollars are being spent to further renovate, refine and upgrade the resort (it will cost $55,000 per room!). I think the Embassy Resort is a great place where our families can truly relax in a casual way.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice family resort, my family of 5 stayed 6 nights in a one bedroom ocean view. The rooms are large, nice sized living area as well as bedroom and large bathroom. The property seemed to be well managed the grounds were beautiful and our room was clean with no problems. I do believe they are updating the property as they were busy working on various floors painting as well as painting the elevators. None of which caused any problems for us. You do get free breakfast which is a big money saver. The food wasn't top rate, but no worse than going to a Dennys and it's free! We ate at the other restuarants within the resort and had no complaints with service or the food. The pool area is great large and clean nice view of the ocean. The beach isn't large, but big enough to swim or play in the sand with kids. Overall we wouldn't hesitate to stay again service was great and the property was very clean. It could use some updating which I think they are in the process of doing. The biggest complaint I had was the size of the parking spaces in the parking garage. They seem to be big enough to fit a Cooper Mini, I mean they are tight! Not to mention they charge $10.00 a day for parking. You may have to have the valet park you car as there are limited numbers of parking spaces. The valet parking area always seemed to have plenty of spaces though. That is the biggest problem I saw with this property nonetheless my family would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation at the Embassy in February! My husband and I brought our three children (age range 10-15) and thoroughly enjoyed our garden view suite, although we would have prefered an ocean view ... The staff was so friendly, morning breakfast a big plus when don't need something fancy and the maid service was excellent! Only two drawbacks that I saw for us - (1) it isn't on the "main drag" of the beach so you need to drive instead of just walking down the beach to Whaler's Village (2) the laundry facilities were quite a hike from the garden view suites. All in all, we would return again, but would request an ocean view right away!

Reviews.Title: “Danger!! Don't stay here with children!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in February. Not only is this palce a wreck, but it is dangerous for children.We were informed that the hotel was being renovated one floor at a time. This wasn't the case. There was major construction happeding on 5 floors while we were there, including the one we were staying on. What bothered us the most was that the painters left shpping carts full of paint and other chemicals unattended in the hallways; the painters were always down the hall and around the corner from these carts. When I informed the manager he said that there was nothing wrong with this, and that it was the parents' responsiblility to watch their children. We stayed in a "renovated" room. This includes rusty door knobs, a badly yellowed porch light, banged up furniture, a couch with the stuffing literally coming out, chipped paint all over, stained doors, and brown grout in the corners of the bathroom. Don't get excited about the renovation if you're expecting a renovated room. The common areas and hallways are what's getting spruced up, even though the rooms BADLY NEED RENOVATING. They did put down new carpeting, and the bedspread and curtains were in good shape.Don't make the same mistake we made; if you're looking for a clean, well-maintaned ROOM, stay somewhere else. Read all the comments. There's a reason why so many people bring up the maintenance issue at this "resort". The management still hasn't gotten the point, the common areas are the only ones getting a real facelift.Especially if you have children, Watch them carefully here if you do decide to book here. The management is aware of dangerous practices and is unwilling to change for the sake of their young guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: raintroy
Reviews.Content: We spent April 3-8 at the Embassy and loved every minute, as did our 7 yr old, his 5 yr old cousin, and their grandparents. No, it is not brand new, but it is well kept and clean. Our suites were huge and the separate bedroom was perfect w/ kids. We had oceanfront which had a spectacular view. The kids loved the pool and slide and I appreciated being able to get food and drinks right there also. The food was all good, the breakfast buffet was not cold and had variety from eggs, pancakes, meat, potatoes, fruit, cereal, yogurt and breads. The free happy hour lacked real food, but you could get mai tais, margaritas, punch, wine, beer and some well drinks. The valets were quick, as was any service we asked for, and all of the employees were very pleasant. The kids also had a good time at Beach Buddies, the resort's camp. All in all a great place for any age- but very much family and children-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “In Need of Updating”
Reviews.Author: Scot in America
Reviews.Content: This resort had definite pluses and minuses. The pluses: (1) well-appointed, large suites with big TVs, stereos, and nice kitchens; (2) the free breakfast (not merely continental -- eggs, pancakes, the works!). The minuses: (1) the common areas (lobby, restaurants, etc.) are quite rundown and desperately in need of updating; (2) the location is not right in the center of the Kaanapali scene, but rather a couple of miles north on a part of the beach that's not technically Kaanapali, so if you want to walk along the Kaanapali beachfront and hang out at the restaurants you should stay farther south (the location is convenient to Kapalua, however); (3) the parking garage, which has spots that only a Yugo could fit in, appears to be designed by an auto body shop hungry for business; (4) the "free cocktail hour" is pretty desultory, as it takes place not outside but rather in one of the tired common areas that smells like a beer-sodden fraternity house. On balance, this will be a great place once they spend a few million to fix up the common areas and repaint the lines in the parking garages

Reviews.Title: “I cannot believe this is not listed as a #1 hotel for Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that this hotel was listed as a #6 because it definitely should be listed as a #1. My boyfriend I loved it there and till this day (since our visit to Maui was 01/99) we still rave about our experience there. The rooms were Clean (which is extremely important for me especially with the beds), housekeeping was excellent, and the rest of the hotel employees were awesome. They gave us a up grade from mountain view to ocean view without even asking. The morning buffet was delicious! I will never stay anywhere else when I go back to Maui, for my wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sldue
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Beautiful open air lobby. Beautiful rooms right on the ocean. Whirlpool tub the size of a bathtub.... separate glass shower. Huge bathroom - bedroom - & living room. Great FREE morning buffet!!!!!!!!! It has everything. Great food poolside. Try it... we didn't until the last day and regretted it. Great pina coladas served in pineapples! Great location, away from the hustle and bustle and touristy hotel chains on the Maui coast. It's not in Lahaina though. It's set closer to the Ritz Carlton than anything else. I wish I was there right now!A Maui tip: Plantation House restaraunt on the north side of the island. has the best food on the island.

Reviews.Title: “A resort like no other. Simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Embassy Resort on Ka'anapali beach in Maui about six or more times. The atmosphere at the resort is great. The rooms are spacious and include a oversized bathroom, living area with a 32" TV, kitchenette, and a considerably large bedroom. The rooms were obviously designed with detail and comfort in mind. There is an amazing breakfast buffet in the morning and happy hour in the afternoon. Both the breakfast and happy hour are included in your stay. The pool area is exceptionaly large which includes a one-acre pool, slide, and spa all overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Around the pool area is a grill and bar allowing easy access to drinks and food. The only negative aspect of the pool area is the limited number of lounges and chairs (make sure you put a towel down on a lounge in the morning). The beach is just a few feet from the pool. I have read some other reviews addressing the algae growing in the waters directly off the beach from the resort. It's true that there is SOME algae in the water, however it is minimal and not a cause for concern. I think the person who wrote that review has never set foot on a beach before. Oh well, getting back to the resort there is also a gym located directly by the pool. The gym is a little small for the size of the resort, however the equiptment is in good condition and there is both cardio and resistance machines. Overall, the resort is great And I give it an excellent rating. Every time I stay on Maui I return to the Embassy Vacation Resort due to the lavish enviroment. I will be returning to the Embassy resort in about a week and look foward to revisiting the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: StellaAnnabella
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Maui and I was very pleased with our accomodations at the Embassy. We were fortunate enough to get an oceanfront room at the height of whale season and the "show" they put on was quite spectacular! It was very rare not to see a whale SOMEwhere while looking out into the ocean! Okay, about the resort......... The pluses were: 1) Spaciousness. The bathrooms have a large tub (built for two!) and a separate shower with two sinks on opposite sides of the very large room. The "kitchen", dining, and living area of the one bedroom unit is like one large room so you can interact with your travelmate(s) no matter what you are doing. 2) The pool area is just beautiful! The pool itself is quite large and there is a separate pool with a slide for the kiddies. There are waterfalls that you can actually sit under and the hottub is large and the water is just hot enough. There's also a volleyball net for groups who want to partake of that. 3) There's a morning breakfast and an evening cocktail hour (actually two hours....) that are usually included in the price. 4) The daily maid service was very thorough. 5) A very courteous staff from the valet attendants to the bellhops to the front desk. 6) The location. It's right on the beach and within minutes of the Maui nightlife. 7) The view. Spectacular! You can see the islands of Lanai and Molokai, watch sea turtles romp right off shore, and if you are lucky enough to go during whale watching season (January through April), you'll see them EVERYWHERE! 8) A beautiful lobby area. There is plush seating everywhere and pools of very colorful carp and the constant sound of falling water. Very relaxing! 9) Cable TV with LOTS of channels for those who just wanna couch potato it for a while. 10) A beautiful sandy beach for romantic strolls and a coral "reef" for really great snorkeling just feet from the shore. 11) There's an 18 hole miniature golf course on property. 12) Towels, snorkel gear and special equipment are available from a poolside stand and nothing at all was EVER "hawked" to me (as someone else previously posted) the entire time I was there. 13) An evening lighting of the torches "ceremony" while a shellhorn signals the end of another day in paradise. Now the minuses: 1) Having stayed at several Embassy Suites, I was a little disappointed in the lack of variety at breakfast and the hors d'oeuvres during the cocktail hour. 2) There's no cooktop in the "kitchen", only a microwave, coffeemaker, toaster and mini-fridge. (this isn't really a minus to me since, I don't go on vacation to cook.........but some people like the ability to do so while staying in a condo and might be a little disappointed to find out that you can't unless you are in a two bedroom unit.....) 3) The balconies ("lanais") are rather narrow. A chair just barely fits from wall to railing. Overall, it was a very pleasant, relaxing vacation. On previous Maui trips I've stayed in Kahana, Kehei and Wailea and now I know why Kaanapali is so highly touted.........it definitely has the most to offer of any of the places I have stayed there. I hope this has been helpful. Please email me if you have any questions that you think I might be able to answer for you! Cassie

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Honeymoon at Embassy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased we spent our two-week honeymoon in Hawaii instead of the Caribbean or Mexico. We spent our first week in Maui and the second week in Kauai. Lots of sunshine and comfortable 80-degree temperatures awaited us in early November. We knew when we first arrived at Embassy Resort that we were going to have a fantastic time. Check-in was a breeze and we received an upgrade to the top 9th floor, at a discount, next to the oceanfront rooms overlooking the ocean, mountains, and large pool. That was a great decision and well worth the extra cost. Sunrises and sunsets were spectacular. Our suite was large with separate bedroom with king bed, large marbled bathroom with his/her sinks, living room with tv/stereo/vcr, dining, mini kitchenette, and spacious balcony. Daily maid service in our suite was excellent. Grounds, landscaping, and multiple goldfish ponds were well-manicured and colorful. When we arrived in our suite, we were greeted with a bottle of champagne on the table with a personal note from the staff greeting and congratulating us on our special day. We reserved the honeymoon package which included complimentary daily breakfast buffet and afternoon cocktails. Since restaurants in Maui are generally pricey, we saved an average $50-60/day which was very helpful in controlling our expenses. Lobby area was tastefully decorated, complex was large and spread out so we didn't feel crowded or cramped. Parking was convenient, either valet or park it yourself via short stroll underground to the private parking garage. The beach was beautiful, plenty of room to lay out, good walking beach, and not crowded. There were only two negatives with Embassy, the gym and whirlpool were small, but they were minor compared to the many other ammenities and attentive services. When we returned from our private sunset beach wedding in Makena Beach, another bottle of champagne was awaiting us in our suite, compliments of the staff. Dinner at the restaurant several days later was quite delicious, romantic ambiance, and our table overlooked the ocean. If we weren't headed to Kauai for the second leg of our two-week honeymoon, we were tempted to stay another week. We highly recommend this resort. We are planning a return trip to Maui to celebrate our first anniversary and we are selecting Embassy Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “paradise at last”
Reviews.Author: 24jeffanascar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Vacation Resorts and can't tell a single negative thing about it. The buffet breakfast every morning is very good- cover your plate if you don't want to share with the feathered thiefs. I dragged hubby to all the highlights, sunset cruise on The Spirit of Lahaina (cheerful and attentive), bus tour with Merle the pearl around Hana, Bike down Haleakala with "mountain riders" was a blast (even for the almost 50 crowd), I snuba (combo snorkel and scuba) while hubby snorkeled on Molokini boat tour.We also attended the Old Lahhaina Laua, and went 150 ft underwater inthe Atlantis submarine. I was an expensive but fun filled week and I would recomment it all to everyone. Take the dramamine if you're at all seasick and enjoy the whales from Dec. to March. The only downside of the trip was the 9 1/2 plane ride each way and everyone is looking for tip (gratuities are not included). :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-Great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked seven nights at the Embassy primarily because it offerred a good value for a suite. We have two small children (3yrs and 3mos), and the thought of a separate bedroom was very appealling to us. Additionally, we found a "buy 4 nights get 3 free" offer for the hotel, which made it very reasonable. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, which was nice. The price of food in Maui isn't cheap, so the free buffet was nice as well. The food was ok, but there were plenty of basics to fill you up. We went the second week in December, so it didn't feel too crowded. The pool area was quite nice (although no umbrellas-bring plenty of sunscreen for the kids), but the pool felt a little chilly. I expected it to be a little warmer. There weren't too many folks swimming in the ocean, but the beach was nice for little kids to run and play on. The staff was very nice and friendly. The only problem we had was with construction. We were on the top floor (the 12th) and the entire 11th floor was closed off for construction. This took place all day, and became a little challenging when trying to get the kids down for a nap. The staff however, was very accomodating, and offerred to let us use a different room during nap times, offerred to move us to a non-ocean view room (other ocean view rooms weren't available) and gave us complimentary parking for the week. Based on other reviews I read about this hotel, my expectations weren't that high. For every positive review I read, I found a negative one as well. My wifeand I traveled a lot before having kids, and while this hotel is probably not one we would have chosen for just the two of us (would have picked something a little more luxurious), I was very pleased with this a family hotel. The rooms are huge, which makes a big difference with kids. Yes, the overall accomodations are a little dated, but the hotel was clean, the staff was helpful, and we had a great vacation.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The food was great cause it was included”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had no prior experience in Maui or Hawaii for that matter, so we shopped around for the best deal. We were pleased. We went to Maui in April 2002, to get married and had four other rooms in our party. We had no complaints about the food. I do believe it was worth it to have the option to grab a banana, bagel or apple to go. Sure there may not have been food so hot you burned your mouth eating it but who's expecting that at a buffet anyhow?! One thing, very odd, the European Sparrows are very quick and love to eat your breakfast - cover your plate if you get up and are still going to come back to eat! We even had the birds bringing food up to our balcony to eat. The happy hour in the bar was a definite plus considering drinks were expensive anywhere you went. The first/greeting breakfast was good and helped us plan great tours. Loved the room we had, directly over the bar, 2nd floor. It was fun to have the music drifting up every night and great to hear the ocean and pool's waterfall in the morning. Were lucky enough to see whales breeching off the coast. We are definitely coming back and will request the same room. You're on vacation to have fun and relax- dwell on the fact that you're healthy and not at work!!!! "It's all good"

HotelInfo.Name: Ka'anapali Beach Club
HotelInfo.Address: 104 Kaanapali Shores Place, Maui, HI 96761
